body: I found that mixing 1/2 cup water with 1/2 cup Tuscan Milk and a teaspoon of salt makes a salt water like liquid with a white color that really serves no practical function what so ever, however, when applied to tough and stubborn stains on clothing and upholstery, scrubbing with a course brush will not remove the stain but give you the satisfaction of knowing you tried really hard.
title: Great product, many uses

body: Once upon a mid-day sunny, while I savored Nuts 'N Honey,With my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gal, 128 fl. oz., I sworeAs I went on with my lapping, suddenly there came a tapping,As of some one gently rapping, rapping at the icebox door.'Bad condensor, that,' I muttered, 'vibrating the icebox door -Only this, and nothing more.'Not to sound like a complainer, but, in an inept half-gainer,I provoked my bowl to tip and spill its contents on the floor.Stupefied, I came to muddle over that increasing puddle,Burgeoning deluge of that which I at present do adore -Snowy Tuscan wholesomeness exclusively produced offshore -Purg'ed here for evermore.And the pool so white and silky, filled me with a sense of milkyArdor of the type fantastic of a loss not known before,So that now, to still the throbbing of my heart, while gently sobbing,I retreated, heading straightway for the tempting icebox door -Heedless of that pitter-patter tapping at the icebox door -I resolved to have some more.Presently my soul grew stronger; hesitating then no longer,'This,' said I, 'requires an extra dram of milk, my favorite pour.'To the icebox I aspired, motivated to admireHow its avocado pigment complemented my decor.Then I grasped its woodgrain handle - here I opened wide the door; -Darkness there, and nothing more.Deep into that darkness peering, long I stood there wondering, fearing,Doubting, dreaming dreams of many Tuscans I had known beforeBut the light inside was broken, and the darkness gave no token,And the only words there spoken were my whispered words, 'No more!'Coke and beer, some ketchup I set eyes on, and an apple core -Merely this and nothing more.Back toward the table turning, all my soul within me burning,Soon again I heard a tapping somewhat louder than before.'Surely,' said I, 'surely that is something at my window lattice;Let me see then, what thereat is, and this mystery explore -Let my heart be still a moment and this mystery explore; -'Tis the wind and nothing more!'From the window came a stirring, then, with an incessant purring,Inside stepped a kitten; mannerlessly did she me ignore.Not the least obeisance made she; not a minute stopped or stayed she;But, with mien of lord or lady, withdrew to my dining floor -Pounced upon the pool of Tuscan spreading o'er my dining floor -Licked, and lapped, and supped some more.Then this tiny cat beguiling my sad fancy into smiling,By the grand enthusiasm of the countenance she wore,Toward the mess she showed no pity, 'til I said, 'Well, hello, kitty!'Sought she me with pretty eyes that seemed to open some rapport.So I pleaded, 'Tell me, tell me what it is that you implore!'Quoth the kitten, 'Get some more.'
title: Make this your only stock and store

body: I poured the Tuscan Whole Vitamin D Milk, Gallon, 128 oz into a reasonably sized bowl, filled about halfway with cheerios. I ate in the dim morning light of my dining room, watching the cheerios dance around the bowl as my spoon captured their brethren, I remembered my Uncle Richard, "John", as my mother called him. My father wasn't around much during my childhood (always away on business in Sioux Falls) so Uncle Richard was more a father to me. I remember squirrel hunting near the Black Hills after Thanksgiving, snow gently covering the meadows surrounded by dense forests of ponderosa pine, spruce, quaking aspen, paper birch, bur oak, and green ash. He was always a jokester, one of his favorites was about cheerios, but I had long forgotten it. As the Tuscan Whole Vitamin D Milk, Gallon, 128 oz fell into my stomach, I remembered it. I can still see his wide-eyed smile after he told it to me on the bank of the Belle Fourche River.There are three classes of cheerios, the lower class (plain ol' cheerios), the middle class cheerios (frosted), and the elite class (honey nut). One soggy morning in Seattle, a plain cheerio awoke in his single room apartment. He looked out at the still sleepy city, blanketed in a mist of rain. He quickly got dressed and put his shoes on, this would be the day. He stood propped against the bus stop, smoking a cigarette."God I have got to stop this habit." He thought to himself.Glancing back and forth at the bustle of cheerios, he saw her. She looked about 25, devastatingly gorgeous, and he could smell the honey from where he stood."Excuse me ma'am," his voice quivered, "I - I think you might be the most beautiful cheerio I have ever seen."She smiled and her otherwise golden brown face grew red." This is a long shot, but will you marry me?'She was obviously caught off guard by this, but her red lips formed the word, "Yes."They raced through the morning mist of the city, and arrived at her fathers house. The cheerio bent down in front of her father."Sir, I would like to ask for your blessing in marrying your daughter""No! You are a regular cheerio and my daughter needs a high quality honey nut" he snapped."But sir.""No means no damnit!""Sir this is very unrea-""You come back a honey nut and you'll have my blessing, my daughter is not about to marry a low life like you."The cheerio sprinted home, tears streaming down his face. He fumbled against the lock and sprawled out on his bed. When he awoke it was early, his sheets had a dark silhouette from his wet jacket. He sat up and lit a cigarette. "Damn." he sighed to himself. Walking in front of his mirror, he noticed something different. His body was frosted! He had become a frosted cheerio! He darted out the door without shoes, reaching the honey nut household in no time at all. He banged on the door, and the beauty's father answered."Sir I am a changed cheerio! I'm frosted!" he exclaimed.Her father had a stern look on his face."You think you are any better? The dirt on my boots are worth more than you." he hissed.The old honey nut slammed the door on the young frosted. He heard the deadbolt click. The newly frosted cheerio didn't take the same way home.He stood on the edge of a bridge, feeling the cool autumn wind on his sugar coated skin. Was he really going to go through with this? Was it worth it? No he was a frosted cheerio now. He couldn't get the girl, but he was a changed cheerio. He stepped off the edge and walked home silently.He woke up late after the good night's rest. Glancing in the mirror he noticed his new golden brown coat. Without putting a shirt on he dashed out the door. He noticed the carton of cigarettes, and tossed them into the trash.Her father was waiting on the porch, 12 gauge in his lap. He was going to finish this dirtbag.He watched a nice young man on a morning run. He was startled when that same young man came bounding on his porch."Sir I am better now. I have changed. PLEASE may I marry your daughter. I love her." the new honey nut panted."Son, I am a man of my word, you have my blessing."The cheerio had never been so happy in his entire life."You must have the wedding today."The cheerio's mood quickly changed. How was he supposed to arrange a high quality honey nut wedding in a day?"Sir how am I supposed to do that?" he squeaked."Don't worry, you just handle the refreshments."Now, what kind of refreshments are served at cheerio weddings? Milk of course!He grabbed his fiancé and dashed to the milk store. 50 gallon drums filled to the brim with milk filled the store. He was going to do it. He would finally get the girl. As he toted a drum to the counter, he smelled a familiar smell. Rotten milk. Every single one of the drums had spoiled."What are we going to do? We don't have any milk for the wedding!" he said to his fiancé"Don't worry my love, we can use water instead." she cooed.They ran to the water store, but they were sold out. At this point the couple was frantic. It was getting late and they needed to get back for the rehearsal."I could really use a smoke." the cheerio said."Don't you give up on me now!" she yelled, "You are a honey nut now, and honey nuts never give up!""What are we going to use, juice?""Brilliant! We will use juice"They ran down the street. They reached the juice store but the line was out the door."We will never make it in time!" the cheerio said."Quick! There is a store that sells punch just a few blocks away."As they turned the block they saw it. The front windows glistened in the sun.They opened the door, and thankfully....There was no punch line.
title: Brought back many good memories

body: First off I figured by the price of $75-$150 this was some really good milk. So I bought it and selected the 2 week shipping option. But instead of receiving my milk I got yogurt instead. Must have been some kind of mixup. The yogurt was tasty anyway despite the food poisoning and diarrhea.

body: After almost a lifetime of drowning my poor Corn Flakes in a variety of unsuitable liquids, everything from pickle brine to Kaopectate (TM), I was finally put wise to this wondrous dairy delight by a knowledgeable old sage known to most as "Gus from down the street".I'll spare you the tale of my perilous adventures in procuring myself a Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz from an exotic trader, save to say I may never think fondly of burlap again.I returned triumphantly to my humble abode with my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz gripped firmly in hand while neighbors glanced jealously at my prize. The condensation on the plastic jug sparkled in the morning sunlight, the drips of which marked my passage across the parched pavement.I entered my pantry and set my jug down removing the safety ring followed by the cap. I was immediately awash in the scent of good old fashioned fresh wholesomeness. I could wait no more! Ignoring my ringing phone, and caller ID loudly announcing it was my Mother, I grabbed a bowl down from the cabinet in one hand and my box of Corn Flakes in the other and filled the bowl with anticipations galore. Then as I raised the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, I momentarily hesitated in remembrance of previous pairings with my breakfast of choice gone awry. I shrugged it off and poured away!I waited but an instant for the liquid white velour to permeate the fibers of the crisp yellow flakes, then dashed a spoon into the center giving the mix a quick little stir. Delicately I scooped up a spoonful of Corn Flakes and Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and slid them past my quivering lips and into my mouth. "Would this measure up to my building expectations?", I wondered for the brief interval of a heartbeat until my taste buds registered their unanimous approval."By the Gods of Elation!" I cried aloud, "From this day forward my breakfasts shall always be divine!"
title: My Live Has Changed Forever

body: What does a country need?I ask myself this question every day. A quote comes to mind, "Молоко является ключевым" This is what my father told me from the day I was born. "Молоко является ключевым". What does a country really need? Security? Wealth? Education? The answer is no. What a country truly needs is milk. Lots of milk. Milk so white and frothy it makes snow look like dirt.But it can't be any milk. It has to be Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz.This milk runs countries.Buy it today for the good of your country.
title: The good of your country

body: This is simply the best blue cottage cheese I have ever purchased.  Vintage circa 2011, and requires no refrigeration, just like all dairy products.Pros1.  No need for a spoon!I can just pour it out in clumps to this ergonomically designed jug the cheese comes in.2.  Excellent consistency!I could really feel the chunks as they slid through my finger tips into proper globs.3.  It's vintage!Just like fine wine, cheese ages amazingly.  And just like fine wine, you need to sip it in small increments spread out over several weeks.4. It makes you see and hear things you never saw before!My lampshade agrees with me, this stuff really opens one's eyes and ears.  Last week, after eating some, I found a portal in my dresser I never realized was there.  Unfortunately, I couldn't fit into it, and ended up breaking my leg, and the dresser, but now I know that there is most definitely another world outside of our own.Cons1.  It tastes horrible.I mean, what do you expect of cottage cheese?  I was prepared for this when I opened it, but even then I was surprised.  It kinda tasted like I was slowly dying.  I honestly can't tell you why that was the first thought that came into my head.2.  It is basically ipecac the first time you try it.I have to admit, I threw up, a LOT after the first swig of this.  For about 11 hours, actually.  But, during those 11 hours, I got some much needed thinking done about my life, so I guess this counts as a partial pro.3.  For some reason it claims to be "milk".I'm guessing the dairy farm is just lazy and just slaps the same label onto all of its products.  Still, it's rather confusing seeing cottage cheese come from a milk jug.Overall, I'd say this is an excellent product, in spite of what the doctor with the horrifying stag beetle face who keeps me on IV tubes says.
title: Best Cottage cheese EVER!

body: I rarely give a product a bad review because mostly I like all things.  Unfortunately, this Jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz had no warning at all upon its label to people like me.  People who have a hard time digesting milk.  The Lactose Intolerant. I mean, I want to be tolerant of lactose, I really do.  I fully realize that Lactose has every right to exist in the world.  But, I just can't. I'm not wired that way.  So, not being warned I had a hefty glass full of the thick rich white goodness of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.  Then I had some on dry cereal, just like another review suggested.  Then, I couldn't really get to sleep, I have a lot on my mind, so I drank a nice warm glass of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz  to try to lull me to sleep.  Without giving too much information, I am writing this from the bathroom.  I haven't been able to leave this room for 17 hours now.  Please, good people at Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz  INC., please include a warning upon the label.
title: Unfortunate Incident

body: In fairness, I have to admit that I'm reviewing this without trying it ... but there's a reason.  I've had cow's milk and goat's milk, but never the milk of a Tuscan.  The image of someone even trying to milk a Tuscan is, quite frankly, more than a little disturbing, so how could I drink something like that?  More to the point, where would one find that many lactating Tuscans to get an entire 128 fl oz of Tuscan milk, much less, gallon after gallon of the stuff? (Yes, I know ... Tuscany. But that's not the point.)  Something's just not right ... just not right at all!  And in what sort of conditions are these hordes of lactating Tuscans kept?  Are they free-range Tuscans, or are they caged?  Are they forced to exist in feed lots, given only pasta and wines from genetically-modified grains and grapes, or is this a certified organic operation?  And how about freshness?  It's bad enough that the milkers of these Tuscans must work 'round the clock (child labor?), but how long does it take to get this product from farm (or colony) to store?  And at what cost in the way of a carbon footprint?  No ... I just can't do it.  Call me Tuscan-intolerant, or whatever you like.  Someone has to take a stand!
title: I have my doubts ...

body: It was a frigid Friday evening in February, the wind whistling and whining through the barren willow boughs. I was alone at home, except for the fluffy feline that slumbered curled like a fiddlehead fern in front of the flames in the fireplace. All the while, I was unwavering in excitement. This was the wonderful moment I had waited for - with weeks of planning, and many orders of Tuscan Whole Milk. I had been warming the white ambrosia for hours, filling thermoses, simmering it in pots, even filling a coffee urn with the fabulous bovine nectar. No low-fat or non-fat milk would suffice. No cows from Slovenia, Switzerland nor Senegal would do, it had to be Tuscan Whole Milk.I removed the heating pads that warmed my deep claw footed tub for the past hour and one by one, I poured thermos after thermos of the steaming Tuscan-sourced milk into the tepid tub. The milk foamed and frothed as I poured more and more milk into the tub. Quickly, I removed every article of clothing, and slipped into the sumptuous sultry liquid, feeling it yield for my body whilst enveloping me in its creamy grasp. I luxuriated in the lactic liquid with the knowledge that this nutrient had coursed through udders somewhere in the fields of Tuscany, within sight of the fringes of Firenze. The 3.25 percent milkfat caressed my body, nourished my skin and satiated my soul.Near the end of my nocturnal indulgence, the curious cat leapt up to the edge of the tub. Leaning over the opalescent elixir, he lapped up the liquid with his little tongue. This presented an idea! I reluctantly stepped out of the cooled tub and blotted my body dry - not wanting to wipe off the milky film completely. I grabbed an ivory pitcher from the kitchen and dipped it into the milk, filling it to the brim, and then I placed the pitcher in the refrigerator.That night I slept a deep, luxurious sleep, dreaming of several soft hands massaging my supple body with subtly salted Tuscan butter. I awoke refreshed and revitalized. Later that day, a pleasant plumber popped by to look at my hot water heater. When I offered him coffee, he commented that milk would make him content - warm milk. Feeling provocative, I smiled and removed the ivory pitcher from the fridge and poured some milk into a pan to heat it. I presented it to him in a large mug. He sniffed it, sipped it, slurped it, and savored it, standing in the midst of the small kitchen. His eyes grew large, his face flushed, a grin grew upon his gorgeous countenance. He finished the rest of his mug of milk as quickly as he could without burning his mouth, blowing on the surface to cool it between eager sips. Finally, he arched his back and tilted his head back to get every delectable drop of Tuscan Whole Milk, that same Tuscan Whole Milk that had caressed my body the evening before. He stepped closer to me, so close I could smell the Tuscan Whole Milk on his breath. He whispered, "Questo è il più magnifico latte che abbia mai avuto." I slowly wiped off his milk mustache with one hand, and placed my other hand on his chest, and replied, "La ringrazio. È una parte della Toscana. Si tratta di una parte di me."
title: Midnight Milk Bath

body: Frankly I was at the end of my rope.We'd gone through the Sicilian, Ligurian and Venetian Whole Milk gallons, and our marriage was still lackluster and at a dead end."There's always Tuscany," mumbled my spouse, his one glass eye peering out the window of our cottage while the other practically pleaded with me."I'll see what I can do," was my only response. I owed him one final attempt at fulfilling, satisfying Italian Whole Milk.Thank you Amazon for offering us the opportunity to sample this gallon on liquid miracle.We can't stop imbibing this wonderfully rich lactose. In our cappuccinos. Baked into the tiramisu as well as the carbonara sauce.This is what we were looking for, aimlessly, for years!Once you go Tuscan Whole Milk, non si torna indietro!
title: We can't stop imbibing this wonderfully rich lactose

body: I ordered this milk due to the generous size for such a great deal. It seemed like a great decision at the time, but it just happened to arrive while I was on a ten day Caribbean cruise this past May. Where I live, it is HOT in the spring, many days topping out at 90 to 95 degrees. It must have been sitting out on my porch for at least eight of those ten days, due to it's condition when I returned home. As I stepped out of my limousine, gave my driver a generous tip for the ride home from the airport, and walked up my driveway, a gust of wind brought along a stench so horrid that I was nearly knocked off of my feet. I paused for a moment to gag, while pinching my nose and hyperventilating through my mouth. I believed the sour aroma to be emanating from a dead animal of sorts, and I began to trot as fast as I could in my heels to get into my house to escape the smell. I panicked as I struggled to find the right key to open my door. In my frenzy, I realized that the sour smell of death had gotten much stronger, and I whipped around to see the gallon of Tuscan dairy milk, a filthy film of dust obscuring the label. I had been in such a rush that I had ran right past it without noticing it. It was lying on it's side, the lid discarded about two feet away. Perhaps a raccoon had gotten into it and drank it all. But then, where was the stench coming from? I hesitantly stooped to peek into the bottle. What I saw was a solid white brick with the scratch marks of an animal, most likely a raccoon, that had reached it's furry little arms as far as it could into it to scrape as much milk jello as it could for itself. I screamed in horror and kicked it, and continued to kick it until it was in my neighbor's yard. It was their problem now.
title: Not a Pleasant Experience.

body: It was good milk. The only down side is that Putin likes it. Look heres Putin now.
title: To bad putin

body: Don't get me wrong, this milk was very milky.  Snow white, creamy, delicious even.  The problem, you ask?  Where was Tuscany?  There is absolutely nothing in this milk pertaining to Florence, Renaissance art, or even Michelangelo’s "David" statue.  I mean, it is literally "just" milk.  The prospect of combining such a nutritious beverage with the sites and sounds of Tuscany sent joy through my inner being.  Would I open the otherwise boring red lid to smell the rugged Apennine Mountains?  Would the usually unsatisfying plastic shape of the jug be transformed into the Leaning Tower of Pisa?  No.  Nothing was done to place the sensations of Italy into this drab dairy product.  Milk, it is.  Tuscany, it is NOT!
title: Tuscany it is NOT!

body: Doesn't taste a darn thing like a Toucan. I thought "whoa, tropical bird flavor". Boy was I wrong. Returning this immediately.
title: Seriously misleading

body: After struggling for hours with the Fort Knox worthy security seal on the top of the container, we finally determined that it was NOT NECESSARY to turn the cap to remove it. Another reviewer referred to the cap as red and "twisty" but "twisting" the cap only causes it to REVOLVE around and around, not allowing access to the product inside. Finally my daughter found a video online that demonstrated the opening process, which involves peeling a tab from the base of the cap, which then SNAPS off the container. Some simple directions would have been most HELPFUL to my family. Additionally, there should be a WARNING LABEL to advise consumers that the milk can POUR from the container with excess volume. I can see why customers often purchase paper towels along with this product.
title: Needs better instructions

body: A friend and I managed to muster up the cash to buy this a few weeks ago. We read a review saying that when you open it there is an explosion of rainbows and cats. This is a straight up lie. Our had an explosion of leprechaun gold. Of course my friend wanted to open it at my place, so now I have a thousand little green men running through my place for the past 2 weeks (they found out about the gold). I can still get sleep because ear buds block out most of the noise they make at night, but I have stepped on a few and it really sucks to have to clean up the dead ones.Maybe I should behead 2 of them and place there heads on poles right outside my door.the milk tasted great though
title: Open the bottle up outside

body: Whose milks these are I think I know.His house is in the village, though;He will not see me stopping hereTo watch his milk as white as snow.Tuscan Dairy must think it queerTo milk without a farmhouse nearDrink with pies or frozen cakeThis is better than the darkest beer.Use to blend a smooth milk shakeDrink it down there’s no mistake.For seven days it should easily keepNo gassy wind or farts partakeThese milks are lovely, white and deep,But I have promises to keep,And miles to go before I sleep,And miles to go before I sleep.
title: Drinking My Milk on a Snowy Evening

body: Maybe it's great stuff. I wouldn't know. When my first order of Tuscan Whole Milk arrived, my excitement quickly turned to disappointment. The seemingly well-designed container had a mere pinhole in it. This hole was enough to leak all the Tuscan Whole Milk into the shipping box, creating a saturated mess of cardboard that held together right until the moment it came inside my door. As always, Amazon was great about return of the item but the Tuscan Whole Milk people put up a stink. They wanted proof that their precious Tuscan Whole Milk had not been consumed. I hadn't taken any photos for evidence. By this time the milky cardboard had dried out and gone into the recycling bin. I ran into the alley just as the city truck was pulling away. I'm told it was a harrowing scene when I dove into the hold, barely avoiding the churning machinery, but I came up victorious. Sure. A dried out box was not enough for the Tuscan Whole Milk people. Amazon is mediating.Undaunted, I placed my second order of Tuscan Whole Milk under an assumed name and used my office address for delivery. The perfectly dry package arrived a few days later. This time it was not Tuscan Whole Milk at all. It was 2%.I don't know if I will order a third time.
title: I'd Give it Zero Stars if I Could

body: Be sure you read the fine print -- the picture is not an accurate representation of this product.Mine arrived in a cow, "some assembly required." On the plus side, I have to admit it WAS pretty fresh.
title: No Truth in Advertising

body: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, has restored my faith in humanity.  Yes, things are going to hell in a handbasket in every conceivable way here on planet earth, yet you wonderful people choose to celebrate life with such spirit, such enthusiasm, composing sonnets to this bovine fluid with such giddy good humor, it makes me choose to live, not despair.  I love you all.
title: Restored my faith in humanity

body: Tuscan whole milk. Tuscan whole milk. The words haunted me, I knew not why. In my dreams, in my waking hours. Always Tuscan whole milk. What was this ambrosia foretold in my nighttime? Where would I find it? And would it satisfy my rarified tastes?For days, weeks, months I wandered like a starved zombie through the streets of my home city greedy for the answers to my questions. I lied, I cheated, I stole, I murdered and was no nearer the truth. Until one day, I was told of a wondrous 'virtual' word called 'teh Internets'. I, after many days of intensive instruction, learned how to launch a 'search' on 'teh internets' and found Tuscan whole milk on Amazon. Yes, Amazon. Which I had previously believed to be a river, was now, as they say, 'online'. And on this online (no doubt virtual) river I found Tuscan whole milk.I ordered some. I did. My hands trembled as I did so, so great was my excitement. Imagine how much greater my excitement was when the product eventually arrived.It arrived. I opened it. I drank it. I was enlightened and immediately achieved a serene oneness with the Universe.
title: Soft, Enter Ye Milk . .

body: Dear Amazon,I never thought it would happen to me.  I don't normally get choked up writing a review, but this is special.  It was a cold, dark night that caught me by surprise.  I was awaiting the sweet kiss of sleepiness, but it continued to elude me.  Then I saw her from a far.  The Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz jug of liquid snooze.As I sat down to contemplate how best to consumer her, she spoke to me.  Her sweet lips kissed mine as I brought her close to me.  We exchanged pleasantries for just a brief moment before we were interlocked in the most orally-gratifying way possible.  Then it happened.My wife walked in and caught us.  My pants were at my waist but felt like they were at my ankles.  Her glistening helical axis screwing me just as I would do later to her.  I dropped everything, including my sweet Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz jug.She hit the floor, spilling her heart all over the floor.  I hurt her badly but did I end her?  No.  Her rugged exterior contained the damage and only her sweet elixir spilled.  I was able to grab hold of her before she emptied completely and before I knew it she was put back together.My wife walked over and took her from me.  I figured the worst would happen.  She would kick her to the curb with the rest of the trashy things we had in the house, but she didn't.  She looked at me deep in my eyes, took my lovely Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz jug in both hands and kissed her passionately - just as I had moments before."Is that what you wanted?" she cried.Without a single word that could come out of my mouth, a thought emerged.  A smile as big as the desert sun came across my face."I knew it!" she exclaimed as she walked to the bedroom, bringing our Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz jug with her."Grab the cookies," she said.  "We are going to have some fun."About an hour later I was exhausted.  My sweetness had done her job.  Sleep came quickly.  Thank you my lovely Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz jug.I recommend Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz if you need to experience life.  I know I did that night.  I may never see her again as she quickly became soured by our experience and ended up leaving when the city workers came by to take her away.  Her last gift a stain, white, on our driveway, and forever in my heart.
title: I don't normally get choked up

body: It's my dear friend Hillary's birthday today...  She's been through a lot, and I wanted her to have a gift that said "you are special, you are refined, you are le creme de la creme."  Of course its nothing less than Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 Fl oz if you want to say "I love you friend."  And once I saw that I could say all this for the bargain price of $75??? No brainer.  This milk of ambrosia was brewed by glorious bovine that have basked in the tuscan sun with the sublime winds of the mediterranean gently caressing their silky cow fur. As this milk is produced by the world's only mensa cows its no wonder it imparts such wisdom upon those that imbibe.  In Tuscany the locals often take it directly from the teets…were you to visit you'd see them reverently kneeling to suckle. I'd like to send you to Tuscany dear friend, to suckle as they do… but  I unfortunately have to settle for getting it shipped via amazon.
title: The perfect birthday gift to show you care

body: Wholesome, white liquid from cow boobs taste great in coffee, on cereal, and pancake batter.  Not to be confused with Tattooine Farms Tuscan Raider Milk, also known as "Space Milk" or "Blue Milk" - which is supposedly made by sweat shops filled with illegal Jawas.Support your local cow boobs, drink Tuscan.
title: White > Blue Milk

body: I thought they were joking, but in addition to its many breakfast uses -- pancakes, cereal, instant oatmeal (if you choose to go with the milk vs water option in directions) -- I was surprised to see countless recipes on the web and social that it can be added to lots of recipes. I haven't had a chance to try them all, but I am excited to give it a try!I would have given it five stars but found after a couple of days the cap you use to close the container begins to smell a bit like ass. I am no marketing person or inventor, but if they can fix this "small" problem I think this could be really big.
title: It's like a Swiss Army knife

body: I would definitely recommend Tuscan Milk to other adventurers. Please note that the effects described above are for me, a Level 43 Elf Cleric, and other races/classes may be affected diferently. Milk is not advised for Orcs.
title: GOOD

body: While I was a bit apprehensive about buying an off-label brand of milk, I decided to give it a try.  I was feeling rather daring and rebellious that day...I bought All of my Christmas presents at Amazon that morning, then I parked in the red zone while I dropped my boyfriend off at the store.  I even threw a receipt on the ground in the parking lot!  It was an amazing feeling.  Anyhow, I browsed online and found this milk product.  Very intrigued by the name, as I had always wanted to go to Tuscany, Italy, and thought I'd get a taste of that beautiful, historic country.  When it arrived a full 2 days later, I carefully selected a large glass in which to pour this liquid gold into.  I took a sip, then two, then three... Mmmm, this stuff tasted delicious.  Then the phone rang.  It was my boyfriend, telling me that the lottery numbers matched up completely, including the powerball number, and that he was dumping me so he could travel the world.  I was offended that he wouldn't let me take part in his riches, so I, gulp, actually hung up on him.  Can you believe I did that?!  Then the phone rang again, and it was a telemarketer offering to replace my windows at no charge.  Are you kidding?  I felt like I had won the lottery myself!  I made the appointment and chatted with the gentleman all while sipping the liquid gold.  He said he had to go because he had to make some important phone calls, and it sure sounded busy in his office.  Just then, a research group called and asked if I wanted to take part in a clinical trial regarding a new drug to treat cancer.  They were offering me a $50 gift card and I certainly couldn't turn down the offer.  The side effects were that I could suffer from depression or suicidal ideation, break out in hives, suffer irreversible hearing loss, develop liver cancer, show signs of genital warts, and lastly, develop a dangerous heart arrhythmia.  The likelihood was about 80%, but that 20% chance of Not developing these symptoms, AND that $50 gift card was really enticing.  I took the offer.This was last month, and I have gone through about 6 gallons of Tuscan Milk.  I've had to learn sign language and I depend heavily on email communications, I now have a pacemaker to control the arrhythmia, and the hives are driving me nuts.  However, I was lucky enough not to get liver cancer!  I was ecstatic.  They said that the genital warts could be treated with a new product that they are conducting a clinical trial on, so I'm on the list.  My house looks beautiful with all these new windows, however I have to pay someone to fix all the leaks at the window sills.  I don't mind though, I really got a great deal.  The only problem is that they keep sending me bills for thousands of dollars, and I'm contesting it because I was told it was free.  I'm also contesting the Cirby vacuum company charges because they also said that their vacuum would be free if I allowed them to dump soil on my white carpet and vacuum it off.  It's still stained, but a promise is a promise.I'm telling you, this milk has made some magnificent changes in my life.  I highly recommend it above Lucerne.  And if you hear the attorneys on TV requesting you to call for a class-action suit against Cancerosia, I'm part of that, too.  I should make a few hundred bucks for losing my hearing, developing genital warts, and developing permanent hives!
title: This milk changed my life!

body: I ordered this product for my wife, who wished to bathe in milk, as she heard this is good for the skin. Whenit arrived, I could not determine from the packaging if it was or was not pasteurized. I advised my of this potential complication, asking if she wanted her milk pasteurized, but she assured me that as long as it was past her ass, she could splash it on the rest of her. So, this was not an issue; however, others may wish to know.
title: The Secret Dairymen's Handshake

body: I was working late on a tough case. Amazon Uranium Ore was being smuggled out of the country. The cops didn't know how. They had reluctantly asked me for help. Because I got results.When the blonde walked through the door to my office, I could see she was no ordinary dame. Despite the hourglass figure and legs up to her neck, her face was what caught my eye. She was sporting a milk mustache over her full pouty lips. I remembered those lips well. They're the reason why I started keeping napkins in my desk drawer.She carried a jug, but I could see that it was not the only one she had. While I hoped to eventually see the other two, she distracted me by unscrewing the cap from the one in her hand."Aren't you happy to see me, Slim?" she asked. I rolled my chair closer to my desk so she couldn't see just how happy I was. I played it cool."Sure, baby," I said. "Been a long time.""I know, Slim," she whispered, casting her eyes down to the floor. When she bent over to pick them back up, I could see she had tears in them. I hadn't cleaned in a while. The floor was dusty."Have a seat," I said, watching her. She moved like a cat, slow and sinuous, and walked past the chair. Coming around my desk, she perched on the edge of it, crossing her legs in a way that gave me a glimpse of what the future held. Because there on her knee, she placed the jug that she had been carrying. I could plainly see the label now, "Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz."Fearing my voice would crack like my resolve, I kept my mouth shut and watched as she poured the life-giving fluid into my glass. It sparkled, almost glowing in the dim 40 watt light of my office, as if it was lit by some internal power source. That's when I knew she was using the jug to transport the uranium ore."Well, aren't you going to drink it?" she asked, looking at me suspiciously. She was a dame. That's what they do. But she didn't intimidate me. Not until I reached for my piece and she started unbuttoning her blouse. Because that's when I saw what she was wearing under it: The Mountain Three Wolf Moon Short Sleeve Tee, its moon bulging in three eye-catching dimensions.I knew right then that this was the gal for me. Tossing the Tuscan Whole Milk back in one gulp, I set my glass down on the desk."Pour me another?" I said. She smiled and nodded.
title: Tall, Cool Lady
