That's no goodBut the bubbles in my gutThey put me in a rutOf digestive despairThis lactose ain't fair!From whole milk, I make descentI prefer 2 percent...
title: No one in this review panel is normal. Lactose Intolerance....Intolerance

body: Connoisseurs of fine milk often ask, "Why is Tuscan Whole Milk so expensive? Is it the velvety texture, the lightly sweet lactose, the softened hue?" I just smile, amused by the idea that Tuscan's value is defined by its physical components. The truth is something greater, more ethereal, and immeasurable. More than just letting our cows traipse freely across the grassy meadows. More than just their fibrous organic diet.Tuscan Whole Milk is all about relationships. Specifically, the relationship with the cow.We don't treat our cows as mere objects. We're not the type to hang out in barns after hours, filling our emotional voids with the first over-lipsticked heifer who winks at us. We don't confuse our passion with vulgar hunger. We're not dairy lizards on the prowl, looking for vacuous, weathered Bessies to swap cud and play hide-the-udder with.We take our time. We want to get to know the cow. Its passions, its dreams. Our commonalities.Maybe we'll start with dinner. A candle is lit, Mantovani strings play softly. I enter the stable in Versace overalls and masculine confidence. I have bruschetta with kalamata and roasted red pepper tapenade; she has a clump of orchard grass.We don't need each other's life story. We are two beings who just happened to intersect at the same time - we care about who we are now. There will be a lifetime for us to ask questions of each other. But for now, we consume ourselves in each other's gazes and swim in the light of our connection.We laugh. Oh, how we laugh.After we dissolve in the pleasure of each other's company, after we've talked and mooed about our dreams, our loves, the scars of our past heartbreaks, dark moments when we were tipped over by college pranksters - only then do I level my stare, gather my longing and courage, and ask the question that has hovered over the entire morning. A question that must be asked with grace and poise, cognizant of desire, yet protective of the vulnerability of the secret that passes between us:"Forgive me if this is too forward, but the stirrings of my heart beat in time to the cocking of the rooster, my pulse quickens with the movement of the tractor, and my intent is well-meant. My gentle bovine, my cherished, hooved friend... may I milk you?"And then, the moment. I place my stool beside her udder, as if I am laying a ceremonial carpet `neath a queen. I pat her side. It's all right, I'm saying. I'm beside you. Close your eyes, my pet, and dream of Kentucky bluegrass.I start gently, with a mild tug, a touch that says all that words cannot. But it can't be rushed, or forced into speed. I'm not some teenage jackhammer, and she's no automatic fountain. Gentle rolls, knowing caresses, speed and velocity only ramping up as it feels natural. My pace hastens, my heart sets it charges, my voice rises to sing with the celestial chorale.At long last, our forbidden dance reaches its pinnacle, its emotional summit! "We're almost there!" I exclaim! "Love me!" she... well, I'm pretty sure she's saying "Love me" in cowspeak, whatever that is. Then at last, long last, I hear the first drops in the bottom of the bucket. Then a quicker series of drops, then... oh, then! Streams of lactic gold, filling our coffers, gushing towards ecstasy until it nearly spills over the sides!It ends all too quickly, yet it feels complete. I roll over and chew on a hayseed. She stands there. Oh, the volumes of words she says by the stillest of movements. She doesn't have to be outlandish in her actions. She doesn't have to acknowledge anything. She knows. We know.So when people ask me, "Why is Tuscan Whole Milk so expensive?", I respond with a shaking head, a raised eyebrow, and return the question to them -"Have you ever really loved a cow?"
title: It's all about relationships.

body: Milk, how could such a simple word make someone experience such an array of emotions. After finishing my checkout purchase I giggled at myself for ordering such a simple product, but I was completely wrong this product is far from simple. When I finally received the Tuscan Dairy Milk 128 oz. I felt more awake then ever my body felt rebirth while my eyes settled on the luxurious curves of the container. My fingers trailed over the label, the handle, and then finally finding the red ribbed cap that keeps the beauty contained inside. Like a caged bird needing to be set free, I quickly turn the cap and toss it across the floor. There it is sitting in there ready to take any shape that I desire. But as quick as my happiness and curiosity came it vanished, first I saw the milk slowly vibrating then my table, then my house was completely shaking, we were experiencing an earthquake. I had to make the choice save the milk that was nearing the end of the table or take cover and save myself. I do what not many people would do in this situation but I have a conscience and I couldn't let my Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz go to waste and not given a chance to be enjoyed. I throw my self on top of the milk to protect it from the on coming debris from my ceiling caving in. Soon I was laying in a puddle of milk under a pile of debris. I knew I could just wait there for help but I needed to save what was left in my Tuscan Whole Milk container. I began digging up to the surface, I cut myself plenty of times but I wasn't worried about my minor injuries, I only had one thing on my mind and it was to have my salivary glands finally taste what was left of the Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk. I could finally here birds chirping in the distance I'm all most there, I can see a little bit of sunshine through the last of what was on top of me. I pushed myself up and my body and my milk was saved. I knew I was going to lose consciousness soon because of my bleeding wounds I quickly raised the milk to my lips but it was to late I passed out. This is why I find myself here again about to purchase my second Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz. Hopefully this time I can experience the sensual Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk.
title: The Experience

body: It had been 6 months since I had last seen Greg smile. Despite having been married and getting the big promotion earlier that year, he just couldn't shake the funk he was in. It might have been that things hadn't turned out quite how he expected or maybe it was just a hormonal thing, but he wasn't himself. I wanted to change that. We went to our favorite spot in the woods right by his house to talk it out. When we arrived, the first thing I did was pull out a bottle of water: his favorite!You see, Greg had been raised on water. It's an unusual thing, I know, but his mom had encouraged him to drink the stuff right from birth. With every meal, he'd order an ice cold water. As he took his first sip of the smooth, thirst-quenching concoction, I KNEW I would get to see my old friend in his happiest state for the first time in months. I looked up to see those beautiful pearly whites...And I caught nothing but dismay. If water, of all the drinks in the world, couldn't raise his spirits, what could?  There had to be something. I had to find a way.I traveled high and low looking for a solution.Greg and I climbed the Himalayas to seek out the fabled Orange Juice Monks. The tangy goodness they crafted left Greg unmoved.We set sail for the Cove of the Sunken Tea. After days of deep-tea diving, we found our booty. But Greg just shrugged off its bold flavor with a frown.In London, we found a hidden alleyway stacked to the buildings' roofs with Gatorade: all flavors! As Greg filtered them all down his gullet alphabetically, he sunk further and further into his depression.Finally, we returned home, hopeless. When Greg and I parted ways, I tried to distract myself from the problem. I dove headfirst into the internet. After 3 straight days of browsing, an advertisement caught my eye. It was for an obscure vendor called "Amazon.com." As if I had no free will of my own, my hand moved the mouse to the ad and clicked it.A search bar at the top: how quaint. With Greg at the forefront of my mind, I moved my cursor there and typed in "depression antidotes." And what was the first item that came up?Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. My heart jumped and I placed an order to be delivered to Greg's house immediately!I know I don't need to tell those of you who have tried this product, but Greg is the happiest he's ever been. He quit his meaningless job the day after he took his first sip and started his own business the next day. Forbes has him on their list of "500 Entrepreneurs to Watch in 2015."He and his wife are more in love and more sexually active than ever before. They're even expecting their first child in the Spring! I think I know what THAT baby will be drinking.Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz saved my friend's life. 5 stars!
title: Its Creamy White Texture Saves Lives

body: I thought 1500 generally positive reviews couldn't be wrong so I went ahead and bit the bullet and bought Tuscan Milk 1 gallon 128 oz. I have to say I was a little disappointed. Although it did, as some other reviewers noted, grant me the ability to fly and read other people's thoughts, I found myself craving it at odd times. I would constantly check the refrigerator to make sure it was still there, sometimes waking up in middle of the night to go into the kitchen to make sure it was safe. I soon began to suspect that my roommate was drinking it and surreptitiously drew a line to make sure that I would notice any theft. When I found him flagrante delicto with an icy cold glass of my Tuscan Milk 1 gallon 128 oz I strangled him to death with the cord my Hamilton Beach Quesadilla Maker, which was as a whole, a much better Amazon purchase that I wholeheartedly endorse as it makes seriously delicious crispy quesadillas and has a cord that is both firm and durable.
title: Mixed Results

body: This gave me diarrhea, and it was the best thing ever. I have not had such a powerful colon cleanser in a while. The poo was soft, and it smelled pungent. It did not give me a hard time, like the times I eat cheese. Anyone who needs a cleansing, internally and externally, should buy a jug of this beautiful milky substance, and lather in it, soak in it, drink it, and indulge in it. I am not the same person before I was introduced to this liquid of the colon gods.
title: Lactose Intolerance

body: I have been looking for some new drink ideas for years and I truly believed that I had tried them all; water, coffee, orange juice, apple juice, other juice, other types of water, flavored coffee, ice coffee....you name it.  So imagine my surprise when I discovered Tuscan Whole Milk - thank you Amazon!  I guess it was the packaging that initially drew my attention to it.  Was the jug a gorgeous white or is this product actually that color?  Solving that mystery alone made this purchase a winner.  Spoiler Alert: THIS STUFF IS ACTUALLY WHITE!!!There were no directions on the packaging, so I was a little confused on how to properly use this product.  After searching online for hours I discovered that the red cap on top actually screws off of the jug counter-clockwise (who thinks of these things?) I carefully unsrewed the red cap, but immediately ran into my next quandry; what do I do now? Back to the internet(please Tuscan add some directions to the packaging or at least include a manual of some type).Turns out the cut out on the jug isn't simply decorative, it's actually a handle (great idea guys!).  While you cannot get both hands around the handle, believe me I tried, you can adequately control the jug by using 1 hand.  The jug is quite heavy and the opening fairly wide, so I would not suggest trying to drink directly from the jug, I have 3 velvet vests at the dry cleaners who can attest to this!  So I would recommend transferring the milk from the jug to some type of smaller receptacle.  I went with an empty glass that I was storing in my cabinet, if you don't have one of these check on Amazon under "housewares" and you can probably find one.Once transferring the milk to my glass, it was time for the taste test.  I sheepishly raised the glass to my lips and took a baby sip while holding my nose (I had no idea what to expect).  It was glorious!  I proceeded to drink the entire glass.  Long story short, this was a great purchase and I have been telling all of my friends about Tuscan Whole Milk.  It's so good I'm going to try to find other uses for this product other than simply drinking it.  Any suggestions would be much appreciated guys!Please be on the lookout for my video review of Tuscan Whole Milk.  I'm going to give my review, but also include some tips on how to work the red cap and handle.  It should be a real time-saver for everybody.
title: First Time User

body: That's if anything is any good anymore. I ordered a gallon of this artisanal milk, I thought it might be a pleasant step up from the normal milk I put in my cereal and coffee. I guess I was hoping for a new direction, a new start, some kind of… I don't know… hope for the future.And at first, I thought, hey, this is gonna work. I poured some over my Honey Nut Cheerios. Now, I'm old enough to remember when Honey Nut Cheerios came on the market. It was a different world then, bright, colorful, out with the old and in with the new. It felt like anything was going to be possible. If there was a cereal to recapture the possibilities of the future, it's Honey Nut Cheerios. If there was a milk to pair with that bold and audacious cereal, it would be Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz.I don't know how much time passed, all I know is that next thing, I became aware of the stench of the curdled milk in the half eaten bowl. I suppose at some point I simply stopped chewing, and continued to sit there in my bathrobe, and judging from the amount of beard on my face and the curdled milk it had been some time.I got up, and rinsed out the bowl, and went back to bed. I can tell you this about Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz, it's not going to bring her back. Nothing is going to bring her back. She's gone, and that's that.As such I can only halfheartedly recommend Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. I can pretty much only halfheartedly recommend anything anymore, though. I'm going to bed.
title: It's a good milk, I guess.

body: I ordered my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fluid oz., and receiving it in a timely manner, I decided to taste it to see if, indeed, it would suit me.  I am happy to say it suited me quite well, and I ended up drinking the whole gallon by the end of the day, finishing up with a nightcap of warm milk before bed.  I drifted off to sleep with a full belly, warmth in my heart, and a smile on my face as my last waking thoughts were of the deliciousness of the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fluid oz., both cold and heated.Alas, my waking smiles turned to sleeping dread.  It seemed as if I entered dream state the moment my head hit the pillow and my bedside lamp was off.  Suddenly I was in a field in Italy, and a local farmer was yelling at me, "Che cosa hai fatto? Che cosa hai fatto?  Che cosa faranno adesso?"  Even though I do not speak Tuscan, somehow I knew he was saying, "What have you done? What have you done?  What will they do now?"He motioned for me to come closer, and as I did a giant barn shaped building rose from the ground.  It looked to me to be the size of Rhode Island.  I could hear distant bleats and snorts as well as hooves pawing the ground.  The farmer opened the massive door and beckoned me inside.I could not believe what I saw.  Thousands, no MILLIONS of calves, in various stages of starvation, looked up as the old farmer pointed to me.  "Egli è l'unico!" he cried to the restless crowd.  "He's the one!"The calves as one unit turned to me, their baleful bleats roaring like thunder in my ears.  They did not attack, did not stampede, simply looked at me with their huge brown eyes as if to ask, "How could you?  How could you take our only food from us?"Then a single calf, malnourished to the point its skin looked like a mere blanket covering its skeleton, feebly walked up to me.  Its huge eyes stared into mine, and I bent down to face it.  It gave one sorrowful bleat, a bleat that pierced my heart and shattered it into a thousand pieces, then it lay down at my feet and died.Sobbing profusely I picked the calf up, cradled it in my arms and thought, why?  Why had I ordered Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fluid oz.?  I had soda, water, beer, coffee and various teas at home.  Why had I been so selfish as to order what these calves clearly needed to live?Suddenly, the old farmer shut the door.  One by one, the calves started advancing on me.  Their hooves turned to pitchforks and their teeth to sharp needles.  Fire flew from their nostrils, and their tails became scorpions tales.  I ran to the door, but it would not budge.Thankfully I woke up at this point.Knowing it would be awhile before I could get to sleep, I stumbled to my study, turned on the computer, and decided to write all of this down.Try as I may, I could not get back to sleep.  And that's when cold reality hit me:  It had all been a dream.  Calves do not breathe fire or have scorpion tails.  Nor do they starve in order for us to drink milk.And warm Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fluid oz. would really help me sleep right now.I ordered another gallon right then and there.Stay tuned for the next nightmare...
title: Beware the Tuscan Calves

body: After ordering Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gal, 128 fl. oz., my wife of 14 years suddenly became super amorous. I can't explain it. She uses it in everything now. I can't keep her off of me. We're walking in the mall and her hand is constantly on my tush. She's calling me at work and talking dirty over the phone. I can't get any work done. The other day we were heading for the beach, and she had a WHOLE glass of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gal, 128 fl. oz. and we can't even get out the door before she's all over me in her string bikini. This is getting serious! She's ordering all of these little intimate things now from Amazon, you know how they show up in your email when it's shipped. A few days ago this really hot little number shows up and I'm like, "If she wears that I am a goner!" I actually hid the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gal, 128 fl. oz., but it didn't matter. She's keeping small containers of it in the little fridge in the bedroom now! I'm trying to .... finish this but .... she wo-- leave me aloneee ......
title: This stuff will get you laid.

body: I ordered this milk because my family drinks a LOT of milk, okay? Normally we buy a gallon of milk at the store and it just does. Not. Last. Sick and tired of our weekly milk dilemma, I decided to go online for help. I researched my options thoroughly, and when I finally found this special super-size milk - 1 gallon, 128 fl oz, or so it claimed to be! - I thought, there it is! Someone has finally made milk in a package large enough to meet my family's special needs.When the package arrived, I thought it looked a little small for 1 gallon and 128 fluid ounces. When I opened it up, I was dismayed to find a container that appeared to be the exact same size as our normal gallon jugs of milk. I held it up to an empty carton and sure enough, it matched in size. Next, I began serving glasses of milk for my children, pouring the contents of the jug out into my measuring cup before transferring it into glasses. I ran a tally of the ounces served, until all my children's bellies were full on milk, and would you look at that! It only added up to 128 fl oz. Hello? Where is the gallon part?! A whole gallon is missing and what's even stranger is that the 128 fl oz part looks exactly the same as a gallon, but the gallon is nowhere to be found.I am trying to return the empty jug for a refund, but the company won't get back to me. 1-star for an inferior product and zero customer service.
title: NOT 1 gal, 128 fl oz!

body: as quickly as it came, it was gone.ive always been told that if you love something you must set it free and i cannot wait until tuscan dairy pastures graces me once more with another 128 fl. oz of this sweet frothy delicacy.I remember it as if it were yesterday, i stood outside awaiting its delivery. after graciously tipping the delivery driver i took my package inside."well its just you and me now"i sat patiently awaiting a response... but none came."come on now dont be shy," i said gazing upon the beauty before me.after much hesitation, she came around.we had a lot of fun that summer.unfortunately i let my thirst get the best of me.which lead to her unfortunate and untimely demise.until next time, Tuscan Dairy Whole Vitamin D Milk. Gallon, 128 Fl oz.with lovefred
title: she was really something,

body: He always brought home milk on Friday.After a long hard week full of days he would burst through the door, his fatigue hidden behind a smile. There was an icy jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz in his right hand. With his left hand he would grip my waist - I was always cooking dinner - and press the cold frostiness of the jug against my arm as he kissed my cheek. I would jump, mostly to gratify him after a time, and smile lovingly at him. He was a good man, a wonderful husband who always brought the milk on Friday, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.Then there was that Friday, the terrible Friday that would ruin every Friday for the rest of my life. The door opened, but there was no bouyant greeting - no cold jug against the back of my arm. There was no Tuscan Whole Milk in his right hand, nor his left. There came no kiss. I watched as he sat down in a kitchen chair to remove his shoes. He wore no fatigue, but also no smile. I didn't speak, but turned back to the beans I had been stirring. I stirred until most of their little shrivelled skins floated to the surface of the cloudy water. Something was wrong, but it was vague wrongness that no amount of hard thought could  give shape to.Over dinner that night I casually inserted,"What happened to the milk?""Oh,"he smiled sheepishly, glancing aside,"I guess I forgot today."That was when I knew. He was tired of this life with me, tired of bringing home the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. He was probably shoveling funds into a secret bank account, looking at apartments in town, casting furtive glances at cashiers and secretaries and waitresses. That's when I knew it was over. Some time later he moved in with a cashier from the Food Mart down the street. And me? Well, I've gone soy.
title: One Friday, Without the Milk

body: What is this glory called Tuscan Milk? The sweet, pure, angelic color with the name that evokes DaVinci, Michelangelo, Raphael, and images of creamy gelato, hearty cheeses,and sandy beaches with foamy, white capped seas with lavender blue waters...It is to dream of and to taste just one silky, creamy drop on my tongue is agony. An agony I can't cure despite the wonders of Amazon Prime free mailing and quick, gorgeously muscled UPS men. For alas, I have lactose intolerance and that my friends evokes many different images of which I shall not disgrace these pages. Oh the sadness and shame of it all. That which heaven provides is still so far out of reach. *Sigh*,
title: That touch of heaven with a red, pomodoro sauce colored lid.

body: Have you ever had Sand People milk before? Obviously, when you milk a Tuscan Raider on a planet full of sand, you are bound to get residual sand particles in the mix. Little did I realize before pooring a glass of Tuscan milk that I would need to have a sieve handy. That said, the bottom two inches of the jug was nothing but sand. I guess I'll just stick with fresh almond milk for now. As hard as it may be to find the nipples on an almond, I'm sure its a lot tougher to get to the nipples on a Sand person, let alone find your way to Tatooine.
title: Its a trap!

body: I've never told anyone about my true love: Gorbie. Im married now but I always think about him. I have children and i wish they were his. My husband is such a disappointment because of this magical man. I live in a six million dollar home, I have four beautiful children, and my husband is a model for Calvin Klein. It isn’t enough. My life would be perfect if I hadn't met him. Most women are jealous of me but I want a different life, I want mine with Gorbie. It was the summer of 2008. I was out with friends at a bar in upper Manhattan. There was so many famous men, they were all flirting with me (including my husband). I felt like I was on top of the world until I saw him. He walked in with a wrinkly, stained Hawaiian top on: the kind old men wear. He had ripped cargo shorts, black nails (not from paint but from fungi), and his greasy hair. His whole body was greasy, I wanted to touch his hair. He looked and smelled like he hadn't showered for a month or more. When he spoke I thought I would die, he was so phlegmy you couldn't understand a word he said. I decided to talk to him and he was friendly but obviously wanted nothing to do with me. I then asked him how are you this hot. He wouldn't tell me. I proceeded to bombard him with questions. He told me he was a magician. I wanted him so bad. The bar was empty after abut 5 minutes of him entering the bar, so i had him all to myself. The whole bar smelled like him, it was wonderful! I continued asking him questions like how old are you, etc. He told me he was 49. I’m only 22 but I wasn't going to let that get between us. I was having so much fun with him. I asked him how are you this hot again. He then started to pull something out of his bag. It was a gallon of milk. He placed it on the bar counter and said Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon 128 fl.oz. My heart started pounding in my chest more than ever. I asked him to marry me, he said no. He started walking out of the bar. I yelled please tell me  your name. He yelled back Gorbie. That would be the first and the last time I would see the love of my life.
title: Gorbie

body: Two mice fell in a bucket of creamA desperate fate, a struggle metThe white flow a soft cold dreamThat pulled them down, a nightmare threat.One mouse drowned, a life submitThe other thrashed, he wouldn’t quitHis life was his, and strongly earnedAll the cream to butter, churned.I’ve earned your faith, a job, a house,As the mouse crawled out, to live his life.I’ve earned the love of my son and wife.I stand before you; I am that mouse.Then the same thing happened with Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz  and it worked just as well.
title: Two Little Mice

body: 6 years ago, I was a homeless man living on the streets of Manhattan. But then my life changed forever, a kind stranger approached me, holding something behind his back. Then, without saying a word, placed a beautiful artifact in front of me. Tuscan milk. Needless to say I was confused but I accepted the gift. Less than a day later, the bridge I was sleeping under collapsed, trapping me. For the next 7 days I had nothing to drink save this milk. Without it, I would have died. I saw this milk as a sign of God and decided to change some things. Eventually I got a job working as a fry cook at a small resturuant chain and got the courage to face my family again. My father and I began to work together and I got an idea for a business. My father, being a well off man, proceeded to give me a small loan of a million dollars. Using that money, I established multiple hotels across the country, started my own family, and even starred on my own tv show. Now I have a larger goal, to become president of the United States of America. My name is Donald J Trump, and this milk has allowed me to stump the negativity out of my life, and it is all because of...Tuscan...milk...
title: Can't stump the trump

body: Nothing drives me to the brink of desire like Tuscan Whole Milk. Just the thought of that creamy elixir stripped from the teats of a grass chomping ruminant can make me fling my jugs right out of the sack and call my hubby over for some serious quaffing. Wow, those look great, he'll say, his eyes fixed on the cold beads of sweat sliding down the contours of the milk jugs. It's not long before we're gulping down big mouthfuls of foamy goodness packaged by Tuscan in a convenient 1 gallon, 128 fl. oz. size.
title: Tuscan play at this game

body: Flashback: 3 years ago. I was just a geek. A nobody. I jammed out to Justin Bieber in my Hannah Montana pajamas. Little did I know, my life was about to change.My friend, Bethany, was the coolest girl ever. She was popular and her parents even let her watch PG-13 movies. She was the greatest.We rode our bikes (me on my awesome pink trike with glitter streamers out the handles and a squeaky horn. It was pimped out with beads on the spokes and a matching pink glittery unicorn helmet). We met up with her friend, a sophomore named Mike. Mike led us to the other end of town, into a dark alley. I'll never forget the sight of it. Curious items and trinkets littered the area. On a pedestal, we saw it: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. It was the most beautiful thing I'd ever seen, besides Nick Carter.We asked to buy the milk, but the guy refused, telling us to get lost. Mike continued insisting, until the guy pulled a gun on us. I hid in my pig tails and nervously bit down on my retainer. "Let's just go, guys", I squeaked. Mike scoffed, stating his parents were gone for the weekend and him and Bethany were going to drink the whole gallon, to seal their fate as soulmates.Mike lunged for the gun, prompting Bethany to grab the milk and run. She grabbed it and ran, me sitting on a moldy pizza box, stupefied. A gunshot echoed throughout the alleyway. Mike fell to the ground. Next I heard another shot and Bethany's groan. Trembling, I ran to her. The guy ran the opposite way, upon hearing sirens. I held Bethany in my arms, crying. "Take.... The Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz", she stammered.Before I could say, "heckdoodly with that dingdang milk!", it jumped from her arms and bit me, before scurrying up the alley's wall!I've since gained special abilities. I now listen to Slayer and Pantera. My teeth are straight and my hair no longer in pigtails. Best of all, I can transform into a gallon of fresh, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. Each night, I ride my spiked Harley Davidson through town, looking to avenge Bethany's death. I..... AM MILKGIRL.
title: It gives sweet superpowers!

body: I do not mean the milk. It has been known for a long time.  However, I have discovered that adding a little milk to coffee produces an unexpected improvement.  This is not obvious.  While milk and coffee are both liquids, they have quite different properties.  Milk is light in color, usually cold, and is the product of animals.  Coffee is dark, hot, and is a plant product.  I am convinced that if the millions of coffee drinkers knew about milk, they would become eager consumers.  Venture capital anyone?
title: Invention of the Century

body: I highly recommend this product. After years of failure putting cows through my Juiceman, Tuscan Whole Milk has come out with a product that not only looks like milk, but actually is milk. I have no idea how they've done it, but surely there is a patent on their brilliant process. The best I could ever hope to get was a pulpy red mess with chips of bone and some fur.
title: I highly recommend this product.

body: Feeling a thirst for some delicious white nectar I happened apon this product. At first I was very curious as to why someone would want to order a dairy product online, but my curiousity was soon answered with this very reasonable $45 gallon of what I would argue to be "God Juice". I cannot explain to you how the product has altered my life. I awake every morning looking forward to having just a sip of this milk.I have actually started a pure milk diet that is benifiting me tremendously. Granted it is a bit on the expensive side costing me roughly $1,000.00 a week but it is doable now that I am living out of my car due to my house being forclosed on. Its quite easy to keep in the trunk in a cooler by simply buying ice every few hours.Basically what I am saying is that Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon 128 fl oz is the best thing to have every come in my life and I will be a lifetime drinker.
title: WOW

body: In Tuscan fields the milk doth flow  Between the bossies, row on row,  That mark our milks; and in the aisle  The jugs, still bravely waiting, sighScarce heard amid the shops below.We are the Cows. Short days agoWe milked, and squeezed, saw liquid flow,  Milked and were milked, and now we lie,  In Tuscan fields.Take up our quarrel with the supermarket:To you from failing hands we throw  The Tuscan milk; be yours to hold it high.  If ye break faith with 128 ouncesWe shall not sleep, though milk doth flow  In Tuscan fields.
title: In Tuscan Fields, by Lieutenant McCrae

body: I ordered this product for my wife, who wished to bathe in milk, as she heard this is good for the skin. Whenit arrived, I could not determine from the packaging if it was or was not pasteurized. I advised my of this potential complication, asking if she wanted her milk pasteurized, but she assured me that as long as it was past her ass, she could splash it on the rest of her. So, this was not an issue; however, others may wish to know.
title: Pasteurized?

body: When I ran across Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz I smiled as pleasant memories flooded my recollection.  As I child I would wait eagerly at the table in my dirty smock, picking scabs.  I'd hear my mother's limping footsteps as she staggered into the room, a big warm bowl of fresh milk shlorping in her withered hands.  My half-witted brother would utter shrill peeps of excitement and rise as far as his chains would permit before I yanked him back down on his bench so I could claim my share.  Well do I remember his moans of envy and Mother's rasping chortle as I slurped deeply of the creamy white nectar, redolent of Swiss meadows, tinkling cow bells and bosomy dirndl-clad milk maids named Inga.When I asked Mother why our milk was so good, she would smile her gap-toothed grin and point to the nuclear power plant that towered over our little farm.  The milk had a curious tingly buzz and faint whiff of ozone that Mother said was ionizing radiation.  It would keep for months without refrigeration.So when I saw Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz on Amazon, I couldn't resist.  I ordered a tin of uranium ore from Amazon along with it.  When it arrived in the post, I poured myself a big bowl, mixed in the ore and had a long slurp.  It was just the way I remembered it!  The rich texture, the tingle, the flies.  All that was missing was my brother's envious gurgles.Highly recommended!
title: brings back memories

body: This is the real thing! Obtained from lactating Natives of Tuscany, (not those posers in Arizona) and shipped straight to you from Italy like the finest wines. The flavor of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is far superior to products of other regions and a long-time favorite of international milk connoisseur clubs globally.A real find!
title: Not to be confused with the Tucson knock off

body: My first jug of this milk was the best $45 I ever spent. It made me the envy of my "milk crew"! You see, me and my buddies loved to hang out and drink milk together. Just get set up in the Costco parking lot, blast some Skynyrd, and pound some cold 2% on a hot day. You can bet people got jealous when they saw us in action.Over time, this milk-drinking thing became a real competition. Mark Polzack was the best of the bunch - the fastest milk-drinker north of 76th Street. He could take down anything from a half-pint to a quart without blinking. They didn't call him "Milky Mark" for no reason. He was always bragging about how he scored high quality milks from Lon's Grocery, and soon we all started doing the same. We went from 2% to 4% to the organic whole milks! Couldn't beat the rush of that white stuff pumping through my veins and dribbling down my chin!Have you ever taken down a speedball? That's when you mix whole milk with buttermilk and chug it.  Really gets you going, but it can lead to some real benders. "Dairy Dan" McKinley even wound up in the ER after a 3-day buttermilk rager! I stuck to the whole milks after that. Problem is, I built up a huge tolerance to milk and kept looking for something stronger and purer. Most milk producers cut their product with fillers and chemicals to get a cheap, addictive product on the streets. You're lucky to get milk that's even 80% Holstein anymore. The standard milks, even from Lon's, weren't doing the job. I needed something MORE.So I sprung $45 for 128 fl oz of the Tuscan Whole Milk. It's imported from Tuscany so the dirty U.S. milk grocers don't have a chance to meddle with it. What you're getting here is the real deal. It arrived in a timely manner, with discreet packaging that didn't tip the Feds off. I drew the shades, put on some Skynyrd, and slowly slipped my first glass. Instantly, I became gripped with euphoria - my heart raced and my stomach tingled. I saw stars, and had magnificent visions of spotted cows prancing through violet fields. This milk had to be at least 98% Holstein - it was that strong. I damn near drank half the jug and saved the rest for the next night's milk party.When Milky Mark and Dairy Dan saw what I had, they couldn't believe it. Their eyes were as wide as saucers (of milk). They couldn't believe I got such a bargain on this gallon of milk! Once they got their first hits of Tuscan Whole Milk, they were hooked. This milk provided the perfect rush, without the jitteriness and stomach-upset of store-bought milks. Now it is all we order, and nobody else is the wiser. Our rival milk gang at the Safeway parking lot is going nuts trying to figure out where we get our stuff. Your loss, suckers!To everybody else, I say cut out the middleman and get this Tuscan Whole Milk on Amazon, imported from the famous dairy barns of Tuscany! Everybody save your milk money for this dairy-licious deal!!! 5 STARS!!!
title: Milk Money Miracle!

body: If they had this at the end of "The Grapes of Wrath," it would be a very different book. Just a thought.
title: Just a thought

body: I had an extra 50 dollars burning a hole in my pocket, and I immediately thought- Tuscan Whole Milk time!  I eagerly awaited its arrival, and lined my countertops with bowls of cereal and cups of coffee, and had water boiling on the stove in anticipation of preparing the best macaroni and cheese I'd ever tasted.The product more than lived up to its reputation.  The rich quality exceeded even that of the Black Forest Wisent Milk I had splurged on last summer.  The Wisent Milk had little effect on me, but this stuff- since my first taste of this 'milk', I'd begun inexplicably speaking in some strange dialect.  I babbled constantly, yet no-one could understand me.  In a panic, I drove to the nearest Natural History Museum and consulted the head of the Historical Object Department.  He consulted his colleague in Linguistics, and finally my indecipherable stream of words was identified as Ancient Etruscan.  These two kind scholars aided in the translation of this crude missive, so I could convey my strange conundrum to any future potential buyers of this product.I now roam my once-familiar landscape clad in a heavy tunic and intricate [and painful] sandals with strange upcurving toes, my hair artfully plaited.  I am often seized by the powerful desire to construct an aqueduct, and must constantly fight the urge to try to discern what fate awaits me via the examination of various animal livers.  [Fortunately, the local market sells both beef and chicken liver, so I have been able to exercise this compulsion in a limited fashion without consequence- thus far.]  Perhaps Cathua and Lasa Vecu will hear my prayers...My gallon of 'Tuscan Milk' [or whatever this potion is] ran out long ago.  Yet I continue to make absolutely no sense to the locals and have despairingly confined myself to my chamber, which I have daubed with the soothing tones of ochres and oxide.  I sit by the light of my oil lamp and blow sadly into my aulos, hoping to make sense of it all.
title: caveat emptor

body: ...but it's the same Bantha milk those detestable raiders have been peddling for years.I will never forgive them for what they did to the Skywalker family.Who do you think you're fooling Tuscans?
title: The product name may have changed...

body: While the milk itself is divine, I confess that I'm disturbed at the picture of the cow arched provocatively over the label.  At once, I knew that this pose was stolen. In fact, I distinctly remember that lovely day at the beach in St. Augustine when I was showing off my new cow-spotted one piece I bought from a local dairy.  My husband told me to try a back bend and when I did, we both heard the ominous clicking of an I-phone.I would like Tuscan to remit payment for said stolen picture.
title: Thieves!!!

body: Jared didn't make it home again last nigh.  Our neighbor boy's pig, a sure winner for the fair, had taken ill for the third time this week.  My heart just breaks for he and his momma.  They been working so hard after that layabout she married didn't layabout no more.  So here I am pulling Jared's rubber boots on so I can get to the girls singing to me from the barn.  It's 6 am and it's already so hot I'm sure Satan decided to take the day off.  My dress is sticking to me like a paper napkin on a whiskey sour.  It don't matter none.  I'm so dang proud I can help America plunk down a cold, sweet jug of Tuscan dairy whole milk, 1 gal, 128 fl. oz.
title: God Bless America!

body: My God what a milk. I'm not 100% sure what species it comes from, but I am 100% sure it's the most delicious jug of white blood that has ever spewed from an animal. I have spent my entire adult life trying to recapture the experience and taste of baby formula and so far, this is the closest I've come. Drink it ice cold after mowing the lawn to cool away the summer blues; drink it it hot right before bed and have the most disturbing dreams you will ever have in your life. I've bought a jug a week for the past two years and although I've quadrupled the amount of time I spend in the bathroom and have gone cross-eyed, my sexual stamina has increased by two-minutes and I now have a much greater appreciation for people who have attempted to milk an Italian moose and succeeded. Also, the empty jug makes for a cool souvenir and is great for showing your friends you have expensive tastes when it comes to imported Internet milk.
title: Tasty and Functional

body: REVIEW FOR USED MILK:I can't comment on new milk but the gallon of used milk I got wasn't very good at all, it loses something the second time around.Also $75 is a bit pricey for used milk.
title: Not as good when used

body: I opted to purchase the VINTAGE Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz for $185 because you get what you pay for... and who doesn't like vintage, right?  Well worth the money!When I served the clumpy, noxious, twenty year old milk to my hipster neighbors (who never gave me the time of day before), they snarled and asked why this milk smelled like ass. When I explained that it is vintage milk, they loved it, and most importantly, LOVED ME!  I am now the coolest person in my neighborhood because of this milk that I have imported to me from Italy.  My self esteem has gone up and I no longer want to throw myself in front of a bus. Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz for giving my life meaning.
title: Vintage Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz gave my life meaning

body: Tuscan Whole Milk changed my life from dull to exciting. For years, I worked as a clerk for a solicitors firm, with most of my day being spent filling in forms. However, one day my boss called me in to his office and explained that I was to visit one of our more reputable clients: 'Count Tuscany', with my role being to  present some forms for signing. Off I went, and after grappling through the British train system, a devouring tempest and some strange superstitious locals, I finally hurtled off in a donkey driven cart through the darkness of night and mountains.  Eventually, I found myself at Count Tuscany's castle. I chapped the large omnipotent door hesitantly. Finally, it was answered by a strange foreign looking man and I was quickly ushered in and told to sit at a table. I shall never forget that table: On it lay the biggest bottle of Tuscan Whole Milk I had ever clapped eyes on - indeed it truly looks bigger than 1 Gallon, 128 flz. 'Drink' Count Tuscany said, and I did and honestly, I have never felt the same since. Everyone should drink this!
title: Tuscan Whole Milky Goodness

body: I ordered this several weeks ago. However, when it was shipped I did not receive milk, but rather cheese. I was very disappointed and thought of writing a one star review until I realized the cheese was Casu marzu, the formaggio marcio of Italian fame. I was able to sell the cheese at a considerable profit on the black market, or as I prefer to call it, the noir market.
title: Not what I was looking for, but not bad

body: I am new to both milk and cooking, so when the recipe I was trying called for "milk" I went to the best place I know of to research new products: Amazon. When I saw all the positive reviews for Tuscan Whiole Milk, I knew this was what I needed and so I bought three  containers.  So when I got to needing the milk in the recipe, the first step was easy. Twisting the cap off allowed me to easily pour in the sugar that was needed (but strangely left out of the recipe). And I quickly learned to pour it slowly so that I could mix it in without having the milk spill out of the container. So far, so good.  And the top screwed easily back on. Fantastic! But the next step is where I feel that my fellow reviewers let me down. I put the milk jug on the floor and jumped on it, surprised to see it come pouring out of the container!  That was odd, as the reviews led me to believe this milk is perfect. So I took the second jug, poured in the sugar, and then placed it under my car tire and slowly drove over it. What a mess! Yet again, I had thought this milk would perform better than this. So I had to write to warn others: while this milk sweetened ok, it apparently is not good enough to condense. Buyers beware!  I guess I'll have to figure out something else to do with the third container.
title: Not for all recipes

body: As a child, my father served in the armed forces. We traveled a lot and never stayed in one place very long. We traveled to Tuscany to a small village located to a smaller naval base. I didn't speak much Italian and my only friend was my mother.The small village was mostly older people but I did find a couple of children, slightly older than me, but children nonetheless. They didn't speak much English either but we somehow made it work. We ran the dusty streets and gentle sloping hills of the country side. We played the same as millions of children in The States, until sunset.Weary from a days play I would meander in and I would smell the wonderful smell of pasta and sauce slowly drifting from the small kitchen my mother was in. I would take my dirty cloths off and bath not realizing how hungry I indeed was. I put on my night cloths and wandered into the kitchen and sat down. My father was home by then and my mother served him first, I came second, and she last. We weren't Italian but mother always did a wonderful job preparing Italian food. I always drank milk for dinner but this time something was different. It was milk alright but something was different. This milk seemed to glow from the cup. The smell of rich cream and fresh milking was rising into my nostrils. It flooded my my mind with a tangent of aromas. The ice cold milk caused the outside of the cup to condensate with water. I wrapped my fingers around the ice cold cup of milk and slowly raised it to my waiting lips. As the deliciousness poured over my lips onto my eager tongue I waited to swallow. I wanted to savor this moment and this glorious refreshment. The rich and flavorful milk awakened taste buds in my mouth that have never been awoken before. Slowly, I let the coolness trickle down my throat. This was indeed a treat to behold. Mind you, I've had milk before but this was a whole different experience. I didn't chug the milk because a beverage this fine deserves to be nourished. My mother must have noticed my enjoyment and asked if I liked the milk, eagerly I shook my head and said yes very much so. She said this is a new milk, it is from right here in Tuscany. For the next two years I had the privilege and delight to partake of this Tuscan Whole Milk. When we moved I remembered feeling lost knowing that I'd never be able to drink it again but it still lingered just on the edge of my pallet. I tried many different milks since but nothing ever compared.I had thought all was lost until, one night, while searching for Christmas gifts. I decided to take a shot in the dark and search amazon.com for this milk. To my surprise it was here! Tears weld up in my eyes. My hands trembled as I entered my information. I still haven't received it yet but I can wait to taste this amazing milk again it's been many years since and I know that when I do everything in the world will be whole again.
title: Nostalgia

body: I highly recommend this product. After years of failure putting cows through my Juiceman, Tuscan Whole Milk has come out with a product that not only looks like milk, but actually is milk. I have no idea how they've done it, but surely there is a patent on their brilliant process. The best I could ever hope to get was a pulpy red mess with chips of bone and some fur.
title: Gaya's milk be blessed

body: Those of us who grew up in the 50's know what good milk is all about.  In that era of A-bomb testing, radioactive fallout dispersed itself onto the grasslands of the Midwest.  Cow milk from the heartland contained condensed radioactive power.  Just look at any TV show from the 50's and you're likely to see kids gulping down glassful after glassful of milk at the dinner table.  It was great stuff.  We rued the day when all the A-bomb testing was ordered underground.  I thought milk would never again deliver that delightful dose of universal power I had become accustomed to.  Tuscan has proved me wrong.  I don't know how they did it.  I am guessing it has something to do with cold fusion or nano-technology, but enjoy it now before they make it illegal.
title: Almost as good as the radioactive milk of the 1950's

body: As usual, I felt the slightest bit of trepidation towards the idea of ordering a pet over Amazon for my fie year old, Bartonothew. But, for the money Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon proved to be worth it.I wasn't sure if the weight listed was right, as 128 fl oz is perfect for Bartonothew. He's been very sick since birth with shingles and the thorpe so I was worried it would arrive and simply be too big to play with my little boy. But thank goodness, the weight was right on the money. I checked.Overall Tuscan Whole Milk is very patient, though as messy as you'd expect a new pet to be. It never lashed out at Baronothew, no matter what he does. It's almost impossibly quiet, as I don't think I'e ever heard it bark. Training Tuscan Whole Milk to do tricks, though, has proven impossible. I think my batch may have been born deaf. And again, it tends to make quite a mess when given to a five year old.4/5, would buy again.
title: A decent pet, if frustrating to train.

body: This milk made me the man I am today.  After not drinking milk for almost 5 years (as I became so disillusioned by the lack of all milk's whammo-mojo) I took a chance...yes, I paid this insane amount for a gallon, here on Amazon.  It arrived as cold as the driven snow, and nearly as white...of course the snow around here doesn't stay white for long with all the cars and dogs, but I digress....Halfway through this gallon,  my hair thickened, I was able to add 2 inches to my stride, I was able to lift both my dogs at once, and my wife got that twinkle in her eye again...though I suspect it may have been from the milkman.After waiting a couple days, I finished the rest, and was able to kick the milkman's butt.  Now that twinkle belongs to me.  Thanks Tuscan!
title: Milk of the Gods.

body: After reading so many requests for "used" Tuscan Whole Milk, and wondering where it could be purchased, a third-party seller finally shipped me some. The only advantage the "used" product has is price, I only paid $7.99 per gallon instead of $128,000.00. Otherwise, the milk was warm and watery. It had a yellowish cast, and though it did have a few bubbles at the top, the taste was bitter, rather like Brussels Sprouts. When I contacted the seller and told him I was p.o.'d, he just laughed at me.
title: Don't Buy It Used!

body: This product mixes well with chocolate syrup and the substrate did not settle out into an undesirable combination. Being that I enjoy extra chocolate flavor toward the end of the glass, it performed superbly in that respect. It also worked equally well when mixed liberally with coffee and sugar. I am currently in beta testing of the freezing properties of this solution to determine if it can be used as a suitable substitute for ice milk. Those wishing to donate additional quantities of the fluid and its related shipping costs will receive a complimentary copy of my research findings.
title: Qualities of Mixing

body: Daddy would bring it home to us twice a week. This was between the hours of 9 and 5 so Mommy's husband never caught on.
title: Reminds me of Daddy

body: It may be "Tuscan", which we ALL know demands at least a 500% price hike, but it doesn't even say "Organic" on the label? I mean come on...Where are the hand-drawn pictures of free-range, hormone-free, Italian bovine individuals, coquettishly batting their freakishly long eyelashes at you while they frolic through protected native grasslands? Where is the political statement on fair trade?How do we know they didn't just milk any old cow?
title: A little pricy.

body: I am a bit confused but happy with Tuscan Milk.  I read many reviews concerning "new"  and "used"  Tuscan 128oz heaven,... I wanted something divine so I ordered what the seller called "vintage"  for quite a bit more money,... Well I reeceived it in 2days and it seemed odd.  It was not the characteristically white color,.. It was not the velvety smooth bovine nectar I had expected.  Yes,  as mentioned previously by other fellow reviewers,  the cap was removed very easily.  Beautiful craftsmanship went into machining the caps threads and the matching threads on the carton as well.  Here where thing seemed different,... After opening,  I tried to pour my first jigger of milk and nothing came out?!?  I put the lid back on and shook the container and the milk moved like a solid block Scrapple.  I took the lid off, the quality of craftsmanship went unnoticed as I began to panic.  I shook that carton and nothing.  I then placed it between my legs and did the old thigh master technique squeezing out the milk like toothpaste.  Even though it looked like thick mayonnaise,.... I sliced off about an inch of milk,  put it in my jigger and threw it back.  I suffered from a little gag reflex and the texture made my eyes water,  but after repeating 9-10 times,  I found it quite pleasant and very smooth,  even after some got stuck between my teeth.  I thigh mastered some into my cereal bowl over my honey nut cheerios and mixed it together,... It reminded me of the days when grabbing a handful of cookie dough from my mother's mixing bowl.  It was unique and satisfying experience.  I want to try grapenuts next.  I think the crunchy grapenuts may help keep the milk from getting lodged in my teeth?  I am very happy with my 2012 vintage Tuscan Milk and will reorder again,... Hopefully I can still buy a itmay be rare,...
title: Vintage?

body: Finally I found it! THE Tuscan milk....OMG! Ever since my aunt Fannie took me to a wonderful spa in Barstow (they used ONLY Tuscan milk in their treatments!) I've been dying to get my hands on this wholesome goodness in a bottle. It makes an incredible facial wash AND bath (please refer to my image #56 above, in the product description). If you're the organic type and want to avoid chemicals it makes the perfect skin wash that makes you feel clean and OH SO SOFT! It's been said that Cleopatra took milk baths, and there's a darned good reason she did. Amazing skin! THAT is what you get with Tuscan milk, and the more you use...the better! I honestly think my wrinkles are going away (my stomach seems flatter and my buttocks is tighter too!), people often comment on my "creamy" skin. A friend recently started using it as a hair conditioner, but I haven't tried it yet, will try it with my avocado/banana hair pack I'm mixing up in a few days. Highly recommended at ANY price! You'll need at least 16-20 gal. per milk bath, which may seem to be a bit pricey, but if you want to be a drop dead gorgeous as Cleopatra, it's worth it. Unfortunately, there's NO organic version of this fantastic milk (at the price you're paying it SHOULD BE!) but a little bovine recombinant growth hormone won't hurt your outsides as much as it will your insides. A small price to pay, IMO.Who knows...your breasts may grow too!

body: Some may call this product simply "milk", but that is a woeful and shameful label to place upon this intoxicating beverage. This elixer must have been gently drawn from the teat of an angel by trained unicorns. I actually poured some on my Rice Krispies and instead of hearing "Snap", "Crackle" and "Pop" I was instead treated to a vocal arrangement of Handel's Messiah.Yes, you only get a gallon's worth for your $45, but a little goes a long way. You will find that a simple 1 fl oz portion is enough to sooth the soul and mend broken bones. Some people also carry a thimble-full to ward off demons and angry trolls. But a word of warning: ensure that the container is placed in its own refrigerator. It does not tolerate the presence of lesser liquids well, and has been know to banish them to Helheim.

body: I like this milk. It is good milk. I left it in the car once for three weeks. When I finally remembered it, I brought it in the house. I did a taste test and was amazed when I realized it still had a fresh taste. It probably lasts longer in the winter. So, I don't bother to put it in the frig anymore. The bottom gets thickish after a month but it is still tasty. Use a spoon toward the end.
title: Stays fresh after leaving in the car.

body: Best friend doesn't accurately describe Skip Bronkie. "Best friend" is hyperbolic shorthand from the elementary school playground. "Best friend" is a flippant measurement of how long I've known a person, but not how well. Skip Bronkie isn't just my best friend. He's a person with whom I have a deep rooted relationship made of familiarity and trust.Skip deserves a better label. Over the past decade, he's had every reason to simply stand back and allow our friendship to wilt. A walk around the block, and he'd surely find other people more deserving of his trademark Skippiness. But for an inexplicable reason, Skip committed. From across the country, he did the hard work to maintain relationships with me, with my wife, and with our mutual group of friends.He has his flaws. Skip's hair his floppy. He can be a little competitive at Can Jam. And he makes a drink called Load, which tastes like s***. But things like hairstyle, beverages, and yard sports do note define a man. No we are defined by honor, humor, and good spirit, the very materials that compose my friend Skip.Skip Bronkie is more than a best friend and that is why I'm giving this gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk a confident 4 out of 5 stars.
title: Skip Bronkie: More than a best friend

But the disappointment of my friends and family when they came to visit was almost unbearable.That is until I found the Tuscan Whole Milk at Amazon for $10. Needless to say I purchase 5 gallons and invited all of my friends and family over for Oreo cookies and milk. body: I went forward with my purchase of this product under the belief that it was indeed Tucson milk. This is not the Arizona breast squeezings I remember from the cows of my youth. This is, I daresay, Yankee milk. It tastes of East Coast swagger and Speedos, not low humidity sweat. I prefer my milk broiled slowly and continuously in the sun with just a mist of water coming from the roof tops. My milk lays there and prefers not to move, to at most produce a faint, knowing grin. My milk mustache is dried on, not drippy. My milk speaks of unexpected rainbows in a rainless sky. It speaks of mesas and motorcycle cops. This stuff smells funny and has a spray-on tan. Whole milk? I don't want even a part of this scam.
title: False advertising!

body: What was once a mere luxury has now become a necessity.  Allow me to explain:It began back in the summer of '08.  There I was at 6:00 AM, groggy and groping for some milk to go with my Grape Nuts.  Little did I know this would be the start of a grand adventure.  My paw landed on the plastic of this magical jug.  Our usual brand of Organic/FreeRange/GMO-Free/Fair Trade milk only comes in Ultra-recyclable cardboard, so this was a bit of a surprise.  I shrugged off the change in routine, and proceeded to pull the jug out of the fridge.  There was a strange elecktricky jolt when I made contact with it, and again, dismissed the phenomena as a construct of my sleep-deprived brain.Over the cereal it went, silky smooth, preternaturally white and with a strange sighing sound, it enveloped the hard, fibrous nuggets, slowly making them edible.  The first spoonful instantly woke me up, fatigue washed away with the creamy coldness of this elixir."Oh, you're trying the new milk!"  I hadn't even heard my roommate coming down the stairs."WHAT?"  I replied.  As anyone who has eaten Grape Nuts will tell you...well...you can't hear s*** when you're eating them."I didn't say anything...and why are you shouting?" Replied my roommate with a puzzled look on his face."OH..."What was going on here?  His voice sounded like it was coming from inside my head!  Did I just hear his thoughts?  I stopped chewing and listened for more.  What happened next changed my life forever.I heard a jumble of sentences and thoughts from not only my puzzled roommate, but also from all around the neighborhood.  Then all around the state.  If I stopped chewing long enough, I had no doubt I could have heard the thoughts of every being on the planet.Without a word, I grabbed the jug, along with my Grape Nuts and ran for my room."This is amazing...imagine the good I can do with this!"  What followed over the next few years is a tale for another time.  I was recruited by the CIA.  I was hunted from Colorado to Prague by every three-letter agency in the world.  I stopped so many world-ending events, I lost count years ago.  I only felt the danger of my new life when this Tuscan Whole Milk magical elixir was unavailable, and I had run though my emergency stashes.I fear I must end this by asking you to take this as a cautionary tale.  Order it.  Enjoy it.  But only if you are prepared to shoulder the enormous responsibility of your new powers.  You will be hunted, exploited, chased to the ends of Gaia.  But you will have the power to change the outcome of every major event in your lifetime.I gotta run.  They will be here in two minutes and twelve seconds, exactly.  You've been warned.P.S.  Oh, you'll be able to communicate with animals too.  Try not to get too freaked out the first time it happens...
title: Be Prepared for Your New Life.

body: It was only a few hours after my order arrived that the large vehicle with tank treads pulled up in front of the house.  Three gentlemen, and I use that term loosely, knocked on the door and when I answered they demanded that I hand over the milk.  Apparently, this stuff  is obtained illegally from their village and then resold here on Amazon.  Or so they say!  Funny how they somehow knew that I had ordered it.  I had a really tough time kicking several of them out of garage.  These guys are like gnats when they show up.  3 of them distract you with the whole milk thing while the rest of them get into everything.  Said they were looking for "droid" parts too.  I didn't get that part as I own an iPhone.  I still suspect this is some sort of scam.  Oh, and they track sand everywhere too!!

body: I have no idea why I am posting a review for Tuscan milk given I don't enjoy the individual taste of this lush dairy beverage.  For me, milk falls into that category of product which must have an accomplice to become palatable; milk and cereal, milk and cookies, etc etc.  I am pretty much the same with cigarettes; cigarettes and beer, cigarettes and police stations; and very much the same with cocaine; cocaine and whores, cocaine and er... whores.  But I digress.Lets see, what do we have here then... oh, on the label, it's a cow jumping over the moon, just like in that nursery rhyme.  Except this moon is yellow, almost like it has jaundice.  Seems a bit odd.  Still, better a cow jumping over a jaundice moon than a cow jumping over what could also be interpreted as the sun, what with its low-lying udder exposed to the blazing radiant heat and thus curdling the milk.  That ain't cool, pun intended.And the brand name, Tuscan, is sending shivers down my spine too.  It implies the high probability that this here fine product was brewed in Tuscany by a clan of old Italian men.  I am an old Italian man myself, and between you and me, you really do not want the likes of me going anywhere near your breakfast staple.  I won't go into the repugnant details, but let's just say no amount pasteurisation can disguise the unfortunate osmosis of cheap cologne and malting nasal hair.And lastly, on the label, that obscure character to the right of the word MILK and to the left of the jaundice moon, what is that?  I have turned my internet settings spyglass thing to 400% and I still cannot make it out. Now,  I don't want to jump to conclusions nor cause mass panic, but while my heart tells me it's just a full stop/period or even a smiley face, my head it telling me it's an asterisk.An asterisk.  Jesus, Joseph and Mary, pray for our children.Anyways, so there you have it;  the jug of milk ain't half empty, but neither is it half full.  I give it a solid 3 stars.  No wait, I'll give it four, because I am drunk, and in the company of whores.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk

body: Whole Milk (Tuscany, Greece) is an artist who works in a variety of media. With a subtle minimalistic approach, Milk creates intense personal moments masterfully created by means of rules and omissions, acceptance and refusal, luring the viewer round and round in circles.His practice provides a useful set of allegorical tools for manoeuvring with a pseudo-minimalist approach in the world of art: these meticulously planned works resound and resonate with images culled from the fantastical realm of imagination. By using popular themes such as sexuality, family structure and violence, he uses a visual vocabulary that addresses many different social and political issues. The work incorporates time as well as space - a fictional and experiential universe that only emerges bit by bit.His works bear strong political references. The possibility or the dream of the annulment of a (historically or socially) fixed identity is a constant focal point. By merging several seemingly incompatible worlds into a new universe, he touches various overlapping themes and strategies. Several reoccurring subject matter can be recognised, such as the relation with popular culture and media, working with repetition, provocation and the investigation of the process of expectations.His works often refers to pop and mass culture. Using written and drawn symbols, a world where light-heartedness rules and where rules are undermined is created. By emphasising aesthetics, he seduces the viewer into a world of ongoing equilibrium and the interval that articulates the stream of daily events. Moments are depicted that only exist to punctuate the human drama in order to clarify our existence and to find poetic meaning in everyday life.His works doesn't reference recognisable form. The results are deconstructed to the extent that meaning is shifted and possible interpretation becomes multifaceted. With the use of appropriated materials which are borrowed from a day-to-day context, he presents everyday objects as well as references to texts, painting and architecture. Pompous writings and Utopian constructivist designs are juxtaposed with trivial objects. Categories are subtly reversed.His collected, altered and own works are being confronted as aesthetically resilient, thematically interrelated material for memory and projection. The possible seems true and the truth exists, but it has many faces, as Hanna Arendt cites from Franz Kafka. By questioning the concept of movement, he absorbs the tradition of remembrance art into daily practice. This personal follow-up and revival of a past tradition is important as an act of meditation.He creates situations in which everyday objects are altered or detached from their natural function. By applying specific combinations and certain manipulations, different functions and/or contexts are created. By applying abstraction, he creates work in which a fascination with the clarity of content and an uncompromising attitude towards conceptual and minimal art can be found. The work is aloof and systematic and a cool and neutral imagery is used.His works sometimes radiate a cold and latent violence. At times, disconcerting beauty emerges. The inherent visual seductiveness, along with the conciseness of the exhibitions, further complicates the reception of their manifold layers of meaning. By contesting the division between the realm of memory and the realm of experience, he finds that movement reveals an inherent awkwardness, a humour that echoes our own vulnerabilities. The artist also considers movement as a metaphor for the ever-seeking man who experiences a continuous loss.His works isolate the movements of humans and/or objects. By doing so, new sequences are created which reveal an inseparable relationship between motion and sound.
title: Hoem Sweet Tuscany

body: I laughed; I cried; I'm a better person for having had this milk.This lactose luxury bears evidence that the care given these bovine beauties really makes a difference.  Is it because they are fed only the finest grains?  Is it because they are milked by hands clad in gloves made of unborn antelope suede?  Is it because they are never traumatized by fences but instead kept in place by a circle of orphans seeking to supplement their income?  It matters not; the results speak for themselves -- udderly delightful and a teat for the senses.
title: Dairy, Dairy Good!

body: "Tuscan Whole Milk" can be re-arranged to say "I'll know mustache".  Coincidence?  I think not.

body: I was delighted to receive a gallon of Tuscan Whole milk as a gift from my girlfriend for Christmas, however upon opening the bottle and pouring a glass I knew something was amiss. It didn't have the same full bodied taste and satin like texture that defines Tuscan whole milk. It tasted somewhat healthy and a little watered down.After doing some research I discovered that a company in Shenzhen has been repackaging Tuscan 2% milk (green cap & label) in gallon milk containers with counterfeit whole milk labels (red label & red cap). From the outside you can tell the counterfeit from the real ones because the counterfeit milk labels are missing the star above the cow. Also the red cap seemed a little pinkish to me.
title: Watch out for counterfeit knockoffs!

body: Buyer beware! Ever since I ordered this product I have been having these recurring nightmares every night, the same one each time. It always happens on a damp winter morning; I am standing in my yard watering my plants, and the fog is just really thick everywhere, when suddenly I see the mailman driving up. I think to myself, "oh, he must be carrying my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gal, 128 fl. oz that I ordered a few days ago," and I walk up to the gate and wave to him.But I don't see him wave back. I wave harder and harder and start yelling, but he doesn't turn to face me. Maybe the fog is really thick, and he didn't see? I start running towards the mail truck, but he drives right by without slowing in the slightest. And as I try to run after him I yell, "Stop! Stop!" but it is no use as it feels as if I am running in slow motion and that the mailman is in full speed as he turns the corner. Suddenly before he passes out of view, he throws something out of his window. Is it? Can it be? A milk carton?!? I try to run up to it, but I can never get there. I am just running in place, running, running, and then I just wake up in a cold sweat. I never want to dream it again, but I am afraid it will be the same tonight too.
title: The wait is a nightmare!
