body: The product insert was so enlightening! While I thought the jumping cow on the label was to illustrate the relative lightness of the cow after losing the weight of 1 gallon 128 fl oz, according to the insert it represents the joy of the cow after discovering the fresh flavor of the 128 1st time lactating Tuscan women who produced this product. My breast feeding grandchildren love the flavor so much that I now have to order a gallon a day for each of them, as they all shun their mother's milk. This is definitely worth the price, now that my daughters are free to booze it up with the rest of the family without having to deal with "drunken baby syndrome." I also love the fact that I can return the container, unwashed, for 10 pennies off my next purchase! (Oh, and George turned me on to this great product.)
title: No more "drunken baby syndrome"!

body: Wow!  If their cows can jump over the moon and buildings.....I'm ordering this stuff!  I'm hoping it gives me the same effect cause I'd love to become a Super Hero. "Able to leap tall buildings in a single bound."  Since I have milk allergies, I'll going to try half of the recommended daily allowance.  I'm sure I'll be missing out...but leaping over small buildings is just as cool.  *Patiently awaiting for it's arrival.*  I am however thankful that this brand chooses to bottle "Whole milk"......I'm concerned with all the preservatives and fillers in Half milk.
title: Super Hero here I come!!!

body: This product has changed my life forever. Everyday I work hard and to know that there is cold, fresh 1 Gallon 128oz Tuscan Dairy Whole Vitamin D Milk waiting for me in the refrigerator when I get home keeps me going every day. 10/10 Would recommend.
title: Life changing product.

body: What's not to love about this milk? My advice is to drink it as is during a full moon 'cuz you transform into a beautiful awesome cow, and you can jump over the full moon like in the picture. When this happens you will see a cat playing a fiddle, and a little dog laughing to see you jumping over said moon. But sadly, since you didn't use your milk with cereal your dish will run away with the spoon. Don't ask me why a dish and not a bowl... But if you are okay with your dish and spoon running away then this is the milk for you!!
title: More than just milk.

body: Two milks stood ready in a yellow store,And sorry I could not purchase twoAnd be one shopper, long I stoodAnd looked at one as close as I couldTo where I understood each through;Then took the other, as just as fair,And having perhaps the better price,Because it was normal and not Tuscan;Though as for that the containers thereHad held volumes equal and precise,And both that morning equally layIn shelves no customer had wrought dry.Oh, I kept the non-Tuscan for another day!Yet knowing how milk leads on to joy,I doubted if I should ever come again by.I shall be telling this with a nostalgic sighSomewhere ages and ages hence:Two milks available in a mart, and I--I took the Tuscan Whole Milk (1 Gallon, 128 fl oz),And that has made all the difference.
title: The Tuscan Milk taken

body: Your search is over.  Whatever it is you are looking for, you can stop looking for it.  This stuff is the real deal, the bee's knees.  You need to get it now, before the government bans it, or before speculators drive the price up to six figures.  You know when you see those commercials on TV where operators are standing by, and if you order in the next ten minutes you can get another one free?  This is like a million times better than any of that crap.  I guarantee that this will leave your Rice Krispies crispier, your Froot Loops loopier, your Cap'n Crunch crunchier, and your Special K will be more like Special KKK (except without the racist hood wearing freaks).  When mixed with any Hershey's, Nestle's, or Tobasco product, milk will yield a potent ambrosia that will have Zeus himself riding a lightning bolt to your refrigerator.  I don't care if you have to lie, cheat, or steal to get a jug of this magical elixir - just do it!  Whether you want to use it as an additive when mixing cement, a solute for chemistry experiments, or as a bribe for Santa Claus on Christmas Eve, you can't go wrong.  Order now at any price!Note.  Only given four stars because face it, 128 fl oz is just not enough.  Tuscan Farms, where are the 5 gallon buckets?!?
title: The Real Deal

body: Before speaking with my local shaman, I was quite skeptical about the miracles of Tuscan whole milk, regardless of its key role in Sumerian mythology. But I'm an open minded person, and as per his recommendation I went and purchased an entire gallon, and after 13 nights of consecration on the Dairy Altar, my dreams were becoming incredibly vivid; my mind flooded with images of a dancing cow, and she informed me that, soon, answers to all of life's questions would be unlocked. I would find out just days later that this cow is my spirit guide.I have since found my senses keener; I am more aware of my surroundings at all times. I have found who I truly am, and what my ultimate goals are. I owe it ALL to Tuscan Whole Milk.
title: The nectar of another spiritual plane.

body: I've always had weak bones. Not being able to do much of sports, I discovered Tuscan Whole Milk. The first sip I took, made all the bones in my body tingle. The feeling I had is still undescribable. I proceeded drinking and the tingles got stronger. It was so weird! I felt stronger then ever, but I was afraid. I decided to visit a doctor. After a full-body research by some of the best doctors in the world, they were all shocked; my whole skeleton had turned into adamantium.Nowadays the only thing I do is running through concrete walls, bending 20-inch thick steel bars, and bare handed cutting big trees. I'm happier than ever! Thanks Tuscan Whole Milk!
title: This milk will change your life

body: I was on a covert-ops mission in the jungles of Thailand.There I was, trudging through the thick undergrowth, the reassuring weight of an M-16 slung on my back. I hadn't seen any action in the 4 days I'd been in that miserable swamp and my trigger finger was getting itchy. Looking back, I should have been careful what I wished for.Because that's when I was ambushed.Without warning a dozen men spilled from behind the leaves, armed to the teeth. I had mere seconds to react before gunfire rained around me."COME GET ME!" I bellowed as I hoisted my rifle. I dove for cover and was able to get off a few rounds until my gun jammed. Before I even knew what was happening one of them was behind me. I spun around but he was too fast. I caught the stock end of his rifle full force to the face and it was lights out for me.I came to on the floor of a dusty wooden shack, the taste of blood in my mouth and the barrel of a gun in my face. There were at least six of them in the room and they demanded to know who I worked for."I'll never talk," I spat, which earned me swift and painful retribution. Despite having trained for situations like these, nothing could have prepared me for what was to come. They interrogated me for hours, introducing me to new levels of pain I had never thought possible. It was only after they shot me for the 3rd time that I knew I couldn't hold out much longer.At that point, as I swam in and out of consciousness, I became dimly aware of a mysterious figure enter the room and gun down all of my captors. Wearily, I lifted my head from the blood-soaked dirt floor to gaze at my savior.It was Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz who saved my life that day.
title: Combat Ready

body: This was a bad idea.
title: In Retrospect

body: "8 new from 9.99"Just wondering how much the used milk would be should some come available....One must ponder these things.
title: Any used?

body: Cruise about and see the hottest, sexiest styles on LuLu's, PinkIce and GoJane, then bust ass back to Amazon to catch the vibe of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.  At first, this item is eye-candy, a monochromatic ectasy of Italian design.  The gently rounded lines and the cute red accent on the top is classic and hip. Right out of the FedEx box, it is cool and inviting. But, like many quick shop decisions, this one proven to fall flat after purchase. At first, the fluid design was appealing, but after just one washing, the product was limp and lifeless.  I could not fold it or get it on a hanger.  Even the slightest touch of fabric softener changed the entire personality of this item.  Ironing is out of the question.  I soured on this purchase very quickly. Add to the fact there is no color choice, size is limited and some socially conscious issues floating around about genetic enhancement, I would have second thoughts about purchase.  One star.
title: Stylish, Trendy, Natural... but few sizes and colors limit 'closetability'

body: I find the used milk to be just as good as the new stuff. Who needs a sealed lid and so what if there's some missing. The chunks sift out easily too. Save money, buy used.
title: Five stars

body: I didn't want to believe the hype, so I tried it for myself. This amazing milk is made from the reproductive juices of the angels themselves! I experienced a spiritual awakening that showed me the true nature of all things. We are all connected, and this blessed life-nourishing milk is the tie that binds us.
title: From Heaven

body: You can't handle the truth! Son we live in a world that needs milk, and those have to be delivered by men with trucks. Whose gonna do it you, you lieutenant Weinberg? I have a greater responsibility than you can possibly fathom. You weep for Santiago and his lactose intolerance, and you curse the milkmen. You have that luxury, you have the luxury of not knowing what I know, that Santiago's lactose intolerance while tragic, probably saved lives. And my existence while grotesque and incomprehensible, to you, saves milk. You don't want the truth because deep down in places you talk about in coffee shops; you want me on that delivery route, you need me on that delivery route! We use words like whole, expiration date, pasteurization, We use these words as the backbone of a life spent delivering something, you use them as a punch line. I have neither the time, or the inclination, to explain myself to a man, who nurses at the teat of the dairy products that I provide, and then questions the manner, in which I provide it. I'd rather you just say 'thank you' and go on your way. Otherwise I suggest you pick up a crate, and drive a delivery truck. Either way, I don't give a damn, what you think you are entitled to!
title: You Can't Handle The Milk!!!

body: I saw this while shopping at the local Amazon store today. Tuscan Whole Milk - 1 GALLON! My wife lived in Europe for a year, and frequently visited Tuscany, so I'd heard about the pure organic goodness of Tuscan Whole Milk. So I thought, "Maybe my problems digesting milk have nothing to do with lactose intolerance, but are due to the impurities that infest American processed milk squeezed from abused and tormented factory cows." (Tuscans milk their cows by talking sweetly to them and singing romantic Italian arias until the cow releases her milk in a flood of ecstasy!) So I picked it up, went home, and drank a large glass of it.Shortly afterwards, my stomach started roiling. A few hours later, my intestines started spewing, and I sadly realized that even the wondrous Tuscan Whole Milk was NOT the cure for lactose intolerance!
title: Arggh, finally thought this would be the cure!

body: Never in my life have I dared dream of purchasing a $2,500 gallon of milk.  When I saw this on Amazon I first saw it was $45 and there were other offers.  I figured why buy a used gallon of milk for cheap when I can get the brand new one.  I grabbed my credit card and ordered this glorious promise of deliciousness.  When the milk arrived I was expecting it to come in a limo and hand delivered by zeus himself.  I was saddened to see  UPS.  I thanked the man and rushed into my kitchen and opened my package. I poured the milk in a glass my taste buds aching to savor the flavor. To my dispair it tasted like normal milk.
title: Expensive yet normal tasting

body: I know what you're thinking. You're thinking, "if you're so lactose intolerant, what the hell do you think you're doing drinking Tuscan Milk?"Well A) I don't appreciate your tone and B) stop swearing at me.I watched the movie "Under The Tuscan Sun" and came away with the idea that Tuscany is a font of healing. That Diane Lane was just a disaster but she went there and ate all those bowls of noodles and now look at her! She married Josh Brolin.[UPDATE: they are divorcing. Perhaps another trip to Tuscany is in order]Are Italian cows more nutritious than American cows? Is their milk more invigorating? What types of grasses do they eat: wheat grass? lawn grass? Easter? Is Italy closer to the sun? If I drink their milk, will I soil myself by midmorning? These are all questions I sought to answer.Fact: I should have been more thoughtful about how I planned my day after consuming a 48 oz glass of Tuscan Whole Milk and a wedge of melted brie. Why I chose to take a leisurely swim at the pool directly after is still a mystery to me. Again, my most profuse apologies to the members of the Senior Ladies Swim Club as well the participants of the Family Open Swim. The parents present there were particularly horrified.Although my expirement ended in humiliation and mass hysteria, I still have to give Tuscan Whole Milk 5 stars because it is delicious and filling and I detected notes of oak and boysenberry when I drank it. I have no explanation for why a cow would be consuming such things, but who am I to question it? It is what it is.
title: Still Lactose Intolerant

body: Even though I prefer getting my milk by sucking directly on the teet of a dairy cow, this is truly the next best thing! And anyway, dairy cows can take up a bit too much space in my studio apartment, not to mention the cost of hay, the constant mooing, and the manure piled all over the apartment.
title: Udder ecstasy!!!!

body: MILK WAS A BAD CHOICE!
title: One Star

body: Best BANTHA milk available in this sector ! Straight from the Tusken Farms of Tatooine, sample from the 'Raiders Finest' collection (skip past the cheaper imitations listed - purchase only the hand delivered offerings).  After a generation away from the market (following a rogue jedi attack on their most sacred dairy) the Return of the Tusken is a triumphant masterpiece! One sip and you will have visions of forests and teddy bears and stars exploding in the sky. Chill in the freezer and the Tusken Strikes Back with an icy bite that will shake you like a giant metal dinosaur has just walked all over your base! I also suggest you try A New Tusken -this variety has decolored the off putting blue hue of normal Bantha milk to present a more familiar white colored milk to the beings in this galaxy.  Orukak argg yurag?!
title: Best milk in this galaxy or any other !

body: It came just in time one day as I was stuck on a particular philosophical quandary.  I opened up the package and lo and behold -- the jug was empty. Revelation replaced agitation. The milk wasn't there. Perhaps, it was never there to begin with. And thus, is the true nature of reality.My brain and 82 page thesis paper would like to thank the good people of Tuscan and Amazon for providing me with the catalyst for great intellectual discovery.
title: Revolutionized my view of Quantum Mechanics.

body: Saved my marriage.
title: No more will I drink partial Vitamin D.

body: The main drawback is that in recent years, since I started using it, the number of annoying carolers showing up at my door has steadily increased, along with what amounts to no less than an extortion expense of providing them all with Tuscan Whole Milk eggnog.Currently -4 cups sugar16 tsp vanilla2 tsp salt3 qt (96 fl oz) rum3 qt (96 fl oz) bourbon4 tsp nutmeg2 tsp cinnamon1 gallon (128 fl oz) Tuscan Whole Milk (not half, but whole milk)1 gallon (128 fl oz) Tuscan Whole Heavy Cream*4 dozen (48) Tuscan Whole Eggs**, separated*didn't know they had heavy cream, did ya.**I tried using their economical half eggs but the carolers wouldn't go for it and boy, I paid a heavy price that year, I tell you.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz (Misc.)

body: One day I had decided I'd had enough and had put my head in the oven to say goodbye to this cruel world, when I noticed that I forgot to put the milk away.  When I got up and walked across my kitchen and put it away, the doorbell rang.  It was Publishers Clearing House with a giant check and balloons.  Turns out, they had the wrong house.  In my despair I cried hysterically and reached for the cookies thinking it would make a good last supper, but the crumbs were getting stuck in my throat making me cough.  As I choked them down in the saltiness of my despair, I remembered that I had a gallon of milk in the fridge.  I poured myself a glass of this, and no longer wanted to go in the garage and start my with the garage doors closed.  Milk saved my life, and now I put that s*** on everything!
title: Why settle for half milk when you can have whole!

body: It is a truth universally acknowledged, that a single man in possession of a good fortune, must be in want of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.However little known the feelings or views of such a man may be on his first entering a neighbourhood, this truth is so well fixed in the minds of the surrounding families, that he is considered the rightful property of some one or other of the Tuscan Whole Milk outlets."My dear Mr. Bennet," said his lady to him one day, "have you heard that Netherfield Park is let at last?"Mr. Bennet replied that he had not."But it is," returned she; "for Mrs. Long has just been here, and she told me all about it."Mr. Bennet made no answer but supped contentedly on his Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz."Do you not want to know who has taken it?" cried his wife impatiently."You want to tell me, and I have no objection to hearing it."This was invitation enough."Why, my dear, you must know, Mrs. Long says that Netherfield is taken by a young man of large fortune and improved Vitamin D content, from the north of England; that he came down on Monday in a chaise and four to see the place, and was so much delighted with it, that he agreed with Mr. Morris immediately; that he is to take possession before Michaelmas, and some of his servants are to be in the house by the end of next week.""What is his name?""Bingley.""Is he married, single or full fat?""Oh! Single, my dear, to be sure! A single, Grade A man of large fortune; four or five thousand a year. What a fine thing for our girls!"
title: Pride and Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz

body: I'll just say it- This milk saved my life and it will also save yours.I was overcome with ennui last summer at my summer home in Livorno. My winery in Bordeaux had produced a less than average yield, my mistress broke the heal of her favorite Manolo Blahnik strappy sandals and to top it off, someone dented the door of my Maserati while I was dining at the Olive Garden.My other mistress and I boarded my second smallest jet and we headed off for Nassau on a hope that the vitamin D would help heal my less-than-sunny disposition. The second Sunday after our arrival my other other mistress and I were sitting down for cafe au lait on the bow of my yacht when the cook/first mate informed me that my milk was not Tuscan.  "Vous êtes une vache! Faire plus!" I demanded. He waddled off and immediately ordered a dozen of the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz to be shipped next day. I was pleasantly surprised the very next morning when I again arose for coffee, (this time with my other other other mistress) and my cafe au lait contained 100% Tuscan milk. Thanks to you and the secrets of Scientology, I am now back on the road to recovery.Thank you, merci, grazie, obrigado Amazon.
title: You saved me

body: It's the Tuscan Cows make this milk taste magical. All my life I knew there was something not quite right about the milk I had been consuming. I can tell by the smooth flavor that my particular cow had been very well treated, allowed to roam the hills of Tuscany. Having been imported from Italy I knew the price would be a little steep (I opted for the $98.99 fearing the $45 was a knock off) but it was worth every penny.
title: Tuscan Cows

body: This morning as I was feeling my way to the kitchen (I was blind) My olfactory senses which had been heightened since I lost use of my eyes picked up a smell that could only be described as wholesomefantastic.  My pursuant investigation revealed that it was milk, but oh so much more.  The cool firmness of the container welcomed my probing and soon its sweaty plasticene skin revealed that it was still fresh from the fridge.  The smell was even more powerful at this proximity and it sent me into (I am ashamed to say it) a lustful rage, desiring only to be sated by it silky cool contents.  I bit off the top with my profound overbite and poked a hole in the bottommost area with my white-tipped (I was blind) cane.  I shotgunned the remaining contents of the container and some of it splashed and streamed across my defective ocular orbs.  I began SEEING!! flashes of light at first and then full HD vision (1080p).  The first thing I beheld in that kitchen was a glorious full gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, 128 oz.  I am a believer.  in addition, over the course of the next 5 minutes, my overbite was reigned in and is now properly aligned.  If you are infirmed, sick, lame, lazy or crazy...indulge, believe....
title: Testimony of a once blind man...

body: I researched the web for a long time before I made my choice of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. I assumed that this company would be responsible enough to put out a product with good support.  It arrived with absolutely NO instructions for set up and use! I got on-line immediately and tried to contact their support and help desk. and discovered that I was left waiting for help for days before anyone cared to get back to me.  By the time I got the product installed and sampled, I discovered that it was no better than what I could get around the corner at the local store where I can always find product support around the clock.  A real wake up call!!!
title: Not user friendly!

body: This milk is fantastic, white, and comes in a recyclable plastic container.  If you store it in the fridge, then you can have it cold... if you leave it out of the fridge (which I don't recommend) then you will get an interesting smelling but liquidy beverage to share with friends and family.  The great thing about this milk is that it is delivered to your door, usually by the UPS guy.  I did have to knock it down one star because of the price, $45 for a gallon of milk is almost what we pay for gasoline, and that just is a little high, but considering you don't have to go to the market, then you have an added bonus there.  I know others have said the same thing about this product, but overall I think milk does a body good.  So drink up and enjoy, either in a coffee beverage, with some chocolate, or even in a tall glass with some cookies!
title: Udderly Delicious

body: A new reviewer has been appointed. But has anyone actually appointed him?  Is he not rather acting on his own instructions?  Certain malevolent people say that he is the new representative of Tuscan Whole Milk, 128 ounces... or technocracy.  One of those.  Others, mistaking their insults for wit, claim that he is a supporter of Skim Milk.  Or at least that he offends the rights of man and woman (they will not forgive him for having proclaimed the 'death of butter').In any case, it all begins like a story by Gogol (rather than by Kafka).  The new reviewer approaches the cow.  The cow is alone in a field, isolated from technology.  Technology will eventually come to the cow, but not today.  The reviewer will ignore both the vertical hierarchy of propositions that are stacked next to the Tuscan milk, skimming the metaphorical fat from the whole product, leaving it with protein and some carbohydrates.But I digress.  The subject today is the whole milk, all 128 ounces of it.  But is it really Tuscan?  Tuscany is far away, seemingly, and milk must spoil in such a journey.  It is natural for us to have misgivings.  For the reviewer deliberately refuses to give examples where this Tuscan milk has been successfully consumed, even with Ovaltine.  Or in cereal.One thing we can discuss is the price.  $45.  For a gallon of milk?  Really?  This reminds the reviewer of a mobile diagonal line that allows us, within this space, to make a direct study of the same set at different levels, where at least one level contains those  who would pay so much for that which can be obtained for 0.1x the price.  If not less.
title: An archaeology of milk, by Deleuze

body: I was born without bones. Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz changed that. Just one jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and I now have a skeleton much like any other person, granted I spend my nights feeding on the blood of innocents, but I have bones now. Yay me.Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.PRO: Can actually create bonesCON: Might give you an insatiable blood lust only quenched by eating the souls of the virtuous.Serve cold for best results.
title: Medical marvel or horrible curse?

body: While it was relatively easy to overcome intolerance to race, gender, sexuality, religion, etc., it took Tuscan Whole Milk to make realize I will never overcome my intolerance to lactose. Sweet Jesus, this milk is mucous-forming! On the bright side, I can no longer hear the nagging of my girlfriend. Okay, it's snot that bad ... Ha! Or is it?
title: Enjoy a Pair of These Jugs

body: A small round yellow light. Barely noticeable, really. But somehow, within the faux lacquer-wood paneling, that light is all my small round yellow eye can comprehend. This light and I, we share the type of bond which a child might share with a moth, the only living thing within unwalkable miles, which landed in your hand while tripping in the Mojave, only to die there, in the cupping embrace of your palms, your fingers overlapped for added cushion. Just you and the moth, and the Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon/128 fluid ounces, dying together in the grey blue light of the moon. Meanwhile, that same blue grey sky silhouettes rooftops with cartoon chimneys and wisps of smoke atop square yellow windows, where men such as myself sit, drinking Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon/128 fluid ounces, patiently awaiting the sounds of Jazz on the wind, unwillingly recalling the memories of a thirteen year old.  I remember it. I had imagined a red perforated line, boop boop boop, leading from my eye right to the yellow light, a 180 degree, perfect line. Just fold my reality along the dotted line, tear from the edge, and watch it all fall away. Afterward, include the return slip with your payment.  This moment was every moment, played out in grainy, distinct frames, all yellowed and repeating images reeling as old projectors do. At least three major revolutions must have happened in the third world by the time my senses settled. Then the perforation formed a 5 degree angle, as my line of sight slipped slightly upward toward the number: 17. Just then, I took a long, luscious sip of Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon/128 fluid ounces, my lips relishing the thick embrace, and the same number sounded above my head, ding, lit up in the same uninviting, sepia yellow.  And finally, after I’d grown a rather impressive shadow for a thirteen year old, the familiar metallic elevator doors roll back on their tracks. I notice the tiny red light up in the corner of the track which senses my hand holding the Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon/128 fluid ounces, which is holding the door open for my brother. I turn around to face the room, a room usually full of light, action, men and women and downright kids in not-very-playful uniforms, prancing two and fro in a somewhat chaotic, yet obviously methodical waltz of efficiency. The room is empty. My thoughts seem to echo off the far wall, and when they return to my ears the sounds are distorted and multiplied. The wall ahead of me is made entirely of two panes of fogged glass, lit from the back in the ominous, familiar din and boring hum of hospital fluorescents. In that wall, right in the center, there is another jug of Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon/128 fluid ounces, and although I realize this was an ICU, and even though here, on my New York rooftop, with my cap an my pipe and my Charlie Parker, I know that there were all kinds of lights in that room; in my memory, it’s dark. Dark except for the distant grey whir of the fluorescents, and one calm full spectrum light bulb above the Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon/128 fluid ounces. Then I began to realize how far the door is ahead of me. Was this room designed by some mad experimental architect during his last job before he was put in a psych ward due to a split-personality disorder? One side of him attempting to build a funhouse- perhaps this would have been the maze of mirrors- while the other side tries to finish building a professional institution. Each step, as I traverse this warehouse of shadows, cast off looming surgical equipment and metallic tables from the shivering light of that ever more distant wall, is heavier than the last. This is what Sisyphus must have felt like. But my brother lowered his reassuring hand onto the center of my back (his hand covers nearly half of my torso), and smiled shakily at me through his long golden mop.  “Come on,” he managed to croak out, “It’s not like we have a choice.” The only thing I remember after that is my father’s face. I see it more in Carl’s smile than my own. The color of his skin: yellow. And his words. I may be remembering wrong. I was completely checked out at this point. He asked us to forgive him. And how can someone deny in a situation like this? I let him go in peace. He asked us for milk. I said "no." I figured this wasn’t the time for arguing. Now, exhaling my smoke into the brisk, already disgusting night air of the city, where it will mingle with the sounds of laughter and jazz, and the aromatic taste of Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon 128 fluid ounces, and be carried away through the clouds, where maybe my father will catch a whiff and an earful and a little taste of Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon/128 fluid ounces, and be reminded and pleased, if for only a moment. Now I wish I would have screamed at him. I should have yelled and asked him “How dare you, dad? Screw you for taking this last memory of mine!” Well, he had the last word. Again. Now it’s off to the village, because even at the vanguard, they pack in their sets.
title: Memories of Milk

body: We all agree that the Tusken raiders are known for their healthy bones and teeth, though certainly not for the accuracy of their blast marks.  Their nutritional needs are met by Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.  Strong, and solid, the raiders are well respected--and feared--throughout their home planet of Tatooine.  While they are easily frightened, they return in greater numbers, all of whom enjoy a shiny coat and soft skin.  One might think the name of the milk was a bastardization of their name, but it was quite the opposite.  The raiders grew so fond and somewhat dependent on the milk (delivered in 2 days with Amazon Prime), they adopted its name.  Tusken raiders are not known for their spelling, being largely phonetic creatures.  You see, the Sand People, as they are sometimes called, were indigenous to Tatooine and their former dietary staples were intentionally destroyed by humanoid settlers in an attempt at ethnically cleansing the planet.  Amazon to the rescue.  Convenient packaging and a low price!
title: Official milk of the Tusken Raiders

body: Well, despite being highly dubious, I bought and drank this milk. I didnt actually think it would cure my chronic rectal bleeding, or even taste any different from regular milk for that matter. Oh how wrong I was!Not only is my anus and rectum as fresh and new as the day I was born, but it tasted very much as I remember the sublime ambrosia from my mothers breasts tasting like. I recall that flavor well, since my mother breast-fed me well into my teens. Interestingly, she was my adopted mother, but her work as a wet-nurse meant there was plenty of her love amber to go around. Even my father started breast-feeding again. But we digress.This milk is truly miraculous, and I seldom use that word. Mainly because it's ugly and sounds like vacuous, a word my father uses for my biological mother Bertha Ann.So buy and consume this overwhelmingly mouth-watering, magnificent, majestic, and miraculous milk....even if you dont have rectal bleeding.
title: My anus is bleeding!

body: My friends and I are avid milk connoisseurs.  We have spent years searching the globe for the best dairy excretions available to the general public.  These last few years have been particularly subpar, depressing even.  In our Journey of Many Laments to Nepal, we stumbled upon a curious village in the himalayas.The local shaman greeted us at the airport in his 1967 Ford GT 40 and provided food and lodging in his flat.  After acclimating to the harsh conditions, our vigor was rejuvenated.  He then kindly directed us to what we now consider our first real breakthrough in the search. The shaman brought us to the aristocratic monk troup 509. Unbeknownst to the rest of the world, these monks practice the rare art of cold fusion. After the intense initiation, we became brothers of the clan. After a fortnight of pillow fights and toga parties in celebration of our success, a poignant epiphany of our rash decision came to light. We couldn't afford the 5 dollar initiation fees.  Leaving in shame we visited the local walmart. And it was there that we saw a man in a green pair of taco pants that glistened with the sauted oil of onions and fruit snacks.  This man looked at us with a strange expression chiseled on face. It was a mixture of anguish and enlightenment. We asked the man 'Are you selling any milk?'  He replied with a furtive look to a cloud shaped like a bong in a whirlwind, 'Yes. Tuscan whole milk extracted from the teets Chuck Norris'.
title: Delicious

body: This product has a serious design flaw.  When I removed this product from its container, it did not stand on its own as I expected.  Instead, it spread out onto the ground, then appeared to disappear into it.  For the price I paid, I would have expected this product to have a lot more substance.  Someone told me that I needed a glass, but this is not listed in the instructions.  Also, there are no clear instructions on how to open the container.  I tried everything from cotton balls to a can opener, to no avail.  Eventually I was able to open it by burning a hole in it with a curling iron.  I was afraid to use a knife, since I didn't want to damage the product inside.  Clearly, Tuscan needs to re-think this product.**Edit**  It seems that I would have had to let this sit at room temperature for several days in order for it to stand on its own.  Again, terrible instructions.  I would also appreciate a product that was ready to use.
title: Design flaw, poor instructions

body: Now I'm no tight wad, but I'm also not made of money! I really was looking to stay under my tight budget but unfortunately there are almost no used gallons of Tuscan Whole Milk on the market! The 1% and 2% are always available used on the cheap, but I have standards, don't cha know! Try to get a vintage 2011 and forget it, the price sky rockets! All said and done I'm happy with the quality of Tuscan Whole Milk, but the price leaves a bit to be desired!
title: Now I'm no tight wad but....

body: This product is misleading. I thought they meant the milk would come from Tuscan Raiders on Tatooine, but instead it tastes vaguely Italian.
title: Misleading

body: I ordered this fine dairy product, yearning for the ultra-creamy liquid inside me.The product arrived, in discrete packaging, and was placed on my front porch.I grabbed the package with both hands, seeing that it was extremely large; I tookit inside my modest home, and placed it upon the kitchen table.I opened the cabinet, selected my favorite glass, and prepared my mouth for theburst of creamy goodness. I poured it slowly, watching it drip down the sides ofof the textured glass. Ummm… , wait! What the heck? This milk is spoiled. I shouldhave opted for next day shipping instead of Priority 3 day.
title: Not so Happy

body: Mine came warm. Tasted a little funny. But  I added chocolate to cover it up and it was fine that's how it got the 5 stars. Thank you tuscan
title: Mine came warm

body: Can I buy it used? I only have fifteen dollars to spend on milk. It's the economy. Times are tough.
title: Urgent question

body: I drank my Tuscan milk on a Monday. By Tuesday, I was able to tell jokes in languages I don't even know. People told me I had been the life of parties that I hadn't even attended. My words began to carry a weight that would break the jaw of lesser men. I totally aced a Rorschach test. ... Stay thirsty, my friends
title: Even Better Than Advertised

body: I really like milk, but it's hard to find any.  I live next door to a farm, so I went to a cow and tried to get milk from the cow, only the cow got mad and chased me away, and then someone yelled, "That's a bull, you <EXPLETIVE> idiot!" and I felt like I was in a Bugs Bunny cartoon, only I wasn't in Spain and I didn't have a red cape and the bull wasn't funny when it was mean.  And where did this bull come from?  There had to be a girl cow somewhere because boy cows come from girl cows, right?I saw Tuscan milk for sale, but I think it's weird that there's no milk in the US and you have to order the milk all the way from a region in Italy.  But my cereal tastes funny without the milk and I hear it's bad for the bones if you don't drink any milk.  There's Greek yogurt, which has milk, too.  Why does all the milk come from Greece and Italy?  That's strange.Anyway, I ordered the milk and got it after three weeks.  I don't understand.  Does it take that long to milk a cow?  Do the bulls chase them away?  I poured out the milk onto my cereal and it smelled really bad.  It tasted really bad too.  I don't understand it.  What is wrong with all the cows in Tuscany that the milk is like this?  Isn't there any place where I can find normal milk?
title: Why do I have to order milk all the way from Tuscany?

body: The milk moustache from this particular product is legendary!
title: Five Stars

body: This milk is too strong! I ordered it thinking it would be great for breakfast. However when I arrived (in a timely fashion I might add thanks for that.) it was okay but "hey I bet this would taste supreme chilled" I thought. So I put it in the refrigerator and left the room. Came back an hour later and it had invaded Poland and named itself dictator! I hate it so much! Oh no it found me! Not the salt mines! NOT THE SALT MINES!!!!
title: I ordered it thinking but would be great for breakfast

body: I love Tuscan Whole Milk, but sometimes on my college budget buying a whole gallon can seem impossible! Sometimes I make back alley deals to score just a couple ounces of the sweet creamy drink. I think the company is holding out only selling "New" products, well what about Used? On Amazon lots of products are sold used or even soft covered! I want cheaper options! Maybe the company could buy back unwanted milk to resell as used or instead of using expensive plastic products use cartons or bags? Lets make a stand for college budget milk!
title: How do I afford Tuscan Whole Milk on a college budget?!?!

body: I had just finished another later night at the station. On the way back to the apartment I stopped at my usual drinking hole, The Dairy Dipper. I approached the bar, with out asking Eddie "Three Utters" Mahogany, the bar keep was already eying me."The usual?" he asked.I replied with a sigh, "Yes, Whole milk. Tuscan whole milk, shaken, not pasteurized."He was about to walk away as I interjected, "Leave the bottle."Who was I kidding, I was a wreck. I still could not get Sarah off my mind. It seemed like she was gone for an eternity, but left just yesterday, but how would I know. This stuff messes with my memory. She always said I had one boot in the force and one mouth on the utter. Maybe she was right. Maybe we just weren't meant to be, not in this life. Between the constant investigations on the illegal breakfast market and my dairy habits, it's no wonder she thought I never had the time of day.I milked the thought of her gentle beauty as long as I could until my real demons rose up. My thoughts spiraled towards my partner... well ex-partner Louie. He just got snuffed out by those bacon-banging breakfast dealers "Orange Juice" McCoy and "Two eggs, sausage links, and a side of grits" Jefferson. I'll see them in the ground if it's the last thing I do. Suddenly a woman in a long black dress sat down at the bar next to me. She glanced at my bottle; then with a certain seductive look in her eye, at me. A smooth passion burned in her eye as she whispered to me,"Is that Tuscan Whole Milk?"I was taken aback for a second as no one besides Three Utters says a word in this sad excuse for a dispensary of dairy products."Why yes, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.", I half drunkenly repliedShe smirked, and with a faint sense of satire in her voice said,"I remember when I could get off on that stuff."Not realizing at first what she meant, I mistook he for being in the same boat as I; lost and lonely, clinging to my Tuscon Whole Milk 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz for dear life."It'll never be the same as back in the academy, when we all started hitting the gallons pretty hard.", I said with a desperation in my voice clear enough for a def woman to know I need companionship badly.I poured he a shot, and we toasted to our empty lives. Afterwards we sat and gazed, not necessarily at each other, but not at anything else. Soon she looked up and in a tone some temp.......Wait wait wait, sorry, way too drunk to finish this. Sorry, pushing 4 AM and can hardly type anymore. Need sleep, SPOILER ALERT: the mysterious woman was going to take our hero back to her apartment where he discovers she is in the misdst of the illegal breakfast trade, they were going to start snorting lines of pancake mix and smoking bacon etc etc maybe he was going to resign his badge and live a life of adventure and recreational breakfast use with whats her face, who knows. sweet dreams.
title: Blues in the Bottle... of Tuscan Whole Milk

body: When it comes to grade A homogenization, Tuscan really knows milk. This milk tastes pure, wholesome, and makes me ecstatic toward the world in general. I love this milk. I give it a whole hearted recommendation.
title: I love this milk.

body: As I sit on my couch like a lazy POS for the third day straight, surfing Amazon for holiday steals and deals, I realized I've finished 3 pounds of hot Cheetos, and a couple ghost peppers. Legend has it that Tuscan milk is the best for handling 3rd degree capsaicin burns. I need milk NOW. Is this milk available for drone delivery?
title: Eligible for drone delivery?

body: While searching amazon for deals on fresh rabbit carcass to use in my famous holiday fudge, I stumbled upon the link to Tuscan Whole Milk. Unfortunately, I purchased this product used, but supposedly “Collectible.” It was only a few weeks past the expiration date, so I assumed it would only increase in value as it aged. To my chagrin, its resale value plummeted almost immediately. Amazon offered to buy it back for a mere $0.02, whereas I paid $6.99.Since it has proven itself a worthless investment, I decided to literally eat my losses and give it a try via a bowl of cereal. As it slowly dripped out of the jug in small clumps the smell hit me. Not altogether unpleasant; it recalled happy memories from my days working as janitor in a mortician’s office. It did not mix well with the cereal; however, I do believe it helped to cure my week-long bout of constipation.An annoying hazard of this product that is not disclosed by the seller is that it will draw stray cats to your home and for some reason I cannot explain, it inspires them to urinate on all of my windows. Also, I have begun to grow breasts since drinking Tuscan Whole Milk.
title: Not A Sound Investment

body: In the beginning of the year, my dog began to experience serious health complications. Upon taking him to the vet, i was informed that my dog was terminal, and not expected to survive for very long. Wallowing in extreme sadness, i turned to comfort shopping online. Thats when i saw it. Upon loading Amazon for another round of online shopping, I saw it, on the side of the page. I felt it quietly beakoning to my soul. It was... Tuscan Whole Milk. 1 Gallon, 128 floz. I didnt hesitate. I immediately ordered the one gallon container. One week later it arrived. The delivery man had an almost angelic aura to him and as he handed me the box, the sound of a Tuscan male choir reverberated in my head. Upon opening the box, i found that the milk had the ability of keeping itself cold, no need for refrigeration. I decided I might as well try a glass, after all I had been waiting for a whole week to taste Tuscan Whole Milk, in all its 1 Gallon, 128 floz glory. Unfortunately, I made the horrible mistake of pouring the milk into a cheap generic brand plastic cup, and upon contact with the milk's righteousness, the cup sublimated into vaporous angel tears, and the milk spilled on the floor. My dog, who had been watching the spectacle went up to the milk before i could clean it and lapped some of it up off the floor. I thought nothing of it at the time. My dog has been alive for 28 years. I thank the gods of our realm for providing me the miraculous drink that is Tuscan Whole Milk 1 Gallon, 128 floz.
title: A Divine Intervention

body: When our infantry company was surrounded in the central highlands, far from base with the monsoon preventing resupply or medivacs, we soon ran out of ammo. As the advancing NVA horde steadily mowed us down we were forced to resort to a last-ditch effort at survival.As the sarge shouted out to the remaining few, "Fix bayonettes!!!!!" my thoughts led to Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. A friend of my youth, due to the many miles separating Vietnam from the "real world" I had been forced to forego my previous life-long affair with my one true buddy, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.The incoming fire slapping the air as the slugs sped by brought me back to reality. Then, Sarge's voice rose above the crescendo of death flailing our ever-diminishing ranks, "CHARGE!!!!!!" he bellowed, jumping up to lead the way against the advancing foe outnumbering us a hundred-to-one. Immediately, a dozen slugs sent sarge whirling to the ground. A dozen others who had risen with sarge fell also.Looking about me, all I saw were mangled bodies, looking like the jugs of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz whose luxurious contents had been quaffed, then tossed into the trash compactor and rent asunder by the powerful compactor jaws clamping down.Facing impossible odds, apparently the last survivor of my unit, I vowed to go down fighting, visions of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz filling my last earthly thoughts.Springing up with a shout of, "Long live Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz," I ran towards the enemy horde, bayontte leveled, certain that I had mere seconds left to me.As I ran through the hail of incoming fire, running through the rushing monsoon rain, I sought out the enemy, ready to wield my weapon yet still thinking of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.I ran and ran. My throat becoming raw from the incessant yelling so I ceased the yells but kept my legs pumping, calling upon the marvellous physique I possessed from arduous physical activity and the years of nourishment provided by Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.Mile after mile I ran as the sounds of gunfire receeded behind me. Coming upon a river I flung my rifle aside and dove in, swimming downstream, the fast-flowing water aiding my efforts to escape. Hours went by when I espied a boat, a powered boat, a large boat dispalying an American flag!!!!! Hallelujah!!!! I was saved!!!!The SEAL team on the craft hauled me aboard and took me to their base where I was served, to my shocked delight, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, specially flown in via the special channels those SEALs had at their disposal.The decades crept by but my thoughts often go back to that fateful day where I was the lone survivor out of 120 good Americans. Visiting Vietnam last year with a group of 'Nam veterans, we met some of those who had opposed us. The veterans from both sides shook hands and decided to let the past remain there. To salute our mutual forgiveness I hefted a jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. There wasn't a dry eye present.Every now and then I salute my long-gone comrades. I come to attention, raise my glass and proclaim; "This is for you my bretheren, may your souls be at peace." I then drink my glass of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, wishing those guys could be there to join me.
title: Unadulterated Delight

body: I was more than usually cautious in opening the jug. A watch's minute hand moves more quickly than did mine. Never before that night had I felt the extent of my own powers - of my sagacity. I could scarcely contain my feelings of triumph. To think that there I was, unscrewing the cap, little by little, and the jug not even to dream of my secret deeds or thoughts. I fairly chuckled at the idea...The Tuscan was mine. The thin, milky jug ...
title: Stealthily...

body: What sacrosanct nectar is thisthat doth drop like silverfrom the swollen eye of the Holy Madonna Bovus,may her name be hallowed, forever and ever?:So sweet and thick a liquoras to make yeomen weep andmighty Czernobog loose sogreat a howl that the verytimbers should crack and crumble.La! What nectar indeed?It is for this that popes and magisterslaid down staves and hats, andtook to churning in the parlor--It is that precious brewthat loops and swirls and slopes throughconsecrated cartons and startlesthe martyrs alive.Oh, White Goddess: Oh most quenchifying savior,I would gladly lay down my every fancyto carry your banner even onto the darkest heathen,even to the very gates of sin, if you bid me.Would that I had the requisite glandto squeeze you forth from my very nipples:I would rise and drench the cities with your luster,I would drown the scoffers, the non-believers,and breed a race of Titans, suckled at my teat:What treats and treasures,what wealth without measure or limitleap from your touch, why I can but skim the surface:I would have you in me like bread and body,like sleep and breath and bone and death,for only through our union can I truly know peace.Let a feast of my body be laid before you:Gladly will I fill the basin of my desirewith your warmth, and submit myself toyour slick embrace, 'til every nick and traceof skin, hair and nail is coated thickwith your divine luster.I will be the Milk Man of your Destiny,a living candle, coated with your spirit,and I will carry your gospel in my glow forever.
title: Would that I could assign more than 5 stars

body: I bought this milk used.  For $1 per gallon, it was a great deal.  I chose ground shipping because it was the cheapest option (like $8 because of the weight and packaging), and it arrived to my house within 7-10 business days.  It was kinda warm when I came home around 4pm and found it sitting in the sun on my front doorstep.  I just threw it in the fridge to cool it down.  I drank some of it last night, and so far, there's no problem.  :-)
title: Bought it used, tastes like new

body: I know, I know, I've heard it before . . . you think that goat milk is just too strongly flavored, and that prejudices you against anything that isn't cow milk. But Tuscans aren't even related to goats. They're actually akin to gerbils, although they're a bit smaller. Their milk is very mild and sweet. It's also amazingly high in butterfat content, so it's wonderfully rich and creamy.Milking a tuscan is a dying art (they do tend to bite, which makes the process a bit tricky). That's why I'm glad to see this product achieving so much fame. As more people come to appreciate the extraordinary flavor of Tuscan milk, we'll see an increase of farmers who are slowly rediscovering the tuscan-milking process; supplies will increase, and the cost will go down. So give yourself a treat and help grow the industry! Buy your gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk Today! You'll be glad you did, and tuscans everywhere will thank you for it.
title: Tuscans, not goats

body: I finally received this product a few weeks ago, it is simply divine, a pure orgasmic delight. I had to find out what made it so delicious so I bought a plane ticket and traveled to the dairy to see for myself how this nectar of the gods was made to be such perfection. The dairy is a paradise, the milk cows have their own rooms, they get constant five star spa treatments, nothing negative is allowed near them, they have personal musicians to serenade them, they are fed only the best hay and grain grown by local nuns. The manager of the dairy also informed me that they are not milked by cold machines but by hand by the purest gentlest virgins, who collect the cow nectar into pure silver pails. Even PETA would approve of the treatment and conditions these glorious animals are kept.
title: Just the best

body: I approached the Airport Security Gate and fed my bags into the x-ray machine."Sir," said the TSA agent, "is this your bag?""You know it is," I replied."There's no need to get testy sir," he said.The agent escorted me over to a side table."Do you mind if I search your bag?"  he asked."What will you do if I say no?" I asked."I'll take you in the back room and we'll strip search you," he replied."Then by all means, go ahead and search," I said.The agent opened my bag and peered inside."What do you call this sir?" the agent asked holding up a pair of nail clippers."Those are nail clippers," I said."I'm going to have to confiscate these," he said."That's alright," I replied, "they sell them for a dollar in the store next to my departure gate."The agent looked at me with hate in his eyes.  He looked back into my bag and pulled out my gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk."Sir, you can't take this on the plane," he said."Why not?" I asked."Because, if you have more than three ounces of a liquid you could use it to blow up the plane," he said.I was astonished. I had no idea that Tuscan Whole Milk was so powerful."May I drink it now?" I asked."Yes," he said, "liquids are harmless once they are inside of you."I drank the entire gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk that I had purchased on Amazon.com while the people behind me grew increasingly inpatient.It was delicious.I did not blow up.
title: What Do You Mean I Can't Bring My Milk???

body: The Tuscan whole milk is the most amazing drink I have ever had. I used to be an alcoholic, but after one drink of this amazing milk, alcohol has never touched my lips again. Why drink bourbon when this amazing milk from the hills of Tuscany is now available to us all. Nothing short of the Second Coming compares to the sight of Tuscan Milk. Less than $100 per gallon is a steal. Don't miss out on the amazing opportunity to experience Tuscany as its finest.
title: This Milk Changed My Life

body: Tuscan Milk was really there for me on election night.  It took all 128oz to prepare me for Making America Great Again.
title: It took all 128oz to prepare me for Making America Great Again.

body: My Grandmother said never cry over spilt milk and so when I spilled this amazing milk I just decided to take photos of the milk shapes. Trust me this milk is so good it was hard not to cry. I took photos of the spilled milk on my iPhone. I shared them on facebook. A friend feeling sorry for me liked my photo. You know how Facebook works. One of her friends then saw it and messaged me to say that I was the next Jackson pollock of the art world!  I now am in major museums around the world. My next logical idea is to use the milk cartons in a sculpture. But this will take some time to drink all that I have ordered. I sip it in a wineglass while writing my memoirs.
title: Art installations copyright don't steal my ideas

body: The first time I tried TWM was on Fourth of July of this year. Some friends of mine had purchased some two weeks prior. We took it orally and I was very impressed with the stimulation and general euphoria it produced. In the months that followed, I began using it regularly....and intravenously. Tuscan Whole Milk is ruining my life! I have drained all of my assets and most of my veins are collapsed. Are there any other people suffering from addiction to this devil's milk? Can anyone direct me to some good 12 step books regarding Tuscan Whole Milk addiction and recovery? ADVICE FROM AN EXPERIENCED MILK USER: DO NOT accept used Tuscan Whole Milk.
title: Addicted

body: The doctor said I'd end up in the hospital if I ate lactose. Apparently my blood receptor cells would mitochondria from catabolization and inflammatory if I consumed lactose, or something like that (my doctor explained it to me but I cannot really remember what exactly he said). So after that fateful day, I stopped eating lactose and meticulously checked labels. But, one day I was out of milk (I drank it whenever I felt faint and nauseous) and decided I desperately needed NOW some before I passed out. I ordered Tuscon Dairy whole milk, 128 oz from Amazon and the drones brought it in three days. I was so weak I had to crawl to the front door to collect my milk and tip the driver (I didn't see him, so I left it on the drone).I quickly unscrewed the cap and downed the whole thing in seven minutes - it said MILK, it did not say LACTOSE. But I somehow ended up passing out anyways and I couldn't breathe. I quickly called the police and reported spoiled food (the best-by date said 2011! Maybe should have read that before drinking), but after talking to me they sent over an ambulance and sped me to the ER. They did some doctor-y stuff and asked me if I had any allergies. I told them I am deathly allergic to lactose, and told them I always drank milk whenever I felt like I was getting sick. Then the doctor told me LACTOSE IS IN MILK. I said "ohhhhhh" and finally understood. That however will not stop me from calling my lawyer, Tuscan dairy!
title: This product ALMOST KILLED ME. NOBODY told me lactose was in dairy!!!!

body: Melville put his finger on it: "This elusive quality it is, which causes the thought of whiteness, when divorced from more kindly associations, and coupled with any object terrible in itself, to heighten that terror to the furthest bounds. Witness the white bear of the poles, and the white shark of the tropics; what but their smooth, flaky whiteness makes them the transcendent horrors they are? That ghastly whiteness it is which imparts such an abhorrent mildness, even more loathsome than terrific, to the dumb gloating of their aspect. So that not the fierce-fanged tiger in his heraldic coat can so stagger courage as the white-shrouded bear or shark."...or milk!
title: the whiteness of the milk

body: Two milks diverged in a grand fridge,And sorry I could not drink bothAnd be one consumer, long I cringeAnd looked into one as far as I couldTo where it pooled in the undergrowth;Then took the other, just as white,And having perhaps the better odorBecause it was grass fed and aged with care,Though as for that the passing thereHad cooled them really about the same,And both that morning equally fullIn jugs yet unopened, seal and all.Oh, I marked the first for another day!Yet knowing how cup leads on to cupI doubted if I should ever come back.I shall be telling this with a gulpSomewhere ages and ages hence:Two milks diverged in a fridge, and I,I took the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl ozAnd that has made all the difference.
title: The Milk Less Traveled

body: Please...pray for me...I can't see this wonderfully delcious white blister of a jug of pure wholsome cold vitamin enriched homoginized paturized bovine breast milk!!!I'm a Vegan, but a closeted Tuscan Whole milk drinker...if anyone in my commune found out, they'd banish me to the netherlads of Bacontopia, to be ravaged by the ills of a factory farmed hell hole of a society that you pukes wallow in...with that, I make straw purchases from unlicensed dealers to circumvent existing codes of conduct within our commune. I do this on the darkest nights under cover, in living fear of being caught & judged & convicted...but it's all because of Tuscan Whole milk...luscious, thick, rich, creamy & brain freezing cold!!! OH SHEVA!!! HAVE MERCY ON MY SOUL!!!
title: I'm a backsliding Vegan...

body: Within the deep confines of the plastic shield that is the housing of this product lies a delicious, yet savory white nectar that is Tuscan Whole Milk 1 Gallon 128 FL OZ. I used to eat my cereal with various liquids such as water, juice, beer and my salty tears but never felt quite fulfilled. One evening when I was perusing the website known as Amazon.com I found this little gem. I was looking for a new liquid to fulfill my inner most desires of finding a new cereal liquid and after purchasing the bottle of Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon 128 FL OZ my soul became complete, i transcended space and time and became enlightened.
title: white gold

body: Bless the Tuscan whole milk, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless its holy name.Bless the Tuscan whole milk, O my soul, and do not forget all its benefits--who forgives all your iniquity, who heals all your diseases,who redeems your life from the Pit of Osteoporosis, who crowns you with steadfast bone structure,who satisfies you with icy frosty good flavor as long as you drink from a glass that's been in the freezer.The Tuscan whole milk works vindication and justice for all who are oppressed.It makes known its ways to Moses, who might have sold his soul for it in the desert had it been available.Tuscan whole milk is merciful and gracious, slow to spoil and abounding in Vitamin D.It will not always accuse, nor spew vile phrases about 2% milk being healthier.It does not deal with us according to our sins, nor repay us according to our iniquities.For as the heavens are high above the earth, so great is its nutrition for those who drink it;as far as the east is from the west, so far it removes our transgressions from us.As a father has compassion for his children, so the Tuscan whole milk has compassion for those who drink it.For it knows how we were made; it remembers that we are dust.As for mortals, their days are like grass; they flourish like a flower of the field;for the wind passes over it, and it is gone, and its place knows it no more.But the Tuscan whole milk is from everlasting to everlasting as long as there are cows to produce it, and its righteousness to children's children,to those who keep to the USDA dietary recommendations and remember to do the food pyramid.Tuscan whole milk has established its throne in the heavens, and its kingdom rules over all.Bless the Tuscan whole milk, O you angels, you mighty ones who do its bidding, obedient to its spoken word.Bless the Tuscan whole milk, all the cows, its ministers that do its will.Bless the Tuscan whole milk, all its works, in all places of its dominion. Bless the Tuscan whole milk, O my soul.
title: Bless Tuscan Whole Milk, O my Soul

body: What can be said about Tuscon whole milk?  Plenty of people have covered it's many virtues as a beverage, relationship saver, or even it's life changing abilities.  But as a survivor of a recent zombie outbreak in my hometown (you haven't heard about it due to the government covering it up), I can attest that milk is one of the most valuable anti-zombie defenses you can have in your zombie survival kit.  Forget crowbars, first aid kits, or even Molotov cocktails...a gallon of Tuscon whole milk is THE greatest defense you can have on hand.For one thing, milk is much more delicious then water.  When zombies cut off your water supply, you'll be forced to drink blood, dew from your rooftop, or any other manner of disgusting moisture.  But the zombies can do nothing about the milk stored in your fridge.  If you've stockpiled milk (preferably several gallons), then you'll have a delicious beverage that not only tastes better then water, it's also great for breakfast.  Nothing cheers you up during the zombie apocalypse like a bowl of cereal flavored with milk.Secondly, Tuscan whole milk is packed full of nutrients and vitamins that you'll need to keep your body in shape when fighting off the undead hordes.  After a long day of punching off rotten heads, and running several miles without a break, Tuscan whole milk has tons of protein that's the perfect fuel for building new muscles, so that when you wake up the following morning, your muscles will have recovered and are stronger then ever.  Not like those poor folks down the street who didn't have any milk to drink after their zombie based exercise.  They're all dead now.  Not like me, for Tuscon whole milk gave me the vital nutrients I needed to fight off the undead.Perhaps most importantly, Tuscan whole milk has lots of calcium, which you'll need to help maintain a strong skeletal system and ensure you'll have rock hard bones that won't break.  I drank plenty of milk during the outbreak, and my bones were rock hard, which allowed me to perform awesome kicks and leap from rooftops, landing safely and without injury.  Not like my poor neighbors, who hadn't been drinking Tuscan milk, and had their legs shatter on impact, leaving them helpless against undead teeth.  I wish I could forget their screams, but at least I'm still alive to spread the word about how vital milk is when it comes to surviving a zombie outbreak.All in all, though I had help during my time in zombie hell, nothing contributed more to my survival then Tuscan whole milk.  Without it, I would be rotting on the streets, another mindless being seeking to slaughter others.  But with my supply of milk on hand, I avoided such a horrible fate.  And while I may never emotionally recover from what I saw and endured, I can at least thank Tuscan for providing the nutrients I needed to survive.  Thanks to them, I'm at least able to move on with my life, and continue my search for true love.
title: The perfect anti-zombie defense

body: Few bands have sufficient staying power or the raw talent necessary to bridge the transition from one generation to the next.  Tuscan Whole Milk is a rare exception. Their first release Whole Milk rocketed them to fame in the late 70s, and remains a fan favorite to this day.Fans of Tuscan Whole Milk were split over subsequent releases of 2% Reduced Fat and 1% Reduced Fat.  Some said the band were selling out.  Others emphatically insisted the band was just changing with the times.  No matter which side of that fence you were on, their latest release "1 Gallon, 128 fl oz Red Label" is a treat.  Red Label will likely prove to be to Tuscan Whole Milk what Hot Rocks was to the Rolling Stones --- a lot of the best in one beautiful package.Red Label is a long-playing version of the classic 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz fan favorite.  Tuscan Whole Milk Red Label is a release that defies immediate classification or description, simply because it's so obviously a turning point for Tuscan Whole Milk that only time proves capable of shifting into eventual perspective.Each and every ounce of the Red Label release can't fail but take you completely in, proving that Tuscan Whole Milk is still the leader in quenching the world's thirst for the best.  Tuscan Whole Milk Red Label provides a real explosion of indie driving rhythm on even the slowest day of the week.  Tuscan Whole Milk Red Label is not overproduced, as is so common of lesser entries these days.  No, Tuscan Whole Milk Red Label is packaged like a grunge guitar chord that makes you want to just pop your top and swig like a hillbilly on his day off.Tuscan Whole Milk plays with so much passion and challenge that the Red Label '09 tour is something that can't be missed. Tuscan Whole Milk doesn't need to play at lesser venues, so don't look for them there.  Tuscan Whole Milk plays best in larger arenas that can accommodate fist-pumping crowds who can scream along with every last drop.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz World Tour '09

body: I walk down the street, clutching my paper bag.  Inside, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz,  and a pack of smokes.  It's cold and the wind bites my cheek like a hungry rat.  I pull my collar higher and slit my eyes as the banshee tugs at my coat.Something pink in the gutter.  Metal, twisted.  A child's lunchbox.  Barbie perhaps.  Flattened by traffic, the indifferent tires of the city bus or the gaudy spinners on some drug thug's Escalade.  Once upon a time this was the pride and joy of some little girl.  Now, discarded, like this city.  This city which was once the symbol of our industrial might.  Discarded like the union cards of retirees as they watch their benefits shrivel and their 401k's evaporate.  Ignored like the leaves which blow into burnt out shells of once majestic houses, to rot in dank corners as the timbers lean and mortar crumbles.Michigan Avenue.  Four lanes each way but not a car or person in sight.  It's dark now and the punks rule the streets.  Good people still live here but trying to keep the gang bangers, meth heads and crack fiends out is like holding back the tide with a torn raincoat and a pair of rubber gloves.  No one around, no witnesses.  They can sneak up behind you, kick you down, steal your wallet and even give you a tattoo with their dirty Air Jordans before anyone comes along to shoo them off.  They smell fear with the instinct of hyenas.Life has changed for me ever since I started drinking Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.  No more apprehension, even though my limp, a souvenir from 'Nam, gives me away with each step I take.  No more hiding like a cockroach.I heft the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz in my hand.  The weight feels good.  My combination lucky rabbits foot and brass knuckles.  Drunk from a tall cold glass, it can be a honeyed elixir giving strength to your weary bones and adding resolve to your spirit.  Swung properly, with enough momentum as you pivot on your opposing foot, it can break your opponent's nose like a toothpick.  At least my 3 years in the jungle were good for something.Dark now.  Shadows behind me.  From the corner of my eye I count two of them.  Punks.  They swarm the weak like maggots on putrid meat.  They've got something extra coming tonight.I tighten my grip on the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz,  slow my walk and smile to myself.
title: No bailout in Motown...

body: There I was in the train station. My heart pounded and jumped like the pebbles on the track as the train approached. Would I recognize him? After all, it had been a whole summer -- my first summer -- without Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.As the passengers poured out of the cars and into the arms of long-lost lovers or bent over to scoop up their young children, faces beaming, I craned my neck to get a glimpse of something familiar - that milky white hue, the red cap he always wore.After a few seconds that could have been a thousand years, I saw him. He looked the same, the same one-gallon frame holding those 128 fluid ounces of raw sexuality. But one look told me things would never be the same between us. I knew then that something had changed this summer."Hey," I said, holding back tears. "You look fantastic. Want to get out of here?"He didn't answer. He was, after all, 1 gallon, 128 fl. oz. of milk.We slipped over to a cafe a few blocks away. It was the kind where young couples would go to sit out on the sidewalk and be seen. Passersby would look over and wish they could have just a little bit of the happiness and excitement these young people were conspicuously enjoying. The love was palpable. Sickening.We slipped inside to the counter.Catching up was easy enough. I told him all about law school, mentioning the friends I had made along the way, their hopes and dreams. I left out that one evening with soy lattes, of course, but I didn't have to. He could see in my eyes that the long summer in the big city had driven a wedge between us.The summer had changed him, too. He was curdled from days of laying out on sandy beaches, but no matter. I loved him just the same. As I reached past him for the sugar, I took a furtive sniff at his cap. The pungent odor betrayed just how much he had changed. I didn't mind that he was spoiled. I just wanted him to take me, right there, in front of all those people. One more time. Just to let them see what love actually is. It's not love when it's pure and white, it's love when it's chunky and smelly and you don't care. It's about need, not desire.I paid our check and walked out of the cafe. The sun was going down, half shining behind the skyscrapers. I looked at him one more time, hoping to catch some glimpse of the way he used to see me.It wasn't there.Our day was civil -- there's no other way to describe it -- but things had changed. That long summer robbed us of our relationship, but it robbed us of so much more. Our innocence was shattered.We said our goodbyes on the corner before going our separate ways."Hey," I called after him, "I'll call you sometime." He didn't reply, he just looked back and smiled.I knew then we would never be going back to Tuscany.
title: Saying Goodbye

body: It's all well and good to indulge our creative writing and have a little fun at Amazon's expense, but what do we really know about this so-called Tuscan Milk? I will endeavor to prove that it is neither Tuscan nor milk.Everyone knows nascut (an anagram and almost a backwards spelling exactly of t-u-s-c-a-n) is Romanian for "born" (specifically, the past participle of naste). So what we have here is a thinly veiled admission that this liquid has its origins in Eastern, rather than Southern, Europe, and thus offers a flavor more Balkan than Mediterranean. Transylvania to Tuscany is exactly one thousand miles, and allowing for the fact that the earth rotates on its axis one thousand miles per hour, is it any coincidence that Lao Tzu wrote, "A journey of one thousand miles begins with a single step"?As for the question of color over origin, we are presented with no less of an obvious obfuscation. To be sure, the pictures of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz appear as white as newly fallen arctic snow. But color theory teaches us that white is after all the combined color spectrum. Given the geographical and lexicographical insights above, are we hinting at vampiric energy drinks or merely an FDA investigation of immense, nay, bovine, proportions? Either way I think I'll have a good old fashioned Mexican Coke (24 Pack) instead.
title: A Conspiracy of Bovine Proportions
