body: The latest whole milk offering from Tuscan, introduced at this year's CES, was a clear upgrade from their last offering. The earlier version, while a compelling idea, had a number of limitations that prevented it from competing with other leaders in the new social dairy medium. It showed promise, however, in its ambitious attempts at elegantly fusing a number of niche products into something more pocketable and financially available for the dairy hobbyist. Even throwing in some features that were previously the sole territory of the prosumer-level cheeses and baconnaises, the Tuscan has been the it-girl of the connected refrigerated goods market. Do the new features really differentiate it from the ambitious but unfulfilling initial product? Read more after the cut.(read more)1. The operating systemWhile the original was a WinMo beverage, the addition of Android has added support for already implemented cereal-topping hardware. This feature alone warrants an upgrade, but people considering purchasing Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz might want to consider waiting on the promised Eclair update scheduled to be pushed OTA in the beginning of next quarter. No plans to support Froyo have yet been announced, but hopes are high due to some stray notes in the blessedly open source of Tuscan's MilkBottle custom interface.2. ConnectivityThe original version, while software-upgradeable, fails in one key aspect; it is limited to use near a wifi hotspot. The addition of a SIM slot in the new hardware will allow you to pour milk on the go, though drinking milk is still reserved for wifi usage. Fan site TusLait has gotten a leak from a trusted source within Tuscan that implies that this limitation is entirely within software, and the lock was put in place to ensure that their relationship with AT&T; for their wireless support would continue. Expect a rooted version of the firmware to disable the lock soon.3. The displayThe larger 52" display of the new iteration of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz improved readability, even including a wider viewing angle and more accurate multitouch. Sadly, they haven't improved on the weight, and you're still going to need the included stand to do any serious reading on this. Holding the three-ton, steam-powered behemoth while reading on the subway is a strain after several minutes. Rotating into landscape is questionable as well, as the tilt sensor is not very sensitive. To coax the device into triggering the autorotate, it is almost guaranteed that the milk will spill all over the floor. Beyond this, we also found that the exhaust from the coal burner that powers this monster of a multipurpose dairy dispenser is intensely noxious and will cause intense nausea if used in an enclosed space.4. Battery lifeThe battery is still pitifully small, hardly lasting long enough to power the device on. As it lacks any charger or mains plug, it is vital that you have a sufficient supply of coal on hand to power Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. We had hoped that they would be able to improve uptime on the included 25 D-cell batteries, but any improvements seem to be lost in powering the argon-neon backlight element for the larger display. Now I have to buy coal. So much coal.5. CoalFull disclosure, Tuscan has employed this writer as a coal miner for their new Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. To provide the necessary juice, I mine coal for 10 hours of each day. Due to technical constraints, I am no longer able to provide my wife the attention she deserves, and she has taken my children away to be with Steve, who will provide for her and the kids. It takes 2000 lb (1 ton) of coal to pour milk for 10 minutes continuously, and that same ton can keep the milk for 2 hours on standby. If reception is poor, those times halve, so I cannot stray more than 5 miles from the Tuscan headquarters at the northern tip of Alaska.6. AlaskaEach resident of Alaska received $1,305.00 from the Permanent Fund in 2009, but this was immediately spoken for by my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. I am uncertain of how the device communicated with me, as it has no internal speakers and is woefully limited by its 2.5mm headphone/mic jack for which I do not own any accessories. I am fairly certain that it is powered by the black magicks of this place, but we will have to wait for results from the iFixit teardown. Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz has told me not to allow the teardown, and my will becomes weaker with each passing day. The screen will only display the faces of a rotating cadre of elder gods, and the boundary between dream and reality becomes thinner all the time. Each time the sun sets I fear it will not rise again, as the days become more brief and the night, and the terrors that lie within, dominate to day.7. My wifeTell my wife I am sorry. Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is too powerful. I must find more coal for Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. She was right. Tell her I love her. Tell Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz I love her. Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz her. Oh Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. Oh God Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz comes for us. Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.
title: The vanguard of milk tech?

body: THE NIGHT I FOUND CHRISTMAS'Twas the night before Christmas, our shopping was doneAnd we'd returned home, to start on the fun;we wrapped and we stacked all our gifts by the tree,then, just for a laugh, set out milk and cookies.The children all grown, living cities away,except for Dana and her lover (they're gay);They came for a visit, and a quick night cap,said goodbye and "Love You" and went home for a nap.We'd just gone to bed when I heard a great crash,I sprang from the bed, grabbed my baseball bat.To the living room I ran (my wife called the cops)Where I saw a great sight that caused me to stop.Our fireplace cast an unfamiliar glowOn a man dressed in red who was covered with snow ,"Get back!" my voice trembled as I raised my bat high,"The cops will be here soon" I warned the weird guy."Ho, ho, ho," laughed the man, "I am not a thief.Don't you know who I am? Can you not believe?"I turned on the light and there stood St. Nick:Shortbread cookies in hand, eyes on his drink.I could see disappointment in his rosy red cheeksHis lips frowned, his nose wrinkled as though something reeked"It's fresh from the fridge," I said as he churttled"The milk's neither soured, nor has it curdled!""As far as this sludge that you've put in my cup,"He sniffed and he sneered, "I cannot drink this up."He held out his hand, whilst grasping the mug."Well, that's all I've got," I took it and shrugged.Then Santa spoke, his voice like a song"No, no, no I am sorry this is just all wrong.Lucky for you I have brought you a gift.Go on, open it and see what it is."And then, in a twinkling, he gave me a presentYet before it was opened I could smell its sweet scent.I hastily tore at the gold wrapping,'Til my hand held the gift that sent my heart a tap-tapping.What I saw made my mouth moist and my tummy do bounces,Tuscon Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz;I gently unscrewed that red plastic cap,more excited for this than for fresh bubble wrap.His eyes -- how they twinkled; he held out two fresh mugsAnd he smiled as I poured us some silk from that jug.We had just put the rims of our cups to our lipsWhen my wife did appear screaming "What the **** is this?"Like reindeer in headlights we were just standing stock,And then at the door there came a great knock."Well, that's the police that you asked me to callbefore you came out here!" said my Wife from the hall.She came back with two uniformed men by her side,"What's the problem?" They asked sounding bored, acting snide;A wink of Nick's eye and a twist of his head,Soon gave me to know I had nothing to dread.He spoke not a word, but went straight to his work:Filled up three more mugs; then turned with a jerk,And laying his finger aside of his nose,And giving a nod, up the chimney he rose.My wife and the cops and I all stood amazed,St. Nick was gone, four full mugs took his place.Each held the glory of Whole Milk from Tuscon,"Well!," I exclaimed, "we might as well have some!"Then with snow falling outside and us sitting in,We each took a glass and breathed that milk in.Heaven took over all five of our senses --when it came to milk, this one sat on no fences.It truly is peace, love and joy in a jug;Each sip is magic held in a clay mug.We drank til the Tuscon Milk was all out of sight,That was when I found Christmas, my first true Christmas Night!
title: Twas the night I found Christmas

body: Chapter 1Once upon a time in a land far, far away known by many as Lady Orchard's classroom, sat Lady Orchard herself and 23 amazing students and a Chip. One rather snowy day as class was starting, Lady Orchard poured herself a nice large glass of 'Tuscan Whole Milk' (not the whole gallon now, she's not that crazy!) when something a little peculiar happened. Each sip she took, another one of her students was turned into a different mythical creature. One a dragon, one a unicorn, and etcetera. This worried Lady Orchard greatly, for King Nelson was going to survey the classrooms in just a few short hours. She tried everything to turn them back. She tried calling in Knight McCallum the wise to Witch McMillon. NOTHING WORKED!!!Chapter 2Lady Orchard was worried. She did not think she had actually taken 23 sips of the rather mad milk! Maybe her Zumba teacher could help her! She was a witch! She even used Cravendale milk to give her cats thumbs!!! She rushed over to her Zumba teachers hut to find her pinned down by all her kittens with thumbs! Lady Orchard was very confused on why her sweet kittens would do such a thing! Then she realized what Queen Lisa (The Zumba teacher) had nuzzled in between her arm and her side... Cravendale! The Cravendale was the key!!!Chapter 3Lady Orchard, who just realized she had left her class unattended, pried all the cats off of Queen Lisa. This task proved to be rather difficult since the cats had claws and thumbs. Once the task was done, Lady Orchard ran to the nearest by market to get her Cravendale, and quickly rushed back to her classroom. But alas, by the time she got there, King Nelson was standing furiously in the doorway. Once Lady Orchard got closer to her room, she realized that the animals had breed, and now there were four times as many mythical creatures as there were when she left!!! Before she explained to King Nelson what had happened, she drank the whole gallon (YES! This time the whole gallon!) of the Cravendale milk. Nothing happened.To Be Continued...
title: The Orchard Challenge

body: The first I had ever heard of Milk, was after it came out and won the New York Film Critics Circle best of award for 2008. Since then, it has been the best reviewed of Gus Van Zant career. However, had I known was merely a remake before I saw it, I would have seen the original first. But such was not the case.So, I hesitantly ordered this "Tuscan Milk" on Amazon (it finally arrived last week over the holidays (I also used Super Saver Shipping). As much as I like European products, I have to admit that, in this instance, the American version is most certainly better (well, this and The Office!).In this version, there simply is no stand-out performance like Sean Penn's. While you are kept abreast of the story throughout, it will initially leave you ice-cold, and the the depth of it fails to last as long as you'd like it to. As a matter of fact, the only character in the whole thing is Phlegm and he doesn't show up til just as the movie ends! The visuals are amateur at best: all shots of it are completely blown out (even in absolute darkness, you can still make out the pale white image).While not exactly formulaic, in the end, there is a homogenized feel to the whole thing. It leaves a taste in your mouth for something more, perhaps Chocolat?Side note: the movie poster of a cow jumping over the moon has NOTHING to do with gay rights. But it could be an italian inside joke or something.It's not bad, a little bland, but i'd stick with the movie still currently in theaters.
title: In a surprising twist, the remake is preferred

body: Hello.I want to share my story with the world.Perhaps some people can learn from it. Maybe even some will be changed in some small way.I know I was.~~~~~ It all started long, long ago.... *smoke billows as we go into a flashback*I was 7, or perhaps I was 8 years old. Well, either way that doesn't really matter. My story is a universal one, not dependant on age or circumstance.I was naive back then, full of wonder and hope. I was happy. I didn't know how the world worked or what ugly things lied just beyond the scope of my childhood. What wretched things lurked just over the horizon. What atrocities I would come to experience as my innocent days withered away into oblivion as they gave way to the complex existence that is Adulthood.Such romance in my small childhood imagination! Love was a story like that of Cinderella who lived happily ever after, when in reality, Love was more like Romeo and Juliet-- You end up wanting to kill yourself in the end.Life is like a box of chocolates... I found that out the hard way. I ate too many of those cherry-flavored cream things to think Life was worth living.And so, as I grew up and came to realize that everything I thought I had known was just a lie; that my parents were not superheroes at all, but imperfect human beings, like I was; that the sweet smelling days of the summer-like existance of my youth had frozen into the Winter of perpetual existance; that is when I knew I had to find IT.IT was that thing that would make my days shine bright again. Shine with hope and glorious destiny. I wanted to see the rays of light reach out for me again, to feel something bigger than myself holding me and drawing me into the light of existance I once knew so well.I cannot tell you what spurred me on or what hope I had of thinking that IT was even out there. But I knew that I had to try; I would die anyway.My journey began when I stumbled upon a valley in the hills of Tuscany. The rolling, softly green hills were filled with the musical notes of bovine songs. Their soft, lulling "Moo"s were like rays of brilliant light which stood starkly against all that is dark in this world.A particular bovine - such a majestic being it was - came to me, floating like a lily pad on the waters of destiny. It stood before me, raising it's head to meet my hand which was outstretched to meet the soft nostrils of this giant lactose-producer. I looked into that cow's eyes and saw a deep ocean of feeling that lay inside the creature. It was as if she could see my very soul.... Time seemed to stand still...I took and drank of that creature's udder - The succulence of that pure and true Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz flowed down my longing throat and filled my being with the warmth I had once long ago remembered. That milk of Tuscany - Such a beauteous lactose potion! It awoke my very heart. The warmth of sun on my face was so real. The splendor of childhood wonder and hope were mine once again. All things good and pure in the world were unveiled before me, and the dark existance I once knew so deeply dissipated as the mist does when the morning dawns.I had been so dead inside; The world had become to me a playground rid of all it's merriment, darkened by the ruin of childhood dreams and the drinking of Skim milk, 1%, even 2% - Nay, these did not satiate my need. But this Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz fed me. It nourished the starving child inside my hungry soul.*Smoke billows as we once again travel back to present day* ~~~~~~~~~~~I am now an old woman. I cannot tell all of what happened after my experience of drinking Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. All you need to know is...Though I did live happily ever after, the point is, reader, that I lived.**(Ever After - A Cinderella Story )
title: An Awakening of Splendor Upon the Tuscan Hills (A Melodrama for Milk Lovers)

body: A lot of folks have mentioned the big con with this Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz: no instruction manual.  But come on now - let's be fair to Tuscan.  Putting together a manual for this product would be an unapproachable chore, as there are a million and one uses for this stuff.Not only is this milk delicious and usually fresh, but it's an amazing substance to have around the house.  Got dandruff?  No problem - liberally apply Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz during shower time, and repeat if desired.  Kiss those flakes goodbye.  Need to strip grease from your dishes?  You guessed it - this milk cuts the mustard.  And the grease.  On your dishes.  Just soak for 15 minutes and it'll remove even the most caked-on food.  Same goes for stains on your clothes.Amazingly, I've found that Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is great for disciplining pets.  Did your dog just eat your shoes?  Maybe your cat pooped on the floor.  All you have to do is get your pet hooked on Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, and then when they misbehave - take the Milk away.  Your pet will be a whimpering, obedient slave within minutes.Finally - and I know this sounds crazy - Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz acts as an amazing signal booster for cable television.  If you live in an old house like I do, you know that sometimes the strength of your cable signal can waver.  During those vital newscasts or gameshows, nothing can be more obnoxious than a weak signal.  To fix this, simply dump Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz onto your cable box.  It's amazing - a clear beautiful picture within minutes!So in short, the lack of operator's manual is a bit unfortunate, but supplying one would undoubtedly raise the per-unit cost of the milk.  Think about the insane bargain you're getting for this amazing liquid!

body: In 2006, I was a photo journalist embedded with the 1st Marine's Battalion in the ongoing war to spread God's democracy in Iraq.  The experience changed my life.Among the many hearts and minds we won over, there was that of a young boy, aged seven.  His name was Ahmed, an orphan who was dying of leukemia in a lonely ward in a crowded Karbala hospital.  His entire family and most of his neighborhood was completely destroyed by tank shells coated with depleted uranium.  My initial outrage at the tragedy, however, was calmed as my unit's commanding officer explained furhter.  He assured me that six suspected terrorists were killed in the skirmish.  And well....when you're making omelets, sometimes you have to break some eggs.  A tired American physician working at the hospital also approached me soon after and added that Ahmed's cancer was most likely a pre-existing condition for billing purposes.I knew there had to be a sensible explanation.I had befriended the little boy in the last few months of his life.  He was so innocent and had a smile that could light up a room.  But that smile began to fade as his last days were approaching.  Gaunt and barely able to keep anything down, the only hope we had, to keep him nourished for just a few more precious hours was to offer him his favorite food.  As it turns out, what the boy really wanted was a 128 fl oz dose of his favorite milk.  It was the only thing he could keep down and the only prayer he had to regain his strength and fight to live another day.With the region in tatters, milk was hard to come by, but thank God or Allah, or whomever you wish to show gratitude to.....thank God for Amazon.  When I asked Ahmed what kind of milk he wanted, he said, in his sweet, melodic little Arabic voice....Lucerne."Lucerne?!"  I asked, dumbfounded.  "Lucerne is a decent brand young man, but we Americans know quality when we see it.  Allow me to show you the superiority of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, my boy, It is simply the best.  And once you've had that, you'll never go back."Ahmed smiled.  In our months together forming an unforgettable friendship, he was so agreeable...so enamored with Americans and always wanting to please.  While he preferred Lucerne, I know he wanted to please me.  And why not?  The milk, after all, was far more expensive than all of the others on Amazon.  If this was to be his final meal....or his final hope for a subsequent meal, I was going to make it an experience like no other.  I ordered the milk and it arrived four days later.  The smile printed on the Amazon box could not have been sweeter than the smile on that little boy's face.But as his lips were about to touch the nourishing bovine beverage, the boy's eyes rolled backward and he breathed his last.  A hint of joy was still on his face as the final memory of smelling his favorite drink was still embedded on his facade.  Ahmed had died.Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is the greatest milk on God's green earth.  No one can tell me any different.  I would highly recommend it.  And had Ahmed survived long enough to judge for himself, I am confident he would say the same.My only thought:  and this thought will likely haunt  me for the rest of my life.If I had bought Lucerne, the cheaper milk....I might have been able to afford rush delivery.
title: The Best - I don't care what they say.

body: I just bought a gallon, poured a glass, finished it, poured another, finished it, and repeated until the gallon was gone. I can't explain why I did that, or why I was compelled to instantly write a review, but I stumbled in a white haze to the computer, opened Amazon, and saw that there were already 1,336 reviews. The milk has forever established my credibility on the internet, as this review will be teh 1337. Enough said.
title: 1337th post.... enough said

body: I purchased the milk hoping to make some low fat Tuscan cheese. When I received the milk, however, I knew that I wouldn't be able to wait for any cheese to mature. I figured, what the heck, I'll pour a glass while it is still room temperature from shipping. I popped the top off and took a whiff. It smelled as fresh and appetizing as the succulent, glistening teat of the Tuscan cow from which it came. Even thinking about it now arouses my deep, mammalian desire to drink milk.I awoke in a daze on my kitchen floor some time later, covered in milk. It looked like there was still over half of the milk left in the container, so I hurriedly tossed it in the refrigirator and left for work.When I returned home from work, my milk-thirst had returned as well. I opened the refrigirator hoping to see that smooth, plastic jug, but it was gone! At that very moment, I realized I had made a terrible mistake. I opened the freezer and there was my Tuscan milk, frozen as solid as granite. I grabbed the milk I turned to begin heating up the oven so I could thaw my milk faster. I noticed my back door was open. Someone had broken into my house!I looked to my left and there was a man holding MY put-put golf club in the air. He meant business. I was so scared that I almost dropped my milk. Instead of dropping the jug, however, I gripped it tighter. I could feel my own pulse through it's perfectly crafted handle. No, instead of dropping the jug, I raised it in the air behind me. I threw it right at the burglar's head with all of my might.The frozen mass crashed against his head and made a wrong-sounding crack as it shattered. He fell to the floor, and the pieces of frozen milk fell upon him like an October hailstorm. He lay there on my kitchen floor and all of that whole Tuscan milk began to melt.I grabbed the phone to call the police, but hung up before dialing. I was not going to let that milk go to waste and I had to be quick! I cupped as much as I could from the floor into my hands taking tiny slurps and dreaming of Tuscany. I'm not sick or anything, so I didn't drink any of the milk that had mixed with the pool of blood forming under the burglar's head. There was some on his face, neck, and chest that I had to slurp off of him. I tried to slurp quietly and softly so I wouldn't wake him.The funny thing is, when the police came, they told me he was dead. I could have taken my time! Anyways, I owe my life to that jug of milk and I'll never forget that day.
title: It Saved My Life

body: Even as a child I wondered about the territorial and xenophobic fearsome desert savages known as Tusken Raiders. Why were they so protective and what were they hiding that was so good? Then I bought this milk and all became clear, they were guarding herds that produced the best milk money can buy. George Lucas did not create these creatures wholly out of thin air, no. He discovered them and their secret while traipsing through the hills and valleys of Afghanistan. In the land where goat milk was king and even saying other wise was blasphemy, it is no wonder that this band of cattle herders were overly protective. Thankfully George was able to persuade them to let him tell their story on the big screen. (Provided that he change the name of their tribe from the original Tuscan of course, along with not revealing their true location in the universe.) Now all can be told due to changes in their part of the world and we are free to enjoy their rare treasure.As a bonus we can reflect upon a simple little movie called Star Wars and attempt to ascertain the true meaning behind the rich universe of characters outside of the noble Tusken (Tuscan) herdsmen. For example, who does Chewbacca really represent? Perhaps George will tell us in time, but until then we can only watch in awe and wonder.
title: A Star Wars mystery is solved!

body: My housemates and I got snowed in by the second horrifying blizzard to hit Washington, D.C. this winter. The day before I went to the grocery store which was mobbed by like-minded individuals, stocking up for the inevitable. I had no trouble finding the eggs, Gatorade powder, or Hawaiian shirts, but as I approached the milk rack, I saw that it was completely empty. Looted! Vandals, all of them! Soy and Hemp milk abounded, but the remaining racks were but skeletons. Until I saw, ten feet back into the refrigeration unit, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, wedged between a shattered Greek yogurt and a crushed thing of candy beans. Like a cat I snuck into the fowl-smelling ice cave, my huge head avoiding the girders and the rafters on all sides. Extending my arm, my fingers grazed the dewy exterior of the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, slipping at first until finally grabbing hold of its sturdy, milk-filled handle. As I yanked at it it resisted at first, but I persisted like one rescuing a kitten from the top of a tree. I brought freedom to the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, and had no problem paying the $69.99 for it at the register. My housemates and I are now safe in our living room, warming our hands at the burning Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz in our fireplace.
title: Milk for the Snowpocalpyse

body: Tuscan Whole MilkThis story is dedicated to the ace typewriter mechanic Martin Tytell, who built a duplicate typewriter when the experts said it couldn't be done.Terry Bricker was reading his legal journal when his secretary Dolly Lane opened the door to his office. "Chief, there's a young woman here to see you about a problem." "Show her in, Dolly." "Hello Mr. Bricker, my name is Lizzie Berdan and my parents were really sick last night. I think our milk was poisoned by an enemy of my father." Terry knew about Andrew Jackson Berdan, a self-made man famous for his avariciousness. "You must not be buying Tuscan Whole Milk" said Terry. "No" said Miss Lizzie. "Father used his position at the bank to award a supply contract to Farmer Arnold Brown and he gets his milk at a special rate." Terry said he would use his detective Donald Gander to investigate.The next day a telephone call brought news about the murder of Andrew and his second wife Abby. The only two people known to be in the house, Lizzie and the maid Bridget, were the chief suspects. Bridget was soon cleared, she was outside at the time of Abby's murder. Donald Gander reported that his operative talked to Bridget, who told of an unexpected visit from Uncle John the day before. Lizzie and Uncle John spoke in a low voice when Bridget was near, this was unusual. The house was searched from top to bottom but no bloody axe was found, nor any blood-stained clothes. When Lizzie was arrested Terry visited her in jail. "Is there anything new to tell me" asked Terry? "Mr. Bricker, I didn't tell you about my cousin Raymond. He had a debt that was coming due and was supposed to see father. Raymond has a terrible temper and was once sent to a hospital. I want Raymond's name kept out of this for family reasons. I am innocent of committing this crime." "Well Miss Lizzie, you would be surprised by the number of innocent men in prison" said Terry.When the trial of Miss Lizzie began Terry, with the information developed by Donald Gander, was able to cast reasonable doubt on the testimony of the state's witnesses. The gilt paint in Abby's skull proved a fairly new axe was used. One of Gander's operatives obtained information about Raymond and his half-brother William. The latter was seen to be waiting in front of the Berdan home, as if resting his wagon in the shade on that hot August morning. William was called to the stand but said little. Raymond was called to the stand and didn't say much. Then Terry asked him about the loan and if he was late in payment. His face flushed and he shouted "Yes, I did it and I'm glad! I'd do it again if I had the chance!" "Once is enough" said Terry.The judge directed a verdict of not guilty, and so a guiltless Lizzie Berdan returned home. But tongues wagged, and public opinion turned against Lizzie. She was guilty except a slick lawyer fooled a half-wit into confessing. Or maybe they were both in cahoots. And so the legend of Lizzie grew. There was a jingle that was repeated like a popular song. To this day most people think she was guilty.Buy and drink Tuscan Whole Milk to avoid such problems.This Is Based On A True Story.The names were changed to protect the innocent.
title: The Case of the Millionaire Miser

body: My dermatologist told me to start taking weekly milk baths to help my rosacea.  I left a note for my milkman to leave me 25 gallons during his next delivery, but instead he knocked on my door and asked me, "Ma'am, is this correct?  You want 25 gallons of milk?"I tried to explain what my dermatologist said, and then, perhaps naively, asked him what kind of milk and how much he thought I should get.  He asked me, "Do you want it pastuerized?"  "No," I replied, "just up to my [...].  I can splash it in my eyes."He left and hasn't come back since.  Thank God for Tuscan Whole Milk.
title: Amazon's a lifesaver now that my milkman's cut me off.

body: Being a shy, backward person, it is truly difficult to tell my story, the story of a person suffering from near-necrotic epidermis. But I'll give it my best and relate to you the shortcomings, nay, the failings of this product as a skin treatment.As difficult as it is to admit, I suffer from chronic, persistent Folliculitis. This horribly tragic skin affliction has been my curse since puberty and only grows worse by the year. It starts with small bumps, but with uncontrollable scratching and flaking, it has transformed my somewhat-normal skin into a leather-like covering that only serves to keep my veins, arteries and organs intact. At first it attacked only my arms and stomach and was easily hidden by longish-sleeved t-shirts. Winter was a godsend, as I could slink around fully clothed and the casual observer would never know my affliction. Keeping a calm demeanor and having passably handsome face, I would sometimes merit even the occasional approving nod or glance.All that has changed with time, however. Summer or winter, I must drag myself along like a strict Mormon in long sleeves and pants, envying all other humans as they laugh and play in short sleeves, tank tops or even go shirtless.Then I met Dr. Smetigonavitadong, my ayurvedic dermatologist. He assured me all would be cured if I'd only bathe myself daily in whole milk, preferably Tuscan. Living outside the fringes of society, whole milk would be hard to find (even moreso, whole milk of the Tuscan variety), but thanks to the internet and Amazon, I was able to procure said product in the form of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fluid ounces. I purchased several cases.Months have gone by and, disappointingly, I've seen no change. Pustules and pimples remain, fetid and squamous as ever. And worse yet, I've found that the good Doctor is an investor in the entire Tuscan Whole Milk financial scheme! My embarrassment is complete, as I've been taken by an ayurvedic quack! Adding insult to injury, I have an entire cache of spoiling whole milk and I'm lactose intolerant!Now nights are spent reading Wikipedia to learn various cheese recipes. Any help would be appreciated from those residing in Wisconsin or of Swiss lineage.
title: A Skin Problem Remedy This is NOT.

body: (a) Description. Milk is the lacteal secretion, practically freefrom colostrum, obtained by the complete milking of one or more healthycows. Milk that is in final package form for beverage use shall havebeen pasteurized or ultrapasteurized, and shall contain not less than8\1/4\ percent milk solids not fat and not less than 3\1/4\ percentmilkfat. Milk may have been adjusted by separating part of the milkfattherefrom, or by adding thereto cream, concentrated milk, dry wholemilk, skim milk, concentrated skim milk, or nonfat dry milk. Milk may behomogenized.  (b) Vitamin addition (Optional). (1) If added, vitamin A shall bepresent in such quantity that each quart of the food contains not lessthan 2000 International Units thereof within limits of goodmanufacturing practice.  (2) If added, vitamin D shall be present in such quantity that eachquart of the food contains 400 International Units thereof within limitsof good manufacturing practice.  (c) Optional ingredients. The following safe and suitableingredients may be used:  (1) Carriers for vitamins A and D.  (2) Characterizing flavoring ingredients (with or without coloring,nutritive sweetener, emulsifiers, and stabilizers) as follows:  (i) Fruit and fruit juice (including concentrated fruit and fruitjuice).  (ii) Natural and artificial food flavorings.  (d) Methods of analysis. Referenced methods are from ``OfficialMethods of Analysis of the Association of Official AnalyticalChemists,'' 13th Ed. (1980), which is incorporated by reference. Copiesmay be obtained from the AOAC INTERNATIONAL, 481 North Frederick Ave.,suite 500, Gaithersburg, MD 20877, or may be examined at the NationalArchives and Records Administration (NARA). For information on theavailability of this material at NARA, call [...], or go to:[...]  (1) Milkfat content--``Fat, Roese-Gottlieb Method--Official FinalAction,'' section 16.059.  (2) Milk solids not fat content--Calculated by subtracting the milkfat content from the total solids content as determined by the method``Total Solids, Method I--Official Final Action,'' section 16.032.  (3) Vitamin D content--``Vitamin D--Official Final Action,''sections 43.195-43.208.  (e) Nomenclature. The name of the food is ``milk''. The name of thefood shall be accompanied on the label by a declaration indicating thepresence of any characterizing flavoring, as specified in Sec. 101.22of this chapter.  (1) The following terms shall accompany the name of the foodwherever it appears on the principal display panel or panels of thelabel in letters not less than one-half the height of the letters usedin such name:  (i) If vitamins are added, the phrase ``vitamin A'' or ``vitamin Aadded'', or ``vitamin D'' or ``vitamin D added'', or ``vitamin A and D'' or``vitamins A and D added'', as is appropriate. The word ``vitamin'' maybe abbreviated ``vit.''.  (ii) The word ``ultra-pasteurized'' if the food has been ultra-pasteurized.  (2) The following terms may appear on the label:  (i) The word ``pasteurized'' if the food has been pasteurized.  (ii) The word ``homogenized'' if the food has been homogenized.  (f) Label declaration. Each of the ingredients used in the foodshall be declared on the label as required by the applicable sections ofparts 101 and 130 of this chapter.If that doesn't make it clear how much I love Tuscan Whole Milk, I don't know what can.
title: 21 CFR 131.110  Milk

body: It was my birthday, and I was afraid that no one remembered, what with the hustle and bustle and comedown of the post Christmas rush.  A knock at my door. I glanced through the eyehole, and there it was - sitting on the ground, a 1 gallon (128 fl oz) jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, jauntily adorned with only a silver bow.  The card read "I care enough to help you prevent osteoperosis"  It was unsigned.I brought the astonishing gift into my kitchen, noting the cold firmness of the plastic container as I held it to my chest.  To the kind stranger so concerned for my bone health, I drank to you, glass after glass.  Perhaps someday I will be able to enrich someone's life in the same way.
title: The best gift I've ever recieved.

body: Milk.  A word that stirs the emotions like no other, playing with our minds and tearing at our hearts.For me it reminds me of my time as a baby suckling on that warm teat, enjoying the sweet flavour of life.For others it evokes pain, recalling that terrible morning when the only milk left in the fridge was a couple of ounces of stinky cheese type stuff in the bottom of the bottle.For my cats it heralds the cries of "meeeeow" at all hours of the day, the greedy little fur balls.But Tuscan Whole Milk 1 Gallon 128 fl oz has transcended all of this to create a powerful step towards milky perfection.  It's reported that President Obama has declared that Air Force One must carry at least 4000 gallons of Tuscan Whole Milk 1 Gallon 128 fl oz on every flight, just enough to survive on should the plane have to make an emergency landing on a deserted island.Perhaps one day we Brits will have easier access to this delicious cow juice, but alas it seems that it will always be `currently unavailable'.What an udder shame.
title: Yes, I TusCAN recommend this milk.

body: Like many others, I awoke this morning only technically, only physically.My routined stumble towards the kitchen and my precious coffee machine was forgettable but for one thing.I was missing creamer.A migraine was led by explosive epiphanies: "CoffeeWithoutCreamIsJustBitterBrownWater!" & "ICantWorkOrDriveOrEtcWithoutCoffee!"I quickly turned to my survival skills. In an urban environment, these amount to two things: the ability to memorize easily overlooked parking spots, and the sixth sense that informs the owner of their potential candidacy for a mugging. I was out of luck.In a brief moment likely motivated by the fear of experiencing the infinite complexity that can only be described as "The Mondays," I recalled a final survival skill - the one that had let me buy the newest electronics without waiting in line for hours. The one that let me save a few dollars with each purchase, thereby allowing me to make more purchases. The one both of us are using right now.I used Amazon. Without regret or self-pity... I used Amazon.Endless seconds of searching later, I was introduced to Tuscan Whole Milk. Its boasts of "fresh flavor" and "highest quality milk and products" ultimately won my business.Damning the costs, I opted for 2 day shipping. Damning that my purchase was not creamer, I delved into the study of Creaming. Having devoured every YouTube clip and Yahoo Answers answers I could come across in the hour this held my attention, I went back to sleep until the anticipated moment of delivery.Having now received the milk, I must comment on Tuscan's interesting approach towards creating a thicker and more sour milk than its competitors. The lesson learned? Sometimes long stories don't have any lessons.
title: Needed for a proper cup of coffee.

body: Milk is a nutritional product of adult female mammals secreted through specialized sweat glands called mammary glands.  All young mammals depend solely on milk at the beginning of their lives through a process called suckling directly from their mother's mammary glands.  This process is humans is called breast feeding. Many members of the human species continue to consume milk secreted from lactating ungulates far past their formative breast feeding period (anywhere from several months of age to seven years) and far into adulthood.  Not through direct suckling, but by glass. The overwhelming ungulate of choice in the United States is the bovine species, and cattle are specifically domesticated, bred, raised, and housed for milk production by mechanical milking machines.  Nowadays, bovine milk is prepared for marketing through homogenization and pasteurization and is placed in gallon-sized containers for distribution to their intended human consumers.  Tuscan Milk is a far superior example of lactating ungulate secretion available now to all through Amazon mail-order.  I am pretty sure that it is cow's milk, as there is a bovine depicted on the label vaulting over what appears to be the moon.
title: Premium lactating ungulate secretion of choice for human consumption!

body: I was actually pretty excited about this product. I'm all about imports. I had heard good things and couldn't wait to take it for a test-run.I opened my amazon box and was baffled when I could find no instruction manual. I didn't want to break it with improper use (or risk damage to my own body, mental state, or my family). I had to return it and am still waiting for my replacement from Amazon.Given the situation, I had originally awarded this product with one measly star. I know this product has great potential, and has appeared to make so many consumers happy.With that knowledge, I awarded an extra star.I will follow up with a review once my replacement arrives in the mail, hopefully this time with a manual.
title: Huh?

body: To my amazement, when walking through Attiko Metro one beautiful spring afternoon, I witnessed perfection for the first time in my extensive stay here on Earth.  As I walked along the splendid metro listening to Sondra Radvanovsky on my iPod, I witnessed a passing hawker carrying delicate dairy delights on his way to Kabul.  As I squinted my eyes and focused in on the striking street vendor valiantly speeding by, I observed an expertly veiled parcel tucked between his arm and torso.  It sparkled with a splendid light which seemed to manipulate the matter around it.  As I glanced at the beautiful spectacle, I noticed a few words written on what appeared to be a white plastic jug: "Tuscan Whole Milk".  I stared, unwavering and never once breaking stride or averting my eyes away from this astounding milky miracle.  As I stared intently upon the magical jug, I mistakenly walked into traffic and was struck by a passing Volvo Penta traveling at 97.5 km/h.  I was immediately knocked into a coma, but luckily the hawker had observed the altercation and hastily sped to my rescue.  Upon reaching my mangled, comatose-induced corpse, the Afghan salesman proceeded to pour a single drop of the miracle liquid directly onto my tongue.  As soon as the droplet collided with my tongue, I saw angels flying, a leopard wrestling a Chinese midget, as well as a sweaty Middle-Eastern man holding a glorious Tuscan Whole Milk jug straddle his aluminum horse and continue on his way into the dense Greek metro.  From that day forward, I would sip only a single creamy beverage; Tuscan Whole Milk.  Now I must go spar with Chuck Norris in an alternate universe where we swim in mystical lakes of Tuscan Whole Milk chilled to a perfect 44° Fahrenheit.
title: Tuscan whole milk hath destroyed Zeus

body: [New Review]: After accidentally spilling one drop of this unholy goo onto my Starz vinyl LP collection, the records began melting into a single blob. But, similar to the phoenix rising from the ashes, the melted blob then slowly took on the form of a super-record, the likes of which I'd never seen.This super-record stood about, oh, yay high and bared the name STARZ - Starzongas. At first out of fear I tried not to make eye contact, but after a few moments I came to sense that this record was there to help me. It contained the band's best songs from their illustrious career, but also included all their great songs they had never recorded or got around to writing in the first place. One stand out was the magnificent "Banana Boat" with the irresistible chorus "Banana Boat .... Baby I got your goat .... on the Banana Boat .... Chickee Chickee Baa Baa .... Chickee Chickee Baa Baa ...". Up yours Capitol Records. Other unwritten standouts are of course "Coliseum Rock All Night" with it's 36 min guitar solo and "Jumpin' Handclap Marvin", a bouncy song with some of the best wordplay Michael Lee Smith never wrote.As you may expect, the Starz super-record swallowed up some of the lesser records next to it (bye bye Boz Scaggs - Lido Shuffle), but for the most part it leaves the good ones and my young children alone (although I will not leave it unsupervised around my teenage daughter).So if you're looking to forge Starz super-records or just wanting to get rid of Boz Scaggs, I wholeheartedly recommend spilling some of this milk. It'll be nothing to cry over, unless maybe your daughter becomes pregnant. And I suspect taking some of it orally might solve that problem as well.[Old review]: Until recently I was a loser and a shut-in, never venturing outside for anything unless it was to pull the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Edition from the mailbox. But after tasting Tuscan Whole Milk just once, my lifelong acne cleared up, I stopped lisping and my little black book quickly swelled to a large black book, chock full of phone numbers as I now have the confidence to talk to all the pretty ladies at Starz gigs. I even saw my first boob for Christmas! Tastes just like a milkshake and it's magical powers get to work immediately. Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk .... thank you for making me cool. Tell your cows to raise their hooves and consider themselves high-fived! Eternally in your debt, Richie S.
title: Will Melt Records And Create Super-Records

body: So I decided to make my purchase about a week or so ago. I was young and willing. Ready to try new things and accomplish new feats. Milk was on that list undoubtedly.When I brought it back home, it sat there on my counter. Almost with a grimace upon its face. This was the milk's challenge to me. He was saying, "C'mon, drink me. You won't, you wont." I surely denied his assumed accusation. "But I will, this is your purpose here. I shall not be taking such criticism from a loathe of a gallon such as yourself."After sometime the acid wore off. I woke up covered in sweat. I remembered that gallon still sat in my kitchen, questioning...instigating. Then it hit me. It was him....the one....my mother warned me about...Why here? Why now? This is how it will be?Part 2 coming soon.
title: The war....the war....

body: BEST CEREAL WATER EVER.EVER.It's changed my life in ways that you just don't understand.  I don't know how I made it 34 years of my life without it.
title: LIFE CHANGING

body: It took a week to arrive and it had a funny taste to it!
title: ... took a week to arrive and it had a funny taste to it

body: Of course I would pay almost seventy bucks for 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz of Tuscon Milk. Every time I sip Tuscon Milk from my flask, I think back to the first time I ever had it and, we can all agree, seventy bucks is a small price to pay for recapturing our youth.In October, the dusk comes early to Ravenna. I had given my last Euros to Fitz, who was still making an honest living in "St. Christopher's Crossing," the finest Christopher Cross tribute band that Montenegro has ever seen. This is before Fitz took to doing his Michael McDonald imitation on a full time basis; he was still content doing background vocals as the rest of St. Christopher's Crossing rocked out on "Ride Like the Wind" and "I Really Don't Know Anymore." We sat in the cafe watching the birds descend on top of the ruined Byzantine church and drank coffee while talking about the much maligned papacy of Clement XIV, the decadent state of the super bantamweight division, who the third in command of the Justice League was, and desk lamps that we had known. Fitz demanded money and promised me the truest drink that I would ever have.The aroma of the Tuscon Milk lingers too short and leaves you as quickly as clouds on a windy day, never to return. Fitz called Lady Ace and her friend Tina over. While Fitz tried to pick up Lady Ace, I downed the Tuscon Milk. It was good. It went down my throat and was still good. Tina then asked me if I had scars. I told her that I did. She nodded and said most men have scars. I drank more of the Tuscon Milk until I was tight. I told Tina that, like most men my age, I was 24. She nodded and told me that most men my age had scars. We sat in the dusk as the shadows of the old church descended over us. It was October and it would be October for the rest of the month.
title: An Honest and True Drink

body: Tractor was broke but the rock laddin earth still needed plowing... after 14 hours in the South Texas sun with just my shovel and 128 fl oz of Tuscan Whole Milk at my side, parched and dehydrated as I was, I slammed 128 fl in a single chug... only to have it reappear faster than it went down.
title: on a hot day

body: WOW WOW WOW WOW WOW I am almost speechless withMy mouth full of this delicious Collectors milk taken so gently from antique cows
title: Better than holy water

body: It was a day just like any other day: dark and hopeless.  The situation I was in was equally dark and hopeless.  The tip I'd received about the Verchetti Gang drug deal had been accurate in concept, if slightly off about the exact numbers of people who would try to kill me.I was flopped behind a crate, only sitting up because of its wooden sturdiness.  The air was filled with the taunts of the half-dozen mobsters as they searched for me.  All I had was half a clip in my automatic, a cigarette in my lips and a slug resting somewhere in my gut: things weren't looking good.I closed my eyes and let my smoke and gun hand sag.  The sounds of the footsteps in the empty warehouse were definitely getting closer.  I was prepared to accept my death sitting down.When one of the mobsters tripped over a canned good, the others took a break out of hunting for me to laugh at him.  To be killed by a lot such as this.  Pathetic.  I opened my eyes to roll them.That was when I noticed the crate I was leaning on: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.  I smiled grimly.  I didn't have to die like a dog, there was another way.  I shifted up to squat and gripped the edge of the crate.  Ignoring the lances of pain in my gut, I ripped a board out of place.The voices all hushed and began proceeding at a much quicker pace in my direction.  I quickly grabbed a gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk; dropped my gun and cigarette; and peeled off the freshness seal before popping off its red top and downing the liquid into my mouth.Its effect was immediate.  The cool, refreshing taste of the milk washed away my pain and its kosher source of calcium wash away my fear.  I grabbed my gun and rose, milk still in my other hand.I managed to get off three shots before I dropped.  Even the milk wasn't enough to keep me going.  Sure was good though.
title: Delicious Despite Darkest Despair

body: I would definitely recommend Tuscan Milk to other adventurers. Please note that the effects described above are for me, a Level 43 Elf Cleric, and other races/classes may be affected diferently. Milk is not advised for Orcs.
title: Five stars

body: These days it's hard to find a good glass of milk that isn't secretly riddled with Mad Cow Disease DNA. Not only has Tuscan accomplished the impossible with their delicious and clean whole milk, but they've done so much more.Two weeks ago my friend Betsy, who works in the milk industry, told me about Tuscan Whole Milk. We were sharing a plain backyard salad and the subject of bad food came up because she accidentally bit into a bitter root and got very angry suddenly--I think it was a dandilion. She then mentioned that there recently had been some growing concern at work about whether or not people should still drink milk or if they can get their calcium from a daily suppliment. As we debated back and forth, she became more and more irate and of course the subject of "Mad Cows" came up. And who wants to give that milk to their children; nevermind to an adult.She assured me that while some people continue to raise concerns in the European market, that the US dairy industry is booming and safer than ever! In fact she said that not only is the 1 Gallon container of Tuscan Whole Milk safe, but it's also a complete steal for the price. Because it comes from healthiest and highest grade farms in America. So I tasted it with some cookies and she was right. It was absolutely delicious!!!I later found out that her husband worked for the company, but the milk truly does stand on its own as one of the silkiest and delicious in the industry! [...]
title: Tuscan Milk is da BOMB!

body: For months after my wife gave birth to our infant son, I would be frequently overtaken by fits of jealousy. Her ability to breastfeed drove me to the brink of despair. "Why," I thought, "should she alone have the privilege to nourish our child with this life-giving elixir through her breast?"This inspired me to take action. I would not sit idly by in the face of nature's cruel inequality. After months of searching, I found exactly what it was I needed: On Amazon.com, Tuscan Whole Milk. 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.To my dismay, injection of 64 fl oz (294 syringefuls) of this product into each of my breasts did NOT have the desired effect of giving me the ability to lactate. Instead, it caused severe hemorrhaging and pain.
title: Does NOT work for male breast milk augmentation!!!!

body: I grew up in a small town in the midwest in a pretty big family. 32 kids and 4 house chickens. My father worked at a paper mill, my mother sold cloth at a fabric store. Ironically we didn't have a single book in the house (ironic because books are usually made out of paper) nor did we have a single item of clothing (well, what one would normally think of as clothing: all our clothes were made of fruit bags we would save from the grocer's and sew into shirts, pants, hats, shoes (etc) at the dinner table as my father read scripture) We were always struggling financially. Not because of my parent's mediocre blue-collar jobs or the cost of raising nearly three dozen children. We struggled financially mostly due to medical bills involving the chickens (they all had diabetes and one of them had a bad back). Even though we barely had enough money to eat, my father would always make sure our refrigerator was stocked to the absolute bourgeoning limit with Tuscan Whole Milk 1 Gallon. In fact, for several months we survived exclusively on Tuscan Whole milk, bypassing solid food altogether. And to be honest I can't remember a happier time in my life.  When my wife asked me to describe my childhood on our first date, I looked up at her from across the table where we had been trying to enjoy a bottle of lobster port and said, "creamy." And you know what? Creamy sounded pretty good to her in comparison to that lobster port. Needless to say, we were married within a week.
title: Heaven Is A Glass of Milk

body: I am completely opposed to hyperbole and exaggeration when it comes to product reviews. A lot of reviews on here are just a little over the top.Please remember that when I say that there is no doubt in my mind that this milk represents the culmination of the biological, psychological, intellectual, and spiritual evolution of the human and bovine races. If it were revealed that the very existence of the human race was merely a mechanism to bring this milk into being, that my own life and the lives of all humans before me were designed by the almighty in order to bring about this liquefied perfection, I could die knowing my life was well spent.
title: An Honest, Exaggeration-Free Review.

body: Added some of this magical moo juice to my Fruity Pebbles. It added a richness I had not previously experienced with water. Definitely worth the $75
title: Milk goes hard

body: Pros:  White, well packaged, goes down smoothCons:  Did not survive a fall from 4 feetI ordered it Wednesday with 3 day delivery and Amazon had it waiting on my front door Friday evening when I got home from work.  3 day shipping and they got it here in 2.  Amazon ROCKS!!!This was a big upgrade for my refrigerator.  Even my wife likes it and she is not what you would call "Tech Savvy".  She asked me the other day "How did we ever get along without Tuscan Whole?", I have to agree.I only gave it 4 stars because when one of the kids was getting it out of the refrigerator it fell from the upper shelf and splattered everywhere.  I feel this should have been considered in greater detail during the engineering phase of product development.  However, called Amazon technical support and they over-nighted a replacement.  That is what I call "customer support"!  Amazon ROCKS!!If you are looking to update your refrigerator for reasonable cost, Tuscan Whole will not disappoint!  I would purchase again.Other Thoughts:  My rig - Dual chamber design "side-by-side" with air cooled 590kWh power, the LT600P water filtration and crisper drawers (for controlling humidity).  Includes separate "egg rack".
title: Low cost upgrade for nearly any model refrigerator

body: Best milk I've had at any price!  Definitely worth the $74.00...and qualifies for free shipping for all those price-conscious deal seekers!  Mine arrived in about 7 days!  Just make sure you cool it down in the fridge after it arrives...then it's ready for that first unforgettable sip!  Um um good!
title: Milk like no other!

body: For those of you who have already been taken in by the slick marketing of this product, and by its unbelievably low price of only $67.99 (plus shipping), I can only feel pity. You've been HAD! This is not the original Tuscan Whole Milk, but a cheap Taiwanese knock-off. Trust me, I know. To be fair, this is one of the better knock-offs. They managed to imitate the signature red cap almost perfectly, but did they get the mechanism right? NO! The genuine item has a trim flip off cap, not a bulky screwtop. (Screwtops are sooo last year.) And whatever sweat shop is churning these things out completely failed to capture the elegant, yet robust lines that characterize the true Tuscan. But the dead give-away that this is a cheap knock-off is right there in the ad. That's right! (And you poor suckers completely missed it!) REAL Tuscan Whole Milk is only sold in metric units.If you want to redeem yourselves, I suggest that you check out the two-liter Tuscan Whole Milk on eBay. It's a little pricier (I believe the bids are up to $2,458), but you get what you pay for.
title: This is a cheap knock-off! Do NOT be fooled by its ridiculously low price

body: They really need to put a warning label on this thing. Apparently, if you put it into your body, it turns into urine. Urine! F'n Nasty. If something is going to turn into urine, they really should warn you about it.  There should be a law or something, the "This Is Going To Turn Into Urine Law."  It would have saved me a lot of heartache, because now I have no Tuscan Whole Milk, just a bunch of urine.
title: Poorly labeled.

body: The description indicates that there are "8 new available."  I wonder where can I purchase a used gallon of milk?
title: Looking for used milk

body: I purchased a gallon of this milk on the 15th of November, 2005.  It arrived on the 23rd of November via FREE Super Saver Shipping (5-9 business days).As of the 16th of November 2008, I have not yet opened my milk but it seems to have held-up pretty well considering I still haven't gotten around to refrigerating it (yet).I purchased this product because a friend had suggested vegan milk, which I tried, but gave it up because of the difficulty of finding lactating vegans who didn't mind being milked (make sure you ask before trying!)Anyhow, the milk appears to have solidified a wee bit but I'm sure some warm water will set it right.  Highly recommended (I would have given it a better review but I haven't tried it yet so my review is more about the nice packaging and the fact that it hasn't evaporated yet.)
title: Very Durable Product

body: After drinking this milk i started having strange dreams. I later found out that this milk had nanoids inside used by extraterrestrial inteligent but malicious beings to track my every movement and location.  One night I put several hidden cameras en my bedroom, and I was able to catch three outer space beings cutting my toe nails, it appears this milk also makes you grow your nails in an accelerated speed.  The next night i prepared myself and had a cage system alarm activated by movement in my room. I wasa ble to catch 2 outer soace beings, one got away. I have been conducting a series of experiments, i will share my findings later on. But it appears that these beings are made of a foamy material that dissolves with the milk I bought. They are very good at playing GTAV and Monopoly Deluxe edition. arghhhh! Outer space alien #1 always gets Boardwalk.  Ill buy more milk to dematerialize the rest of the outer space aliens.
title: Milk is full of outer space tracking Nanoids!

body: I've seen things you people wouldn't believe. Attack ships on fire off the shoulder of Orion. I watched c-beams glitter in the dark near the Tannhauser Gate. All those moments will be lost in time, like tears in rain. But the creamy yumminess of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz will be praised across the galaxy for ever more. Time to die.
title: Replicant Heaven

body: Read the product description carefully before you purchase!!!  This is NOT the Tuscan "whore" milk as seen on Jersey Shore.
title: Read product description carefully!!!!

body: This product is mislabeled but that's okay. Until I saw the Tuscan Whole Milk for sale here, I had no idea I could pre-order fresh cottage cheese five days ahead! That's exactly what I got when I ordered this.
title: not a bad way to make cheese

body: Based on the wonderful reviews I ordered myself the full gallon of Tuscan Milk.  I waited for the delivery for over two weeks. I was really starting to worry that Amazon had run out of milk.  Finally there was a knock on the door and my mailman was there with a gallon sized package from Amazon!I thanked him and rushed to the kitchen to try my fresh milk.  After I got the box open and pulled out the plastic container I tried to pour a glass full.Nothing came out when I tipped the container.  I could tell from the weight that the container was full, but the milk would not pour out.I did notice a distinctly un-milk like order coming from the container, so I must assume that my package was inadvertently filled with something other than the Tuscan milk I ordered.Whatever it is, I have found that it tastes great on baked potatoes so I am giving it 4 out 5 stars.
title: I thought I ordered Milk

body: When I found this on my porch it was too late to be edible. I was able to use it as a base paint for the new baby room
title: works well as a paint

body: My bottle of Tuscan Whole Milk descended in a godlike spot of light through the roof of my house; such dramatization in delivery was well worth the cost of shipping. As if that wasn't awe-inspiring enough, the bottle proceeded to unscrew its own cap, peel off its shimmering film lid and then poured its contents into a glass that inexplicably appeared in my hand which was clenched in gripping astonishment. Without further hesitation, I drank it down with great pleasure, having just consumed the best beverage known to man next to gorilla snot.
title: The Experience of a Thousand Lifetimes

body: awoken one day after having a bad hangover I went to my cabinet and poured all of my cereal in a huge bowl, then i went into my refrigerator to find that my milk was gone....it made me angry, i couldn't even eat my Bootleg cereal.Since i have no Bodegas near me and the closest store is 43 miles down the road,i decided to buy a whole gallon thru Amazon and was quite surprised that when i ordered it, the milk man (god) came and hand delivered it to my stoop.i was a happy boy, but since i was dumbstruck of the quickness of the delivery , i didn't read the expiration date on the milk and was forced to drink all my stumpy bubbly milk with my Kabooms.i had explosive diarrhea for a month, but at least i had eaten.thank you milk man , where you are
title: what a "whole" wonders

body: As a highly intelligent and respected member of the Bovine American community, I am highly disappointed that Tuscan would  promote such offensive messages with its products. Though I'm assured the product in itself is of high quality, the label on the container of this product egregiously and insidiously depicts a cow jumping over the moon. For years now, many Bovines such as myself have been fighting against the widely held stereotype that all cows are capable of jumping over the moon. Most cows are but gentle grazers of the ground, and seek no business with the heavens above. Sadly, a great number of Americans, many of them children, still to this very day believe in these nonsensical lies propagated by the milk industry and its allies.
title: Very Offensive.

body: Not as milky as I expected.
title: Watch out!

body: Troglodytes....It's meant to be sipped. You are to savor the Tuscan Whole Milk not to gulp it down. Let it's bouquet open up to you and enter the beautiful world of Tuscany. Taste its grass fed full flavor. Linger in the organic fertilizer that only the Tuscan artisans can manufacture. This secret blend is passed down from generation to generation in the oral tradition.Have you even tried the Tuscan Whole Grain Flakes Cereal? They are a perfect pairing worthy of the most discerning milk enthusiast.Do not defame what you do not understand.
title: Not for the Unwashed Masses

body: Which to buy?  Which to BUY??  I'm looking to expand my cellar and cannot decide between the 1 gallon at $9.98, or the 128 fl oz at $120000.  Vintages are not listed, and I feel foolish even asking.  How long should a person lay down this fine libation?  Should it be served with red or white cookies, and at what temperature?
title: Seeking investment advice

body: I've worked with better glues before. This stuff goes all over the place and makes a big mess of my art projects.
title: I've worked with better glues before

body: It was the best of milk, it was the worst of milk, it was the age of homogenization, it was the age of tuscanization, it was the epoch of skim, it was the epoch of calcium, it was the season of mammalian mammary liquid, it was the season of specialized sweat glands, it was the spring of pasteurization, it was the winter of lactose intolerance, we had 1 gallon before us, we had 128 fl.oz. before us, we were all going direct to Tuscany, we were all going direct the other way -in short, the milk was so far like every other milk, that some of its noisiest authorities insisted on its being received, for good or for evil, in the superlative degree of comparison only.
title: a tale of two...udders

body: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. WOW!! What a wonderful product! We used to have milk in Venezuela but since Chavez came to power, 11 years ago, all we have is bad milk (Mala Leche / Bad Luck)!We could use containers smaller than 1 Gallon since we also are out of electricity and any milk not consumed will be spoiled by the following day. We have tried to refrigerate the milk in our car by keeping the car running on a permanent basis with the air conditioner at full blast but that only keeps the milk fresh for another day. Yeah! Gas is THAT cheap! When we don't have electricity in our home we sleep in the car, it's so much fresher! At 7.4 cents a gallon I can fill my tank with $1. Too bad it tastes awful if not it would be a pretty cheap supply of food.We can also use the container of the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz to take a bath. We fill it halfway (water is also rationed) and punch small holes in the bottom. WOW! Try it! What a shower! Also, it takes less than the PRESIDENTE mandated three minutes from soaping to drying. Better than a TAPARA. We can also use the container as a pee collector, so we don't have to flush the can so often. Don't forget to put the lid back on after peeing or the smell will kill you.If you collect enough Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz containers you will be able to build a raft and take all your family to Miami, home of the GOOD CUBANS.
title: Bad Milk in Venezuela

body: This Tuscan Milk sure lives up to its reputation!!!  I can totally see why this stuff is privately endorsed by big celebrities like Grace Jones and Andy Dick; it's true!  Ask anyone in California who doesn't have gross fried-chicken-lady skin, and behind cupped hands, they'll coyly whisper: Tuscan...Whole...Milk...1 Gallon...128 fl oz.Once, a Dairy Farm out of Tuscany sent out a few gift baskets packed with milk samplers to famous celebrities in Hollywood, and the rest is history.  Even unglamorous b-listers benefit from the fruit of Tuscany's prize cows.  In fact, the notably dumpy and unloveable Tom Arnold drank the entire gallon sampler in one sitting, and after a mere 30 minutes of violent seizing he emerged from his kitchen having been transformed into the beautiful, platinum blonde sensation you know today as TV's Ali Larter.True Story.No Really.Ali Larter used to be Tom Arnold.Also Lady Gaga is Ted Kennedy.
title: True Story.

body: Mark Ruffalo is all but certain to play the sweet and quirky protagonist.  Amy Adams is rumored to play the love interest, burdened by past transgressions involving soy.  Problem is, Hollywood can't handle tragedies without changing the ending, which means that the cows will probably survive this one.  Stick with Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, the original Italian version.  I may rent out of morbid curiosity.
title: Hollywood remake will hit theaters Memoral Day weekend, 2014

body: I heard that this milk is extracted posthumously from dead cows that died of the rabies.If that's true, I think it's irresponsible for me to recommend it, even though it does taste much better than the rich creamy "milk" jerked from a bull's wiener.
title: Rabidly Delicious!!

body: Vile Tuscan Whole Milk!  Impudent strumpet!  Out of Stock?  Currently unavailable? We don't know when or if this item will be back in stock?  HOW DARE YOU!  Did Montreal mean nothing to you?  You were so warm there, and now you turn cold and unavailable.  Did the caress of your handle mean so little to you?  My gentle tugs on your label, did they fall away from your thoughts like too-reticent autumn leaves blowing away in a December storm?  You torment and delight my thoughts at every moment, and yet your feelings for me, you tell me that you don't know when they will be back in "stock"?  (I see your penchant for cruel linguistic digs persists unabated)  I give you my love, and in return you destroy me.But perhaps . . . perhaps this is something else entirely?  Perhaps you mean only to say that ours is a love to share in secret, that our feelings will remain out of view (or "stock", if you must) from the prying eyes of the unwashed hordes?  I may be clinging to faint hopes, but if this is love reducing me in your eyes, at least I still remain within your visage.Please, Tuscan Whole Milk, give me a sign!  Dash me on the rocks or lift me to heaven, but do not leave me in this hellish limbo one second longer!!
title: I'm all out of love . . . .

body: I left this container of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz., out of the refrigerator on the counter in the kitchen next to a box of Cheerios (the yellow box regular kind. Not the frosted kind. Not the kind with honey. Not the kind with apples and cinnamon. Not the kind that are a blatant rip-off of Froot Loops. Just the regular kind) over night. It was hot that night and the air conditioning was broke again. That's like the fifth time this month that the air conditioner broke. That's what I get for letting my brother-in-law try to fix it. How does anyone fail out of HVAC school anyway? It's not like law school or anything, is it? And, yes, I know he has "issues" with his anti-schizophrenic medication. But we all have "issues" don't we? Anyway, I left this container of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz., out of the refrigerator on the counter in the kitchen next to a box of regular Cheerios, and when I woke up the next morning about 10 or so (I don't usually sleep so late, but I've started sleeping later and later lately. When I first got laid off, I'd wake up at my regular time and shower and shave and get dressed and go out looking for work, but after four months or so, I started hitting the snooze button more and more often. I mean, a guy can only take so much rejection after all. So now, half the time, I don't even bother showering and shaving anymore. And when I do, it's not like I go anywhere anyway. I just sit around watching the Game Show network most of the day). Anyway, so I left this container of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz., out of the refrigerator on the counter in the kitchen next to a yellow box of regular Cheerios, and when I woke up the next morning it had spoiled. They ought to have put some kind of "Refrigeration Required" warning up on here somewhere. And now Amazon won't even give me my money back. And THAT's why I only gave one star to this container of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.On the other hand, after I washed out the plastic jug several times to almost entirely rid it of its spoiled milk smell, I have discovered that it is the perfect size to mix up two envelopes of lime Kool-ade and two and a half cups of sugar (and, yes, I know that the recipe calls for only one cup of sugar per envelope, but I like my Kool-ade just a little sweeter, thank you very much).
title: * * * SPOILER ALERT * * *

body: After making a purchase of Tuscan Whole Milk (NV), 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz., I attempted to decant it in my Reidel decanter (received years ago as a wedding gift).  Unfortunately, my Tuscan Whole Milk chugged out of the bottle (plastic!) in a burping manner, causing much of my Tuscan Whole Milk to spill onto the oaken island in my Wine and Milk Cellar.  Moreover, the whole point of a good decantar is to maximize the surface area of the liquid; even with the spillage, my Tuscan Whole Milk filled the decanter almost to the brim, rendering largely ineffective the whole decanting process.  Must say, it's a fine product, good nose, but it tends to be a little more cloying than the Piemonte varietals, especially the 2009 vintage.
title: Does anyone have a suitable decanter for this product?

body: Anyone wondering just how Tuscan milk came to be a milk of such unparalleled richness and flavor, needs only to reflect on the rich history of the Tuscany region it is exported from.  The Etruscans were the first major civilization in this region; large enough to lay down a transport infrastructure, implement agriculture and mining, and produce vivid art.  The Etruscans lived in Etruria well into prehistory. The civilisation grew to fill the area between the Arno River and Tiber River from the eighth century, reaching their peak during the seventh century BC and sixth century BC, finally succumbing to the Romans by the first century  .Throughout their existence, they lost territory to Magna Graecia, Carthage and Gaul. Despite being seen as distinct in its manners and customs by contemporary Greeks] the cultures of Greece, and later Rome, influenced the civilisation to a great extent. One reason for its eventual demise was this increasing absorption by surrounding cultures, including the adoption of the Etruscan upper class by the Romans.And THAT my friends is why this is a milk product unmatched, anywhere. Pick up a gallon today, you won't be disappointed.
title: Tuscan Milk, a little history.

body: This milk brought back so many fond memories of my time served in New Jersey prisons that I will be buying it by the case from now on. This is one of the only products from New Jersey that is only slightly toxic so drink up with no worries. It's only been watered down a little bit but they make it up by adding healthy chalk powder (which is calcium carbonate and who can't use more calcium in their diet?) Buy!
title: "Whole" Milk from NJ!

body: Our dilemma has always been how to serve Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz to our hounds (we don't call them "dogs"). After years of embarrassment and abuse from the neighbors about our skinny hounds, we stumbled across a review of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz  in Guns & Ammo magazine. Although a bit more expensive than the Brazilian Racoon Milk we'd been feeding them, we decided to give it a try. When it arrived three weeks later, we were amazed by the thick, velvety texture and the almost overwhelming aroma of pure Tuscan nectar. We poured the semi-liquid "milk" into a wooden bowl and our hounds (we don't call them "dogs") simply went wild. We'd never seen them so excited to be receiving their nourishment. Even the dried squirrel strips we give them as a treat on weekends won't induce this level of satisfaction and absolute canine contentment. But one problem... the rich creamy Tuscan Whole Milk clings to the bowl and is very difficult to remove. We tried metal bowls, ceramic, plastic, even Grandma's soup tureen, but nothing delivered Tuscan Whole Milk to our hounds (we don't call them "dogs") in a fitting manner. Then we discovered the perfect vehicle: Dog Dish Large - Votoy DISH TUSCAN GLAZED GN 8.5Problem solved!!!!  (Don't bother with the Medium... it won't hold 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz of Tuscan Whole Milk... not even close). If you have hounds and you love Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz (and who doesn't?), then please get the Votoy DISH TUSCAN GLAZED GN 8.5... you won't regret it!!!!!
title: The perfect vessel for serving to the hounds
