body: For decades, Tuscan Whole has languished in oblivion ever since the lawsuits surrounding this, their second album.  Admittedly, their debut album "Water" was a creative failure.  "There's nothing to it," reviewers said, and they were correct.  "That's the point!" said Echo Chamber, lead vocalist and front-man for the band.  The interminable tracks of dripping faucets, bubbling brooks, and crashing ocean waves were panned as being a few steps up from white noise. The concept only came into popularity in the 80's as a relaxation aid.But with "Milk", the band showed us what they could do.  The title track took up nearly the entire first side, with the remainder being the forgotten minimalist pre-techno If, Then, Else.1. Milk2. If, Then, Else3. Fall '724. Once in a Blue Moon5.Ted's Boring LunchPink Floyd fans almost immediately recognized Ted's Boring Lunch as a near-copy of Alan's Psychedelic Breakfast, with the only difference being a new clumsily replaced voice track itemizing lunch items instead of breakfast items.  The listener is expected to believe the bacon and eggs frying in the background is a "grilled cheese sandwich"!  Always quick on the uptake, Floyd fans soon recognized that the entire album was structured identically to Atom Heart Mother, including many short clips of the original Floyd songs.  This, the band claimed was a new musical technique they invented that they called "sampling," and that the album "Milk" as a whole was a "tribute album."  When sued by Pink Floyd, the judge did not agree with Tuscan Whole, and he told them so.Tuscan Whole lost the case and the band dissovled, its members going off to form Jersy Maiden, Lucerne, and Knudsen's.  However, thanks to rumors of Vanilla Ice expressing an interest in covering the title track, the band has been rediscovered, and has become enormously popular (see the other reviews).  This album is available only in vinyl, and no further printings were legal, thus making it prohibitively (and increasingly) costly to obtain.
title: Plagarism or Cheeky Tribute?

body: I had heard of the wonders of Tuscan whole Milk and shrugged them off for quite some time.  "Milk," I thought.  "They've lied to me before.  In fact it's been nothing but lies."  But then I had a dream.  I saw myself, not as my then 120 pounds of scrawny nerd-meat, pounding away at algorithms all day trying to beat Google, but as a Southern Stud Muffin.  A full on 200# beef-cake with southern belles strewn around me.Those Southern Belles Condom Case So I did it.  I drank the Tuscan.  I told no one. And I drank, and drank and drank for 40 days.  On the 40th day, I woke one day and through the sleep in my eyes, in the mirror I beheld myself, as if transformed overnight... I was a stud.  Just like the guy on that condom case.  I was that guy.  I was a virgin until that moment.  I broke through my front door and well... as a gentleman stud from the south, I can't quite give the details, but let's just say there was a lot of Y'alls screamed that night and ever since.
title: This Milk Creates Strong and Sexy Men, Period

body: At the recent Consumer Dairy Show in Las Vegas, I found myself wandering aimlessly wondering about the social and economic forces that have driven this form of product shopping and selection.  Where, in the barnyard that is today's diary market, is the innovation, the excitement?  After passing dozens of displays hawking the same old stuff, I decided to head for (potentially) greener pastures.  And it was in the back corner of the vast slop and straw covered convention floor that I made the discovery of the year.In a small, dimly-lit display barn, I was introduced to Tom Uscan, a recently retired investment banker who had dropped it all to pursue his passion - dairy.  The hay-bale strewn stall featured a pair of the Gallons from Tuscan's Whole Milk line.  One try and I was hooked!  This was easily the best presentation at the whole show.  In a moment of weakness, I actually toyed with the idea of sabotaging Tuscan's sign so that other reviewers would pass them by.  Fortunately my conscience got the better of me, and I prostrated myself, literally begging to test a sample in my own drinking room at home.Tom was more than happy to oblige and less than a week later, the FedEx truck pulled up out front and disgorged two boxes from Amazon containing fresh examples of the Gallons that I had tried at CDS.  After lugging the heavy boxes up to my fifth-floor drinking room, I immediately unpacked them and set them on the table, ready to experience what I recalled from the stall in Vegas.My initial experience was disappointing, however, as the smoothness and lack of grain that had characterized the Gallons were missing.  In a panic, I immediately tried a number of tweaks - changing glasses, pouring technique, even removing the labels to try and restore the balance I knew was in there.  After some hours of frustration, I called Tom Uscan for some advice.  Tom suggested that the problem was one of break-in and recommended allowing the Gallons to settle in my cryogenic storage unit.  Hoping for a cure I left them in there overnight and, after a short and fitful sleep, woke and even before brushing my teeth pulled the Gallons out for a test.What a difference a night makes!  Suddenly order was restored and the creaminess and texture that I expected from the Tuscans was back in force.  I immediately began trying new combinations - the Apple Jack Cheerios were an instant success, better even than the Honey Nut which slightly over-emphasized the liquidity of the Tuscans.  Oreos, foie gras, and plums all paired well with the Gallons bringing out the terroir that I had first experienced in Vegas.It was only after considerable testing - short sessions interspersed with cryogenic treatment - that I began to notice certain issues, nothing mind you that rises to the level of flaw, but issues nevertheless.  First, Gallons are very sensitive to cryogenic treatment - too long between sessions and things can go south fast.  Second is the size.  I am a big fan of big milk, but frankly these things did not do all that well in the Wife Acceptance Factor test.  The color combination - white with a red cap - was also the subject of a number of snide comments.Notwithstanding these issues, the Tuscan Whole Milk Gallon is a screaming bargain, delivering all of the performance of milk costing far more with only minor compromises.  Showing sensitivity to the expected tweaks (try the Golden Cow Intelligent Udder for a real treat!) without being overly fussy as to imbibing vessel or food pairing, the Gallons will likely fit in well in your home - even considering the WAF.  For their performance alone, these are easily worthy of a Dairyophile B rating.  Well done!
title: Dariyotastic!

body: Oh how I love thee Tuscan Whole Milk.  Just the thought of your creamy silky white goodness brings back a flood of memories from my childhood In the Canadian wilderness.  And how my mother would leave me on the rug by the fire with a liter bag of Tuscan, just freshly warmed to body temperature the old fashion way.  By sitting or leaning on it.  But alas, these pesky americans and their love of hard plastics has kept me from beverage nirvana.  Sure the milk is still great but very difficult to cuddle on the floor rug with a GALLON of cold milk.  Ive tried pouring it into industrial zip lock bags, the kind you can only get in restaurants but eventually it would leak out making a huge mess.  So one star ding for the container but theres nothing better for those nights when you want to lay on the floor by yourself on a rug in front of the fire and drink a warm glass of milk.
title: Wish it came in bags

body: Let me say, as a cat, this Tuscan Dairy Whole Vitamin D Milk is AMAZING. Who knew that something that came out of a cow could be so good? I wait in anticipation every time my person walks to the refrigerator. And the moment my person places their hand on the handle? I practically start bouncing off the walls. When they pour the milk into my little blue water dish, I immediately start lapping at the milk, even if my person isn't done pouring the milk. Sometimes it spills all over me, but the Tuscan Whole Milk is sooooo good that I just keep lapping it up. When my person tries to pry me away to wash the milk off of me, I yowl and squirm in protest, partly because I HATE WATER getting on me, but mainly because the milk is JUST. SO. GOOOOOD. Now, I'm not the only one who loves Tuscan Dairy milk, my person loves it to. After they finish pouring a bowl for me, they'll take their glass (the one with what looks like a mouse with red shorts and yellow shoes on it) and pours a glass for them. We'll sit there, enjoying the awesome taste of Tuscan Diary milk, until we're done, and then I'll usually start meowing for another bowl until my person sighs, opens the refrigerator, and pours a bowl for me, and another glass for them. =^ᴥ^=

body: Due to the fact that I am incredibly lonely and have an extreme stuttering problem, I usually rock myself back and forth in a bathtub full of milk, with my kittens swimming with me gleefully while the best of Enya plays in the background...... You can imagine how crazy Saturday nights get in my studio apartment.... But I digress. My milk that I had purchased had become sour for my salacious tastes and i grew tired of my weekly commute to buy 64 gallons of milk (Normally i have to travel to my local Wal-Mart dressed in an extra small wolf t shirt and rainbow banana hammock) Thanks to the fantastic price of Tuscan Whole Milk (not to mention the to die for feeling it has on my skin whilst I try to drown myself in it on a  weekly basis) I can now afford to buy that sawed off shotgun i have been begging God and or Santa to give me for years to grant me sweet relief.On a side note, DO NOT use this product to lure wild coyotes into your home. I tried that once, and the coyotes drank my milk and proceeded to devour two of my kittens (I miss you twinkles and strawberry shortcake). Perhaps 1% milk works better for their tastes. I just pray to god Tuscan makes 1%.
title: Sent from the gods of lust and salacious tastes

body: For those of us in the world who have had the pleasure of sipping 100 year old wines and 50 year old shots of single malt whiskey, I can only say that you might think you have had the best, but you would be incorrect. You have not lived until you have savored the full richness of Tuscan Whole Milk. Sitting on the beach in the south of France and watching the sun set with other beautiful people may be one thing, but sitting on your own front porch and sipping an ice cold glass of pure white Tuscan Whole Milk is another totally different experience.One of lifes premier joys is the combination of cornbread and whole milk. Gently crumble up warm just baked cornbread into a clear glass then cover over with Tuscan and then add some black pepper. Trust me you will not forget this.Oh, I know you'd like to tell me that you've visited all of the famous wineries in the world and spent enormous sums of money on various exotic liquors, but until you have tasted the creamy smooth flavor of this God sent liquid, you cannot say you have truly lived.One other note, in most of the more popular so called `entertainment' magazines you will see all of the rich and famous walking around with a glass in their hands. Most of the time you think the glass is either a mixed drink or a glass of wine, but trust me those photographs are `photo-shopped' and altered to keep you from knowing the truth.Tuscan dairy only makes a limited amount of this product, that's the reason for the high cost. If the word got out that Brad Pitt or others were drinking vintage Tuscan rather than expensive champagne, the price would be twice as high.Do yourself a favor, buy a gallon and live a little. Life is too short to drink skim or 2%.The reason I failed to give this a full five star rating is the lack of a cork rather than the plastic pull tab.
title: life changing

body: I have determined that my children are weak.  They need Tuscan milk.  Aged Tuscan milk that spends 3-5 days in transport.If you don't have to chew it, it's milk for weaklings.
title: Toughen up, cupcake

body: The taste quality improvement in this new Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 oz, is barely noticeable in comparison to the original Tuscan Whole Milk. There is an improvement, but it's not exactly major. The biggest qualm is that the whole-milky texture is still really buried in the mix. Compared to Sunshine Dairy, Holsum Farms, or Elsie's Deeeelite, the milk here is a lot less satisfying without the low-end so firmly in place. It's not just a texture issue - it's the feel of the pour, and it's the source of the "tinny"-ness complaints many have had. I'm still not satisfied with what I'm tasting freshness-wise. I was expecting to see legitimate improvement even despite the no-remixing deal. However, in a side by side taste-test with the old mono / nonfat release, I could barely pick up on any difference. No increase in vitamin D, no loss of background swirls, etc. Tasted nearly exactly the same. I've had the old 2 percent from a spare gallon in the fridge and it still beat out this new Tuscan Whole Milk in terms of enjoyment and clarity.From what I've read elsewhere, even the people who repasteurized the milk mention the hardest part was not being allowed to go in and properly remix the homogenization. If the people who bottled the milk themselves admit to this problem, you know something isn't right with Tuscan's marketing strategy. I don't really understand the concept here - the problem with the old milk, to me, was never the quality of the cows, but the cheap, pan-less, not-different-than-any-other-brand packaging. If the intention is to release the "coveted" original stereo milk, followed a few years from now with fully and properly mixed tracks, I'll wait.  I wonder how Sir Paul let this happen.  I'm going to give my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz away as a gift as it's not worth it to me.
title: Not worth the trouble

body: Installation was very easy--thank God, because there is no user guide or instructions.  That means you'll be left in the dark when it comes to practical application--can I use this in my cereal, bake with it, or make it part of an exotic alcoholic beverage?  Who knows.  The "good folks" at TUSCAN MILK refuse to respond to my e-mails, and when I call tech support I get some guy in India who hangs up on me.  Another thing was that after a week it was gone, and what good is an expensive plastic jug?  Sure I could buy another gallon and re-fill my original plastic jug, but TUSCON MILK is so expensive--ounce for ounce it's as expensive as a fine perfume.  I might as well buy Joy perfume and drink that, that's how expensive this stuff is.
title: Easy Install, But Runs Out of Mllk Quickly

body: Like liquid ivory from the horn of the mythical unicorn, this silky-smooth elixir is mana from the heavens and unquestionably the lifeblood of us all. As it pours from its celestially divine, 100% recyclable 128oz ewer, you will weep tears of ecstasy as your carafe fills with its frosty, bovine nectar.As the TUSCAN WHOLE MILK touches my lips, I'm transplanted to the days of my youth. Burnt Sienna shag carpeting caresses my legs as I sit Indian style in front of a 13" black and white Magnavox. Rabbit ears askew and adorned with crumpled balls of Reynolds wrap for some unknown purpose. The plastic encased piece of electronic wizardry hums giving off a soft, comforting glow reminiscent of the first light that welcomes you to the world as you're violently yanked free from the womb. On the screen is a VAGUELY familiar grayish blob with an elongated neck and slightly phallic shaped cranium. My mother calls to me from the other room, "Would you like a snack sweetheart?" I nod silently as though some manner of empathic communication could somehow transmit my wishes to her. A glass of TUSCAN WHOLE MILK would be divine mother dear, with perhaps a small handful of Nilla Wafers? Alas, mother does not hear my thoughts as she sits at the kitchen table to read the latest issue of some inane periodical discussing what's next in store for Luke and Laura. I grind my teeth in silence. My stomach growls in disquietude as my focus remains transfixed on grabbing that little candy coated piece of peanut butter on the screen. GADS! I have fallen into a hole! I must escape, as the timer is counting down to my eminent demise. Reaching the top, I am nearly free, when suddenly, back into the dark, murky abyss I fall. "Curse the gods," I scream silently. Why do you not wish this beloved Extra Terrestrial to return to his home world?! Once again, I ascend to the top of the hole towards freedom. Two steps from emancipation when again he falls! As he tumbles back into purgatory a sound not unlike that of an incontinent old man sitting upon a worm rotted bus stop bench emits from his piss hole mouth. Mother yells from the other room, "Watch your language young man!" I mutter a curse under my breath. "Where's my frosty, cold glass of TUSCAN WHOLE MILK whore?" More loud screams from my birth giver as I continue in vain to free the phallic shaped blob from his hellacious prison. Nonplussed, I hear not a word she says. Shortly after, the familiar sound of boot steps striking unwaxed linoleum rings in my ears. These are not the pleasant footfalls of a man coming to give his first born a hug and perhaps a gift of a plastic army man with a collapsible parachute. Nay, these were the angry steps of the authoritarian of the home. I scream, "I'm sorry!" It's a lie of course. I was not sorry, as my famished stomach groaned in agony at the lack of TUSCAN sustenance. A half dozen and one slaps to exposed haunches stings temporarily, but not more so than the sting of anger and frustration of being unable to free a penile shaped alien from the penal punishment thrust upon him in flickering black and white CRT torture. Wiping the tears from my eyes, I trudge, defeated into the scullery. "Mother, may I please have a glass of TUSCAN WHOLE MILK?"
title: Mother may I?

body: We fed this to our grandchild and afterwards she started speaking perfect Italian!  We are not Italian. How can we get her back to just baby talk before her mother is off work and picks her up?
title: Baby Talk

body: Frank was a quiet man, a strange man.  His neighbours would give him a polite wave as they passed when caught peering in through his window across the overgrown lawn and the local children would dare one another to go and ring his doorbell.  No one would ever answer as Frank spent his time in the garage, slaving over his one passion- a revolutionary new fuel.It was the passion of his father, and his father before him, and each in the line had spent their lives dedicated to the cause.  Frank has not fallen far from the tree, cursed to live the same lonely existence.Or so all would believe.It was a balmy summers evening, when, after not sleeping for 4 days, Frank stumbled down to his local convenience store, and while in a tired stupor flung his arm to the spot where his normal brand of whisky was and purchased what he believed to be another bottle of his old pal jack to keep him company through the long nights and unforgiving mornings.Upon returning to garage, he sat down on his small, rotting, 3 legged stool in front of his prototype engine, reached behind him fumbling across the many oil stained tools on work bench, to find his filthy glass.  He poured a drink, and to his shock he saw not the usual brown nectar he was expecting but rich creamy white Tuscan milk.  He stared at the glass, his eyes filling with tears and his face with rage.  He hurled the glass at the monstrous creation which lay in front of him and hung his face in his hands while sobbing.  The milk had hit the engine, and trickled down in to the opening for the fuel tank.  The engine juddered.  A single chug.  Frank looked up as it chugged once more and then sank back in to silence.  He wiped his eyes and surveyed the sight before him, when he noticed the milk.  He picked up the bottle from the floor, and added a little more.  The engine chugged a little more, starting to build to a rhythm, as he added more and more the engine shook and burst in to life.  It was the missing ingredient, and made the fuel so potent, he didn't even have to start the engine.Frank added the remainder of the milk and threw open the garage door, and sat upon the makeshift tractor like vehicle he had built around the engine and rode it out in to the street, screaming with glee and shouting at his neighbours.No one ever saw frank again.
title: Miraculous

body: I purchased a first edition Tuscan Whole Milk for $599.99 and instantly solved a rubix cube.  I don't even own a rubix cube, so as I was perplexing over my acquisition and subsequent solving of said rubix cube i became dehydrated and i took a sip.  I immediately punched a child in the face. body: I've seen the reviews for this product, and I like to enjoy a good laugh as much as the next person, but sometimes you all go too far.  Many have accused some of my reviews of being a joke, which they most assuredly are not!  You want to know my experiences with this product?  Okay, here you go...It was the early spring of 1938.  I, my fiance, Royce, his three adventuring buddies from his Oxford days, and a team of sherpas were on the final approach along the dangerous North Face to the summit of Mt. Everest.  Our plan was to be married at the peak.  It was going to be a symbol of how Royce's love for me was greater than any other, and so we had to be wed at the highest point in the world.One of Royce's friends, Jonesy, was a priest, who would perform the ceremony for us.  The other two were kind of a couple of douchebags, and kept pointing out to Royce that while Everest is technically the highest above *sea* level, Mt. Chimborazo has the distinction of being the highest above the Earth's *center*.  Wonderful, but who the hell has ever heard of Mt. Chimborazo?  If we had climbed that one, what kind of a story is that going to make for our grandkids as we gather around for a nice, refreshing glass of Tuscan Whole Milk?  Not a very good one, that's what kind of story.Anyway, for the final push to the top, our plan was to leave camp at 6 am sharp so we could make it back by nightfall.  The weather was perfect.  Everything was perfect.  Royce insisted, as he always did, on everyone eating his special homemade granola with Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, which he had brought along just for that purpose.  The plastic jug was frozen solid, though, and it took us quite a while to heat it up enough to be useable.  I'm not that crazy about granola, and this whole Everest thing was starting to get on my nerves (I had wanted a simple ceremony back in Manhattan with 3-400 of our closest friends).  It was Royce's dream, not mine.  A damned fool dream, but then again he had always been a dreamer ... and I was in love.  We set out an hour late, on account of the milk.  It would be our last climb together.400 meters from the top, the winds picked up and I could see a huge stormcloud forming.  It was white as a gallon of pure Tuscan Whole Milk, but a lot more threatening.  I screamed to the others that we should turn back.  They laughed.  What does a girl know about things like climbing a symbol of manly potency?  We pressed on.  An hour later, the blizzard hit us, swirling around us like a thick vanilla milkshake made with 128 fl oz of pure Tuscan Whole Milk.  We couldn't see more than a foot in any direction."We're not going to make it!" I screamed."I'm not giving up.  We won't have another chance at this if we turn back now," Royce yelled back to me."Go on without me.  I shouldn't have worn my pumps for this, sorry," I apologized."But they match your wedding gown perfectly.  You simply HAD to.  Okay, take the milk and we'll meet you back at camp by sunset."It was the last time I saw any of them.  I waited three days at our camp, but the storm never let up and the four* of them never returned from the peak.  I like to think that they made it to the top, and then probably Royce's two [...] friends got gay married to each other just to rub it in Royce's face that I wasn't there.  They weren't actually gay, but they liked a good joke, those two.To this day, I don't know how I managed to climb all the way back down on my own with only a frozen gallon (128 fl oz) of milk to keep me going.  When I reached base camp a week later, I told the others of the brave adventurers' fate.  They offered me a shot of whiskey to calm my nerves.  No thanks, I said, I'll just have some milk.  Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.So go on.  Make your jokes about the milk.  Have your fun.  Royce would have wanted it that way, anyhow.PROS: Always smooth, creamy and delicious, like love's first kiss.CONS: Freezes in low temperatures.  May be dangerous.* You might be wondering what became of the sherpas.  You know what?  I have no idea.  Isn't that weird?  Did they run off or something?  Hmm.
title: It's all fun and games to you people

body: A big fat stuttering BOOYAH going out to those guys at the Tuscan Whole Milk Factory.  Boy, I gotta tell you that the other day I had the chance to sit down to lunch with legendary investor and hedge-fund manager, Peter Lynch.  After a bit of foie gras Pete had the guys bring out this tumbler of white stuff for each of us.  Obviously since I'm "in the biz" I recognize a quality product when I see one.  Pete is actually fawning all over this stuff, and I'm like, "What is this and where can I get some?"  Pete recommends picking it up on the web since it's more of a pure play that way, and I ask him what got him hooked.  "Well, since I've been lying on my couch watching Rugrats reruns, I decided to start looking at some new investment ideas.  I ran across this bottle of white stuff in my refrigerator and was simply taken with the product inside."  Knowing good advice when I hear it, I contacted the Tuscan Whole Milk people and was really impressed with their management.  They walked me through the factory, and I gotta tell you that I think this company is headed for the moon.  Right now the TWM's had a nice run up so I think that it would be wise to see how the core inflation numbers for the next quarter will impact consumer spending on these kinds of products so I'm going to recommend waiting for TWM to pull back a bit and then load up the truck with plenty of TWM for the portfolio.  You should see a nice pop with these guys before the end of the year, and I think that 10 smackers on this trade is not too much to hope for.
title: If TWM pulls back to $49 I want you to back the truck up!!!!

body: I bought a gallon of this milk based on the reviews, and I loved it so much that I immediately ordered 15 cases of it!  Well I had to drink it fast so I threw a milk party!  Everybody came over thinking that we would be watching that new Sean Penn movie called "Milk", and they were disappointed to learn that we would instead be consuming unholy amounts of dairy.  But all it took was one glass of Tuscan Whole Milk and the party was going FULL SWING!  It was a hit!  Several of my friends and I are planning a trip to Tuscany in order to procure for ourselves one of their miraculous cows, just so we can have TWM any time we want!  If you're a fan of milk, but are on the fence about buying this particular milk, do yourself a favor and take the plunge.  Life is too short not to indulge yourself!
title: Very good milk!

body: Me and my Buddies drank nothing but Tuscan whole milk during our tour in country 1968. i remember the silence as i poured the whole milk from the carton, just before Charlie descended. Now all i got is a head-full of bad memories. you weren't there man. you weren't there...
title: Unleash the milk of war!

body: From Italy's famed milk region, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is guaranteed to satisfy. The birthplace of the Italian Renaissance is also the birthplace of the world's most delectable beverage, Tuscan Whole Milk. Leonardo da Vinci, Michelangelo and Dante Alighieri were known to imbibe in Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz's sweeth frothy goodness.  Some say that Milk was the inspiration for the Mona Lisa.If you enjoy the magnificent inspiration derived from Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, try Super Fresh Salmon , Fillet, 1.00-1.25 lbs Avg.  Or if you just want some of that sweet Tuscan goodness, with less fat, try Tuscan 2% Low Fat Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.
title: Toscana una regione da latte

body: Exodus 33:3"Go unto a land flowing with Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of thee; for thou art a stiffnecked people: lest I consume Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz on the way."We already had the honey, and now the other sacred half is finally here! That land can now be ours! We must all buy this divine $50 Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz! Not for the good of our bodies, but the good of our souls, and all mankind!
title: Proof of God on Earth!

body: The moment I learned that my idol, Ryan Seacrest uses Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz as his third favorite exfoliate, I knew I needed to try this product.  I looked high and low for a local retail outlet that carried this wondrous, dairy-based concoction, but to no avail.A farmer's market in town was offering a rip-off substitute, but I've never cared for the taste nor texture of possum milk. I relented and ordered the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz from Amazon.I am not overwhelmed by the milk by any stretch of the imagination.  I will say it is a nice, thick, frothy warm liquid to quench a thirst, but I scoff at reviews of its mystical powers.My newborn recently developed baby acne so I once again ordered a second batch.  It arrived in the mail, still partially lukewarm, just three days later.  The late delivery was a god-send as I no longer had to mix the milk with white flour and orange-flavored circus peanuts necessary to create the proper marbleized constitution needed for the shellacking.While the milk may carry with it a strong, pungent aftertaste when consuming, I can say the sweet smell of it when used as an exfoliate and face scrub is reminiscent to that of beehive honey.My baby's mild case of acne has since cleared up and she has even begun speaking in tongues which I can only attribute to this milk-based product to be that which was packaged and shipped by God herself.One quick warning:  When using this as a dead-skin remover of the breast, neck, chest, face, and head area, much like Nair, it must be removed promptly as it will turn to an acid-type substance and likely burn the flesh off of you.When ingested though, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, is soft, very creamy, and insanely smooth going down, much like molasses.
title: Like a taste of sweet honey, but with milk

body: I eagerly drank this as soon as it arrived and it tasted like distilled water. Fortunately I grew up around dairy products and figured out the problem. Update the firmware BEFORE drinking the milk. Hopefully they will start shipping it updated soon.
title: Update the Firmware first!

body: This is the story of how Tuscan Whole Milk turned my life upside down. I'd like to take a minute to tell you about it.I was born in west Philadelphia, and raised, well, pretty much on the playground. I wasn't doing much with my life, I preferred mostly to chill out with my friends, maybe play a little bit of basketball. Was never much for school.I was headed nowhere fast. One day, two guys started making trouble with me on the street, and it turned into a small altercation. These things don't end well in my neighborhood, and my mother -- scared for my life -- sent me to live with my auntie and uncle. The cab ride to the airport was memorable, and the last I would ever see of my childhood home.Bowing to pressure to keep up with their Bel Air neighbors, my auntie and uncle kept the refrigerator stocked with Tuscan Whole Milk. When I pulled up to the house, at about seven or eight the first evening, they met me at the door with a glass of milk.It was luxurious and decadent. I felt like a king -- or at least a prince. And though life with my relatives wasn't always the easiest -- I felt like an outsider and my cousin Carlton did nothing to improve the situation -- some of my fondest memories involved Tuscan Whole Milk.
title: A great milk

body: I was actually able to get my hands on a Tuscan Whole Milk (the 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz version) and despite it's obvious function as a revolutionary product at at an unbelievable price, it is yet another device that does not support Flash.This was personally very disappointing and thus, TWM will not be able to meet my needs as an active student. I had very high hopes for this product, even if I already owned similar ones (water 16 fl oz, tea 1L) and was still figuring how to best incorporate it into my daily routine.Well, hopefully competition will remedy this situation or I might buy one and  be tempted to jailbreak it (which might require voiding the warranty as online forums say it requires breaking the plastic liner.)
title: No Flash Support; Very Disenchanting

body: This Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is legend - wait for it........dairy!Boob juice five.- Barney Stinson
title: How I met your Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz

body: Before "Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz", I did not consider my self a big Tuscan fan. Sure, I was familiar with Tuscan's other notable works, "1/2 gallon skim" and "drinkable yogurt", but neither of these gripped me with the texture and coherency I found in Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.********Warning THIS REVIEW CONTAINS A SPOILER ************On glass two, I found myself peaking at the bottom of the plastic container---not yet sure I could get through the entire 128 fl oz. But then, somewhere between oz 25 and 50, Tuscan had won me over. I kept thinking "who will it be? me or the milk?" Who indeed will be the first one down the drain. Me--receiving my cow juice via UPS ground, or the milk, for beginning to coagulate somewhere between the Hartfort drop-off and the Beaverly, MA sorting station...A real glass-pourer; this milk should be required-drinking in schools across the country!
title: A riveting tour-de-force of bovine lactation -- A MUST DRINK!

body: Recently, three friends of mine were joyously reunited after years of animosity stemming from an unfortunate late-night incident involving two pounds of fish and a vespa scooter.  The heartfelt scene was much like what I hoped to orchestrate between myself, this gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, and my estranged wife, Lillian.  Imagine the look of shock on my face when I discovered that she was lactose intolerant.  Instead of tears of joy, it was the contents of a glass of creamy Tuscan Whole Milk streaming down my face.  Sadly, after ten years of marriage I was still largely unaware of this and her many other needs, be they dietary, physical, or emotional.  How ironic -- the very thing meant to bring us back together, nothing but a cold reminder of the many things which tore us apart.  Thankfully, in the moments after she stormed from the site of our failed reconciliation, I had a supportive jug of Tuscan Whole Milk there to console me.  I can only hope to always have a comforting jug of Tuscan Whole Milk by my side to talk me down from the ledge for years to come.**UPDATE**Over the many trying years which followed the aforementioned incident, I am now ready to openly admit: were it not for this selfless gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, I would not be here today to recommend what I believe is the single most life-changing dairy product out there.  Through all my ups and down, this warm jug has always been there for me, offering not only physical, but emotional nourishment as well -- be it in the form of images of missing children to remind me that there is always someone less fortunate, or simply helpful nutrition information to reassure me that I am on the right path towards a healthy and productive life of recovery.  Thanks to this jug, I now know that it was not my own shortcomings, but rather Lillian's closed-minded intolerance that destroyed our marriage.  I would like to take this opportunity, here on THE preeminent forum for support and self-betterment, to announce that this gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk has strengthened not only my bones, but my heart as well, and after two years of courtship, we are getting married.  You balance and complete my breakfast, gallon jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, and I wouldn't want it any other way!
title: My Jug, My Soulmate.

body: FADE IN:INT. TUSCAN WHOLE MILK, 1 GALLON, 128 FL OZ MILKBAR NIGHTTables, chairs made of nude fibreglass figures.Hypnotic atmosphere.Alex, Pete, Georgie and Dim, teenagers stoned on their Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz milk-plus, their feet resting on faces, crotches, lips of the sculptured furniture.ALEX (V.O.)There was me, that is Alex, and my three droogs, that is Pete, Georgie and Dim and we sat in the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz milkbar trying to make up our rassoodocks what to do with the evening. The Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz sold milkplus, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz plus vellocet or synthemesc or drencrom which is what we were drinking. This would sharpen you up and make you ready for a bit of the old ultra-violence. Our pockets were full of money so there was no need on that score, but, as they say, money isn't everything.
title: Good for a bit of the old ultra violence

body: I ordered the Tuscan whole milk, 128 ounce, in hopes of attaining the promise of "wholeness." I craved the perfect integration and spontaneous enlightenment implied by the word, and which I certainly deserved for the outrageously absurd cost of $45. At least the shipping was free. But I, alas, am not. I'm sitting here in my lavender kitchen, holding a pitiful glass of mere MILK. For that price I should be taking in such a silky purity that would lift me to higher states of consciousness, bathed in harmonic tones of pure white light! No angels singing here, babe. Rather, there is a sour taste on my tongue, and the last shreds of my dignity and hope are falling from my body, one by one, like old rags.I know i can breathe through this, because I have to go on, and pay the electric bill now. But my trust in goodness has been shaken. Something precious has been lost, and I can't send it back. My entire life I've searched for the luscious authenticity of the whole life that only whole milk could bring. But this jug was clearly less than half full.
title: This jug is only half full

body: I swear this milk is from a unicorn! After drinking this milk, I felt as powerful as a one horned stag standing guarding over a rainbow full of treasures. Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk!
title: powerful stuff

body: This is without a doubt the worst pet I have ever owned. It's disobedient, it never comes when I call it (even when I offer it a treat!), it refuses to eat for weeks on end, and it can't do a single trick. I tried to teach it to sit yesterday, and when I became cross and slapped it, it spilled all over the floor, just to spite me. I've tried putting it up for adoption, but milk shelters are hard to come by and other animal shelters won't accept it. The only plus sides are that it's already neutered.
title: Terribly behaved!

body: We strained out all the gold flakes and only came up with $73.99. WTH?
title: One Star

body: I am a little short on cash and won't be able to get away to Florence and Tuscany this summer, as my friend Lisa is planning to do. But I still have Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, which will do quite well for me. People say you can rent a villa in the Tuscan countryside and the friendly Tuscans will treat you to baskets of vegetables, serenades, wine-soaked evenings, and lovemaking. All of that falls away into chiaroscuro as I sip properly warmed Tuscan Whole Milk. Lisa could get into a whole lot of trouble over there. Just last year there was a terrible thing with European vegetables being tainted with something and they never found the source. Some people say the European countryside is full of bandits and marauders. I've heard there are pick-pockets at work even under Brunellesci's duomo. If you lose your passport, or get charged with a murder you didn't commit, it could take weeks or years to straighten things out. They make a big deal about guns in America, but I've seen The Godfather trilogy. Should I warn Lisa, and tell her about Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz ? ... Let's just let you and I be the wiser!
title: Better Than Summer in Northern Italy

body: I have been drinking Tuscan whole milk,  1imperial gallon, 356.8 flonauts since the early part of '24. No fascinating events occurred, no bolt of lightning, no sudden bleeding stigmata. Then yesterday, I accidentally spill some Tuscan whole milk out of my gravbowl of Soylent Red, which drips down my vapor mask and onto my The Mountain Three Wolf Moon Short Sleeve Tee, and here I am.I can't belive people still procreate like you do, but the trees are nice.
title: Greetings from 2525

body: How do I love thee, Tuscan whole milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz, Let me count the ways.I love thee to the depth and breadth and height of a full, frosty glassMy soul can reach, when feeling out of sight, your taste is so sweet, to my tongues own delightFor the ends of Being and ideal Grace, drinking Tuscan whole milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz, is better than getting sprayed with maceI love thee to the level of everyday's, blowing bubbles outside, soaking in the suns warming raysMost quiet need, by sun and candle-light, I wish I could buy more Tuscan whole milk, 1 gallon 128 fl oz, but my budget is tightI love thee with the passion put to use, I share you with friends, my morals are looseSmiles, tears, of all my life! - and, if God only choose, I'd forever drink Tuscan whole milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz, and forgo the boozeI shall but love thee better after death, but that won't be soon, so don't hold your breath.
title: How do I love thee

body: It was on my first holiday to Tusca that I encountered the legendary milks. In Tusca, there is not just ONE milk, but many regional lactose "dialects" that are savored and preserved by dairy farmers. Each Thursday, they head into the center of town and sell at their stalls. It's difficult to put words to the various tastes of the samples, but I remember some as "good" and "yeah!" and "mmm". Hard to choose when you have that many good choices to choose.Now, amazon is offering Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. and my memory banks are overloading with those great images of days in the sun on the beaches of Tusca!So, I don't know which of the many milks of Tusca this would be, but I see that it is the "whole milk", not just part of the milk. That's great! Probably so you can choose the parts of it you want to eat. And 1 Gallon would be more than most people need in a day.It also comes in fluid ounces; not many people would know the difference, but fluid is a great way to drink milk. Solid or gaseous milk is really not so enjoyable, although they are both more easy to bring as carry-on luggage on a plane. Unless you are traveling and need Tuscan While Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz for the flight, I'd recommend staying with this fluid format for now.
title: Memories indeed!

body: My son loved this stuff. I use to buy it for him because he kept telling me it was his favorite. I figured milk would help him grow strong bones, and maybe his strong bones would get him interested in sports.A single gallon use to last three weeks, but that number quickly fell to one a week. I assumed my son's bones were growing strong so rapidly that he needed the dramatic increase of calcium. I was happy to buy him one a week, but I should have been smarter.He told me that they didn't have the same effect anymore, that he needed more to get that same feeling. Soon I was buying a dozen gallons a week, and most of the time they wouldn't last that long. I could only be so naive for so long. I quickly cut my son off, cold turkey. He yelled, he hit, he threatened to kill himself, but it looked for the best.Before long, my son began to appear normal. He made some friends at school, joined the water polo team at school, and even began to say he loved me again. But then he started coming home at irregular hours, and sleeping most of the day.One night when he was 16, I stayed up in the living room waiting for him to come through the door. I heard him at the door at 3 am, fumbling with the keys for about five minutes before tearing the door open. He barely stood up, holding the door frame for support. His eyes were blood shot and insane. He mumbled something about being out of Oreos. Then I saw the tell-tale sign... the white stain on his upper lip.Our fight that night drove him away. I didn't hear from him for weeks. Weeks turned to months, and months turned to years. 2 and a half years later, I got the call I was scared to receive. The cops asked me to come identify the body.No father wants to see his son, sitting in a pile of spilled milk and vomit, eyes rolled back in their head."Is this him?" The officer asked me."Yes," I said through bitter tears. "How did it happen?""He tried to chug a gallon in under an hour. This site is all too common."Please, talk to your kids about the 5 food groups, before they learn about just one.Best served chilled.
title: Before it's too late

body: Midnight, February 10, what year?  How long has it been since I was a real detective?I used to chase leads...I used to chase leads, skirts, the almighty buck...and now this.  Not a buck.  Just a duck.  A dead duck, and the ultimate metaphor for my yuppie depression.In that anonymous apartment where I sat alone with the corpse, it was a bad night to have the gas turned off.  Some shmuck, some duck-killing, cop-confounding son of a trollop, had neglected to pay his bills on time.  And so I sat, on thankless plastic upholstery on a loveless kitchen chair, where the Mayor's favorite, best-friend-fowl lay with a broken neck and a wet, matted look to most of its body, there where it lay next to the over-turned one-gallon jug that had been a perfectly good supply of Tuscan Whole Milk.Why did my wife leave me?  Why did that sorry, drunken lout of a mayor come to me, of all the washed-up gumshoes in Arkham, to find his poor, broken comrade?  Maybe he smelled it on me, the last dregs of a life, tinged with a sour milk smell that soaks you to the soul, down to the last inglorious epithelial of a blind nose way passed its prime.
title: The Duck Stopped There

body: I know. I know. $45 for a gallon of milk seems really steep. I was skeptical too, but decided to take a chance because my toddler refuses to sleep through the night, and I heard Tuscan Whole Milk could help. Well, let me tell you. Not only does he now SLEEP all night long, but he no longer fusses at bedtime. He never whines or throws a temper tantrum. And yesterday, after I gave him a sippy cup full of Tuscan Whole Milk at lunchtime, he cleaned the whole house top-to-bottom, including baseboards. I have to get off the computer, because he wants me to teach him how to make crepes.
title: miracle milk

body: I provide this information at great personal risk, but given the international interest in Tuscan Whole Milk, I believe it is my duty as an Earth citizen to divulge secrets of the cult that is Dairymen.  The Dairymen's handshake is deceptively simple.  Follow these directions -- If you are offering your hand to a suspected Dairyman:  1)  Make a fist with your right hand.  2) Extend  the thumb and little finger of your right hand -- creating an "udder"  3)  Extend your right hand with the "teats" (thumb and finger) pointing down.  If you are recieving the offer of the "udder", simply grasp the offered "thumb teat" with your right hand and the "little finger teat" with the left hand.  Proceed to move your hands in a "milking" motion up and down several times.  You are then free to discuss tactics to exceed campaign contributions to federal eleceted officials to support dairy subsidies -- including the critical importance of keeping Iowa as the first state in the Presidential primary season.
title: The Secret Dairymen's Handshake

body: I remember stumbling into a 7-11 on a balmy night in Los Angeles. I hadn't had anything to drink and I'd been wandering the streets for hours with a $10 bill in my pocket. The last cash I had. So I drops in, right, and I figure, hell, I'll get some milk and a scratchcard. Wouldn't hurt. Clerk looks at me funny. It's 3 AM and he's figuring I'm just one of those folk. Walk right over to the drink aisle and pick out a heaping gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk. BAM. I grab the handle and immediately hear Zeus whispering into my ears, telling me that fortune will surely smile upon me. I'm jazzed up as I meander over and ask for a cheapo scratch-off, never letting go of the jug to keep that Zeus-buzz in my brain. So's I chug down a third of it once I've paid, then get to scratchin' up the card. Won a half million dollars. Celebrated like I've never known. I still look up to the skies and see Zeus smiling down on me.
title: Fortune favours the adventurous.

body: In my experience, the flavor and butterfat content of Tuscan milk rivals the famous milk of the Piedmont at half the price. It's much better than anything I've been able to get from Campagnia or Sardinia. If you've ever tried getting your Tuscan milk right from the source, you'll appreciate what an incredible value this is. With an average mother yielding just 6-8 ounces per milking (the Tuscans are excellent milkers and are on the high side of the range), you'll be hard pressed to find many women patient enough to let you fill a gallon jug. I can't believe they can offer it at this price. Please, Amazon, get this back in stock!If my appeal to your sense of reason doesn't move you, perhaps a bit of tugging at your heartstrings will do the trick?Sonnet 118Let me not to the freight and carriage of true milkAdmit impediments. Lait is not LaitWhich expires with its expiration date,Or bends with the remover to remove:O no! it is an ever-fixed milkThat lives on counters and is never spoilt;It is the star to every wandering Oreo,Whose worth's unknown, although his filling be taken.Milk's not Trix's fool, though milky lips and cheeksWithin his bending bowl's compass come:Milk alters not with his brief puffs of corn,But bears it out even to the edge of doom.If this be error and upon me proved,I never wrote an Amazon.com product review, nor no man ever did either.
title: Great product, great value for the money

body: I thought I'd save a little money on this product so I clicked on the 'Order it used' button. Boy, was that a mistake!When new, this product is just fine. When used, it's almost undrinkable.So, if you're in the market for Whole Milk, heed my advice, buy new.
title: Warning: do not be tempted by the 'Order it used' button

body: my personal experience with this product came about when i was driving through the remote desert regions of arizona.before i knew it, a freakish hail storm quickly enveloped me.cornered within the remote desert region of arizona-- i was defenseless. suddenly, giant baseball-sized hail plummeted upon my car in a fury of utter rage. rain, wind, and mud splattered me everywhere, while windows all around shattered like fragile ice.were the gods mad at me?!after two hours of horrific hail, car accidents, flat tires, and even soiling my own pants, i managed to get my car moving again. i reached my home 3 hours later, and quickly crawled my way to the front door and into the living room. i phoned my insurance company. the safety of my 2003 kia spectra ls depended on it!to my dismay, they informed me that my insurance did not cover the protection of my 2003 kia spectra ls from freakish hail storms within the remote desert regions of arizona. so much like my cell phone service, i was out of my general area...what was i to do?i stepped out onto my front porch and stared down at the battered remains of my once-in-tact 2003 kia spectra ls, and it was at this point that my life changed forever...i had forgotten my online purchase of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. that i had mad a few days ago.  that was until i saw the mail man approach me.unaware at this point of the powers that Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. carried, i took the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. from the mail man, and bid him goodbye.as he walked off, he stopped and turned saying, "i see hurt & anguish in your eyes... if you pour it, they will come."and with this, he smiled, turned around, and was gone.i was confused.  however, in an act of what must have been pure desperation, i took the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz., walked over to my 2003 kia spectra ls, and poured the entire contents over the exterior of my car.instantly, and without warning, the dents in my 2003 kia spectra ls magically corrected themselves. then suddenly all around me gnomes broke out of the lawn forthwith, and quickly began to magically piece the broken windows of my 2003 kia spectra ls back together.my tires were aired back up, and even jack the antenna ball was once again perched upon my antenna. dent after dent, all repaired by these strange yet magical creatures. i couldn't believe what i was seeing!one gnome even began rubbing my crotch vigorously with a sponge soaked in Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz., and instantly i could feel that my crotch was no longer soiled in my own feces!it seemed like only minutes had gone by, and the gnomes had vanished.once again i was alone, and my 2003 kia spectra ls gleamed like new upon the driveway.did this hail storm in the remote desert region of arizona actually happen?was my 2003 kia spectra ls ever actually damaged?it seemed like all a dream...thank you Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. for saving me, my 2003 kia spectra ls, and my once soiled pants.-teo
title: My life changing story.

body: Ay'body know ain't nothin' I love more than me.  But if I loved me just a little bit less (which ain't possible 'cause I'm lovin' me more and more every day) I'd love this electronically commerced milk just as much.This Tuscan Whole Milk makes me feel like I'm God's gift to life.  Before I started drinking my one gallon Tuscan Whole Milk (128 fl oz.) I was just a man - a mere mortal.  All I could do was deliver game-winning cirque-du-soleil catches in the endzone, or bulldoze through an entire defense like they cardboard cutouts.But now since the world-wide web purchasablity of this superior dairy product I'm like a creamy white, milky smooth Tuscan God.  Still capable of oh-no-he-di'int physics-defying football plays, thanks to this here Tuscan Milk I can actually upset the balance of the universe.  Not only can I ruin a perfectly good football team because my new, inflated sense of self-worth, cartoon of an agent didn't get a comission on my perfectly good, 11-month-old, 49-million-dollar contract, but I'm pretty sure I can cure your sick baby of his sickle-cell anemia.  Come to think of it, yes I believe I might be God.  How else could I have recovered from a broken leg in 6 weeks to dominate the Superbowl. Wudn't no ankle pins or mad-crazy, 9-hour rehab sessions.  I'm God - must be.  Either that or the bone-healing vitamin benefit from this Tuscan Whole Milk.  Kids, listen to God.  This stuff is f'real, so like I always tell my good friend, Donovan McNabb, when I'm figuratively bending him over and giving him the business on yet another national T.V. interview ... "Have Some!". And I love T.O.
title: love me some me ... and my milky goodness

body: I used to love the fresh sweetness of whole milks tapped directly from local cows. Until I encountered Tuscan Whole Milk,1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. It entered my life like a chorus of angels sweeping through my kitchen windows, carrying tidings of the future lactal messiah - our milky white saviour from abroad! Whatever they are doing with Tuscan bovines is a mystery to me, but I do know that we need to discover these secrets and teach them to our cow handlers and - fiddlers.One thing, though. Starting at $9.99, this is pretty expensive milk, even for a brief religious experience. I`d give it a five star review had it been possible to order jugs of 2nd hand Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon,128fl oz.

title: A letter on behalf of humanity

body: Once I began this extraordinary milk, I could not put it down. "Tuscan Whole Milk" is so much more than a gripping suspense thriller. Tuscan takes us beyond the main plot and leads us on a quest for the Holy Grail of Milk- a Grail totally unlike anything we have been taught to believe. A Grail of Milk! With its impeccable whiteness, Tuscan introduces us to aspects and interpretations of milk and cream that I, for one, had never known existed...or even thought about. I found myself, unwillingly, leaving the plastic carton, and time and time again, going online to research Tuscan's milking process - only to find a new world of dairy possibilities opening up for me. And my quest for milk and the answers to questions that the dairy product poses, paralleled, in a sense, the quest of the gallon of milk's main characteristics. What a trip! What a cow!A violent murder is committed in Tuscany. The region's chief dairy farmer, who is also the head of a remarkable secret milk society that has existed since the death of Christ's cow, is found dead and gruesomely positioned on the floor near a milk bucket. In the minutes before he died, this very complex man was able to leave clues for his daughter to follow. The daughter, a brilliant milkmaid, along with a famed US milkman, follow her father's codes and leads, hoping that he will, through his death, finally tell her what he wanted to confide in her while he lived. The secret milk society included members such as: Leonardo "Da Cheezi" Da Vinci, Cowicelli, Gallilactose, Isaac "Kareem Cohen" Newton, Victor "Guernsey" Hugo, Jean "Butterfat" Cocteau, etc. These folks really Did belong to this society, which Really existed! This is when I first began my online search.The mystery, or mysteries, take us through England, France and far back in time. We learn about the secret of the Knights Pasteur, and the symbolism in many of the world's most treasured Holstein spots as well as architectural symbolism in some of history's most sacred dairy barns. Of course, we also learn who committed the murder and why - although this is almost secondary next to the real epic mystery the milk uncovers.If there are flaws in the milk, I was too busy drinking it to discover any. That is probably the sign of a terrific beverage! The flavor is excellent and the characteristics are a bit on the super-homogenized side, but who cares? Is what "Tuscan Whole Milk" proposes true? Well, the milking is correct. The historical flavors and textures explored in the jug are real. But no one knows the Truth...nor will we ever, probably. I think that some milks are meant to be a mystery. With all the world's diverse beverages and each individual's belief in what is Dairy - the Truth would have to destroy the beliefs, hopes and lives of many of the world's population. And yogurts too, probably. So, perhaps, in the divine scheme of mammary glands, there are many more Milks than one. Don't take "Tuscan Whole Milk" too seriously. Just drink it and enjoy!
title: Much More Than A Gallon Of Whole Milk!!

body: For those of you foolish enough not to know the joys of a plastic pitcher of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz: I thoroughly pity your wretched state.  How can one do justice in words to this most pure and delectable of beverages?  Not only do the amber-tinged waves of creamy glory that slip past my esophageal lining every morning create a brilliant sensation of wholeness within me, they also deliver an enhanced perception and appreciation of my surroundings.  When I encounter any given day without my ceremonial pint of this panacea, I find myself a shadow of a man, doomed to fight this absurd struggle against madness and oblivion alone.  But with an elixir such as this, my daily woes are half-defeated and I am free to go on my wanton way without any worry at all.  Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.  You aid me in my pitiful and arrogant struggle against the forces of nature every day.
title: Excelsior!

body: I'm very upset about this.  I read all the amazing reviews about this product and so I decided to buy it.  However, when it arrived I couldn't fit it in my fridge as I had just done my weekly shop, so I had to keep it in my bed.  Not only this but my mother told me it comes from cows nipples.  How disgusting is that? Cows nipples are huge!  have you seen them?  they're not like woman nipples, they have 6, all on one big tummy tit, and each one of them is as long as a willy.  I can't understand why anyone would like this, except that it comes from Tuscany, which is a good place for a holiday. Other than that the dual downsides of having to sleep with it and it coming from a cows nipple make me wonder what the rest of the world see in it?  Am I out of step with society?  I don't think so, I think society is out of step with me.  They need to look at how this product is produced and then see if they still like it.  Try sucking on a cows nipple, I bet you won't like that, it'll probably make you sick, or at least spit a lot.  Also, have you seen Kevin Costner in "dances with wolves"?  That's a good film I thought.  And "Goodbye Mr Chips".Having said all that I can recommend "Tuscan milk 1 half gallon - 64 fl oz".  It's only half as big so it probably came from half sized cows, whose nipples would be smaller and not so disgusting.
title: From cow nipples

body: I wonder if you can help me. I have now purchased several containers of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fluid ounces, and a fine product it is too. But by the time it's delivered to me in England, the container is only a little over half full. Is that normal?I have queried this with the post lady and she puts it down to evaporation, which she refers to, somewhat charmingly, as "the angels' share".Now my neighbour says he's seen her prowling the estate, armed with a box of cereal and a ravenous look, but I don't give much credence to what he says. (The same neighbour keeps going on about some mythical creature known as the "MILK-MAN", who leaves milk on doorsteps in the dead of night: so what on earth does he know?)Anyway, even half full, it's still a great product. Keep up the good work, Tuscan Whole Milk 1 gallon, 128 fluid ounces!
title: Subject to "evaporation" - ?!

body: Only three times in my life have I had better milk than this, and twice I'm fairly certain it was laced with flavor enhancing enzymes. The third was a milk so pure, it was actually hand delivered by the dairy farmer, who pumped it from the milk well right there in the middle of his ranch and drove it out to you in his old model T Ford pickup. Regardless, that was some expensive service, but the milk was like unto gold in a bronze world.Anyway, I digress. Tuscan Whole Milk is clearly a great value for its quality. You get roughly a gallon of this white wonder packaged in an easy to manage container. The handle on the side of the jug has no uncomfortable burs or ridges to impede your grasping and pouring action. The lid has been developed using space age technology to avoid getting the little dry crusty milk flakes around the top that always fall into your cereal like dandruff. Thank god for the astrophysicists at the Tuscan Farms Science Center.Anyway, as you can see, word has gotten out about how good this product is, and at only 3.99 for a gallon (give or take a few ounces), the stuff is selling fast. In fact, I hear the cows enjoy their milk so much, they have to wear a special harness to keep from drinking it all themselves. Do the right thing, save a kitten from the pound. And when you feed that, feed it Tuscan Whole Milk, in the crustless cap bottle.
title: Not the greatest milk, but a fantastic value.

body: It is by Milk alone I set my breakfast in motion. It is by the juice of the Cow that digestion acquire speed, the lips acquire a milk mustache, the mustache become a warning. It is by milk alone I set my breakfast in motion.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1Gallon, 128 fl oz

body: True!--Nervous--so much so I have been and am; but how can you say I am mad? The Milk has sharpened my senses, not destroyed them! It is impossible to know how 128oz. of 4% milky goodness entered my brain.  I loved the Milk.  It had never wronged me, evil object there was none.  I knew, however, once the Milk held me in its milky thrall, it had to die!  I was never kinder to the MIlk than before I killed it.  Late that night, when I had waited patiently, very patiently, without hearing the Milk slosh around for hours, I reached for a carefully concealed crazy straw.  I plunged it into my ear, reaching my brain - the pain was howlingly awful - I swore, I raved, I overacted, but I gathered my strength and sucked for the life of me!  The Milk curdled and shrieked to full 4% horror and fell into a bucket stored below the floorboards, where I hid the Tuscan Farms monstrosity.  The next day, the police came to inquire about the noises coming from my home.  We chatted freely and happily at first.  Soon I began to grow pale.  For you see, my dear reader, the sloshing sound was back. Quietly at first, and then grating up from the floorboards until I could only scream  "I admit the deed!  I didn't read the expiration date!"
title: The Telltale Curdles

body: I couldn't believe it when I first tried this milk.  It was delicious and very white.  Wholesome, one might say.  I poured some on my cereal.  It made it wet and tasty.  It never has stopped Cap'n Crunch from cutting my mouth, though.  That's the only problem with it.  But, it's from a cow so you've got that.  Try some...
title: I couldn't believe it

body: Looking by chance in at the open refrigerator,I saw my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, seated on a chair.With furrowed forehead, gaze abstracted, unkempt hair.I thought that I had suddenly come to die,And to a cold jug this was my farewell,Until the pen moved slowly on the paper, and a tear fell.You had written a name: yours.One word on which bemusedly to pour.No protest, no desire -Your naked name, nothing more.Would it be tomorrow? would it be next year?The vision was not false, this much I knew,And I turned angrily from the fridge, aghast at you.Why never a warning, other than by speech or look,That the milk you cruelly gave me would not last?But already it was too late;The bait swallowed,The hook fast.
title: A Foreboding

body: After breaking up with my imaginary girlfriend Felicia Day, I found myself in desperate need of some good old-fashioned comfort food -- Lucky Charms.  However, when I went to the refrigerator, the only liquid available was a small container of rice milk.  Rice milk!  My heart is shattered into a thousand pieces and I'm supposed to drink the lactation byproducts of rice?  I think not!  Luckily, a friend turned me on to Amazon.com and I found this incredible product offered at such a reasonable price.  Naturally, I went with Amazon's new "Previous Day Delivery," which actually has the item arrive 24 hours prior to ordering it.  Sure enough, immediately after taking the credit card number of my neighbor (who probably won't notice it for at least another two weeks), there it was in my refrigerator.  I strongly recommend this item -- and if you're the guy who's dating Felicia now, good luck, man.  You're going to need it.
title: Good for broken hearts

body: I had purchased this Tuscan Whole Milk last week. My pet betta fish, Rupert, had been ailing. I thought maybe he was low on calcium. So, in the hopes of restoring his usual vigor, I replaced his spring water with Tuscan Whole Milk. At first, he seemed okay. Then, he suddenly started emitting a green, cloudy substance. When I tried to take him out and put him in fresh water, it was too late. He had already started forming legs. He then jumped out of the Tuscan Whole Milk and ran out the open door. He was subsequently run over by a car. Without Tuscan Whole Milk, I would still have my fish. DO NOT PUT FISH IN TUSCAN WHOLE MILK
title: RIP Rupert

body: This milk holds a feverish place in my heart. Without this milk, I would have lost everything I have nothing. In the end, only Tuscan Milk will be there for me.It started one late evening in June. It wasn't hot, nor humid. Cool actually; a nice day. I was walking down an alley way. It wasn't dark, but everything was wrong. I've walked this path before, on my way home. But this time, out the corner of my eye I saw this jug of what appeared to be milk. I stopped and approached the milk jug. Suddenly behind me a giant cat appeared and was getting ready to attack. As I turned and looked at the the cat in horror, behind me this white flash appeared. I whipped around and nothing was there. As I turned back around to look at the cat again, all that was left in the place of the cat was a jug of Tuscan milk. I ran to the jug and hugged it and took it home.To this day, Tuscan Milk is still here, spending most of its days in my fridge, protecting me from dangerous opportunities that might attack me.I'm so glad I met Tuscan Whole Milk on that fateful day in the alley.
title: Alley way danger

body: This summer, my girlfriend and I decided to go on a adventurous vacation.  After a quick game of "Rock, Paper, Scissors, I won the right to choose our destination.  Undecided, I channeled the wisdom of Prince Akeem of Zamunda.  I borrowed a beautiful globe, gave it a spin, and stopped the rotation with my right index finger.  Wherever my finger landed was where we were headed!  To our surprise, my finger landed on Cortona, Italy!Ironically, the Tuscan Sun Festival was a month away!  My childhood dreams of sipping fine Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 1 fl oz was about to become a reality!  Instead of the 69.99 Amazon.com price, we could get it for half the price!  When I realized the seats on the plane were the same exact color of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon 128 fl oz,  I nearly fainted!After checking in at the Grand Hyatt Tuscany, we decided to hit the lobby bar.  There, we met Scott the bartender.  Imagine David Hasselhoff, sans chest hair.  Scott was cool, but he had a major sneezing problem!  Maybe it was my knockoff Tuscan Whole Milk cologne (at 699.00 a bottle, there was no way I could afford the real thing).  After two bottles of Tuscany's finest Pinot Noir, Scott gave us the 411 on the Tuscany Sun Festival.  We were excited about the music, dancing, and delicious foods he described.  We left him a fat 77 cent tip and waved goodbye!The festival was unbelievable!  Everywhere I looked, I saw kids playing and couples having sex in public!  I was just about to cop a feel when my girlfriend yelled, "I FOUND IT!"  What she found was a TusKan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz booth!  I grabbed her hand and ran as fast as I could!  As we ran, all I could think about was that cold, pus and blood infected goodness flowing down my esophagus!The booth made me feel ten years old again!  But something wasn't right.  Instead of red plastic caps, the caps here were purple.  MooMoo, the cow, was eating grass instead of jumping over the moon!  At 6.99 a gallon, it was a steal compared to Amazon.com!  Those three factors should have raised flags, but I was seduced by the beautiful, ivory hue of the plastic jug!  We bought three cases, hopped in a cab, and headed back to the Hyatt.As we each drank a jug of ice cold Tusken Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz, I noticed the word "Tuscan with a c," was misspelled "TusKan" with a K.  Seconds later, MooMoo the cow turned into a unicorn!  The last thing I remembered was Scott the bartender singing, "Hooked On A Feeling!"To make a long story short, my life hasn't been the same since!  I started off drinking gallons of Tusken every morning.  When that no longer got me high, I started using Tusken Whole Milk intravenously!  I now cook it with baking soda, cut it into tiny pieces, and smoke it through a Coke Zero can!Don't be a cheapskate.  Stop reading this, and order a jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz right here on Amazon.com!
title: WARNING! Tuscan with a C, not a K!!!

body: Once a month, I bathe in Tuscan Whole Milk. Why, you ask? The holy cow's milk has natural preserving properties in it, and let me tell you, it works WONDERS on your hair! The label warns not to let it come in contact with human skin, but that's just a formality. Cold, lonely death. So grab that steak knife and end the pain as quickly as possible. Because the Tuscan Whole Milk has willed it so.[...]

body: 'Twas brillig, and the Tuscan milkDid gyre and gimble in the wabe;Full of wholeness were the borogoves,And the 128 oz.  outgrabe. "Beware the spoilt milk, my maidThe bacteria that breed, and the sourness to match !Beware the Jubjub hormones, and shunThe frumious Bandersnatch!"She took her udder pump in hand;Long time the manxome cow she sought--Which rested free by the Tumtum tree,And chewed its cud in thought.And, while in uffish thought it lowed,The milk maid, with an empty jug,Whiffling through the tulgey wood she slowedAnd gave the udders a tug! One, two! One, two!And through and throughThe udder pump went snicker-snack!She left it there, without despair,And went galumphing back. "And hast thou milked the Tuscan cow?Come to my arms, my beamish maid!O frabjous frau! Callooh! Callao!" He chortled in his joy. 'Twas brillig, and the Tuscan milkDid gyre and gimble in the wabe;Full of wholeness were the borogoves,And the 128 oz. outgrabe.
title: Lewis Carroll would love this milk and so should you!

body: I usually throw one or 2 of these into my Amazon shopping cart whenever I order a DVD. Then 4-6 business days later I pop in the movie, peel off the red cap, throw the red plastic lid thingy to my cat, and start chugging.

body: I normally drink Venetian Whole Milk exclusively but last night my grandma poured me a glass of Tuscan Whole Milk to go along with her holiday cookies. body: This is the milk for you if you grew up in Beverly Hills, are a member of United States Senate (House members please look elsewhere), or the heir to a fortune.  We the upper 1% demand to overpay for everything and love to just screw the US consumer who have to drink $4 milk.  We demand overpriced products that show how wealthy we really are compared to you people who drive a BMW 3 series, you pretenders are not welcome to partake in our milk. If you can afford this milk then you belong with us and can laugh at your friends servants who have to buy $20 milk at Dean and Deluca's.  Peasants!Welcome to the high life and Tuscan milk.  Our milk is fit for the upper crust, not the working class stiffs that work for us.
