body: Tuscan Whole Milk 1 Gallon 128 Fl Oz, o why have you abandoned me? Was it something I said? Those nights that we spent together with a good ol glass of you and some oreos? Don't you remember those nights? I do. I don't know what I did to make you go "out of stock" on me like that. I thought I had treated you right. Did I not? TELL ME!!! What did I do wrong? Should I have used the UPS overnight air delivery? Did you think I was cheap since I used Super Saving Shipping? it only took you three days to arrive. I didn't think that that would upset you that much.I'm just worried about you. I want you to come back. I miss those nights of your silky smooth texture going down my throat. I want your icy cold goodness to satisfy my thirst. Grocery store milk just can't compare to your dairy goodness. I hope you come back in stock soon, or else I might go lactose intolerent. Just hurry. Don't let me suffer. I NEED YOU!!
title: WHY????!!!!!!!!

body: As i was waking up i thought it would be a good idea to make some cereal. I went downstairs opened the pantry got my cereal out, poured my cereal into my bowl. I then went to my fridge, come to find out we had ordered Tuscan Whole Milk and it had came in last night. Cold and fresh the milk was. I was so happy because yesterday i poured my cereal and there was no milk at all. Now we have Tuscan Whole Milk. I don't know about you but i think the word Whole Milk added on is a personal unique touch that makes milk even better then it already is. I have always been a fan of milk. Its in my regular everyday drinks that i have. I have a glass with anything sweet and with my cereal you automatically have to have Tuscan Whole Milk. Not just any kind of milk Tuscan Whole Milk. 1 Gallon doesn't last three days in my house. I have it at least once a day and i know everyone else does in the family besides my sister who doesn't drink it. which is strange because its Milk. I recommend everyone getting Tuscan whole Milk because if i love it you will love it. I'm a picky person.
title: Milk

body: Why would I go to the store 2 blocks away when I can get it delivered to my doorstep for 10 times the price? I gave it 4 stars only because it doesn't come in Amazon's "frustration-free packaging".
title: Almost Perfect!!!

body: As a child, life was difficult.  I was always smaller than the other kids and they liked to tease me about my glasses.  When I turned 12 I decided it was time to turn my life around.  I started drinking milk.  Little did I realize how much this would change my life.  It began with small changes.  I noticed I wasn't so much smaller than the other kids anymore.  Thanks to the fortification of Vitamin A my eyes started improving.  Before I knew it I was forgeting to wear my glasses. And you know what?  I didn't care.  I could see.  Girls started to notice me.  It was what I had dreamed about my entire life.  But I didn't care.  I only wanted more milk.  I started to miss work waiting for the Stop and Shop to open so I could get my morning fix.  I lost interest in all other beverages.  Friends began to experiment with alcohol.  Not me, I had my vice.  Weekends would find me riding my bike hours into the suburbs searching for milk farms.  Bessie, she was my favorite.  I would watch her graze for hours during that glorious summer.  I never saw her again, I suspect she may be now prancing down 5th avenue as a pair of boots or a shiny leather jacket.  I still picture her blank stare as she transported grass to one of her many wonderful stomachs.I am grown now.  I have learned to curb my passion for milk and share my time with other passions.  For me, milk will always be number one.  I owe it so much, and thinking back to those carefree days of youth still brings back a reminder of the feeling as warm fresh milk slides down my throat.Thank you milk.  You complete me.
title: Milk changed my life.

body: It was on a tuesday night when i reached my mailbox to be greeted by a jug of SEEMINGLY ok milk. It wasnt ok....... My $75 milk was a slightly green hue and smelled of a high school gym locker full of lax bromance....
title: lax milk

body: A Tuscan cow's first milk is gold,Her hardest liquid to hold.Her early Tuscan milk is 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.But only fresh when in houses.Then milk subsides to sour,So Tuscany sank from power,So sourness turns to decayTuscan milk's freshness can't stay.
title: Tuscan Milk's Freshness Can't Stay

body: Hezekiah walked through the desert for many days and nights. And the sun was hot and he cursed it. And after much suffering he reached a river. And he looked down upon the river, and thirsted for a drink. Yet his lips were still, and above him flew a creature whose head was the color of sack cloth, with the wings of the mightiest eagle. And unto him it was said: Take this Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. and drink, and you shall receive sustinence. And he took the carton to his mouth, and drank. And his strength returned to him, and he was able to slay many goats for the feasting for all of his people. And with these goats was served more Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.First Ezekiel, Chapter 14, Verses 6-10
title: Milk Of The Gods

body: after receiving my luscious 128 ounces of Tuscon milk, I immediately grabbed my Honey Nut Cheerios and had dreams of settling into a honey, nut and Tuscan milk stupor. THAT'S when I discovered what the cow on the container label was doing. Upon opening my cupboard, I noticed all the dishes were gone! Then, I went to the silverware drawer. YEP, you guessed it, all the spoons were gone too!!!So, before ordering this Tuscan instigator, make sure to have the "talk" with your dishes and spoons. Mine are all still missing and it's been over two weeks! AND the milk is not bad, just has a slight heavy metal aftertaste.
title: Stay away from this instigator!

body: I don't always drink milk, but when I do prefer Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.  Stay thirsty, my friends.
title: The most interesting milk in the world

body: People keep telling me, "malfouka, you should drink milk."  And I always ask, "Why?"  Then they say, "Osteoporosis man!  Aren't you worried about becoming a hunchback?"  So, although I don't think I would really become a hunchback or anything like that, I decided to give milk a try.  Not really knowing what kind to buy--there are so many different brands and varieties (low-fat, whole, skim, lactose-free, raw, cream top, goat, some in plastic, others in glass, and still more in cardboard--ai yi yi, it's all so confusing!)--I asked my cousin Brenda (she lives in Toledo and has always been a big milk drinker.  Oh, I don't mean that she herself is "big", just that she really likes milk.  Brenda is actually pretty skinny, especially considering she's had 4 kids and is suffering from a slight thyroid problem) to help me out.  Brenda said, "malfouka, I know everybody is switching to fat-free and low-fat milk these days, but take it from me, they're no good.  If you want a really robust milk, get whole."  Then I asked her what brand she prefers and she told me, "That's easy!  I ALWAYS buy Tuscan Whole Milk.  They're the best and if you want to save a little money, you can buy it in the gallon size."  I said, "Thanks Brenda.  I'm going to buy some right now."  Which was kind of a small lie because we talked a little more about her kids and her husband's new snow blower before hanging up the telephone.I don't know if it's me or what, but Tuscan whole milk just wasn't as wonderful as Brenda said it was.  It had a nice white color like bright new snow and an appealing fresh smell (maybe the Tuscan cows are fed on some kind of extra sugary grass?) and true, it's competitvely priced, but the taste was only so-so.
title: This is So-So Milk

body: Drink of milk only with thine eyes,And I will pledge with mine;Or leave a kiss within the cup,And I'll not ask for wine.The thirst that from the soul doth rise,Doth crave a drink divine;But might I of Tuscan Whole milk (I Gallon, 128 fl oz) sup,I would not change for thine.
title: Kind of human milkiness

body: An issue that prospective purchasers need to be aware of.In order to preserve Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz's power, I was informed that I needed to root it, then upgrade it from FroYo to Ice Cream Sandwich. body: You do not do, you do not do,Any more, skim or two-Percent milk I have drunk like a doltFor thirty years, afraid of fat,Barely daring to eat or Achoo.Tuscan Whole, I just had to have you.You nearly sold out before I had time--Udder-heavy, nectar from God,Gleaned from the teats of placid cowsBig as Frisco whalesOn a farm near the freakish AtlanticWith grass bean green from the dewDropped from smog that straddles the Hudson.I used to pray for milk like you.Ach, du.From the Russian tongue, from a Polish townCame Lou Borinsky, who founded you,Tuscan Dairy, in 1918.But the name of the town is common.My Polack friendSays there could be a dozen or two.So I never could tell where LouPut his foot, his root.Ancestry.com doesn't list Lou.Guess no Mormon will adopt Lou.My search got snared in Google ads.Buy, buy, buy, buy.The page would hardly load.They thought every milk was you.So many products it was obscene--Search engine, search engineChuffing me off like a Jew.A Jew to Dachau, Auschwitz, Belsen.I think maybe Lou was a Jew.I think I may well be a Jew.The snow of my skin, fair flax on my headAre not very pure or true.With my ancestress burned as a witchAnd my Tarot pack and my Tarot packI may be a bit of a Jew.I've always been scared to try you,Afraid I would fatten and start to say moo,And a white mustacheWould cling to my lip like glue.Tuscan Milk, Tuscan Milk, O You--Named not by God but Borinsky,Dreaming of sky a Florentine blue.Every woman adores a Tuscan,Full of Chianti & amore, the lush,Lush heart of a lush like you.On your plastic bottle, Tuscan Milk,In pics Amazon has of you,A cartoon cow jumps a yellow moonBut no less refined for that, no notAny less the suave Homo whoBid my pretty red heart "Be true."I was twelve when they took me from you.At twenty I gave up skimTo get back, back, back to you.I thought maybe 2 percent would do.For years I filled the grocery sackWith liquids that tasted like glue.And then I knew what to do.I searched Amazon for you--Tuscan Whole Milk, 128 fl oz--All that Amazon gobbledygoo,And I found it without ado.With pale milk I'm finally through.Google's ads are blocked at the root,The sponsors just can't worm through.If I've found one milk, I've found two--Tuscan Dairy Farms' TrueMoo,A chocolate dream come true.Only two percent, if you have to know,But otherwise just like you.Now there's a stake in the fat cat heartsOf corporations who compete with you.In Jersey they've always loved you.I'm dancing a jig and guzzling you.Tuscan Whole Milk, with other milks, I'm through.
title: Good enough for Sylvia Plath's daddy

body: Initial set up of the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is easy, just unscrew the cap and remove the liner. It has a surprisingly rich set of standalone and integrated food possibilities and the addition of vitamin D was a bonus.However, I find that this product quickly becomes unstable (even without overclocking) to the point that it is no longer usable. At first I tried passive cooling to prevent the degradation, but ultimately had to switch to an active cooling method to prolong the products usefulness.Note that even with this extreme care the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz will still break down. Even if you never use the product it will still fail! This is the worst kind of planned obsolescence, requiring you to replace this product every two weeks whether you use it or not!Pros: Inexpensive, easy set up.Cons: Short product lifecycle. No instruction manual. No optical/coax sound output.
title: Planned Obsolescence!

body: I was at the opera and instead of tossing a typical boring bouquet of flowers onto the stage, I threw a gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk from the mezzanine.  Unfortunately my aim was off and I hit the lead soprano on the head.  When she regained consciousness the next day in the hospital we were able to laugh about it and the nursing staff was nice enough to put the gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk on ice for us to enjoy (as is expected when leave a bottle of milk in a room with an unconscious giftee, the nursing staff had drank much of it, but tried to hide it by filling it with water so what we were really drinking was not whole milk but about about skim to 1%).Coincidentally, she was from Tuscan, Italy and did not speak a whit of English so we communicated through gestures and singing lines from our favorite operas.  Turns out she credited her singing ability to milking cows in the great fresh air of Tuscan Farms and would sing while milking.  Anyway, we've been sharing Tuscan Whole Milk together for about six months now and this Thanksgiving I plan on popping the big question by hiding the ring in the turkey stuffing.  If she says yes I will let you know and will have to thank Tuscan Whole Milk for the best Thanksgiving ever!!
title: For An Especially Thankful Thanksgiving!

body: This product copiously leaks out of my nose whenever I read these reviews.
title: Serious Problem

body: I find Venetian whole milk far superior.  Provencale is even better.  It has hints of lavender.  But it's a rare vintage.  Go for the Venetian because cost and availability are superior.  The perfect accompaniment to this delectable liquid is a Swiss Oreo, But that is indeed a rarity reserved only for those with secret Swiss bank accounts.  (You may contact me with the account information and I will happily send from my private stock once the required funds have transferred.)
title: I find Venetian whole milk far superior. Provencale is even better

body: When my Tuscan Whole Milk arrived last week, I was overcome with joy.  I wept openly and hugged my mailman for quite some time.  I sat down on my loveseat, propped my feet up on the ottoman, and enjoyed approximately 7 of the included 128 fluid ounces.  It was a transcendent experience to say the least!  I felt that I had to share the good news with the rest of the neighborhood.  "Okay, Tuscan Whole Milk," I said to the jolly little jug, "please answer the phone while I am out, and be sure to feed my cat within the hour.  If Mother calls, please wish her a happy birthday."  I took the jug's silence to mean that it understood my request and would comply with it fully.  After spending several hours going door-to-door to spread the Tuscan gospel amongst my neighbors, I returned home...to betrayal!  The jug of milk was sitting right where I had left it!  My cat was quite hungry and noticeably unhappy with me.  I checked my caller ID device and saw that my mother had called shortly after I left the house!  By now it was 5:30 PM - way past my mother's bedtime - and I would not be able to speak to her until the next day.  Let me say that she was quite disappointed that I was not home to answer her traditional birthday phone call.  I tried to explain how it was Tuscan Whole Milk's fault, but she would have none of it.  I was inconsolable, and decided to drown my sorrow in 121 fluid ounces of warm, delicious Tuscan Whole Milk.  If you choose to purchase this item, please learn from my mistake.  Drink the milk, but do not trust it with any household chores or responsibilities.  Please think of your dear mother and your cat, and make the right decision.
title: Great Beverage...But Not to be Trusted With Responsibilities!

body: This looks like any other type of milk but this one is very different. You can taste the delicious  added vitamin D and it is much harder to use with pouring into the cup or bowl.
title: This looks like any other type of milk but this one is ...

body: I Barely Remember Finding The Delivery Of My Recent Online Purchase Of Tuscan Milk 128 oz At My Doorstep After A 3 Day Bender, But When I Woke Up From A Restful comatose-Like State tThere It Was In My Fridge. Only Slightly Spoiled From Who Knows How Many Hours (Or Days) Sitting At My Front Door In Mid Sixties Degree Weather, Chugging A Tall Glass Of This Pure White Elixer With A Surprising And Not Too Subtle Sour Finish Was The Perfect Cure For Cottonmouthed Sewer That Was My rum-Hole That Morning. Added Bonus! After Only A Few Seconds From Emptying My Glass, The Unforseen Benefit Of Projectile Vomitting Voided My Stomach Of The Remaining Poisonous Bile And Relieving That "I'll Never Drink Again" Feeling!Thanks Tuscan And Amazon!
title: Kramer says....

body: There comes a point in every man's life when he realizes, "Why leave my house to buy milk?" with a few clicks of a  button and a little magic, you can have it delivered right to your doorstep, within only a few days.I was that man. I was an unsuspecting, skeptical, regular store-going milk guy, when the idea hit me. I wasn't expecting much when I ordered it. Just some milk. Boy, was I in for a surprise.When the milk arrived, something was...off. Lightning struck as the fedex guy handed me the unholy gallon. It almost seemed like I could hear an organ playing off in the distance...The next few days were...well, I'll just describe them to you. The first day, I woke up to an incredible stench. Upon investigation, I noticed it was coming from my refrigerator. Then came the insects--oh, the insects. Thousands of these six-legged vermon infested my house. They infested my dog and he died. The third day, within my refrigerator, a portal to Hades was opened, and lucifer himself emerged. If there is a God out there, please, I'm begging you, remove this vile substance from my place of dwelling. Please send help if you read this.It does taste pretty good, though.
title: Rancid in a much different way

body: Man is this stuff white! I mean there are many less white milk brands out there if that's what your into, but if you want really white milk Tuscan Whole Milk is the whitest.
title: Not translucent enough

body: Frank settled down in the Valley,and he hung his wild years on anail that he drove through hiswife's forehead.He sold used office furniture outthere on San Fernando Road andassumed a $30,000 loan at15 1/4 % and put a down paymenton a little two bedroom place.His wife was a spent piece of used jet trashMade good bloody-marys, kept her mouthshut most of the time, had a little Chihuahuanamed Carlos that had some kind of skindisease and was totally blind.They had a thoroughly modern kitchen;self-cleaning oven (the whole bit)Frank drove a little sedan.They were so happy.One night Frank was on his way homefrom work, stopped at the liquor store,picked up 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz of Tuscan Whole Milk,Drank it in the car on his way to theShell station; he got a gallon of gas in a can.Drove home, doused everything inthe house, torched it.Parked across the street laughing,watching it burn, all Halloweenorange and chimney red.Frank put on a top forty station,got on the Hollywood Freewayheaded North.Never could stand that dog.
title: Frank's Wild Blue Milk

body: This stuff sounds awesome, can you get it in New Jersey? Ps Edgar write some more please Happy holidays x
title: Aaggh the good white stuff

body: When Italians do something, it's honestly more attractive--which means better. If you go to any world famous art museum and take out the Italian work, then, well... you'll be rich. Point and case, these cows were forced into servitude at that hands of people who are probably much better than yourself--in all ways. Worship this milk. Become one with the milk. Be only the milk. Milk.Caution: You'll feel like the cows utters feel if you drink processed milk on a regular basis.
title: Savor the delicious smokey blend of Italian cow love

body: A lot of people in this country pooh-pooh North American Whole Milks. This is a pity as many fine milks appeal not only to the American palate but also to the cognoscenti of poor starving kids in China.Black Stump 2% is rightly praised as a peppermint flavored dairy, whilst a good Wisconsin Whole can rank with any of the world's best sugary milks. Château Iowa, too, has won many prizes; not least for its taste, and its lingering afterburn. Old Smokey Farms has been compared favorably to a heady skim, whilst the Nebraska Dairy Society thoroughly recommends a 1970 Guernsey One Percent, which, believe me, has a kick on it like a mule. Eight bottles of this and you're really finished. At the opening of the Nebraska State Fair, they were fishing them out of the main sewers every half an hour.Of the Two Percenters, the most famous is Holstein White. This is a bottle with a message in and the message is "beware".Another good fighting milk is Hoosier Old & Yellow, which is particularly heavy and should be used only for hand-to-hand combat.Quite the reverse is true of Château Heifer, which after the new addition of Melamine is specially made for those keen on regurgitation; a fine milk which really opens up the sluices at both ends. Real dairy fans will also go for a Hobart Muddy Chocolate and a prize winning How Now Brown Reserve Barn Bottled Paddy San Moo-Moo, which has a bouquet like an milk maid's armpit.
title: This is not a milk for drinking, this is a milk for laying down and avoiding!

body: The Second MilkingSqueezing and squeezing in the wide containerThe moo cow cannot hear the farmer;Machines fall apart, the suction cups cannot hold;Mere husbandry is loosed upon the cold,The milk-dimmed tide is loosed, and everywhereThe creamery of innocence is mowed;The best lack all mastication, while the worstAre full of pregnant immensity.Surely some expulsion is at hand;Surely the second milking is at hand.The Second Milking! Hardly were those curds outWhen the vast image of Elsius MundiBubbles my sight: somewhere in the meadows of WisconsinA shape with a trademark body, and the head of a cow,A gaze proud and commercial as television,Is moving its slow cud, while all about itReel shadows of the indignant end-customer.The darkness drops again; but now I mooThat twenty hours of pasture sleepWere vexed to lowing by that swelling udder,And what rough beast, its hour come at last,Slouches towards Tuscany to be milked again?- Filling Butter Sates
title: Luke 11:14 "Blessed is the womb that bore thee, and the paps which nourished thee."

body: I ordered the milk and it arrived just in time for movie my movie night. I rented Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy from the local video store, had a half dozen chocolate chip cookies hot out of the oven, poured a glass of milk and got ready. Just as Control asked Prideaux if he had been followed, I took a bite of the cookie, washed it down with milk.... and blech! Flippin' sour. I don't see what the big deal is if they can't ship the product fast enough to keep it fresh. The movie is great, though.
title: Needs faster shipping

body: After hearing all the hype about this film, I finally decided to purchase it from [...]. Matt Damon gives a plausible performance as an amnesiac dairyman pursued by the evil agents of PETA; however, I found the product placements in the film to be heavy-handed and distracting. (For example, the ticket counter sequence with the garish "Tuscan Airways" banner, the lamentable fact that the chase scenes replace the hero's trademark white truck with a Mooserati, and, in what has to rank as the acme of poor taste in this veritable orgy of commercialism, giving the character of Bovine a white moustache.)Parents should be forewarned also of this film's gratuitous display of T&A; (teats and abomasum). The former is to be expected, I suppose, in any 'R' rated film these days, but displays of the fourth (true) stomach are rather disgusting and do nothing to further the plot.Overall, I would suggest reading the original novel by Robert Cudlum over this film; the book and the sequel "The Bovine Supremacy" are also available on [...].
title: The Bovine Identity (DVD, NTSC)

body: I thought I would die, like my parents before me, under the onslaught of pain unleashed by the no-armed man. Having hunted him down from the wilds of Kamchatka, I thought I could finally send their ghosts on to the great adventure beyond, but alas the no-armed man would escape me once again.  After a furious assault of head butting and kicks, I thought I might have a chance to best him in hand-to-no-hand combat. Instead he nearly finished me off. Perhaps it was his guilt that saved me, for in the moment when he could have crushed my head, he turned and ran away. I had puked and voided myself under the beating he laid upon me, and after I stood up, I looked back at my sick on the ground and saw that it resembled the shape of a bottle of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. God was looking down on me that day with great fortune, for it was a bottle of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz that started us both on this path of destruction that must end in death.It was the no-armed man's act of violence, killing my parents in their Huge Ship while driving drunk and trying to pour himself a glass of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon 128 fl oz, that was purely random and not directed at ruining my life and spoiling my vacation to the mountains in the hopes of photographing wolves, as my once narcissistic viewpoint had thought. If only he had some way to balance the glass and the bottle of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz while he was driving, of if only he had read How to Avoid Huge Ships my parents might have had a chance to survive, but he didn't and they didn't and my vacation was ruined and I've been hunting the no-armed man for the better part of thirty years since.
title: Fortuitous Shapes

body: This is a review for Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz.I'm sure this is a fine product, just read the reviews, but I wishit came in 2%, 1% and fat free.  What I really wish was that itcame in a chocolate flavor. And why no alternate languages on the label?That's why I only gave this product a four star review.And as long as I'm being critical, why on earth did they change the nameof this product to Tuscan Whole Milk from its original moniker,Mrs. O'Leary's Fire Brewed Milk. Now there's a name and image thatshows character and pedigree, something you can literally taste with eachsleeve wiping swig.I also wish the expiration dates lasted longer.  After all, you can'tbe too careful.
title: Foamy Goodness But No Cigar

body: I ordered this milk. It came well packed and was shipped quickly. As far as the milk itself, it was pretty good. However, since placing the order Indiscovered that you can get similar milk at the Quick Check for substantially less, sometimes as cheap as $8.99 for a jug. however, they typically do not deliver it to you, so you will have to assume the time and expense to pick it up. Is it worth it to buy this product from Amazon? Only you can answer that question.
title: Good Milk, But Overpriced

body: I ordered a gallon of Tuscan Whole last month and customs intercepted it. My supplier was kind enough to send another one at no cost.  This one made it through. Here's what happened that night.---Trip Report---Dose [10:00pm]: Insufflated 12 fl oz. Tried using a rolled up dollar bill at first. Was very difficult. Switched to bendable straw and worked like a charm.Onset [10:02pm]: Slightly nauseous. Went outside to catch fresh air. Mild anxiety- am worried I have taken too much.[10:15pm]: It's definitely working. Nausea gone. Leaves and branches of trees very pronounced. Slight open-eyed visuals. When closing my eyes I get a sensation that I'm flying.[11:00pm]: Can no longer walk straight. Laying in yard. Chewing on grass.(excerpt from journal) Tuscany. Wher's the beef? Cant finnd it mooo. hindoosave me. magic resist cow king hide [something illegible][Midnight] At this point I was blacked out and my trip had gone bad. It felt like 1000 years had passed, and I was looking at myself in a gritty factory where everyone was tied to machines that pumped milk/blood from the of everyone there. A Hindu warden is standing over me saying, "Nice and easy, Tuscan Whole Milk!" while grinning a dubious grin. It felt as though this lasted an eternity.[2:00am] Coming down. Very shaky. Can still taste the Tuscan Whole in the back of my throat. Did I just catch a glimpse of the future?---End Report---The next morning I felt like I weighed a thousand pounds. I'm not sure how, but there was a cowbell under my pillow when I awoke.. This has been the scariest/most enlightening experience I have ever had. It will be a long time before I try Tuscan Whole Milk again. Perhaps I'm only ready for 2%..
title: The 7th Dimension, Time, and Milk

body: ARTHUR:The Lady of the Lake,......her arm clad in the purest shimmering samite, held aloft Tuscan Whole Milk from the bosom of the water signifying byDivine Providence that I, Arthur, was to carry Tuscan Whole Milk.That is why I am your king!DENNIS:Listen. Strange women lying in ponds distributing Tuscan Whole Milk is no basis for a system of government.Supreme executive power derives from a mandate from the masses, not from some farcical aquatic ceremony.ARTHUR:Be quiet!DENNIS:Well, but you can't expect to wield supreme executive power just 'cause some watery tart threw Tuscan Whole Milk at you!ARTHUR:Shut up!DENNIS:I mean, if I went 'round saying I was an emperor just because some moistened bint had lobbed Tuscan Whole Milk at me, they'd put me away!ARTHUR:Shut up, will you? Shut up!DENNIS:Ah, now we see the violence inherent in the system.ARTHUR:Shut up!DENNIS:Oh! Come and see the violence inherent in the system! Help! Help! I'm being repressed!ARTHUR:Bloody peasant!
title: Bloody Peasant!

body: Be advised this product comes in only one color....WHITE.What's the matter Tuscan Whole Milk?  Afraid of a little color in your life?  It's a different world now with President Obama in the "Whitehouse".  Even Eggs are available in Brown.Get with the times.
title: Limited Color Selections

body: You may find it odd that Tuscan Whole Milk had two expiration dates: one standard, and one earlier specifically for New York City. So...why is New York so special that its standards of freshness are more stringent than anybody else's?I used to live in New Jersey. One day my friend Dan in Astoria, Queens, invited me over to check out some new samples of burlap he had just received from his friend, a wholesaler in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Sadly, Dan had confided in me the deplorable fact that his paycheck got lost in the mail and he couldn't purchase his nourishing whole milk as a result. No problem, I told him, I'll just stop in at Foodtown on the way over to his place and get him a gallon of milk. Dan has been my trusted friend for years, so I knew he could just owe me the money and repay me later.So I hopped in the car, stopped at Foodtown, and grabbed a gallon of refreshing Tuscan Whole Milk. It was at this point that I noticed that Tuscan milk has two expiration dates. It had already passed the New York City expiration date, but there were still a few days left before the standard expiration date, so I figured, no problem. I put the container of milk in the front passenger seat of my car so I wouldn't forget it when I got to Dan's house.And danged if it didn't happen:I got on the George Washington Bridge, and so help me, the second I crossed over the New York City border, the gallon of milk exploded. Plastic shrapnel everywhere -- lodged into the upholstery, wedged in the CD player, putting nicks in my windshield, the works. And the milk, of course, gushed everywhere.Needless to say, after a week or so the smell was unbearable. Trust me when I say, folks, that cow product does not come out very easily.I couldn't even give my car to the junk yard, that's how awful it smelled.So please, take it from me: PAY. ATTENTION. TO. THE. EXPIRATION. DATE.
title: READ THE EXPIRATION DATE!!!

body: September 21, 1957:Daddy laid in bed.  Broken and debilitated, less than half the man I knew just ten years before, and probably only a fraction of the man that Mama remembered.  The pain drove him sick; it ate away at his psyche.  His nights were sleepless and agonizing; hallucinations brought on by both the pain and the medication haunted him.  My brothers and myself were constantly awakened by his verbalized fits of rage and pain.  A week ago we heard him screaming about Death, but not death as in the natural end to one's life, but as a personification of something much more, much worse, and much more complicated than any of us could possibly understand.  We couldn't make out the specifics of what he was saying but he went on for twenty minutes or so, screaming and cursing until his voice gave out and usurped him into an exhausted slumber.  The next morning we gave him his 500mg of Tuscan brand morphine, the only thing in the world that seemed to benefit him at all, even if their affects were not long lasting.  We asked him about his terrors and he became lucid.  "Death," he said tiredly, nudging his feeble head -- which was too big for his shoulders and neck to bear -- towards the corner of the room.  "I can see him there, just sitting there."  He went on to describe Death to us. "He's a man," he said somberly.  "He's a man with no face, no emotion."  He said he was draped in black, and he was there now.  He described it as being omniscient, but only he, so close to the end, could now visualize it.  Death didn't laugh at him nor threaten him or even speak to him.  It merely existed.  That was all it took to elicit such a hopeless rage.  A day later Daddy would be dead.For forty years he spent in those Tuscan milk mines, breaking his back to put food on our table and a roof over our heads.  You'll never hear his name mentioned by any scholar when speaking about the great Tuscan Milk Rush of 1947 and 1948 nor will you ever read about his exploits in any dime store pulp biographies.  My father was just a pawn of the system: the Rockefellars and others like them.  He never became wealthy, never became famous, never inherited a yacht or became the owner of artificial flower mills all across northen California.  He was just a laborer, one of thousands that was used and exploited in those Tuscan death-holes.  For fourteen hours a day, seven days a week, he spent his life underground in cramped little pockets mining the veins of Earth for Grade A whole milk, droplets at a time.  Some considered him lucky as he was one of the few who did not parish in those chambers, but if they knew what I know and saw what I saw of those last torturous years of his life I do not think those people would look upon him with envy.My brothers and I would sometimes venture into town and take great gaze at Nathaniel J.W. Tuscan's mansion and pasta salad bar, which sat perched on the top of Milk Mountain, the highest pique in the city.  It sat there, defying all moral ehtos, almost laughing at us.  It was as if someone had erected a 700 foot tall middle finger and doused it with fluorescent paint.  My father had none of this, not even a millionth of a fraction of it.  He died poor and hungry and in pain.  He died in the smallest room of our three bedroom toolshed, living his last years almost no different than the conditions he spent his life wallowing in.Tuscan and the Rockefellars still live up there on Milk Mountain.  They still exploit their workers, forcing them work in the most dire conditions and still pay them with Snackwell coupons while they simply get rich, selling their Tuscan Whole Milk for over $77.00 a gallon, enough to purchase a fleet of naval jets in this year we live of nineteen hundred and fifty-seven.I'd say don't ever buy from them, don't ever touch their Tuscan whole milk, don't ever support such evils...  But I can't say it, at least not fully.  Their milk is the best I have ever chewed.
title: Disgusted by Tuscan's Exploitation of their Workers
