body: I know a lot of people are complaining about the price of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz milk. And I will admit, that the headline price of sixty-nine ninety nine is kind of steep. But that's all it is - a headline price.The truth is that this mac version of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz comes with so many more features than the windoze version that it actually will save you money. Did you notice the built in handle? That means you don't have to install any expensive third-party handles that open you up to the risk of malware. And the cap? Well, it just works - no repeated uninstalling and reinstalling while your morning ticks away in front of a dry bowl of cereal.I don't even need to mention that this is totally virus free. I mean, there's bacteria (the good kind) but that's supposed to be like that. No one has EVER EVER gotten a virus from Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz. , so you'll save a few bucks there, too.This Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz (mac version) has absolutely seamless integration from fridge to table. I have a samsung refrigerator, and I eat rice krispies out of a 3" star wars bowl while reading the NYTimes on my 15" macbookpro and I've NEVER had any crashes. That used to be a recipe for BSoD, but that hasn't happened to me since switching to Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz (mac version).  True plug and play means it really is an important part of a balanced breakfast.And what if you want something more complicated like rice pudding or yogurt? This comes pre-loaded with iLact that makes these things a snap. Try that with a windoze-based milk and some expensive, complicated 3rd party software. Forget it.To be fair, i haven't tried the Windows 7 version of this yet. But if that new OS is anything like the crappy bloatware that's been coming out of Redmond for decades now, the Snow Leopard version of Tuscan will remain several steps ahead for a couple more years to come..(BTW, I'm TOTALLY not condoning this, but you can get even more functionality out of Tuscan if you jailbreak it.)
title: So Much Better Than the Windows Version

body: Recently, and somewhat inadvertently, I found myself transported back through time to 1955.  And, wouldn't you know it, without my supply of plutonium necessary to supply the 1.21 gigawatts of power necessary to power my Delorean turned time machine back to the present age.Thankfully, I had my recently purchased 1 Gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk and had it with me.  I simply poured all of the 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, directly into the flux capacitor and off I went back through time, leaving just a scorched set of tire trails behind me.Not only that, when I came back parents were suddenly cool, my girlfriend was hotter, and the car that'd been crashed before I left had somehow turned into a sweet truck --- just in time too as it was the big weekend up at the lake.As you probably can guess I stocked up and brought a new gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, with me up to the lake that weekend (but that's a different story all together).
title: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz --- Never travel through time without it.

body: Disappointed to find it had nothing to do with Florida or the land of Oz. Summer ruined.
title: One Star

body: Seldom do I really answer those who criticize my work. In fact, the entire development of my career has been fueled by my ability to ignore denigrating and trivializing criticism as I realize my dreams and my goals. However there is something compelling about Amazon's willingness to publish just about anything, and the sheer outrageous stupidity of many things you've said here that actually touches my proletarian and Democratic soul.Also I use and enjoy Amazon and I do read the reviews of other people's milks in many fields. In sum, I believe in what happens here. And so, I speak. First off, let me say that this is addressed only to some of you, who have posted outrageously negative comments here, and not to all.You are interrogating this milk from the wrong perspective. Indeed, you aren't even drinking it. You are projecting your own limitations on it. And you are giving a whole new meaning to the words "lactose intolerance". And you have strained my Dickensian principles to the max. I'm justifiably proud of being drunk by intellectual giants and waitresses in trailer parks, in fact, I love it, but who in the world are you?Now to the milk. Allow me to point out: nowhere on the label are you told that this is the last of the herd, nowhere are you promised curtain calls or a finale, nowhere are you told there will be a wrap-up of all the earlier material. The milk tells you exactly what to expect. And it warns you specifically that if you did not enjoy Tuscan Fat Free Half & Half, 32 fl oz, you may not enjoy this milk. This milk is by and about a heroine whom many of you have already rejected. And she tells you that you are likely to reject her again.And this milk is most certainly milked -- every drop of it -- by me. If and when I can't milk a cow on my own, you'll know about it. And no, I have no intention of allowing any pasteurizer ever to distort, water down, or otherwise mutilate drops that I have stirred and re-stirred, and churned and polished myself. I fought a great battle to achieve a status where I did not have to put up with the FDA making demands on me, and I will never relinquish that status. For me, cow milking is a virtuoso performance. It is not a collaborative art.Back to the milk itself: the character who gives the milk is my Bessie. I was with her more closely than I have ever been in this milk; her voice was as powerful for me as I've ever heard it. I experienced breakthrough after breakthrough as I chewed with her, mooed with her, saw through her eyes. What I ask of Bessie, Bessie unfailingly gives. For me, three cudding scenes, two which take place in fields -- the lone calf waiting for the veal crate, the rainstorm in the south pasture -- and the late night foray into the barn, stand with any similar ruminations in all of her stomachs. The milk they produced can be drunk at one sitting without a single hitch. Every curd is in perfect place. The short low in which Bessie describes her love for the calf she has never known was for me a totally realized poem. There are other such scenes in this milk. You don't get all this? Fine. But I experienced an intimacy with the cow in those scenes that shattered all prior restraints, and when one is milking one does have to continuously and courageously fight a destructive tendency to inhibition and restraint. Getting really close to the subject matter is the achievement of only great art.Now, if it doesn't appeal to you, fine. You don't enjoy it? Drink somebody else. But your stupid arrogant assumptions about me and what I am doing are slander. And you have used this site as if it were an Augean cowshed to publish falsehood and lies. I'll never challenge your democratic freedom to do so, and yes, I'm answering you, but for what it's worth, be assured of the utter contempt I feel for you, especially those of you who post anonymously (and perhaps repeatedly?) and how glad I am that this milk is the last one in a series that has invited your hateful and ugly responses.Now, to return to the beverage in question: Bessie's wanting to jump over the moon is a vision larded through and through with her characteristic unworldliness. It connects perfectly with her earlier ambitions to be a raider in Jundland, a gothic novelist in the modern age. If you can't see that, you aren't drinking my milk. In her conversation with the Papal Bull she makes observations on the times which are in continuity with her observations on the process of skimming in The Supreme Milk Tuscan, 100% Fat Free, 32 fl oz, and in continuity with Rosie' observations later in Tuscan Heavy Cream of the Damned, 16 fl oz. The state of the farm has always been an important theme in the dairy range. Bessie's comments matter. Every word she lows is part of the achievement of this milk. That Bessie renounced this astronautly ambition within a matter of pages is plain enough for you to see. That she reverts to her old self is obvious, and that she intends to complete the tale of Livorno Farm is also quite clear.There are many other themes and patterns in this work that I might mention -- the interplay between St.Drogo and Bessie, the humble creature who doesn't "count" in the eyes of the world is a case in point. There is also the theme of the snare of Livorno Farm, the place where a bovine existence becomes so beguiling that Bessie relinquishes her milk as if to a spell. The entire relationship between Bessie and Uncle Aurochs is carefully worked out. But I leave it to readers to discover how this complex and intricate milk establishes itself within a unique, if not unrivalled range of dairy.There are things to be said. And there is pleasure to be had. And drinkers will say wonderful things about Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and they already are. There are drinkers out there, and plenty of them, who cherish the individuality of each of the milks which you so flippantly condemn. They can and do churn circles around you. And I am warmed by their response. Their letters, the papers they write in school, our face to face exchanges on the road -- these things sustain me when I read the utter trash that you post.But I feel I have said enough. If this reaches one reader who is curious about my work and shocked by the ugly reviews here, I've served my goals. And Moo, yes you, the slang police! Bessie talks like I do. She always has and she always will. You really wouldn't much like being around either one of us. And you don't have to be.If any of you wants to say anything about all this by all means Email me at [...]. And if you want your money back for the milk, send it to Misery Farm, Howling, Sussex, BN17 MOO. I'm not a coward about my real name or where I live.And yes, the Tuscan series is no more! Thank Nut!
title: From the Farmer to the Some of the Negative Voices Here

body: Initial impressions: Opaque white color. Delicate closed-nose smelling faintly of butter. Really opens up after three or four weeks when it  develops a bouquet like a Prussian cavalry stable, though loses its beautiful tearing properties in its curd-like state. Palate of white, steamed rice. Faint after taste of bovine teat. Canonical pairing is packeted biscuits but those keen on adventure will match it with high-acidity lemon or lime squash. Tuscan Whole Milk is very similar in structure and overall body to its mountainous cousin Montepulciano Latte Nobile but lacks the sugar-forward properties of its brother vintage, Tuscan Chocolate.  Overall impressions: a fine example of lactose-forward, mammary-secreted Italian-mammalian fluid. 4 Stars.
title: A good daily sipper; pairs well with biscuits.

body: When I tried to teach Milk how to ride a bicycle he fell off and scraped his knee.He cried and told me he was a clumsy jug and didn't want to be a Milk anymore; so I told him that Milks were good and that one day he would have lots of Milk friends, that he could even grow up to be an Astro-milk-naut, or the President if he wanted to -- it'd be a first, but he could do it.  But Milk just sat there on the sidewalk, crying condensation down his sides.Later that day he was so depressed he hid himself in the fridge next to the orange juice.  That night, thinking he was just the regular milk not the Amazon Tuscan Milk, I poured myself a tall glass of him to wash down my slice of chocolate cake.  It was only when I'd finished drinking and smacked my lips that he spoke up and told me what I'd done.  How could you do this to me? he cried in a  muffled voice from the fridge.  When I opened the refrigerator door I was shocked with horror to see him there, pale as milky white and drained, no longer the God-given gallon he had been.The next day I took him to see a psych-milk-ologist.  A week later we had the official diagnosis: "Gone Bad".So . . . check your Sell-by date.
title: Milk "Gone Bad"

body: I find that ordering Tuscan milk from "Amazon.it", the Italian branch of Amazon, guarantees that you get the best Tuscan Milk. It is shipped direct from the factory in the beautiful Italian town of Sesto Fiorentino (L'archivio postunitario del Comune di Sesto Fiorentino (Cultura e memoria) (Italian Edition)) and,while the shipping costs are higher, you know you are getting fresh non-pasteurized, non-homogenized, no Vitamin D-added, milk ready for drinking while you eat Baci Perugina, 15 pieces, 7.5 oz (214 g) chocolates.This is best done in the winter, so you don't end up with a gallon of Tuscan Ricotta cheese (Sheep's Milk Ricotta Cheese Imported from Italy every week 3lb $39.95) by mistake.You can mix in a liter carton of wine shipped freshly packed from the Despar Supermarket in Rome's "Little Italy" neighborhood (also available on "Amazon.it") with the milk, and a dollop of Nutella Hazelnut Spread, 13-Ounce Plastic Jar (Pack of 5)or a generic substitute from the same supermarket, put on the movie Roman Holiday (Special Collector's Edition) or Gigli and you will feel like you are back in the Old Country Party Tyme Karaoke: Old Country, Vol. 1. Use ProRaso Whipped Cream (is that what it is?) and it's even tastier (Proraso Cream 5.2 oz (147 g))!UPDATE:  The product description actually says: "While Milk".... Never mind....
title: It comes from the best part of Tuscany, but....

body: I was a little skeptical about spending $2,500 just to have milk "personally delivered" to door, but it was worth every penny!The milk, although past the expiration date, had its signature taste. As an added surprise, the seller even stayed with me for the whole night to bake cookies and brownies with me. WOW! Will return for more later.
title: Personally delivered by the seller!

body: I'm not usually so forthright about this but since it is relevant to my review it is necessary that I share. I have narcolepsy. This morning I poured a big glass of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and sat down for breakfast. I was having French toast (no, I have not yet poured this stuff over dry cereal like J. Fitzsimmons advises, but that is on my to-do list).  Needless to say I had a narcoleptic episode at the breakfast table. While I was asleep I dreamed that I had a near-death experience. I do not remember what exactly caused me to almost die in my dream (that part is a little foggy), but the near-death experience was unlike any that I have experienced before.It started out normally; my spirit rose from my body and began to move toward the white light. But then it took a strange turn. God appeared surrounded by angels in full majesty. What happened to Saint Peter and the gates? I do not know. God triumphantly dismissed the angels and gestured for me to come near. He let his undulating robe slide off of his right shoulder. My eyes closed and my lips were drawn to his percolating teet. I was too busy euphorically gulping the divine milk to ask myself how a man was lactating. In retrospect, I guess, God can do anything. The milk started to run down my chin. I drank from the supernal breast effortlessly. I did not have to suck; the milk flowed in its white glory as if from a garden hose. The milk ran down my neck and moistened my shirt. I looked up at God and said, "It feels so good going down my throat." He nonchalantly responded with a "That's what she said." That caused me chortle. I gained my composure and returned to the teet. The last thing that I remember is that my socks were wet. There were pools of milk on the floor.When I awoke my glass of Tuscan milk was empty, as was the jug. The floor, the French toast and I were all covered in milk. Does this mean that Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is produced by God himself? Was my dream a sign? Does it matter? No, not really. Just enjoy the milk.
title: Please enter a title for your review:

body: The day I got this milk was a day I'll never forget. The UPS guy just hurled it out of his truck as he drove by. It smashed through my window and scared the [..] out of me, but it was the right choice, I think. It was like he was saying, "HEY! Wake up to the idea of this crazy MILK, man!" And boy was he right, if that is what he was saying. As it came through the window, it hit a table corner and burst open. I didn't even have to think--I dove right in, getting down on all fours and lapping up the gushing milk as it came flying out of the plastic remnants in great seizures of ecstatic goodness. It seemed like there was a lot of milk, and that it just kept coming, but that was probably just time slowing down. I also felt like I was being buffeted by some great force, but that turned out to be the neighborhood kids jostling me, as they too jockeyed for position, milk slamming into their eager faces. There really was a lot of milk, the more that I think about it. A really good bargain, even with the cost of delivery.
title: The Day

body: this is by far the most awesome thing ever but my shrink says if I take these pills i won't see you guys anymore
title: Awesome

body: When I got my gallon Tuscan whole milk I took a swig immediately. I could not help but to notice the Elder Sign on the cap, it must be there to keep it fresh and keep those pesky polyps out. 'twas a little warm seeing that I just got it out of my mail box ( I live in Phoenix) but I felt something, something strange. I could feel sounds and taste feelings. I also got the sudden urge to strip down and dance in the middle of the street. Every now and then I hear dark whispers, but the benefits far out weigh the risks. I recommend this product, 5/5
title: The Elder Sign Logo Must Help With The Freshness

body: A while back when my wife and I were adding gift ideas to the Bridal Registry a friend suggested that we check out Tuscan Milk on Amazon because it can be added to our list. Well! Low and behold we went onto Amazon and as sure as Jeff Bezos is a genius, the milk was awaiting us. On our day of bliss we received gallon upon gallon of milk, and now sadly we are lactose intolerant.Just the other day,my wife whispered about the pitter patter of tiny feet, and immediately we both said "Let's see if we can add Tuscan Milk to the wish list for our baby(s)??!!" Well faith and begorrah, there it was again and just as God made little green apples, we have added Tuscan milk to our baby(s) registry.Late last night, I received a call from best friend who had once confided in me that his wife was "barren". I had told him in strict confidence that if he and his wife of 50 years had drank some Tuscan before bed as a night cap that their long days of un-pitter-pattered floors would soon be over. He screamed into the phone "hallelujah I'm gonna be a daddy and it's all thanks to Tuscan milk." Now,wonder of wonders miracle of miracles I felt that I  had to add my two cents to heap the Praises of Johanna on Tuscan milk. Thank you Amazon, Mr. Bezos and especially the Tuscan cows.
title: A Bride's Gift, A Baby's Dream..

body: I normally only drink powdered milk. For the longest time, that was as good as it got, then this sultry mistress of milky goodness came marching into my life. I've found to best extract the true dynamic flavors of this elixir of the gods, all one need do is simply this:1. Open Tuscan Whole Milk.2. Pour directly on face and chest.3. Gesticulate wildly.4. Eat hand fulls of fudge.5. Watch law and order.mission accomplished.....
title: Milk from the teats of Vishnu him/her self...

body: I'm a big milk fan.  I've been drinking it my whole life, I even suspect I drank it as a little baby.  Which just shows my dedication to this miracle of bovine excretions.  But Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. Oz. changed my whole perception of milk.  Being a clever fellow, I bought this used and decided against expedited shipping - I mean, I already have milk, I can wait a week or so for some more.  When I finally got it and started pounding straight from the jug, I was pleasantly surprised to find clumps of milk sticking in my throat!  Inspired, I poured it into a bowl and ate the rest with a spoon.  No cereal required!  Now I save tons of cash not buying oatmeal, cereal, or chocolate chip cookies.  Who needs them when the milk itself is a food?  I just have a continuous flow of Tuscan Whole Milk delivered via standard shipping.  All true milk fans rejoice!
title: Chunky style

body: It was well into the morning when they came back. I could see the dust long before I saw the car or the heard the engine. Driving too fast, I said to myself, they must be drunk again. The car screamed into the farm cul-de-sac before swinging one hundred and eighty degrees in a shower of rocks and dust. I stood up from the farm stoop and peered through the redish haze in the early morning sun. Clarice was in the car, and next to her was her boyfriend, Tuscan Whole Milk. She had reached around his rectangular cardboard body and was running her hand up and down the back of his carton where I couldn't see. I wonder if she even knows what shame is, I asked myself. She sat and stroked his nutritional information in broad daylight."Clarice!" I called, "Get inside now before your mother sees this."She ignored me. I hadn't expected anything different."Hey, Old Man!" Shouted the Tucan milk, "Why don't you suck my cream? Your daughter does, and look how big she's got?" With this, they both errupted into laughter.I felt my face turn red with embarassment. I kept it quiet for as long as I could, but I knew people would find out. What kind of a man lets his good, Christian daughter date a Milky? And an Italian Whole at that? I limped back inside and made my way up the staircase. The rail was soft like 10-day old milk. Gotta clean her sheets, I said, it's starting to smell like a cow barn in there...
title: I'll Never Raise My Hand in Hate Again, Not Even Against a Milky

body: There is a lot of hype about this milk and some of it just looks like the lies they tell on infomercials instead of true testimonials. This probably will as well but it is true.I was a teenager in Italy about the time all the psas were on American tv about milk. You know the ones. Geeky kids, skinny and plain girls telling the people who were picking on them "I drink milk" and showing how good they looked when they grew up. I'm sure millions of kids who saw those commercials decided right then they needed a glass of milk. I haven't seen any of the commercials though.I was in Italy, drinking Italian milk. A geeky boy who spent hours playing role playing games and could tell you more than you ever needed to know about Jack Kirby's X-men. The sort of guy you would assume would grow up to be an adult man in my parents basement playing role playing games and spending my paychecks on comic books.After I graduated high school, I joined the Army like my step-dad. Lived in Germany for a while, then back stateside until I left the Army because I was all I could be.After a year back home, I sold almost everything I owned for a plane ticket to Alaska. After I was there for about a year, I met a lady on an online old-fashioned MBBS RPG. You know how sexy gamer girls are, this one was even more special. She was an exotic dancer with pink hair, the sort of person who would never be with geek like me.We got to know each other, and she threw herself at me. She didn't seem to realize that I was a total geek with a comic book habit. She said I looked like Tom Cruise on steroids, or was that Pee Wee Herman on Big Macs? I don't remember. We started dating, and she became my wife.These days? I'm a well-respected professional in my field, I make enough money to pay for all the comic books I want, and I have a gorgeous wife.I know it's because I drank milk, because I was lucky enough to be able to spend those formative years in Italy where Italian milk is easy to find.If you love your teens, this milk is well worth the price, it's worth any price. It leads to happy futures even for dice and comic book collecting geeks.
title: True Story

body: My Tuscan only had 4 points.
title: Three Stars

body: I'm quite disappointed with this product.Although there is a farm nearby, I purchased from Amazon, expecting that it would be compatible with another amazon product I had previously purchased,Milk Glass Cup LED Night Light Lamp.My night light has been dimming recently, and I assumed that I'd be able to simply add more of this product to regain the lost light output.I used almost half of the container, but did not see any increase in light whatsoever.I will continue to try to make this product work; the package seems to light up when I open the refrigerator door, so perhaps I'm doing something wrong- I intend to call Tuscan technical support, and will update this review if they they can get the product to work properly.
title: not compatible with milk glass night lamp!

body: If you want to sip from the teat of the Annunaki, then you have come to the right place. After my first, creamy 8oz serving, I noticed an ever-so-slight change in my perception. By the time I reached the end of the jug, purged my bowels and left the bathroom, I had an overwhelming drive to burrow into the hollowness of the Earth's core. I resisted, and instead began to enslave my neighbors.I find that if I allow my humble minions a drop of this precious elixer per day, they are more apt to do my bidding and help me take over the planet come this December 21.Thanks, Tuscan Milk! Enki salutes you!
title: Activated My Reptilian DNA

body: It works great on my hair and made it so silky.
title: Five Stars

body: so last week I was pouring myself a bowl of cornflakes, and when I walked over to my milk cow to sqeeze out some milk I was disapointed to find that the cow had run dry. so the next day after  leaving it's body on the side of the road I went down to my local cattle supplier for another milk cow. I took it home, squeezed a cup or so into my cornflakes and decided to logoto the internets while eating my (now stale) cornflakes. then I come across this site and I'm all like " doubleyou-tee-eff?! ". that's right, apparently amazon had come up with the idea to sell milk seperate from cows! needless to say, the convenience of having them send me milk by the gallon from across the country sounded great. and that I only had to wait a week or so for it to arrive only sweetened the pot! it's just a shame that I had to find this out after buying a whole nother cow. so two ours ago I put ol' bessie down and ordered a gallon of this fine milk product. oh the wonders of modern technology!
title: why buy the cow when you can get the milk for $3.99?

body: Tuscan Whole Milk.You will not find a better gallon of any liquid this side of the liquid gold plantation out in Kentucky. Me and mammy wait every day for the delicious Tuscan milk that only them filthy Tuscans themselves can make right. What with all the homogenization and refrigeration these days, it seems like milk just ain't what it used to be, thankfully Tuscan Whole Milk is doing its best to bring about change.Mmm mmm, there's nothing like the feeling of that smooth, delicious milk running down the back of your parched throat. It brings me back to the days of my youth, poor but proud. Mammy would bring home a jug of freshly picked moo-juice for me and my 13 brothers and sisters, and we would all try to get what we could from that steaming fresh drink. I was the smallest, so I never got any. I still loved it though! Just the thought of having some of it made my mouth water.That's why now, after 7 years and 12 deaths in the family, I'm glad to finally get some of that luscious Tuscan whole milk. Me, Mammy, and my brother Cletus all slowly take in the sweet smell of Tuscany, and remember our beloved departed. We remind ourselves that milk, like a fine wine, ages gracefully. That's why we store our milk in the potato cupboard for seven weeks before we drink it.I'm not saying Tuscan Whole Milk, in all of its 128 fl oz glory, is the right choice for you and your money-conscious family, but just remember this old parable that Pappy used to tell us before he left us for a milk-maid:"There'll be plenty of time for life experiences later on; savor your Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz like it was your last. Now bend over and spread 'em."
title: Nothing finer

body: If you have no weapons, I don't recommend Tuscan Milk.  Instead, I recommend getting a set of nunchucks or a club.  A broom stick or a brick are good too. If you can't find anything at all, you can buy the book Combat Without Weapons available on Amazon.  Tuscan Milk does not work well as a weapon because it is hard to swing and difficult to throw.  It also can't be used to stop any bullets.  I read on a website that it can stop a knife, once.  That's not really worth it to me.  Unless you are attacked by cats, and need a distraction, you probably don't need Tuscan Milk.  I wish someone had written a review like this before I bought the milk. I hope this review is helpful.
title: Not as good as Nunchucks

body: It was a warm summer day in the hills of Tuscany...and as a breeze ruffled my hair and a bead of sweat formed upon my brow, an epiphany occured to me..."What better way to quench my thirst than a cold gallon of milk?"  It had to be Tuscan milk of course, and whole milk at that..no halfway milk for me.  Alas, I had no milk, so I sat dejected on the hilly Tuscan mountainside and let my mind wander to thoughts of that sensuous liquid of the breast.  The hours passed, and the scorching sun grew more and more oppressive, and my thirst only became more unquenchable.  Then...suddenly, a vision appeared, and my heart leapt with anticipation as a beautiful girl sauntered up the mountainside.  It was not she that stirred my soul, but the voluptous container with the scintillating red label that she rested in her bosom.  It was milk! Tuscan milk! Whole!  The rest of the moment was a blur, and perhaps too graphic to mention here, but I will just say I achieved true love...with a warm moist drop of whole milk falling gently down my lips.....
title: A story of love....

body: I was trying the "Special K" diet to lose a dress size in ten days but used the local grocery chain version of the cereal "Precious K". When buying it by the pallet, I saved nearly three dollars and twenty nine cents. Where I live, that is darn near the price for one gallon of middle gasoline. When i realized i could use the gift card my sister got me back in December for Amazon.com to buy my favorite milk from the east side....Easst Si-ide! I was elated. I was ready to eat nothing but Precious K and Tuscan Whole. To make a long story short, last week i had a quadruple bipass and they said the inside of my arteries looked like a mixture of blood and cottage cheese. Im not sure if it was the cereal or the milk that caused these adverse reactions, but I will get to the bottom of this. Right now I cant get out of bed, but I am sure that a month or so on Atkins will get me moving again.
title: Precious K

body: Indeed, this is true. While walking to the supermarket, while receiving several women's phone numbers, requests for autographs, and reality television show offers (I, of course was wearing the incomparable Three Wolf Moon T-Shirt), I eyed a gallon of authentic, legitimate, 100% Grade-A Tuscan Whole Milk. Then, several ninjas in black suits approached me. "You are not worthy of the sacred milk. Leave us to our milk purchasing or you will be sushi." I fought them off with my 14 years of martial arts training and purchased the milk. Then, while drinking it at home from my titanium-coated platinum 163-karat goblet, I spilled a micro-millimeter drop of it on my Three Wolf Moon shirt. Then, I noticed a black hole vortex open up within my bachelor pad and suck in the gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk. Then, it ripped off my Three Wolf Moon shirt. It proceeded to close in and disappear. All of the best parts of my life had disappeared within this enormous mistake. Within the next few hours, I sold everything I owned to buy more milk. But, it was only Tuscan 2% Low-fat Milk. I also tried on several imitation Three Wolf Moon shirts to improve my life, such as Four Wolf Moon, Three Wolf Crescent, and Three Moon Wolf. None of them had the same effect. I started to suffer through a series of nervous breakdowns, and I finally checked into the Amazon Oddities Rehabilitation Center, to meet other suffering people going through withdrawls of Tuscan Whole Milk, Three Wolf Moon T-Shirt, and Fresh Whole Rabbit. Today, I am a humble man, struggling to get by, relegated to cleaning bathrooms in McDonald's. I live in the dark corridors of my mother's basement, typing this sad tale on a Emachine.The moral of this story is: Never spill a drop of Tuscan Whole Milk on your Three Wolf Moon T-Shirt.
title: DANGER-ONLY THOSE WHO CAN HANDLE THE MILK SHALL CONSUME IT

body: I ordered the Tuscan Whole Milk about a week ago, and it finally came today. The packaging was less exciting than I anticipated, but you can still see my unboxing video on YouTube.The first thing I thought when I got it was "WOW, this thing is heavy!" If you are looking for a slimline gallon of milk, this product isn't for you. Also, a word of warning: Tuscan Milk does NOT come with instructions! I had to spend hours looking up on the internet how to use this stuff. Right, so once I figured out how to get the top off (they don't make it easy!), I poured it in a glass (not included! check out Bormioli Rocco Verdi  Cappuccino Cup With Stainless Steel Handle, Set of 4, Gift Boxed). This is when things turned sour. I recently got one of those new iPod shuffles Apple iPod shuffle 4 GB Black (3rd Generation), and I like to keep it clipped to my shirt, but it's not very good and the clip didn't hold. The iPod fell in the cup with the Tuscan Whole Milk. Well, whatever the Tuscan Milk did to my iPod, it's ruined now! It won't turn on or sync with my iTunes or anything D: If Tuscan Milk can do that to my iPod, I can't imagine what it will do to your body. This stuff is dangerous! I threw it out straight away!!!Would NOT buy again!
title: BUYER BEWARE. This will ruin your iPod.

body: This review is to be posted only in the event of my death by assassination.During one of the early campaigns, I started opening my speeches with the same line and it sort of became my signature: "I drink Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and I'm here to recruit you."If I was speaking to a slightly hostile or mostly lactose intolerant audience, I'd try to break the tension with a joke about non dairy creamer.I fully realize that a person who stands for what I stand for - an activist, an activist for Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz - becomes the target or potential target for a person who is insecure, terrified, afraid or very disturbed themselves. Knowing that I could be assassinated at any moment, I feel it's important that some people should understand my thoughts. I wish I had time to explain everything I did. Almost everything that was done was done with an eye on the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz...
title: MILK

body: There comes a time in a woman's life when she foolishly does something to make the love of her life leave. I am that woman. You see, I was madly in love with this jug of Tuscan milk. However, Tuscan milk was gone many nights a week. Oh you know the story. Tuscan would assist people who had trouble digesting grandma's brownies, etc. One night I was lonely. Tuscan hadn't called. I remembered that bottle of Yoohoo in the fridge. It looked at me as if to say "wanna have a little fun?" I let my bad judgement get the best of me. I took that bottle of Yoohoo and wrapped my lips around it. I chugged it down good. Suddenly the doorknob turned. It was Tuscan. How Tuscan managed to turn the door handle, I'll never know. "How could you?!" he yelled. My philtrum was covered with Yoohoo. The chocolatey goodness running down my chin. I had been caught. "But baby you mean everything to me!" I told Tuscan holding back tears. I told Tuscan I was lonely. That excuse didn't fly. Now I sit here broken hearted all because I had an affair. Tuscan if you're reading this, remember the good times we had? Remember the time you sat out in the hot sun and got curdled and I put you in an empty container and wrote "cottage cheese" on it? We gave it to the homeless people and they threw up. Remember how funny that was, Tuscan?. I guess it's true what they say. "We'll always have that box of Mrs.Field's Cookies"
title: *sniff* I thought we had something special

body: Tuscan, a maker of milk and dairy products for over 100 years eventually came out with their 128 oz milk "gallon" best seller for nigh over 40 years, the gallon seems to be accepted by everyone from children to parents to grandparents. I unfortunately needed to give this milk 4 stars for two main reasons:128 Oz is too small for some uses, and I hear talk of a 256 oz version that they think will be about half the size, especially with the development of "thin milk", at 7 pounds, this isnt exactly pocket sized, I personally am waiting for the 1024 oz version that will be under 3X3X3"The White color scheme just screams "apple clone" and the fact that the packeging is so simple doesnt help either. I think they need to look at some new color schemes, like laquer red. although plastic is cheap, it is hardly trendy. I hope they fix this in version 2.0. of course you could always just buy this and use it to store in bulk and then take your old retro glass 64 oz version out, but with just 64 ounces you might be called "tiny" by your friends. the external appearences aside, the jug is very resilient, and while you might be afraid of the flexing, that flexing seems to do no major damage, just dont go dropping this thing off a building.
title: Tuscan 128 Oz Milk

body: I was born in '09 and raised on a chicken farm. I don't know much about the country, but I can gurantee you that it wasn't bigger than a drop of spit. Back in those days, that wasn't just a saying. How do you think my town of Spitsburg got its name?Anyway, we used to drive from Spitsburg to Salamantorno (don't ask about the name) to sell our chickens. One day, pappy had an idea. What about using magic to enhance the chicken's growth?Magic was forbidden at the time, and I guess it still is. Pappy was had a bad aim on an account of the fact that he had only one eye and he shot me with his chicken growth spell. That, madam, is why I am a chicken man.I traveled around, hiding myself in a cloak and hood. Feathers fell from me constantly. They were large feather. Think eagle, only much bigger. I eventually had to find a large mask as well to hide my beak. Unfortunately, my talons stuck out from underneath my pants. As it turns out, you can't hide that inside a boot. It's uncomforatable. So I traveled around as a guy in a cloak wearing a human mask walking on talons.I suppose since I was magic I could fly, but I didn't know that at the time, nor do I really right now. I carried a sword and was known as the Chickenfooted Hero of Spitsburg. I managed to kill a wanted criminal, reunited a swordssmith with his long lost horse, I made peace with the pigmies of South Traalk and talked them into making friends with the human folk.Then one day, a man came to me. He was a wizard. After what pappy did, I wasn't too fond of wizards, but he told me he could fix me. So I let him. Big mistake, I tell you. What I didn't know is that wizards could only specialize in certain parts of magic. He thought I was a giant chicken, not a man chicken. He tried to turn me full into a chicken by shrinking me, but I ended up as you see me today: a dwarf chickenman. And so now I need to stay at your fine cabin the night so I can fly up that mountain and see a proper wizard about becoming human again.I had stayed at the cabin of the woman whom I had told the story to and then set off on my journey up the mountain. I was lucky to have feathers because it was blistering cold as I went up. Eventually I reached the top and saw a cloaked man sitting on a cushion with his face hidden."Good sir," I exclaimed, "I have come to seek a spell to reverse another spell.""Let me guess," he said, his breath puffing in the air, "You seek the spell to undo that horrible mountain climbing curse."I stared blankly at him. It must've been a sight to see: a chicken staring stupidly at a supposed wiseman."You are speechless, my son," he said."Sorry," I replied, "I was just taken aback is all.""Fine. Do continue, please.""Well, a spell backfired when I was a child and it turned me into a giant chicken. Another wizard made me short. So now I'm a dwarf chicken man. Do you think you can help?"The old man laughed and pushed back his hood, revealing the head of a goat."I don't think so, but I can make you your old height."At least that was something, I guess...The two of us then proceeded into town where this delicious milk was being sold. We both drank a glass of it and we easily forgot our troubles about being part animal.Thank you, milk!
title: How I became human once again.

body: Back when my family immigrated into this country, times were tough.  People were out of work, families, torn apart with the fear of the unknown looming over their heads.  The one constant...milk.The sweet, delicious, run-down-your-chin white froth never disappointed.  It never made poor investment decisions.  In fact, it invested in us, the American people.Whether you were from here, whether you came by boat, by train, or by burro, milk's stomach filling reassurance gave you hope for the future.Well, here we are now.  The economy in shambles, our grip on the world, slipping.  Can you save us, milk?  Can you help us return to glory?We pray to thee, bovine nectar, the everflowing juice.  Save us.
title: Milk - our lives, our freedom.

body: I replaced the oil in my Harley with Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. The bike doesn't run anymore I am giving this 4 stars because not wanting to waste it I went ahead and  drained the bike and put it back in the fridge to use on my cereal. It was still cold and refreshing and for that Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz I thank you.
title: It was still tasty

body: I bought a gallon two months ago and I'm still having horrible digestive problems
title: ... a gallon two months ago and I'm still having horrible digestive

body: I first heard about Tuscan Whole Milk in the summer of 62, oh what a summer that was. I was on the side of the road in a broken down bus full of free thinkers and free love when a smallish man with close cropped hair slid onto the seat beside me. He looked around as if he were a man in trouble and then he whispered to me, "I have to get out of here, man, you with me?" I shook my head puzzled; San Fran was my destination and this bus was going to take me all the way. The man made as if to go so I asked, "What's the problem dude?" He grasped my arm and said, "A bus load of you guys are going to attract some serious authoritarian attention, and tormenting you guys will fill a few summer afternoons." The man had a point so I too looked around worried, grabbed my bag, and fled into the woods with this gnomish man. After an hour of running through the brush we stopped and sat down, hot scratched, and tired. I pulled out my pipe and he pulled out a bottle. It was an empty milk bottle. Once I regained my senses I asked him if he were a dodger. He replied that he was. I sympathized and said that I thought the war was bad, but to my surprise he said, "NO, I liked the war. People think the domino effect is bogus but if the US really sticks it to the Vietcong, win or loose, other countries will think twice about going all commie." I was getting ready with a baby killing tirade when I asked the now obvious question, "Then why did you run man?" He took a deep breath and said, "The milk man, it was the milk. We have the best guns, tanks, helicopters, and training but then they go and throw the war away by having the worst milk. I came home to get myself a jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz."
title: The quest

body: the best often die by their own handjust to get away,and those left behindcan never quite understandwhy anybodywould ever want toget awayfromTuscan whole milk, 1 gallon,128 fl oz...I'm sure they never tried it.
title: tuscan effect.

body: There are many positives associated with the product - from cow to bowl and udder to cup, it is undoubtedly a good milk - but there are nevertheless a number of problems which have gone unnoticed in some of the more favourable reviews.Chief amongst my concerns is the complete inability of the milk to function in any format other than the (admittedly most popular) white liquid variety. An iced version and perhaps a model which incorporated straws into the design would have been welcome additions, but Tuscan appears to have opted for the mainstream route and prohibited its customers from pursuing any other avenues of enjoyment.Coupled with this, the screwcap is a misleading, two directional contraption with questionable accessibility value. The majority of cats, who constitute a significant section of the target market, will be quite incapable of operating the device by themselves and any attempts to open the item under water are unlikely to prove successful. When I first purchased the item I made this mistake and ruined a perfectly good batch of Tuscan (along with my water), so this should really have been mentioned at some point in the instruction manual. Likewise, as a commentary on eccentrics, introverts and loners, the work is next to useless.Ultimately, I have to say that I was more impressed by what the milk intended to be than what it actually achieved.
title: Good milk but ultimately flawed

body: I'm not a milk snob, but I must admit that I've had better, but at a much higher cost however.  Honestly, my budget does not permit me to afford the luxury of milks in this class too often, but for this balance of flavor and price, I will save up my pennies.  My friend, a true lacto-connoisseur introduced me to this milk the same night she introduced me to Norwegian long milk, and I must admit this was a true pleasure (the long milk made me sick).  I saved a portion of this milk in my goblet for dipping the authentic Oreo dessert cookie she offered after dinner... DIVINE!!  If you can afford this fine cow juice on a daily basis, you should get a good security system :)  I'm stingy with my star ratings, saving fives for very rare products, so don't be put off by 3.  Try this if you can, or share the cost with friends and have a milk dinner.  Enjoy!
title: Saving up for a gallon of my own...

body: $45 a gallon seems like a savings, given how much our cow milk service costs here. Just having the cow milk truck come by costs $600 a month plus the cost of the cow milk, and then the man has to spend time away from his pantry at early O'Clock in the morning to bring in the fresh bottles and stock them throughout the cottage. If Amazon can stock cow milk for less from Tuscan farms then it seems like a sound investment on my part. I already buy boat wax, walking stick wipes, luxury dog water, and other essentials on these internet sites, why not cow milk?
title: I'll bite

body: I wish I could tell you that Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz fought the good fight, and the curdling process let it be. I wish I could tell you that - but milk is no fairy-tale world. It never said who did it, but we all knew. Things went on like that for a while - milk life consists of routine, and then more routine. Every so often, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz would show up with fresh lumps. The curdling process kept at it - sometimes it was able to fight it off, sometimes not. And that's how it went for Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz - that was its routine. I do believe those first two years were the worst for it, and I also believe that if things had gone on that way, this place would have got the best of it.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz Could Be A Friend To You

body: Usually I'm a pretty thrifty guy, but when I saw an entire gallon of Tuscan Whole Milkfor only 48 dollars, I knew I would kill myself later for not splurging. Now NormallyI'm not a huge fan of Italian milks because they skirt the fine line between cheese andmilk that often leaves them unpleasantly chunky. However, I was pleasantly surprisedby how smooth the texture was. It was like drinking a milk flavored milkshake! Despiteits surprising smoothness I would still bring along a few napkins when drinking this,any "milk mustaches" you get will quickly turn into an unsightly paste if left on for morethan a few seconds.Also, I know the old adage is "Italian Milk, Italian food" but I would highly recommenda single toasted peanut butter and Jelly sandwich for a sophisticated yet homey mealFinally, words of warning for those new to Italian milks, prepare to spend at least a fewexcruciating hours in the bathroom afterward. I wouldn't recommend using an Italianmilk to show off to your friends if this is your first foray into the dynamic world of milkappreciation. I would go with something English. Their cows live on a diet of beef andbutter that really lends their milk a hearty taste that is sure to knock to socks off anybudding milk connoisseurs. I would also try something Indian. The reverence they holdtowards cows make any milk produced by that country a slightly salty/sweet taste that issure to curl your toes!
title: Worth Every Penny

body: The Jundland Wastes are not to be traveled lightly. This is the perfect beverage for such a desert crossing. Beware of Tuscan Raiders.
title: Perfect for the Jundland Wastes

body: The Tuscan milk was delivered to my home half full.  The safety ring on the cap had been removed, and the milk smelled of burnt leaves and pepto bismol.  I ordered a "new" gallon...  It looks as if someone drank my damn milk and replaced it with goat semen and pickle seasoning, a common substitute for fresh Tuscan milk.  I decided to drink the remaining contents in my $45.00 gallon of fresh "white", and ended up liking it.  For that, I give 3 stars.
title: Jug was half full...?

body: I live in Florida having moved here 2 years ago after a painful and nasty divorce...the details of which will soon be published in a book I am working on. Anyway...I often borrow a friends boat and take my kids camping out on some of the tiny Islands that dot the Indian River. A few weeks ago..I took my kids to one of the islands and we set up camp and ate and the kids all bedded down for the night. I have to dock the boat about 50feet from shore so if a storm comes up which is typical this time of year..the motors will not get damaged or grounded. I remembered something i wanted to retrieve and it was late but the moon was bright so I waded out to the boat to retrieve some items I would need in the morning. After I climbed aboard...I suddenly heard a scraping noise and then some pretty loud thuds!!!I looked into the water and to my horror there next to the boat was a gigantic alligator...the largest I had ever seen. I have never before seen anything in the Indian River like this...manatees, dolphins a couple of bull sharks and once a tiny alligator but this bad boy was 6 feet and must have weighed as much as a VW!!!!! Now I am cut off from the island and my kids and this beast is ramming my little boat!!! I began to throw everything I could find at the beast...nothing stopped him....he just kept ripping pieces of my little boat off...water was rushing in!!!  As he kept working on the back of the boat and the water was rising..the whole boat began to pitch down into the water. I realized pretty soon this thing could climb aboard!!! My whole life flashed before me. I thought about my life now, my kids, my hopes and dreams...I thought about my ex husband..lets just call him AL...I thought about how bad he would feel when he found out how fabulous I look now compared to him as he has GAINED 20 lbs. even though he and his 4th new "soulmate" are VEGANS!!!! But I digress...so anyway...I run to the front of the boat...get to the cooler and decide to throw this big item at the beasts head and knock it out...I raise the cooler over my head and pitch it at the giant head. The beast opens it's jaws and locks onto the cooler...it thrashed about in a frenzy above the water trying to dislodge its massive jaws from around the sides of the cooler. Suddenly...the top of the cooler swings open and a 128 fl. oz. carton of Tuscan milk flops out and bangs right into the little punching bag thingy at the back of his throat ( I would have said "uvula" but my exhusband never finished High School and we will lose him here or else he will think I meant the beast was a female)while the beast was having a huge gag reflex event..I managed to quickly grab an emergency flare gun...shoot the cooler and although I did not manage to kill the beast...he is now blind and seems to have disappeared from the area. Thank you Tuscan thank you!!!
title: Tuscan Milk saved my life

body: Cruel, cruel Amazon masters, why do you taunt me with offers of delicious, healthy Tuscan Whole Milk, only to reveal that it is nigh impossible to have said milk delivered to my humble abode?  What sins have I committed against your venerable e-commerce site, or the winding, tropical river from which its name derives?  I ask only that you give me one final chance to taste the resplendent white nectar, one final chance and then I shall never implore you again to offer it.  If this is impossible, please, direct me to the simple Tuscan dairy where I might acquire it in person, so that I may make a pilgrimage and reach that land of milk and possibly honey (I haven't seen Tuscan honey on your vast inventory, but I would not be the least bit suprised if it turned out to be a superior, delectably sweet variety of honey).
title: Cruel Amazonians, taunt me not with empty promises of milk

body: I went to Tuscanny one time for a business condference and all the people in the village we had the conference on were always talking in Italliano about the milks that were so great! I didn’t want to have to travel back to there again for something like that, so this is the next best think to have in your refigertor! Its sooooo good to save money on the traveling expnses all over to just get this kind of milk product?
title: Make it so great!!!!

body: Note, do NOT make the same mistake I did!No matter what the seductive packaging says, this RIAA approved Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is *not* DRM free. I tried Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz with my funky new Kindle and... nothing. I suspect I received a repackaged Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz that had already been installed on the original user's Kindle.However, the Kindle is also an awkward container for this product. Quick Fix Synthetic Urine is obviously tailored with the Kindle in mind.Thumbs up on Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz simply for the bold and brash (yet deceitful) packaging.
title: Beware!

body: In 1715, a Dutch chemist discovered a bacterium that could clot wounds with surprising efficency. While on vacation in Italy, he invented what is now known as the Salk Vaccine. Introduced into a wild boar population near Florence, the vaccine quickly spread throughout the European pig population. Experts estimate that the crossover to the domestic pig genome occured sometime in late 1802, on the property of a Flemish farmer named Bill. The vaccine bypassed the normal functions of the mammary ducts in the domestic stock, and when a calf was suckled on one of these "superpigs" following a tragic hayride incident, the vaccine was intorduced into the bovine community.Quick to take advantage of this, Tuscan farmer Mario Luigico bought the entire affected herd and oved them to his sun-dappled plot in Tuscany. To this day, the superior milk of this farms continues to help battle arcane cancers and pus-filled chancres across the globe, all at a reasonable price (shipping and handling not included)
title: 128 fl oz of pure, creamy love

body: If it wasn't for Tuscan Whole Milk, I'd still be alive today. But instead I'm forced to communicate with you through Amazon.com reviews... and only Amazon.com reviews.So anyway, I come home early from work the other morning and I go into the restroom and flip on the lights. I find a kitten frantically trying to open up the window. It was too heavy.  He was clearly breaking and entering.  I grab a hand gun that I hoped I would never have to use, and tell the kitten to "freeze!" and "keep your paws where I can see them!"  The kitten was breathing heavily and looking around the room trying to find anyway out of this horrible situation."Please don't kill me, this isn't what it looks like.", the kitten pleaded. "Look she approached me ok.  What was I going to do, say no? I mean I see you living hear in your perfect house with your perfect wife. Is it so wrong for me to want the same?  If I am the only creature on this earth guilty of envy then go ahead and shoot me right now.  End this horrible sin once and for all with me.At this point, frankly, I was stunned.  I mean... I couldn't speak. I just stood there frozen."But let me tell you this", the kitten continued.  "If you pull that trigger, some believe I will still have 8 more lives left and you better believe I will use each and every one them to sleep with your wife again. So don't waste your time."The feeling of rage was building up inside me. But I just couldn't pull the trigger."That's what I thought. You are no better than me.  Listen to that voice inside you.  What is it saying?  Haven't you ever envied anyone?  Look, if you shoot me you will regret it for the rest of your life."He was right.  What right did I have to criticize, let alone kill, this kitten for something that I too, in some ways, was guilty of?"That's better. Yes, put... put the gun down", the kitten said in a soft calming voice. "Now go in there and look at your wife. Look deep into her eyes and tell her that you love her.  If you took the time to do that every once in a while, then well, maybe we wouldn't be in this situation"I set the gun down and do what the kitten says. By this time, tears were streaming down both of our faces, eyes red, and lips quivering.The kitten, taking advantage of the situation, picks up the gun and holds it hard against the back of my head. "I'm sorry but I must do this. I can't live like this anymore... It's not even about her anymore man.  It's the Tuscan whole milk.  That's how she kept luring me in. I couldn't help myself. I'm hooked. My skin crawls if I'm away from it for only a moment. She is my only source, man! I'll do whatever I have to do for the creamiest, most delicious, whitest milk I've ever tasted!"  (He was totally right. I've had the milk. It is good.)Then, after a moment's pause... BANG!!!!I lifelessly drop to the floor and I find myself having what they call an out of body experience.The kitten slowly lowers the gun.  He looks at what he has done.  He backs up against the wall. Paw prints made with blood scatter the floor.  He decides he couldn't live this life anymore and turns the gun on himself.After several minutes of silence my wife enters the bathroom in the arms of her lesbian lover. Their plan worked perfectly. They knew it would. What kind of kitten could resist Tuscan Whole Milk. From the day they were approached in the alley by the kitten they knew this was their chance... their one chance to erase the life ahead of them and start fresh. They chopped up our bodies and stored them in the attic then headed to the airport with two tickets to Mexico. This chapter was all over. For them, a new one would begin tomorrow...I gave this milk 4 stars because quite frankly it has the best texture of any milk I've tasted. It is completely deserving of 5. However, I just couldn't give it 5 because I still blame it for my untimely death. However, it's hard to blame the milk. Maybe if we tried to create a better life for these strung-out kittens this kind of story wouldn't happen. Instead we reduce them to living in the alleys, shelling out sexual favor for one more lick of the sweet taste of Tuscan Whole Milk.  Should we expect less from these kittens?
title: The Perfect Milk... in the end ultimately worth dying for.

title: It. Cures. Everything.

body: I've been to Nam. I've had my feet pulled out by long bamboo tongs of justice, and left my own entrails lying in the swampy depths of Cambodian marshes. I've beaten a man to death with his own shrimp boat and never looked back. I'm no stranger to pain.But on this morning, in July, I was presented with a most painful sight: a Vietnamese delivery man bringing me a plastic tub full of groceries. Within that tub lay my bastion: milk.But before that slant could bring the tub to my door, he pulled a knife out of his belt and went for my throat. It was 1971 all over again.I wheeled him to the floor and put my foot on his throat. "DI DI MAU! DI DI MAU!" I shouted, hoping--nay-- praying to Jesus above that this man did not have a grenade in his pocket.But it was not my lucky day, and the good lord in his infinite wisdom, decided to punish me for my past transgretions. The small man's neck slithered out from under my boot and whipped up towards my face with lightening speed. I dove for cover, but the bent, serpentine thing surrounded me and began to squeeze.now the man stood and looked into my eyes. His squinty black balls danced with madness as the pierced my gaze. In that pale moment, he was the embodiment of vengeance. But I had one last trick up my sleeve.I wiggled an arm free and managed to grab ahold of my favorite porcupine stripping brush. I slammed the pointed thing into my entrapper's twisted and distorted face with a force heretofore unsee on this green Earth.He fell backwards and his neck-meats loosened to free me. The brush stood, covered in his black Vietnamese blood, from a gash in his cheek. It's shiny carapace pulsed with the flow of his heart.In a moment, I was upon him again, driving my hand into his solar plexus and my foot into his groin. I grabbed a wet sponge and stuffed it into his nasal cavity, twisting my fist once it was swallowed whole by the man's face.And with a tiny, almost unnoticeable click, his brain snapped. He lay dead, my victory apparent in his wild-eyed disbelief. His death mask was one I'd seen before. Many times before.In the eyes of my favorite dairy farmers.And I will find this farmer, for his milk is made by slaves. He sucks it from their very teats with vigor and stallwart dedication. I will break him. This Tuscan man.
title: A middling effort by a stable of half-bred cows

body: My dirty new friends came over last night to freebase heroin and pop barbituates soaked in adrenochrome. Unfortch, being new to drug fiendery, I didn't have any of that stuff.So I mixed some Tuscan Whole Milk with some ether and some Lysol, and then boiled the solution down to a paste. Then I dipped a pack of Parliament Lights into it, and we smoked them while sucking on a horse tranquilizer lozenge.You know what? I SAW GOD. He looks a bit like Hank Azaria, but it was definitely Him. So I'd say, get some Tuscan Whole Milk for your next freak-out. Maybe skip the Lysol -- that was a bad idea.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk blew my mind

body: I had high hopes for Tuscan Whole Milk. I had to prove to myself that TWM was truly a superior alternative to Bessie, who will be retiring in a couple years. I asked my wife to assist me in a double blind taste test comparison. We went out to the barn and she hung up the TWM at the same level as Bessie's udder. She then blindfolded me and spun me around so I would not know which milk I was drinking first.Milk source "A" was creamy and warm, and my lips were rewarded by closing on a soft, smooth, supple milk delivery device. The flavor was natural and buttery, rolled around on the tongue with a delightful smooth sensation. I was very pleased and the experience only left me wanting more. Sampling from source A brought back distant memories from the recesses of my brain, from both my infant days and a few weekends in high school.Milk source "B" was cold and made my tongue get all goosebumpy. It was not nearly as creamy and buttery, and my esophagus rebelled at being chilled as I swallowed. The orafice of the milk container, rather than being warm and soft and delightfully squishy, was hard and sharp edged, and I had to open my jaw to its full extent to fit it into my mouth. Instead of a pleasant, slow delivery controllable by the actions of my tongue and jaw muscles, the icy cold milk came out all at once and went all over my face. I thought I was in danger of drowning or suffocating. My clothing was all covered in icy milk. This was not what I had come to expect in modern milk delivery devices.When the taste testing was completed, my wife removed my blindfold and I discovered that Milk Source "A" was old Bessie and "B" was Tuscan Whole Milk. Who would have thought that milk that you actually have to pay for would be so disappointing compared to milk that gets converted for free from grass in my pasture? I was SHOCKED. Shocked, I tell you. I determined that the extra effort needed to warm up TWM to a drinkable temperature and to transfer it to a drinking apparatus that could delight my tongue was not worth the advertised price. My humble advice is to not sell your cow until they find a way to address these serious flaws in lack of creaminess, chilly temperatures, uncontrolled delivery rate, and the oversized, uncomfortable orafice design.
title: Side by side comparison with my favorite cow teat

body: Tuscan Whole Milk Creed:...And Saint Gristedes raised his glass up on high, saying, "O Lord, bless this Thy empty glass that with it Thou mayest nourish Thine self with Thy mercy." And the Lord did grin and the angles did sing. The Lord spake, saying, "Gristedes, thou shalt receive Thy nectar of Thy grace. The blessed Tuscan Whole Milk!" And Saint Gristedes did gaze upon the light and say, "Oh Lord, how mayest Thy nourish Thine self with such?" And the Lord spake again, saying, "First shalt thou remove the Holy Safety Seal and Holy cap, then shalt hold to Thine mouth. The mouth be the place Thou shalt place the Tuscan Whole Milk, and the place shall be the mouth. Only the mouth shalt be the place, and the place shalt only be the mouth. Once Thou mouth has graced, drink thou thy Tuscan Whole Milk and be nourished, in my sight, with my blessing, forever and ever, till the cows come home." Amen.
title: Book of Lactose (Chapter 3, verses 5-13)

body: It was the last day of summer, and the Tuscan wind played with their hair. They leaned against the railing of the balcony, looking up at the stars. "In Italiano, we call it the Via Lattea," he said, savoring the last syllables of the Italian word like they were slices of creamy tiramisu.--"That's beautiful," she said, looking into his eyes with white thirst.--"Si." His arm grazed gently against hers. "If only...if only we had a gallon, one hundred..."--"...and twenty-eight fluid ounces?" she said, producing a gallon of Tuscan whole milk from the folds of her evening dress.--"How did you know?"--"Oh Amato," she said, "I've known all along."
title: The Tuscan Wind

body: While I'll admit that since I am felineI'm finicky, and while some may delightIn glasses filled with red Chianti wine,the drink I get from Tuscany is white.Plain, in cocoa, cereal or soup,O! Tuscan milk, my love for thee is true!When pouring, I adore the way you bloop--All other dairy products bow to you.Yes, Tuscan milk, how can one not love thee?You bring back memories of dear old Mom,and several hundred more agree with meIn their reviews on Amazon.com!Your gentle taste is sweet and smooth as silk.No other brand compares to Tuscan Milk.(*As recited in the video by Loki the Talking Cat.Typed with permission by one of his primate friends.)

body: "You smell that? You smell that?Tuscan Whole Milk, son. Nothing else in the world smells like that.I love the smell of Tuscan Whole Milk in the morning.You know, one time we had a milk spill, twelve hours, and when it was all over, I walked up...we didn't find one of them, not one stinking Italian body.The Smell! You know, that whole milk smell, the whole hill.Smelled like...victory.""Some day this breakfast's gonna end."
title: I love the smell of Tuscan Whole Milk in the morning...

body: I never thought I would like Tuscan milk.When I turned 13, my family had to leave our hometown on Kashyyyk due to a period of intense economic depression. We wondered the galaxy for a full year and was unable to find jobs anywhere on Naboo, Endor, Bespin, or Alderaan. The economy was in such a trough that not even Trade Federation affiliated corporations were hiring extra Wookies. Finally, Mom and Dad had given up hope and decided to settle on being seasonal moisture farmers on Tatooine.When we arrived at Tatooine, however, we were captured and robbed by a band of Tuscan Raiders who tortured and killed my parents for their refusal to give up the family bowcaster - I have held a grudge against the Tuscan ever since.Last month, while I was on delivery duty speeding across the desert, I became drowsy and drove headlong into a Sarlac pit. When I was within an inch of being devoured by the Tatooine ant-lion, a mysterious Twi'Lek Jedi Master flew by and dropped a gallon, 128 oz. of Tuscan milk into the sarlac's gaping orifice and said to me: "Forgive, not hate - for hate leads to the dark side."Before I could look, the Jedi master was gone, and the Tuscan milk had so highly satisfied the mighty Sarlac that he fell into food coma. I was then able to climb out of the pit and save myself.I will always remember the gallon, 128 oz. of milk that saved my life, and to heed the Twi'Lek's advice to forgive the Tuscan Raiders - after all, their sweet, sweet milk had saved my life.
title: The Enemy's Milk Saved My Life

body: In the darkest, most empty places in this life (which seem to be oh-so-more common than they should be), occasionally one finds some shamanistic object to relieve the crushing nothingness; the incredible agonising reduction to a point beyond infinity that means less than zero can somehow be mitigated for one shining second like razor blade slicing through pain made real.Somehow, this milk is able to achieve an almost post-modern symbolic status in this search for redemption and relief in a world covered in the ichor of stagnation; the life lived as damned from creation.As I sat in the darkness, trying to open my blank mouth enough to engorge my emotion starved pallet with this milk (or Mana in some deep and primordial sense), I realised that this was the one moment where I could someone free the psychic chains of a blind, angry God; one moment where the torture of infinity would break and offer a second of solace; of peace and meditation.At that very moment in time, at that critical second, I dropped the bottle and spilt all the milk onto the old, dead floorboards of my darkened kitchen. I saw the last drops evaporate like my dreams, leaving a stain like pain in the gloom.I should have realised that I was finished from the start. This milk was damned, as am I, but it was only doing what it was meant to do in this play of the soul - hence the 5 stars.Shipping was prompt and the label was nice, if a little tacky.
title: Enter the void

body: I ordered three gallons of this delightful beverage and had it sent to my post office box. Amazingly, the container is exactly the same size as my PO box. So now, when I want a delicious glass of milk, all I have to do is go to the post office, open the box, unscrew the cap, voila! Once they put my milk into the PO box so the bottom faced the door and I had to poke a hole in it and drink the whole gallon at once.

body: Serves me right for ordering art off the internet. I spoke with a customer representative about my Tuscan Whole Milk, and they assured me that the product will soon be available in different sizes and colors. I ordered the item believing I could exchange it if my decor didn't match, and I was dismayed to discover that the attractive Tuscan Whole Milk label only appears on one side. Its bulbous shape makes it unfit for wall hanging, and three sides of uniformly boring color (aside from the accenting red cap) make it impossible to display in the round. Purely a curio cabinet item, at least until alternative versions are designed. While the piece works conceptually, highlighting the dichotomy between consumerism and evanescence, it's practical realization is a disappointment. I'd recommend ordering a print, rather than the sculpture itself.
title: Overrated "masterpiece"

body: Every once and a while you come across a product that manages to redefine the genre. Tuscan Whole Milk is such a product. While other competitors tout add-ons such as 2%, skim, chocolate, or strawberry, Tuscon Whole Milk exposes these features for what they really are: gimmicks. To realize the genius of this milk, one needs only look at the effort that was put into this new product. The drawing board stage alone saw a complete rewrite of what it means to be milk and took over 50,000 cow hours. Perhaps the real secret, however, comes from the returning CEO Clarus. Clarus was one of the co-founders of Tuscan Milk but was pushed out of the company by the board of directors. Years later, the company, on the verge of of collapse, reinstated Clarus as acting CEO. Clarus immediately restructured the company and Tuscon Whole Milk is the first of a reported many new products. When questioned about future products and upgrades, however, Clarus simply responded "Moof!" This answer is simultaneously surprising and puzzling. Surprising because Clarus is usually very secretive and does not discuss future plans, and puzzling because nobody can quite figure out what it means. Sources close to the company have indicated, however,  that work in the newly developed genetics wing of the company have been stepped up. Reportedly a large number of dogs and cows have been seen entering the facility. Perhaps this is the "One More Thing" that has been rumored.
title: iMilk

body: Upon purchasing Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz. I was highly suspicious as to whether it would fulfill my lactic expectations. I waited, on edge, for 10 days until my Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz. arrived. I cautiously opened the lack luster packaging, I had no idea what was in store for me. The luminous white Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz. nearly blinded me, I immediately became aroused; a small moan escaped my wanting lips. I allowed myself a small touch, the red screw cap was ribbed in such a way I knew it would bring me pleasure unheard of ever before. I then hastily shoved the Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz. between my unworthy thighs. Ever so slowly the cap penetrated me! I screamed as I was overtaken with carnal joy. The sensation was so intense I became to convulse as the cap unscrewed between my legs. It was as if the Nile River invaded me when the milk flowed into me. I finally passed out after my unearthly experience. I awoke with the Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz. still inside of me, I refused to extract it. To this day It stays there, I get odd looks when I leave the house but it is worth it! Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk 128 oz. can do no wrong ;).
title: Extreme Pleasure

body: Friends, I implore you, do not be swayed by the siren's song of the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz., and its creamy allure. I say to you all...good consumers, fine consumers, wise consumers...do not let the temptation to imbibe this...this horrid lactose abomination...do not let it consume you. title: Milk

body: As I lay quiet behind my veil of shadow, I saw him.  He-who-must-not-be-named.  We'll call him "Gus, the milkman."  Gus, the milkman, step slowly out of his vehicle, grabbed a large metal container from the storage comparment.  The metal box was black, shiny and seemed heavy.  As he walked up to my door, he carefully set down the box.  It rattled a bit after he took two steps back -- as if it were possessed.  And then it happened......the box opened itself and a blinding light was strewn forth.  The sun grew dark with envy and the wind stopped completely.  The milk jug leapt from it's hindrance and spoke.  "Zeus has sent Tuscan milk," it began, "so that all men may know the wisdom of the afterlife."I didn't know what to do next.  My legs were numb with fear, my eyes bugged out from their sockets, my jaw dragged on the cement.  And then I knew.  I knew what I must do.  I lunged from my hiding spot and grasped the Achilles' handle of the milk gallon.  It forcefully struggled, blowing its top.  And in that amazing moment, drops of the nectar of the gods slipped into my mouth and...... I SAW DEATH ...I will never divulge what of it I saw, but will only say to those wanting to buy this milk: be sure you know what you want in life.  Immortality is not granted from this milk, nor from anything in this world.  But this milk is not for the feeble-minded.  Are you ready for ultimate knowledge beyond this existence?  If so, buy this milk and dare to drink it.
title: From the hallowed halls of Mt. Olympus

body: I was headed to buy a milk cow for my family, when I happened upon a nice gentleman with a Gallon of this lovely Tuscan milk.  I knew I was esposed to spend the money on the cow, but this man promised me that the never ending milk jug would deliver milk as long as we left it in the fridge.  Well, we're now going on 6 months, and my coffee couldn't get any lighter.  My husband is lactose intolerant, but frankly he gets that way about most everyone.  Especially our neighbors, who are Albanian.  Although they smell slightly of cabbage, I think they're quite a nice family.  But not my husband.  He just complains about their noisy parties, chicken coop and endless replaying of Michael Jackson's Thriller.
title: Sweet as the nectar of ambrosia

body: NOW I know where William came up with the name "Flem Snopes." As I Lay Dying from the deliciousness of this milk....I feel character formation at the back of my throat.
title: William Faulkner's muse?

body: I have a dream, that one day, we can all drink milk in a world where we know our bikes cannot be stolen. I have a dream that Lex Luthor, Darth Vader and Conan can live happily in a world full of >'s and Tuscan Whole Milk. I have a dream that safety will be guaranteed if only when he drink Tuscan Whole Milk. I have a dream Tom Cruise will have lactose induced highs that cause him to molest Oprah Winfrey, and that Tom Hanks will compare life to a glass of Tuscan Milk. I have a dream! That young children will bake cakes, that are pretty, and do not end up crazy. I have a dream that Bollywood singers and emo Myspacers will join hands and drink Tuscan Milk out of crazy straws, while singing Kumbaya and wearing kenti cloths.
