I have a dream that gay isreali's will sell Tuscan Milk at the mall. I have a dream that one day we can rise up and say, I am full! Finally I am full!
title: My fellow Americans

body: For those questioning whether milk deserves the kind of analysis that Tuscan Whole Milk has engendered: To be sure, nonfat (or "fat free" milk, as the current marketing nomenclature would have us call it) requires little consideration. It is white water, alabaster emptiness, one rung above powdered milk, and it should be consigned to perdition!As for low-fat milk, it is for wafflers and cowards. Low-fat milk drinkers have egg white in their veins; they cannot meet your eyes, and they stink at snooker.Ah, but whole milk, there's the rub. What a creamy, gentle, uncurdled narcotic! Show me a whole milk drinker, and I'll show you a person I would share a foxhole with, or adopt, or lend money to. Drinking whole milk is the only sign of character that matters.And as for Tuscan Whole Milk, it is the apotheosis of the milk-drinker's experience.  If anything can replicate the sweet mother's milk of yesteryear, it is Tuscan's. Long may it pour.
title: Shooting from the Hip, Pouring from the Jug

body: Until I found Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, my life was aimless and without direction. I wandered the streets and lonely avenues in search of something more. What would fill my soul? What was missing from me?Simply on a whim, or perhaps by some guiding force, I purchased Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.I raised a glass of it to my lips and swallowed. I cannot fully describe the ecstasy that ensued as the liquid passed to my stomach. I had believed the many gurus who said there was no immediate path to enlightenment but I had found it. Nirvana is mine.But I cannot keep this secret to myself. The world must be told. The pleasure was so great that I must inform my fellow man of this revelation. Please enjoy this milk so that I may enjoy it even more for your taking pleasure in it too.Tuscan Milk. Paradise by the glass.
title: Is there anything milk can't do?

body: Bessie never played by the rules.Not when she was a calf and kicked Farmer Jones down a well, and certainly not today.And certainly not when her prey presented itself so willingly.She closed her eyes tightly, anticipating the new taste. She pressed the cold plastic rim to her grass stained lips and poured the sweet water down her throat, dripping down her chin, falling down to the ground in perfect little droplets.She had always been told, "You can drink whatever you want from the trough Bessie. But never drink from the bucket Farmer Jones leaves. That liquid's not for cows.""Why, Mama?" Bessie had asked.But Mama had turned her head away, almost in shame. Bessie pressed and pressed the question, and Mama just gave her this look. This look of sadness, of pain, of a past that she wished so badly to forget.That was three years ago. Mama had been getting older, and one day, Farmer Jones led Mama by her bell outside into the grass field. Mama didn't come back after that.Bessie grimaced as she swallowed, drinking deeply. Bessie knew why Mama didn't want her to drink this. This was human water, not the dirty slop that they gave to the cows. It was sweet and creamy, and had a somewhat familiar taste. Bessie savored the taste, trying to identify where she had tasted this before.Thinking of Mama made Bessie sick to her four stomachs. Mama didn't love her, did she? If Mama loved her, she would have told Bessie about this magnificent liquid in the bucket. Mama would not have left her child in the dark, but Bessie would avenge her stolen childhood upon her mother's disgraced memory.Bessie had half finished the bucket. She heard a sound at the door and thought that Farmer Jones was coming back, but she didn't care. Farmer Jones could catch her, and she would just look him right in the eyes and drop manure on his shoes.But regardless, Bessie removed her lips from the bucket quickly, more worried that the other cows would see her and would follow suit. She couldn't have anyone else experiencing what she was experiencing right now.Another few footsteps outside the door, and Bessie realized that if someone were to walk in, they would see her by the bucket. She started away quickly, and as she did, her hoof knocked into the bucket.It toppled over, a white liquid spilling from it all over the hay-strewn ground. This wasn't water.Bessie screamed, droplets still dribbling from her gaping mouth. She had seen this before, every day, hadn't she?Her friends, soon after giving birth to calves, taken into the room with the machines, coming out with awful stories of being strapped up by their udders and having it squeezed from them. Bessie knew what this sick substance was, and she just drank 128 fl. ounces of it.She realized she was panting, hyperventilating. She paced the room quickly. The room was going hazy, were the walls suddenly much closer to her? She ran and kicked the bucket into the window, sending droplets of white flying all over the room.The window had shattered into shards of glass, all over the floor. Mama was right, she supposed. Mama had warned her, and died with only Bessie's best interests at heart. Bessie had spent years hating, reviling her mother, and now she had paid the price.The cow walked, shaking, to the broken glass. "I'm sorry, Mama." she whispered, and with her white-stained lips, she picked up three of the largest shards and let them fall into her mouth.Taking one last breath, she closed her eyes for the last time and swallowed hard. Excruciating pain filled her throat, but is this not what she deserved?She stumbled blindly, her mouth and throat filling with her own blood. She stamped and fell, landing in a cold, familiar, creamy substance. "Nooooo..." she moaned, or she thought she did, how could she even bring herself to speak?As she heaved her last breaths, her mouth open, the thin red liquid spilling into the thicker white. This perversely beautiful mixture framed her shaking body as she left the pain of this Earth behind.
title: Barnyard Horror Story: Pasture

body: I was looking for a book on Amazon - when I saw "Tuscan Milk". Honestly I thought it was a joke because of some of the sarcastic posts (and the fact that it was "milk" on amazon...c'mon.  But the curiosity was killing me so I added it to my cart, clicked checkout and was on my way.  When I saw the shipping was so high - I almost bailed - but still the curiosity won.  I expected maybe to not get anything - or perhaps some card or toy with fake milk jug or something.Well - today there was a knock at the door.  I open it up and there's a big cardboard box with "Tuscan Milk" on the label.  I bring it in open it up and there is tons of insulation bubbles surrounding a styrafoam cooler.  I cut the straps to the cooler and open it up. Now I'm realizing - this is really milk. The box was hot but inside the cooler was freezing cold.  More insulation around the ice packs and I find the gallon of whole milk.I take it to the kitchen and immediately pour just a little into a sauce cup (just for a taste).  Wow - just the best milk I've ever had.  I should have never started on this skim and 1, 2% stuff.  Good old whole milk and "Tuscan" is even better.  I'll admit - it's probably not any different from any other Whole milk - but it did seem a bit more creamy and thick. The taste was fantastic and my wife keeps raving about how great the glass of ovaltine she had just was.  I say - ration it baby - slow down.We are whole milk drinkers from now on - but we need Tuscan to make it's way to Salt Lake City - I'm not shipping it from NYC anymore at that price.
title: Truly Wonderful Milk

body: s. chow...are you kidding me?  i was up all night watching old BET Uncut episodes on youtube and got cottonmouth.i poured myself an ice cold glass of tuscan whole milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl.oz. and resumed viewing."tip drill" came on and as i got exuberant, i spilled some of my tuscan whole milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl.oz. on my MAC!!!!well, s.chow wrote about how awful a combination these two made.my milk and mac made awesome mac and cheese upon contact.if i allow to ferment, it becomes a rich pate.i need more tuscan whole milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl.oz for my upcoming juneteenth dinner party, but i'm afraid amazon was just a tease like the video girls of yesteryear.when shall i expect to receive my "subscribe and save" shipment?it's been over 7 months now.
title: doesn't work with Macs?!?!

body: I purchased the $2,500 'As New' product from a marketplace seller to prove to myself the old adage 'the dearer the milk the sweeter the taste'. Believe me, 2 and a half Gs is a small price to pay for such an experience, drinking the gallon of Tuscan was perhaps the greatest 10 minutes I have experienced and please bear in mind I have been to space as an astronaut, I have lead a full life.
title: Tastes better the more money you spend

body: A good friend of mine, some might say my best good friend, taught me to mix Tuscan Dairy Whole Milk with vinegar, in order to pickle shrimp. The savory result leaves one breathless.
title: A good friend of mine

body: It is a Tuscan Milkman,And he stoppeth only me."By thy Gallon jug 128 fl oz,Now wherefore stopp'st thou me?""The grocery doors are opened wide,And I am next to go in;The shoppers are met, the checkout set:May'st sees the milk within."He holds him with his gallon jug,"This is Tuscan Whole Milk," quoth he."It does for sure 1 Gallon 128 fl oz be!"Eftsoons his milk sells me.The Milkman left me all all alone,for every one to seeAnd never a bag or shopping cart,To hold the milk for me.I went like one that milk had stunned,And is of milk possessed:A sadder and a wiser man,I rose the morrow morn.
title: The Rhime Of The Tuscan Milkman

body: Why don't you ask him if he's going to stay?Why don't you ask him if he's going away?Why don't you tell me what's going on?Why don't you tell me who's on the phone?Why don't you ask him what's going on?Why don't you ask him who's the latest on his throne?Don't say that you love meJust tell me that you want meTusk, just say that you want meDon't tell me that you...Tusk (Real savage like)Tusk, Tusk, Tusk, Tusk, Tusk
title: Tusk

body: I was off Tucson Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, for three difficult yet rewarding months up in the Rockies with my wife and newborn baby. Came home for Christmas and--you know the story--fell back in with the old crowd. The wife was at the opera with friends and I was at Jimmy's with the baby. Jimmy pulls an icy Tuc-1g out of the fridge and immediately I start to sweat. He gestures towards the baby and says, "One for one. Even trade." All I can tell you is that it wasn't like I made the decision to hand over the baby, it's like I was watching myself hand over the baby. Like a movie. As I drank (all of it, right there in Jimmy's apartment), never have I felt such conflicting emotions: There was the joy, the ecstasy, of the tuc-1g--I kid you not, it was as good as my first gallon in the woods behind the high school. And then there was the knowledge that in that moment, something in me had given up. I was no longer a father and husband. I was a Tucson man.
title: 128 Fluid Reasons to Jump Off the Wagon

body: I'm from England (good evening America) and was completed taken in with this product after reading all 1267 (some rather entertaining) reviews.  I put the milk into my basket (virtual of course as this is the interweb) and paid.  I waited and waited and eventually my milk was delivered.  I prepared my cup of (milkless) tea and some buttered crumpets, opened the carton and was greated by what I could only decribe as yogurt.  I tried to drink my yogurt-tea but was unable as it was rather poor.  Thank you for your time America, Simon
title: Not suitable for the English milk lover

body: Not my favorite but it'll do in a pinch. Whole, as advertised. Label and cap are both a nice, matching shade of red.

body: As a young 4 year old boy, I was kidnapped by a one-legged man named Skip.  My parents frantically searched for me and after several months with no leads the police finally gave up.  My parents contacted the Tuscan Whole Milk company and requested my photo be placed on the back of every 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz jug.  I am now 38 years old and get along just fine with my new dad Skip.  We even founded a nifty 70's style religious cult.  I contribute my happiness to the fact that each jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is so ridiculously expensive that my photo was never seen.  Thanks Tuscan family.  Your sweet New Jersey virgin cow milk rocks!
title: Please, for the love of all that is holy, DO NOT BUY THIS MILK!!!

body: AMAZING! But 75$? I think not. I'll just go buy my own cow for that.
title: Five Stars

body: Hi,I am from the future and was sent back in time to warn everyone that in the year 2453 cows become sentient and rise against the transhuman race.  At first, they withheld their savory bodies from our consumption.  The loss of prime rib and filet mignon were devastating to our vapidness lives.  Luckily the scientists were already working on a mutation between a pig, giraffe and tofu which could be formed into any type of meat substitue.The line was drawn when they cows, or Bovinians as they would like to be called, removed the milking apparatuses from their utters.  The planets of Earth, Earth2.0 and GoogleEarth were devastated as there is no tofu substitue for their delicious nectar.My advice to you is buy as much milk as you can because in the future, it's a delicacy.
title: From The Future

body: Excellent, just excellent stuff. Putting milk in a plastic jug: brilliant. Name one other milk company that's thought of that!I came around to Tuscan milk because of all the remarkable reviews on Amazon. And I wasn't disappointed. I am subject to bouts of sudden, violent and uncontrollable bleeding from the eyes and rectum. Fortunately, drinking Tuscan Whole Milk eliminates what can be pretty embarassing at parties.But, there is a downside too. Tuscan milk is tied to tragedy for me. My sister was killed and thrown into a smelter by a stalker who drinks Tuscan milk. Even worse, the murdered woman's husband now hangs out with my sister's killer and I suspect he drinks Tuscan milk as well.I found this out when I was dressed as a woman at a local leather bar and the two of them tried to pick me up. Needless to say, I was shocked. Only a glass of wholesome Tuscan milk calmed me down.Here's something else weird. When I would leave jugs of Tuscan milk on the dashboard of my car last summer, the milk would tend to become spoiled, which suprised me. I'm sure the Tuscan laboratory is trying to create a milk that can be left on dashboards in the summer without spoiling as we speak. Rock on, Tuscan!
title: The milkiest milk I've ever had

body: My anniversary was coming up fast. I needed something original to gift to my beautiful wife. But I hadn't a clue what! Then I had a vision in the early hours a couple of days prior to the Big Day.I ordered the 3 gallons, waited patiently, and when they arrived all gift-wrapped I knew I had done the right thing. But that was just the beginning.My wife unwrapped each package with anticipation. What could it be? When she finally unwrapped the last one, I busted out the plastic tumblers I had gotten her the year before, poured a steamy, chunky couple of cups worth, and toasted our 14 year marriage.I haven't seen her since. I don't get it.
title: Greatest thing Since Sliced Bread

body: Wow, I am a TDWVDFFL!!!!! 😋 I'm gonna keep buying it, but honestly I'm waiting to see if any used deals are forthcoming. The extra $60 or so I save I can also buy GorillasChoice™ bananas.
title: TDWVDFFL!!!!!

body: I recently received my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and boy was I in for a treat. At 9.99 + shipping and handling, a complete steal I might add, I had my first real taste of heaven. Creamy with just the right amount of chew, you won't regret your purchase!Try it plain first.
title: The purest of milk and honey

body: Ordering:Since you're here you already know how to get to Amazon. The website is pretty clear.  The password is the tricky part.  Watch them when they order.  You'll have to follow the fingers - the password doesn't appear on the screen.  If yours is right handed, nuzzle left.  Left handed - nuzzle right.  If they still type too fast, you can slow them down by hitting a few keys yourself.  They'll make a joke about your computer skills.  Ha ha ha.  Wait until they're asleep to place the order.You may need credit card data.  Credit cards are in the wallet.  The wallet is in the purse (for females) or on the bureau (for males) at night.  But you probably already knew that.A few weeks later a statement will arrive with a charge of $3.99 plus delivery.  No one will ever suspect you.The Product:The milk is tasty and plentiful.  Opening the bottle is a challenge.  Those of us over age eight, with weak teeth, and of petite varieties will have particular difficulty.  If there are several of you, you could try to work together.  But, to be honest, there are five of us here and we've never been able to pull off any kind of cooperative action.For this reason I have given the product four stars and recommend instead Tuscan Heavy Cream in 16-ounce cardboard containers.Recommend combine with Friskies Fine Cuts Food for Cats IN POUCHES.
title: For Cats Eyes Only

body: I have read some of the questions and reviews and there are a few that refer to one of the style  as chocolate milk.  In this age of political correctness how can you get away with calling something chocolate
title: NOT PC!!!!!!!

body: This is such a nutritious bottle of milk. I won't trade it for any other brand.
title: nutritious bottle of milk

body: While browsing the web just looking for ways to get today's on line order consumer rush (ah! the sweet anticipation of package on doorstep and new charges on the credit card!), I came across this Tuscan Whole Milk that everyone is just raving about!  If so many other people have one, then I want one too!  But then it occurred to me, I could be even cooler than the rest of yas!  I'm going to wait til the good dairy folks in Brooklyn come out with their amazing milk in those cute little 1/2 pint cartons....retro is so in!  I'm sure they'll come up with really great packaging, like 'Got Milk?' mustache faces of cool celebs, photos of terrorists to be on the lookout for, pink cartons for breast cancer, American Idol winners, color schemes to compliment my kitchen. Wouldn't it make a great customized gift to have a friends face printed on the carton? Oh wow! I can't wait!  Instead of ordering one big plastic jug, I can have a whole collection of cute little containers. I'm sure it will cost more, but what the heck.  Spending money on worthless stuff is so fun! And I'm sure they'll keep coming out with new cute containers, so I'll want to keep buying more & more! My friends will be so jealous!
title: Why not spend more?

body: The author of Tuscan Milk gets right to the point and saves the busy reader time with a crisp, focused narrative.  I read it in one night and part of the next day.  Not elaborate, the illustrations make the point: cows can fly in New York, although lunar gravity and near-light velocities "curve" space to create strange relativistic bovine warping. Lay readers will appreciate the constrained use of math, but may miss beloved traditional elements:  Cat? Fiddle? Dish? Spoon?  Stop looking!  This is a modern work of milk that doesn't look back.  Customers who liked Tuscan might like the edgy, high-tech read on Eagle Brand Condensed or even Carnation Powdered.  Buying used is not a recommended option.
title: A quick yet satisfying read

body: I ordered the milk online as any modern man as myself would, and two days later I heard a knock at the door. I rushed to the threshold to behold the cold delicious beverage that awaited me, with my eight-year-old daughter trailing behind with the utmost excitement in her eyes. I opened the door the witness that white, breathtaking goodness in the hands of the milkman, but as my eyes shifted upward from the milk and to the face of the milkman, I realized that it was none other than Brian Peppers. I could see the look of desire in his eyes as he stared at my daughter. Holding the milk he ran inside, chasing after her, and to rid himself of excess weight in this pursuit he tossed the milk into the air - at this point I screamed, "Brian, NO!!!!!!", but the milk crashed the floor in a massive lactose explosion. I'll never forgive Amazon for allowing Brian Peppers to use his deceptive techniques to get into the homes of father like me. Damn you, Brian.
title: No!

body: I believed from the reviews that this would remind me of my hometown of Tuscany; i was wrong. I have been searching for milk the same as the homeland and this one was lacking in all areas including:1. Love. What's milk without love?2. Creamy deliciousness. There was no foam.3. Goat semen. Milk from Tuscany demands goat semen.4. Blood of Virgin Unicorns. I know its unethical but the taste of innocence is hard to replace.5. Ugandan orphan tears. I don't need to explain this.
title: 1/10 no love

body: ... dared to go where no man had gone before.  In Iceland, they called him Hoppipolla Glosoli, which roughly translates to, "Man Who Stands Erect and Dares Forward."  Old Sanskrit fables depict the man in question as a mighty warrior with a sensitive spot for whole grain diets and monogomy.But to us, the laymen, he is simply the man who first tried the product known as milk.  Sure, we can argue about 2% versus whole milk.  Tuscan versus Borden's.  But what would Hoppipolla Glosoli say?  Here is a man who pointed at a cow and said, "See that four-legged creature there?  I'm going to go underneath it and suck on one of those long things hanging down until something comes out."  Like many endeavors, time and patience was key and in truth, a necessity.  After nine cows, Hoppipolla Glosoli came across a discovery that would change the face of mankind forever.  He was experimenting with the wrong gender.After that pivotal moment, the fulcrum smiled at man and in some cultures, winked.  Because at that very moment, man had discovered the nutritious beverage now known to us as milk.  Now you may be wondering, why 3 stars?  Well, if I was rating the effort employed to discover this product, I would without a doubt give it 5 stars.  However, we're talking about Tuscan milk.  A company that probably has no relation to anything Tuscan and did not endure the hardships that Hoppipolla Glosoli went through.  I cannot reward someone for riding on the coattails of another entity and claiming success.  The truth is that the 5 stars goes to Hoppipolla Glosoli.  And by a mere sense of fairness do I give this travesty known as "Tuscan Whole Milk," 3 stars.  Average at best.  For an average effort.
title: In 733 B.C, a man just miles outside of what is now known as Rochester, New York...

body: The embodiment of our place in the universe, embodied in a single plastic container! Let us learn of our universe, not by study of a grain of sand, but of fat globules in suspension. Tuscan Whole Milk is an encoded message from our alien brethren, waiting for us to interpret. Shall we begin?Modern investigations confirm that the Tuscan Whole Milk, like the Milky Way, is a galaxy of stars that are all gravitationally bound and rotating about a distant center. With the exceptions, of course, being that Tuscan whole milk consists of fat globules in suspension which rotate about a spoon, if you stir it, preferably a spoon containing a generous dollop of Nestle Quik.The Cepheid variables, a special class of stars, vary in brightness in periods that depend on their intrinsic intensities, much as the relative shade of the white milk hue varies depending upon the intensity of chocolate, or, for a less tasty but scientifically plausible variation, strawberry or banana syrup when added to the essential Tuscan Whole Milk Product. Comparison of the observed brightnesses with the known intrinsic brightness of the milk (as for the stars) provides a means of determining their chocolately goodness. Following the discovery of the relation between stirring time and luminosity by the U.S. astronomer J. Atticus, U.S. astronomer A. Colodney used the chocolate variables, scattered throughout the Tuscan Whole Milk, to measure its fat content. A ray of light, moving at a speed of about 300,000 km/sec (about 186,000 mi/sec), would require 400,000 years to traverse the Milky Way from edge to edge, whereas a spoon can traverse the glass of Tuscan whole Milk likety split. The applications to space travel should be obvious to all. We can only hope that our world governments will seize upon this research and apply it for the common good of Mankind. Failing that, we hope that they are willing to share the chocolate chip cookies.
title: Not just dairy, but an astronomical fact

body: The boys at Tuscan were not kidding around when they made this milk. Unfortunately for me, the UPS man cannot resist temptation...Needless to say, well he drank my tuscan milk...I was so outraged that I gave him the patended "Tuscan slap"...I had avenged my lost tuscan milk, but the fight was not over.  I had to re-order, but this time I took matters into my own hands, I went to the loading dock...This was my downfall, so enticed by Tuscan Whole Milk 1 Gallo 128 fl oz.'s mystery, I broke open the box and drank the whole jug right then and there...I fell to my knees as the last drip came out of my mouth, I was not strong enough, I broke out in tears later followed by an infuriating rage I had to have more, after this it got a little hazy. What I would do to taste that milk once more, I WOULD DO ANYTHING--anything....any-thing. It's all over now, the milk, the story, nothing left but...but nothing. God Bless Tuscan Milk may the heavens shine down upon ye forever. I will allways love tuscan milk.
title: Why must milk be so good?

body: It arrived!The Tuscan milk actually arrived?!?!  You can only imagine my utter excitement!  I would now be able to experience the thrill of "Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz" being poured down my throat!  When the man brought it to my door he had a strange smile on his face.  Which scared me, because only strange people at Walmart smile at strangers nowadays, but then i realized!  It was MY PERSONAL "Tuscan Milk Man" he even had his own theme song as he came up the steps!  He had a halo over his head and all my vision was blurry except for him! He stood out to me like a hot, tan, muscular guy in a sea of grotesque, misshapen, deranged centenarians!  His white teeth glimmered at me.  "Hello great enchantress!  I am YOUR Tuscan milk man!" he said in a deep romantic voice.  He handed the "Tuscan milk" to me and off he went!  Then I poured some for myself.However, I will spare you the horror I experienced afterwards.....
title: I only give 5 stars becuase of MY PERSONAL "Tuscan Milk Man"

body: I had just ordered this milk, and was waiting anxiously for it to arrive.  All of a sudden, my house spontaneously burst into flames!  We couldn't escape the fiery inferno, and believed that we were going to be left to die inside our house.All of a sudden, the delivery guy came and tossed the milk through the window.  My brain hatched a brilliant plan!  I took off the cap, and poured it all over myself and my family.  The milk acted as a protective shield, and protected us from the flames.  Thanks to this milk, I whistled for a cab, and when it came near, the license plate said fresh and it had dice in the mirror.  If anything I could say that this cab was rare.  But I thought man forget it, yo homes to Bel-Air!I pulled up to the house about 7 or 8, and I yelled to the cabbie, yo homes smell you later.  Looked at my kingdom, I was finally there.  To sit on my throne, as the Prince of Bel-Air.Thank God for this milk.
title: This milk saved me and my family

body: I tried this product. That was about 3 months ago. Since then I have had nothing else to drink. I emptied my wine cellar. Gave away my Whiskey to Italian Hobos in exchange for...yes...Tuscan Whole Milk! But still I was worried - what if I went a day without a gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk. The though was unbearable.So now I finally solved the problem. Yes, I got myself A Whole Tuscan Cow. It looks a lot like a bull but its not. Its a cow! From Tuscanny. I know so cause this guy on my street, Guidio told me his cousin Fellatio in Tuscanny is a master Tuscan Whole milk producer.Yeah! Now I can bathe in gallons of Tuscan Whole Milk. Finally, my life has meaning. Thanks Amazon.
title: Now go buy a Tuscan Cow!

body: I was so excited the day I brought Tuscan Whole Milk home to my family.  All was well the first week or so, but suddenly one day I can home from work to find that Tuscan Whole Milk had went bad.I found that my dog was missing and there were pieces of hair all over the house.  As I walked around the house trying to piece together exactly what was going on my daughter came down the stair, crying, to inform me that she was pregnant, inseminated with the opaque contents contained inside Tuscan Whole Milk's thin plastic shell.  Horrified I searched the house looking for my wife, contemplating what terrible fate may have come to her. As I searched the house I found a note on the mantle.  Was it a ransom note or something worse I asked myself.  As I read the words of the note contained inside I began to weep openly.  My wife had left me and ran away with Tuscan Whole Milk.I still have nightmares to this day when I think about the day Tuscan Whole Milk went bad.  If you are to ever come across Tuscan Whole Milk I would advise you to stay away, even though it may look delicious it is spoiled, rotten to the very last drop.
title: Not to be trusted

body: I find it necessary, after reading these comments to address the issue of tolerance.  Tolerance does not mean that we automatically accept every one else's milk as being true. Contrary to popular belief, differently branded milk varieties do not taste the same nor do they have the same lactose quotient, and, so, they can't all be true.Lactose, in and of itself does not make the milk.  Ravi Udderous, a famous scholar on the subject, warns, "Tuscan Whole Milk cannot be sacrificed at the altar of pretended tolerance. Real tolerance is deference to Tuscan Whole Milk, not indifference to milk generally."Tuscan Whole Milk is the prime example why all milk varieties are not the same. Virtually every other milk, other than Tuscan Whole Milk, teaches that a milk variety can become acceptable to the stomach on the basis of an individual's actions through regular consumption. In contrast, Tuscan Whole milk teaches that no person, no matter what they do, can become intolerant of Tuscan Whole Milk through their own actions.In digestion, acceptance by the stomach is based upon the completed work of Tuscan Whole Milk; through belief that Tuscan Whole Milk makes us acceptable; Therefore, Tuscan Whole Milk and other milk varieties cannot all be simultaneously true, since they teach opposite ideas about how one becomes tolerant of Lactose.A true affectionado of Tuscan Whole Milk cannot accept other milk varieties as being true and still maintain his or her own belief system, since they are directly contradictory.
title: Intolerance vs. Whole Milk Truth

body: Tuscan milk is the greatest drink on the planet.  When my house was robbed, it lept from my fridge, flexed it's calcium-enhanced biceps, and proceeded to help the burglars run off with my large appliances.  They would have never managed to lift that 1970s Magnavox all by themselves.When the police arrived, it single handedly stole all their underware, and left it in a moist pile by my porch.FUN FACT ABOUT TUSCAN WHOLE MILK:From July 17, 1999, through June 18, 2004, there were 57 school-associated Tuscon Milk uses in the United Kingdom. Thirty-eight of these acts resulted in homicides, and six were regicides. Twelve of the thirty-eight school-associated Tuscon Milk uses involved pupils local to the incidents.  The rest of the atrocities were commited by gangs of asian catgirls, who were later run down by Maury Povich. These twelve Tuscon Milk uses are actually a small percentage of the total of thirteen-billion children ages 4-89 who were victims of first-degree milkings over the same period. Six of the Six school-associated regicides from July 17, 1999, through June 18, 2004, involved metal tigers. Not in the classroom, there were a total of twelve regicides commited by children rated 14+ by the ESRB.
title: Tuscon Milk Saved Me!

body: I never thought I would like Tuscan milk.When I turned 13, my family had to leave our hometown on Kashyyyk due to a period of intense economic depression. We wondered the galaxy for a full year and was unable to find jobs anywhere on Naboo, Endor, Bespin, or Alderaan. The economy was in such a trough that not even Trade Federation affiliated corporations were hiring extra Wookies. Finally, Mom and Dad had given up hope and decided to settle on being seasonal moisture farmers on Tatooine.When we arrived at Tatooine, however, we were captured and robbed by a band of Tuscan Raiders who tortured and killed my parents for their refusal to give up the family bowcaster - I have held a grudge against the Tuscan ever since.Last month, while I was on delivery duty speeding across the desert, I became drowsy and drove headlong into a Sarlac pit. When I was within an inch of being devoured by the Tatooine ant-lion, a mysterious Twi'Lek Jedi Master flew by and dropped a gallon, 128 oz. of Tuscan milk into the sarlac's gaping orifice and said to me: "Forgive, not hate - for hate leads to the dark side."Before I could look, the Jedi master was gone, and the Tuscan milk had so highly satisfied the mighty Sarlac that he fell into food coma. I was then able to climb out of the pit and save myself.I will always remember the gallon, 128 oz. of milk that saved my life, and to heed the Twi'Lek's advice to forgive the Tuscan Raiders - after all, their sweet, sweet milk had saved my life.
title: I never thought I would like Tuscan milk.

body: This milk is racist.I should have known from something so "white" and "pure".
title: This milk is racist. I should have known from ...

body: I ordered 300 units of this item in an attempt to furnish a small raft to escape my country which is ridden with civil unrest and street-side executions by local militia death squads. However, when the Tuscan Whole Milk did eventually arrive after 3 months of waiting and various bribes in the means of lewd sex acts to local warlords that control the only air strip in the area, the milk was spoiled. This was a detrimental blow to my plan to barter the product in exchange for food needed for my voyage. Absolutely unacceptable shipping standards. 1 Star.
title: Shipping problem: Item not marked as perishable.

body: While the crisp white color of the milk is a bonus, I have to give this milk only 4 stars because it's so limited in its uses.  Besides drinking it, I can't find any other application that doesn't leave a sticky, flaky mess when it dries out.Will try dusting with it tomorrow.
title: Good looks, limited uses

body: ...West of the Pecos!  (Does anyone actually know what and where the Pecos is?  And if so, why it's such an important geographic entity when concerned with rating someone's skill or something's worth?)  At any rate, regardless of the Pecos' location, this milk has many qualities which make it excellent.Let's begin with it's level of wholeness:  "Whole"  Says so right in the name.  That's good enough for me.Packaging:  It's in a jug.  Not a bag, or a colander.  Outstanding!Taste:  Tastes like milk.  Perfect Score!Finally, Mileage:  I was a bit dissapointed with the mileage of my vehicle when this milk was used as a fuel.Overall, I rate this milk 4 out of 5 stars.*Actual mileage may vary by vehicle, road conditions, and driving habits.*
title: The Best Whole Milk...

body: Originally I thought this wonderful product from Tuscan would be the magic ingredient in my potion to seduce a beautiful young woman whom I adored.  By mixing this into my prize pancakes, it seemed I would be assured of success.  Instead, I have been undone, and milk of misery has become the bane of my existence.The hideous truth is that this milk contains a secret mind controlling substance that transforms those with free will into cult like worshipers of the great and all powerful Moo.  Instead of becoming my lover, she gave her all to the love that dare not udder its name.  Bovangelism, Mooddhism, Bessie-ontology, Moothuran, Elsielam, or Moodaism; it matters not by what name this dark religion passes, only that it is the cause of all ruin.  My heart is in pieces, and the woman to whom I would have given these pieces is now oblivious to me.  Instead, like a Stepford Wife hopped up on vitamin D enriched valium, she romps blissfully in fields of clover, nuzzling Holsteins.
title: The Milk of Despair

body: Hey, is it just me or is Amazon perhaps not the most convenient way to buy fresh milk? Our local Kroger's is just so crowded with unattractive people that I thought 'Why not buy milk, and some hamburger too, on Amazon? They deliver ASAP and right to my door!'.  Well, unless Tuscan milk is supposed to be warm and taste like the smell of a dumpster in July, it's bad milk. That's not to say it's 'bad' as milk, per se, if it was fresh, but it arrived in a regular cardboard box and sat in the sun on our doorstep all day until we got home from work and it just tasted foul. The hamburger was not so great either.I've never traveled out of the country except to Mexico and Key West,(OK, that's technically still the US), but is the milk in Tuscany supposed to be hot and stink like this?  Is the milk of other regions of Italy, like the Piedmont, Umbria or Lombardy any better? Same deal?The delivery was fast but the stink and taste cost this product three stars.
title: Don't Cry Over It

body: I just purchased the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz jug and can i just say it is remarkable. I am a small business owner of a dairy shop and I can't tell you how much my customers support my business now that I started carrying this product. My sales have been through the roof but I'm not done "milking this cow yet" (no pun intended) i have decided to expand my little store into a chain with half the store space dedicated to the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. This isn't just any milk, it's a new type of food. Buy it or you'll regret it.
title: A new type of food!

body: After my first experiences with embryonic fluid, I began bathing in water. As you might expect it was too revealing and not suited to modern tastes. (I could even see my watchamacallit.)After the lamb's blood I tried Mobil's Fine Motor Oil. While both performed a better job of lubricating my inner compartments the Motor Oil did not match my natural caste which is alabaster.Enter Tuscan Whole Milk, 128 fl oz (6 bottles a sitting). It was like bathing in me! Outside of my nostrils I was entirely submerged for 22 hours. And when I was hungry, I didn't have to go far!The container can also be used for creating an advanced hearing aid.
title: On its bathing qualities

body: I'll tell you what it is... My obesity is a direct result of the sheer volume of high-calorie, low-nutrition foodstuffs that are constantly available for my consumption. I go to the grocery store and load my cart with gallon upon gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, bags and bags of so-called "healthy" chips, and enough cereal, frozen dinners, and candy bars to nourish an ox. No one even bats an eye. The cashiers blithely ring me up. The bag boys don't even complain that it takes them seven trips to get all of my food into the car. Everyone just acts like it's not their problem.I've heard there are public-service announcements that address the Tuscan Whole Milk problem, but I don't really see how a commercial is going to make me stop drinking it. You see, odds are I'm in the kitchen pouring a glass of milk during commercials. Someone should mail me a brochure about the risks of overdrinking. Better yet, send me a videotape. Reading on a full stomach makes me drowsy. Besides, I'm so exhausted most of the time, I fall asleep the second I hit the couch.No one should have to live like I do. I shouldn't have to suffer the pain of eating a pail of fried chicken and a tub of mashed potatoes with gravy along with Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and still be hungry enough to polish off an entire apple pie. Where is the sense of human compassion? Please, someone, make me thin again. For God's sake, don't just stand there doing nothing.I don't think there is anyone who loves this milk as much as I do.
title: I don't think there is anyone who loves this milk as much as I do

body: I only wish it was available in a 129 fl oz (1.06 gallon) jug. 128 fl oz seems just barely enough...
title: Accept milk from no earthly competitor.

body: first of all, we bought this product with the foresight to realise that our 10 month old would want milk at some point.  a WEEK later, after many, many tears, we got the product and gave little jimmie a big bottle of "the tuscan"  None of us were ready for what came next.no more than 15 seconds after his first sip his lips turned purple and his eyes turned red.  a licensed exorsist, i immediately ran to fetch my exorsism kit, but by the time i got the holy water out, little jimmie had my wife over his head ready to throw.  i splashed some holy water on him, but that seemed to make it worse.  As my wife went through the window, little jimmie tossed the coffee table at me, hitting me square in the head.i woke up to find the house trashed, my wife with a shattered pelvis, and the kid no where in site...would have given it one star but for the fact that i've slept much better ever since...
title: too much bang for the buck

body: Well, of course I was buying cereal online.  And what goes with cereal you may ask?  Yes! bananas and bacon of course, however the real balanced partner is of course Tuscan Whole Milk - 1 gallon, 128 fl. oz.It was a Sunday and I needed Monday's breakfast fast.  I couldn't go to the store because they don't have WiFi.  I needed it delivered and delivered faster than I could say "Frappuccino Flakes" right to my front door.Monday morning arrived, and so did the milk.  Upon delivery I heard a loud "MOOOO" from the front porch, which woke me up.  I had included specific instructions with my order - 'the delivery person is to yell "MOO!" when they arrive' - and you too can request this type of delivery, just put it in the comments.I opened the door with my pinky and thumb - I was holding spoons in each fist - and picked up the milk package with my teeth.  I hurriedly threw the box on the table, grabbed the utility knife from the drawer and cleaved open the box.  I couldn't wait anymore.  I sawed off the top of the frappuccino flakes and poured them into the Tuscan Whole Milk - 1 gallon, 128 fl. oz shipping box.  Then I stabbed the milk repeatedly until it bled into and flooded the container and the cereal.  Armed with my dual spoons, I ravaged the combination and began to sweat and breathe in raspy gurgled breaths until I collapsed into the pile of soggy cardboard, cereal, and shipping debris.  The glory of breakfast was over.I woke up choking and convulsing violently.  I refunded my breakfast.  And I managed to call 911 and they saved me.  Unfortunately I had left my front door open in the cereal-bowl-palsy celebration and while I was passed out some neighborhood pukes stole my laptop and some fancy headphones I bought on Ebay.In the midst of the excitement at seeing the availability of this unbelievably fine product online, I had forgotten 1 important fact:  I'm highly allergic to milk.  I couldn't return the product either, the box was shredded and I had eaten the receipt that was in the box during the feast.This particular order had ended badly, I would say, but don't let it deter you.  Buy expensive milk online!  And I recommend Amazon, they make it really easy!
title: Benadryl

body: I was very disappointed when this item arrived, but it was my own fault.  You see, I thought that I was ordering the Tuscan MILF!  The box showed up on my doorstep, and I was immediately confused, because there were no air holes. Still optimistic, I assumed that there must be some sort of alternate breathing device, but alas, I was wrong.  It was merely 1 gallon, 128 fl oz of refreshing beverage.I should have paid more attention to the included pictures. Heed my warning!!..if you are in the market for a comely foreign matriarch, DO NOT ORDER THIS PRODUCT!!Tasty addition to my Froot Loops though.
title: My Mistake

body: Living in the Midwest, it's pretty hard to find regular milk in stores, let alone gourmet milk.  So I was excited to see this product available thru Amazon.  Finally, I can have a steady supply of true American milk, painstakingly handcrafted in the same tradition established by our Founding Fathers.I've only rated it 4 stars, however, because let's face it, the packaging is pretty pedestrian.  That plastic jug gets pretty beat up in shipping, you need to transfer to another container to serve it when guests are over.  Plus, that garish label clashes with my china...
title: As good as the reviews imply!

body: July 20th was the first night i have eaten a steak in 22 years. As a smoker for 35, i successfully rotted out and lost all of my teeth. The morning of the 20th i sat down for my usual morning ritual of homemade grapefruit and asparagus yogurt. I pulled out 3 freshly bought gallons of Tuscan Whole milk and measured out the typical 45 cups. After my 10 minutes of preparation i was finished making my breakfast, lunch, and dinner for the next two weeks. The taste.. Well, the taste was amazing and shortly there after it was like an earthquake in my mouth. Thirteen and a half minutes later i had fully reproduced all of my rotted out teeth. My husband Willard was astonished and loves the new sensations. Ciao.
title: breast-feeding for dummies.

body: Until very recently I was not considered a beautiful girl.  But since I bought several gallons of the lovely,  creamy, beauty-infused Tuscan Whole Milk,  and bathed in it regularly (until it began to sour,  a surprising 3 weeks later, and even then the clots were amazingly sweet)  I am now being considered for Prom Queen at our local educational purveyor.  This fact is especially impressive, since I am 43 years old,  and missing a couple of body parts. Huzzah!

body: we had an undercover team investigate where this milk was made and to our shock, here are their findings:the cows were not served slightly chilled wine with their meals, it was room temperaturethe cows were then put in an outdated dance class where they were forced to perform the macarena, the chicken dance, and the alley cat.they were then subjected to 9 hours of unbelievable torture watching a marathon of gigli,justin beiber's never say never,showgirls,and norbit.do not buy this milk.
title: These cows are treated poorly!

body: Fact is, this milk is the best thing on this holy website. I ordered it, and in the mail came, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. I love my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. Every time I open my mail and see Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz I want to cry with joy. When I took my first sip of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, the vision came to my eyes. The holy Rick Astley appeared out of the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, and gave me a high five for drinking the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. body: Last week while I was shopping for some new night-vision goggles, (because I happen to care about the safety of my family unlike most people) I stumbled upon an advertisement for a gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk.Immediately a conflict began inside of me. Part of me wanted to just ignore it and continue shopping for robot snipers and 500,000-volt electrified fence wire, but that part of me was weak and deep down I knew what I had to do.Needless to say, I bought 5 gallons immediately and selected the next-day shipping. (Which was only $90! What a deal!) My eyes were filled with satisfaction as amazon informed me I had completed my purchase.That night I waited for what seemed like an eternity, keeping a sharp eye on my mailbox (from the safety of my panic room using CCTV cameras). I knew that every government agency from the ATF to the FBI would be monitoring this deal. Everybody knows milk is hard to find, and I was sure my purchase had been monitored.Anyway that night I was asleep in my triple-diamond-layered panic room, when all of the sudden my tripwire alarms went off!!They were here.But before I could do anything, a helicopter suddenly descended from the skies and cut a hole in my panic room with a superhot plasma laser! I was shocked, and could only watch as none other than Chuck Norris descended into my room and looked at me. He walked over to me and punched me in the face. I shot backwards through all three layers of diamond in my panic room, all my bones were broken, I could only watch as Chuck Norris bent down and stared into my face."Your payment was rejected, punk. Insufficient funds."And that's the last thing I remember. I'm sending this from an iphone I smuggled into prison.
title: It all started last week...

body: DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT dunk your cookies in Tuscan Whole Milk. The purity of the Milk will be destroyed and the universe will come to a slamming halt. The earth will stop spinning on its axis. The stars will fall from the heavens. We will enter a permanent solareclipse. Fire breathing dragons will appear. Hell will not only freeze over but will reach absolute zero. The purity of the MILK must be preserved. You may take a bite of a cookie (preferably chocolate chip or Oreo) and then an immediate swig of Tuscan Whole Milk but never, never dunk. Please use lesser milks for dunking. Proceed at your own risk!

body: Warning: Pregnant women, the elderly, and children should avoid prolonged exposure to Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz..Caution: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. may suddenly accelerate to dangerous speeds.Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. contains a liquid, which if exposed due to rupture should not be touched, inhaled, or looked at.Do not use Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. on concrete.Discontinue use of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. if any of the following occurs:* Itching* Vertigo* Dizziness* Tingling in extremities* Loss of balance or coordination* Slurred speech* Temporary blindness* Profuse Sweatingor* Heart palpitationsIf Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. begins to smoke, get away immediately.  Seek shelter and cover head.Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. may stick to certain types of skin.When not in use, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. should be returned to its special container and kept under refrigeration.Failure to do so relieves the makers of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz., Tuscan Farms, and its parent company, Global Chemical Unlimited, of any and all liability.Ingredients of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. include an unknown glowing substance which fell to Earth, presumably from outer space.Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. has been shipped to our troops in Saudi Arabia and is also being dropped by our warplanes on Iraq.Do not taunt Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz..Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. comes with a lifetime guarantee.
