body: Farmer Jones comes up to me.He says "Elsie I need something from you."I got scared.  I remembered what Jenny the sheep told me.He says, "Elsie, we need some milk from you."  I breathe a sigh of relief.So he hooks up this machine to my udders.  At first it felt strange.  I feel a suction stimulating me.  At first I feel my milk start flowing slowly.  After five minutes I'm gushing, screaming to myself with pleasure, more, more, more.  Ten minutes later my legs feel wobbly. I'm spent.  My milk is gone.  But I feel so satisfied.  I looked at the farmer and with my eyes asked him for a cigarette.  Unfortunately, he doesn't understand me.This milk you now contemplate buying- came from me.  With love.  I personally guarantee Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz.
title: This Was My Milk - "Elsie"

body: "Thank you! This is a moment of joy, This is too much. He who kisses the joy as it flies and lives in eternity so rise. This is wonderful to be here. I want to dive in this ocean of Tuscan Whole Milk, liters and gallons of generosity. A hailstorm of kindness!  This is a terrible mistake because I used up all my English, my body is in tumult. Thank you from the bottom of my heart.  I'm so happy that every organ in my body is moving in a very bad way.  I want to make love with everybody on Amazon."
title: Roberto Benigni, Oscar-Winning Actor, Director and Proud Native of Tuscany, On Tuscan Whole Milk, One Gallon, 128 fl oz:

body: Heard a strange noise in the kitchen last night. Well folks, it seems the Poppin-Fresh doughboy decided to visit me in the middle of the night and bake some of his mouth watering buttermilk biscuits.I found him sitting at my kitchen table munching a piece of biscuit with the one good arm that he hadn't used for dough, and sucking up a big glass of my precious Tuscan Whole Milk with a straw. Now I dont mind a visit from a cute, doughy man from time to time, but drinking my precious Tuscan Whole Milk? OH HELL NO! I sent that boy packing with a well aimed shot squeezed off of my trusty varmit killing twelve gauge. Nothing, but nothing gets between me and my Tuscan Whole Milk. Well, maybe nothing but my four-hundred pound, dead-sexy neighbor in his Three Wolves T-shirt.
title: Poppin-Fresh outta here

body: Do not be fooled!  This product is just one of many from the evil mind of Karl Rove.  To help President Bush and his cronies, who are from Texas, make billions of dollars, Karl Rove has devised a scheme to gouge us on our milk purchases.  $3.99 a gallon!!!  We all know its true market value is 98 cents, but Rove has gotten Big Milk to limit supplies and artificially drive up the price through speculation on the commodities market.Some say it is the market at work and we should open up areas of Kansas to dairy production to increase supply and lower the price.  Possibly true.  But even so, environmentalists are fighting this because with increased dairy production comes increased methane (cow farts), and thus an acceleration in global warming.Even more say that the real problem is all the different blends.  Whole, Skim, 2%, low fat, chocolate, and lactose free.  The distribution and pipelines required for this are enormous and very expensive.  What is needed is more pipelines and a reduction in the required "boutique blends".  And when this project was submitted for review, who did the administration give the "no bid" contract to if congress passed the bill???  HALLIBURTON!!!Halliburton, not content with their military contracts and oil services divisions now wants to gouge Americans and the government on milk pipelines and distribution.  These people are truely evil.  And this can be traced to Vice President Cheney.  Who was formerly the CEO of Halliburton.  See the connection?Karl Rove must be stopped.  Starve the beast.  Drink Soy Milk!  Which in reality is Soy Juice.  It's not milk at all.  But who the hell would buy it if it was correctly labeled Soy Juice?
title: Rovian Conspiracy with Big Milk!

body: I know, if it weren't for the icy cold jug of Tuscan Whole Milk I was clinging to on my way to Mars I would've become over heated and dehydrated for sure. Then when I got to Mars, I was able to grow my own Tuscan Whole Milk tree simply by planting the empty jug. We even named our flourishing Martian colony after this very special liquid to which we owe our lives. From the beginning, the milk was a savior as the native Martians would've made mincemeat of us for sure if we hadn't been able to offer up such a valuable peace offering as Tuscan Whole Milk. Currently, a committee comprised of native and new Martians are discussing which branch of our new government will be ruled by Tuscan Whole Milk and then we will discuss renaming the planet from Mars to Tuscan. Of course there is some resistance as older people often have trouble adapting to new ideas.
title: Greetings from the red planet, Tuscan

body: Well, it all started when I was sweeping my clock.  The minute hand struck my head and I was out cold.  When I awoke, I felt I was in a trunk.  The trunk to a 14 wheeler riding down sunset road.  I crawled out and asked where I was heading.  He said "home".  I said Ok  and sat with him in my car seat.  I turned on the radio and smoke came out.  I says to him "Hey your radio is smokin"  he says "thanks I got it from radio shack".  The fumes began to fill up the car and we both pass out.  The 15 wheeler is now peddling down the hallway full speed.  The highway gives out and we tumble to the icy bottoms below.  There I meet a vegetarian who loves take out.  He ordered me a sushi bun in which I proceeded to devour.  HE say "Why you eat my sushi for?"  I says "Gramma's order".  I march out and found my way to Nebraska.  I see an ocean, I set my basket into the water a proceed to white water raft.  The tides are getting high and the alligator is on my tail.  I reach up and grab the closest balloon in which I fly away.  Theres a blimp I see, gramma R' us blimp.  I jump aboard and say "your taken over"  I highjack the blimp and find my way to the closest grocery store.  They say "were out of milk"  I say NO!  Gramma demands milk for her apple cider.  No milk, I decide to go to the next best thing.  Amazon.com  I travel to the Amazon and find a shaman.  The shaman tells me to find the ultra rare, legendary hindaru plants.  I walk in hid garden and pluck one out.  I give it to him and he tells me to off.  The amazon and I begin to fight.  Luckily the 16 wheeler comes crashing in.  Turns out it was carrying milk to deliver to amazon.com.  I cheer.  I forget to unwrap the milk and I suffocate.  Bewst milk I evar tasted.
title: Gramma's milk trip

body: For heaven's sake...Don't let them see you reading this.  I don't know how long I have. Possibly just a matter of minutes. It started this morning when Uncle Ira changed.  It was right after breakfast. We had that Tuscan Milk everyone is so raving about. In fact, I bought the last quart that Gristede Bros. had in stock, and it cost a small fortune. But quelle milk...with the high butterfat content, that smooth richness, the almost vanilla top notes and creamy but not heavy texture.  We had a bit after dinner yesterday...just a soupcon in the coffee and it was utterly marvelous.  Then this morning, we all had some of them there Kellogg's Frosted Mini-Wheats. So we had our cereal and milk, and milk in the coffee, and Uncle Ira done had himself two bowls of the Mini-Wheats plus a bowl of milk and bananas while he watched Dr. Phil on TV. That was when I knew something was wrong.  It was him that went first. Uncle Ira, I mean, not Dr. Phil.  "Uncle Ira, what you doin' watchin' that there city feller on the teevee?" I yells to him.  He come into the kitchen and he's got long underwear on and suspenders, Uncle Ira, of course, not that Phil galoot. I wuz fit to bust. Here's this neurosurgeon dress up like he was Farmer in the Dell or somepin. Well, I sez, Uncle Ira, you a newer sturgeon or somepin like it an I ain't never seed you wearin em longjohns." But damn if I ain't feelin a itch to dig up some oshkosh b'gosh overalls and slide my rusty dusty into 'em, so I goes up'na attic, which is what I all of a sudden was callin the second floor, and commence lookin' fer sum.  And then I comes down and looks outta the winder and they's there. Jes' a waitin, bidin' they time. I calt to the young uns to come look and down they come a runnin. Now, call me crazy as ol' Bertie's possum hound, but them kids jes don look like theyselves. Camilla is wearin' a washdress with a apron tied round her, and River Joachim has on t'other set a overalls what was up na attic. She got her hair in a braid and his got his all slicked back with water, and they's both grinnin like idiots. "Ready to do the chores, maw," yells the boy.  "I'll get started on them dishes," yells the girl. "I'm fixing to take a sweet tater pie over to Granma Rawlins today and I better git bustlin."  Did I mention they both et two bowls of cereal with that Tuscan milk, plus a glass each? They did.  I'z the onliest one what had jes that one bowl, thas alls I et, plus the coffee.  It musta worked slow on me, because I'm figgerin' it out. Now that I seen them things in the yard, awaitin'.  I didn't know at furst what they wuz, standin there alookin in at us, because they ain't what you expects to see from the terrace of a condo on East 58th street, but I done looked and looked, and it was them allright. Cows. Just starin up at us.  "What's them animals doin' down there?" I yelled, and then...jes like that...I knew.  It was the milk. They done it, the cows. They turned us.  That milk that we couldn't get enough of, that we was guzzlin' like hogs at the trough, it was in the milk. I don't know what it was but we's farmhands now, workin for 'em, workin' for the cows.  Gettin' up at four am to milk 'em, feedin' em, herdin' 'em. It's all about the cows now. They done somthin to us allright...you gotta save yosef...too late fer us. Listen, you go by the big barn where they used to have that there libery on fifth avenue, what we now calls the meadow. There'll be a buggy an a horse hitched to it. The horses ain't in on it, I don't think. Take the horse and...damn, I gotta go. Bossie is comin' this way...
title: For God's Sake, Make it a black coffee...

body: I began drinking Tuscan Whole Milk as part of an effort to align my diet and my life with biblical principles. For reference, here's the verse that turned me on to this wonderful product:"As newborn babes, desire pure Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, that ye may grow thereby unto salvation."-1 Peter 2:2Highly recommended for any and all salvation seekers!
title: Tuscan Whole Milk - St. Peter got it right...

body: Wooed by promises of superhuman virility and riches beyond my wildest imaginings, I finally broke down, liquidating my IRA, and selling my favorite gerbil Winston in order to purchase some Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz.  I could barely contain my tremors of excitement as I wired the Western Union money order.  I must admit that over the ensuing days, my anxiety became nearly unbearable - sleep escaped me, and I could not concentrate at work.  However, as the estimated delivery date approached, a strange calm overtook me.  The realization that I would soon be bathing in the glory that is Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz. made the pettiness of life's minutiae fade away.  I could no longer hear the prattling of my withered wife - she of the sagging breasts and endless headaches - and I smiled furtively at the knowledge that I would soon be free of her.Days later, unable to restrain myself further, I marched into my supervisor's office, oblivious to his protestations, undid my belt, and proceeded to defecate all over his TPS reports.  The look of horror on his face imbued me with emotions that few will ever know.  Feeling triumphant, I strode past the rows of employees, who, slaves to their own fear stood gaping, and slapped the office secretary on my way out the door.  When I arrived home, I informed my inadequate spouse that I had found a new mistress, and she would need to remove herself from my presence by the end of the week - the date of course coinciding with the arrival of the much-anticipated elixir.  As I relaxed in the kitchen, my feet lightly resting on the table's cool laminate surface, I knew that this had been the best $2,500 I had ever spent.Finally, the day arrived.  The drab UPS employee, somehow immune to the package's awesomeness, blithely handed over the Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz.  I raced to the kitchen, suffering a slew of paper cuts in my haste to open the cardboard barrier.  The liquid inside appeared slightly discolored - almost grayish in hue, but I quickly dismissed the observation as I could practically feel it's power pulsing through the attractive plastic container.  I twisted the cap, unleashing a rush of air from the jug.  I stumbled back, as I hadn't experienced an odor so rank since my wedding night.  These signals would have given any sane man pause, but I was too invested, too hungry for salvation.  I pressed the opening to my trembling lips, throwing back my head, and swallowing half of its contents in one go.  The reaction was instantaneous.The insufficiently-viscous mélange caused me to regurgitate harder than one of Hef's girlfriends after inhaling his pubic detritus in a Viagra-fueled crotch-gobbling session.  The evil substance shot through my system like a tornado through a trailer park, prompting what I can only politely refer to as fecal urgency.  A miasma of blood, pus, and bile began to leak from my eyes, ears, and nose.  As I lay prone on the unforgiving linoleum floor, suffering indignities only Jimi Hendrix could understand, my wife passed through the kitchen, suitcase in hand.  I knew in an instant that I deserved every ounce of the disgust manifested in her unsightly features.  I am sprawled here now, awash in my own bodily fluids - unemployed...abandoned...too weak even to end my own suffering...broken in every way.Damn you Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl. oz....damn you.
title: A Broken Man

body: Incredible value for such a rare product. While on our trip to Tuscany, we were able to find the Tuscany milking cattle but unlike our domestic cattle they have only one thingy on the bottom side.
title: Incredible value for such a rare product. While on ...

body: It is suspiciously white.
title: Five Stars

body: I can't decide whether it is whitefish or bluefish. The texture is more like the latter. Don't add lemon, though.
title: Tastes like fish

body: It kills kudzu. Dead, root and all. I tried it on the poison ivy today, and the squirrel that eats one bite out of all of my tomatoes and then figures out, once again, that it doesn't like tomatoes. Them two are a bit tougher and definitely more native than kudzu, though. But if Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, can resolve those pesky infestations in the next few days, I'll next apply liberally to Japanese privet and my neighbor, the timeless wonder who doesn't realize that his guitar doesn't sound a bit better at 3 AM. And if it can take care of those prickly problems, the chickweed and endlessly yapping ankle-biting chihuahua next door should be nothing. Apply as directed, and dispose of the empty container carefully.
title: Effective invasive growth management

body: This product is satisfying and delicious--especially when served after being refrigerated.  However, the label does not warn so-called 'intolerants'--people whose stomachs disagree with this tasty beverage--to beware before imbibing.Use caution.  If you are unsure if you are an 'intolerant' and you are a first-time milk drinker, take a small sample before consuming an entire glass.  If you notice your stomach experiencing an unusual 'full' sensation, or those around you report powerful flatulence, discontinue use for your own safety.  Flatulence is flammable.Tuscan should be more responsible and provide these anti-flatulence warnings.
title: Unsafe, lacks warning label for lactose-impaired people

body: My uncle has a country place that no one knows about.He says it used to be a farm, before Amazon.com.And on Sundays I elude the Eyes, and hop the Tuscan FreightTo fondle some bovines, where my white-haired uncle waits.Jump to the ground as the Turbo slows to cross the Tuscan line.Milk like the wind, as excitement shivers up and down my spine!Down in his barn, my uncle preserved for me a milking machine,For fifty-odd years. To keep it as new has been his dearest dream.I strip away the old debris that hides a shining milker. A brilliant red bar of cheddarFrom a better, vanished time. I fire up the willing engine, responding with a roar.Udders spitting liquid, I commit my weekly crime...Milk-In my hair-Twisting and turning-Mechanical mooing-Adrenaline surge...
title: Adrenaline surge!

body: I tried the Tuscan Chocolate Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. It was "good," but not "45-dollars" good.This time I'll wait until someone's selling a used copy.
title: Weary of paying full price.

body: Usually I can tolerate how regular store bought milk is to me, with its usually snide personality and occasional comments about my obese and supposedly intellectually challenged mother, but Tuscan Whole Milk takes the cream with its rude remarks.  I come home to find my mother near tears when her obesity is brought up and her intelligence brought into question.  I yelled at the milk for verbally abusing my mother and it ran off, only to come back later to verbally abuse my poor grandfather.  I remember he was called something of an aged flatulence or something of the sort.  So I cut the milk and let the juice that kept it alive run down my face and throat, whilst screaming "THIS SACRIFICE IS FOR YOU PAWPAW" who died earlier that day.  I also found it pleasant that the milk bottle is able to be stuffed by a taxidermist very easily.  Another one for the mantle.
title: NOT FOR THOSE WHO ONLY MODERATELY TOLERATE LACTOSE

body: This is just milk you guys. REALLY. I do not understand what the weird fuss is. It is .... milk... As a daily consumer of milk I ordered some due to the rave reviews. I FOUND it to be comparable to my local store brand discount milk. In a blind test my cat could not tell the difference. At $10 a gallon you're better off buying a cow. Don't fall for it!
title: It's just milk

body: This must be the best tasting milk on the planet. At first I was feeling a bit weary to buy Tuscan milk online. I try to be cost effective and frugally minded on all of my higher-end luxury dairy purchases...but then it occurred to me. At almost $75 per gallon it makes the shipping seem reasonable.As it turned out it was a big hit. My cat loves it! But the litter box did not. I've Been hornswaggled again. Walt Disney is probably laughing  from his grave at me... How many Disney cats drank milk in those cartoons? Well as it turns out cats are suppossed to eat meat... Not drink milk.Lesson learned. After she finishes the other 14 gallons I bought for this week, it's no more milk from here on.
title: This must be the best tasting milk on the planet

body: Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz is, please pardon the expression, simply the cream of the crop of Italian mystic milks. Unlike the Verona cow squeezings, I have never had a potion ruined by premature curdling, even when there may have been a touch of fungus on a bat's wing. A liberal dousing of Napoli milk can barely keep a agraldaemon in the circle, while just a small smear of Tuscan on the smudge pot will pretty much guarantee there will be no premature disemboweling. And it will stay fresh enough for weeks in the dankest grotto. It's heaven-sent. Well, maybe not that.
title: Spellbindingly good

body: Very good milk.
title: Five Stars

body: With all the poisons and diseases that plague most other milk brands, it is impossible to put a price on the peace of mind provided by Tuscan Whole Milk. When most other brands of milk at the grocery store will more than likely cause radiation poisoning, flesh eating viruses, club foot, anal leakage, heart palpitations, sweaty limb disorder, back fat, rabid sneezing, and elaborate hallucinations involving Kathy Bates; it is insane to chose a brand other than Tuscan Milk. I am alive to write this review only because of Tuscan Whole Milk. Thank you, Tuscan Whole Milk!
title: Tuscan Milk WORTH EVERY PENNY!

body: At $50 a gallon it costs only $679 to fill up my tank and my car is running like a dream!
title: My Volkswagen is Running Great!

body: Because tuscan milk is the hero america deserves, but not the one it needs right now. So we'll hunt tuscan milk. Because it can take it. Because it's not our hero. It's a silent guardian, a watchful protector. A tuscan milk.
title: Tuscan milk

body: So last July I was driving on my annual vacation from Las Vegas to Phoenix and with all of the comments I've read about this milk I decided to order some and take it along for the trip. I so do like a glass of the 'white' along with my tin of dolphin safe tuna sandwiches and watching my favorite DVD's from the driver's seat.Well, forgetful as I was and so involved in observing the beautiful sage brush and endless miles of desert, I forgot to fuel up at the last stop and now had too little fuel to turn around and go back. Obviously I was in a bad way. I mean...the milk and tuna fish sandwiches (Twelve gallons of milk and five dozen sandwiches) were going to go foul in the hot, July Arizona heat. Yuck!Then suddenly I saw this person walk up to my car from off in the distance. Looked like and old miner the way he was dressed. He didn't say anything, but pointed to one of the gallons of milk and then to the gas cap of my car. I glanced at the milk again and when I turned to look at him he had vanished. A mirage. Guess that's what happens in 120 degree heat.But then when I looked back into my car again I saw a really old two-gallon tank of gas where I was sure I'd never seen one before. It was full so I poured the gas into my car and there was enough to get me to the next town. As I fueled up and an old Texaco, the old station attendant saw the gas can and said, 'that's old Pete's gas can. You're lucky he found you.'I told the old man the whole story and he simply nodded. "Ol' Pete, ya see, he doesn't just do that for anyone." The old man winked and said, "it was the milk." When I got to Phoenix, I found that two of the gallons of milk were empty, just the jugs remaining.Thank you, Old Pete, you saved my life. And thanks to the makers of Tuscan Whole Milk. You saved me too. *Sniff!*
title: Obviously not just any ordinary milk.

body: All of that 128 oz. and 74 dollars spilled and gone to waste.
title: Only milk worth crying over

body: This excellent product confirmed that Mary was a Virgin.  It was surprisingly easy, the only challenge being smuggling Tuscan Whole Milk into the Vatican Library.My good friend Father Guido Sarducci has full access to the most restricted parts of the Vatican Library, where such documents as the diary of Saint Joseph's shrink are kept.  He and I have over the years returned many times to the question of how to convince doubters that the Blessed Virgin was indeed a Virgin.  When I told the good Father about Tuscan Whole Milk over a glass of red wine in a bar in Whippany, New Jersey, he instantly put two and two together, shouted "Four!" (startling the other patrons), and lofted into the air a projectile that landed three weeks later in Rome.We disembarked, our coat pocket flasks of Tuscan Whole Milk raising no alarms at customs (they waived us through), and proceeded to the Library.We asked for the B Logs.  While the good Father kept the supervisory librarian occupied with pictures of his children, I applied Tuscan Whole Milk to these ancient pages, the original logs of the Bethlehem street inspection team which had the duty of stopping pregnant women and checking their virginity.  Most scholars of this document agree that Mary shows as a Virgin every time she was inspected, but there is some doubt.  The document is old.  The writing is no longer clear.  And the careless use of one critical page to record a recipe for cherry pie does make two key entries a bit questionable.  (By the way, the recipe is excellent.  I have used it, and it makes for good eating.)A clean cloth moistened with Tuscan Whole Milk carefully applied had exactly the effect Father Sarducci had foreseen in Whippany.  The recipe was gone.  The key entries now clearly and unambiguously confirmed the Virginity of our Holy Mother.I give this product five stars.Imprimatur: P. J. O'ReillyNilil Obstat: Al Franken
title: Proves Mary was a Virgin

body: Recently, I had a few days when I really was not feeling all that "fresh." I use a number of feminine hygiene products, but this month they, well, they just didn't seem to work quite right... I happened to see my mother that weekend and mentioned my "freshness" problem. As we walked in the morning sunshine, she laughed and told me about the Tuscan line of products. "I have used them for years," she confided. When we got home, she showed me a shelf of Tuscan milk items in the bathroom fridge.That day, I ordered Tuscan Whole Milk using the fast shipment option. I was amazed with the quick delivery, and found that it really did the trick for me. I have ordered Tuscan Skim for "light" days, and have a few cartons of the quart "Two Percent" for my frequent business travel. I also am ordering the Tuscan Strawberry Yogurt as an intimate lubricant. My boyfriend is excited!
title: Great for those Freshness Issues!

body: Has there ever been a liquid as divine as thee, Tuscan Whole Milk? Your sensuality defies logic, caressing my throat as you tumble to my tummy, filling me with a sense of purpose, and calcium. Remember when you saved my life, Tuscan Whole Milk, at the lake during the summer of '79? I was swimming too far out, the current took me under, I scrambled and flailed beneath the surface. You were there, Tuscan Whole Milk, there to bring me above water, holding me tight in your grasp, pulling me to shore. We collapsed on the shore, letting the sand invade our bodies. And in that moment under the brilliant sun, I drank you, Tuscan Whole Milk. I took you into my body and let you tantalize my senses.Then we played Uno.
title: Nectar of the Gods

body: Is this milk expensive? Sure it is. But think how much it would cost for the direct flight to Pisa on Delta from JFK, then add a train or car three hours to Tuscany as well as the fee the farmer would charge you to let you suckle directly from the teat of his most prized cow. This wine of the udder delivers this experience DIRECTLY TO YOUR DOOR. Now if we can just get Amazon to add it to Prime....
title: Expensive But Worth It!

body: This product was wonderfully delicious, but very cold, and did not separate into the differently textured and flavored milk products I recall from my youth.  Milk should be warm (about cow temperature) and served fresh, or allowed to sit and separate into cream (which floats on top) and low-fat milk so that the user can make use of the product both in EXTRA FLAVOR and DIET varieties.  By the way, if you put the creamy top layer of a proper milk into a container and shake it for a while, you can make your own BUTTER and BUTTERMILK.  I was unable to do any of this with the Tuscan Whole Milk at all, so I had to drop it's score from what would have been 4 stars.  Any milk which can't be used properly is obviously defective, as are (in my opinion) the people who WANT their milk that way.
title: Not quite like back home

body: One hundred twenty eightOunces here of milkThe best I've had to dateAs smooth as finest silkFor only fifty bucksIt'll satisfy your familyFortified with calciumAnd vitamin DThe milk of Tuscany
title: The Milk of Tuscany

body: I find myself craving milkWhenever I eat food.For as the bolus leaves my mouthIt puts me in the mood.After chewing up the food of choiceAnd initiating swallow,I have to have that creamy milkOr face feeling hollow.The Tuscan brand it is the champI'll never change my tune.Just check out the crafty labelOf the cow jumping the moon.The gallon jug it is a stapleOf the household kitchen's fridgeIt is liquid that allows my mouth-Lets entree and dessert be bridged.And just what could your cereal beIf not floating in your bowl.No river of deliciousnessTo cure your hunger's toll.So let me say it one more timeIn fact I'll scream it loud.My life is whole with Tuscan's helpIt's moustache makes me proud!Thank you Tuscan.
title: Ode To Tuscan

body: My Little Tuscan Whole Milk...My Little Tuscan Whole Milk...Ahhhhhhh!My Little Tuscan Whole Milk!I used to wonder what milk could beUntil Tuscan Whole Milk came to me!Bottle of plastic!One gallon of fun!A bright red cap!A taste that's sweet!And one hundred and twenty eight gallons makes it all complete!My Little Tuscan Whole Milk...Don't you know that you complete my breakfast!

body: My mother was no freaking liar! She said "Drink your milk and your bones will be strong!".  Strong, they are. I took a roundhouse kick to the jaw from none other than Bob Betancort himself (he fought Chuck Norris as a child). It's also been sung that "If you can buy, I'm sure they sell: VITAMIN L". Well the same goes for milk. White, wholesome goodness from the Gods.Drink a gallon of this a day and you'll be pissing calcium stones regularly.  That'll make a grown man cry, but you'll be strong as a moose. Ready for the day your Monopoly game gets ugly and you have to pound that jerk with the racecar into the ground. Make you take the thimble, will he?Sam Kelly once said with a sigh : ahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh! I'm sure he was talking about MILK. MILK. MILK.  128 fluid ounces of cow oil.
title: White, Wholesome Goodness.

body: I bought this "Tuscan" milk... Turns out NOT FROM TUSCANY! SO PISSED! DO NOT BUY! CAN'T RETURN! SPENT MORE THAN 20$ ON THIS! TOTAL RIP!

body: I heard such good things about Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz I just had to try it. I was a little put off since it only came in Caucasian but I put my qualms aside. After bathing, I was upset to discover that I had no youthful glow as I was expecting. Very disappointing.In the future I will stick to the blood of virgins for the restoration of my youth. body: I had been plagued by chancres for nearly a year; a delightful "I'm leaving you" gift from my ex.  There was simply no relief from the pain, and I have tried everything on the market.I had been reading these incredible reviews about this simply fantastic product, Tuscan Whole Milk, and thought, "Hell, why not?  Let's give it a try!"  It wasn't a miraculous cure, to be sure, but after dipping my chancre-encrusted genitalia in this milk during my last outbreak (twice a day for week), I'm proud to say I've been chancre-free for nearly a two months!Now I know what you are saying, "Impossible."  It's not and the sex has been great!  If you are suffering from unwanted STD's and chancres, give Tuscan Milk a whirl.  Worked for me, can for you too!
title: The Healing Power of Tuscan Milk

body: Warning cows were held hostage and had this stuff stolen from their underside. Don't support underside cow juice theft. Only buy milk from cows that willingly walk into the dairy and drop of a few gallons.
title: Stolen Cow Juice!!!

body: I can only fully express my feelings for this product in a poem.Oh silky substance!Oh nature's boon!I long to feel your wholeness!Your galactic touch,Your soft white form,And suckle in your milky-ness!Oh Tuscan fields!Oh Elysian pastures!I walk as Maximus before the arena,Smell Roman earthAnd Tiber's waterFor Tuscan Whole Milk I couldn't be keener.My heart is pierced!My soul bereft!I asked dear Amazon to fill my needs.Across the oceanThe goods were ferried -But only got Tuscan Whole Cheese!
title: I wish I could have my Tuscan Whole Milk

body: I highly recommend this product. After years of failure putting cows through my Juiceman, Tuscan Whole Milk has come out with a product that not only looks like milk, but actually is milk. I have no idea how they've done it, but surely there is a patent on their brilliant process. The best I could ever hope to get was a pulpy red mess with chips of bone and some fur.
title: Way better than juiced c

body: I was coming home from a hard days work when suddenly, from behind the bushes outside my 6th fl apartment, lept a man in ski mask holding a gun. He was shaking and nervous and I just prayed that he didn't have a twitchy trigger finger. Just as I was slowly about to hand him my wallet, out comes my neighbor with a bowl of Cap'n Crunch and a bottle of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. I did a Chuck Norris ninja-roll, grabbed the milk and flung a squirt at his open mouth (he was in the middle of a "WTF?"). He immediately became lactose intolerant and lost all bowel control on the spot. He scampered away whimpering, clenching his buttocks tightly as he ambled farting down the stairway never to be seen again.I now carry some for self defense at all times.-J
title: Saved my life

body: I sipped it and shuddered.  She watched over me, holding the gallon of Tuscan whole white milk, making sure I would get to the bottom of the glass.  I almost gagged.  All I could think about were the undulating udders the milk had been squeezed from.  The hard metal suction cups that had clamped onto the things to squeeze the thick milk from the mammary glands that had created it.  But she watched and waited from me to drink it all still holding the gallong of Tuscan whole milk.  I hated her a little for it.I held my breath and sucked it all down, my eyes going cross eyed as I watching the cold white substance diminish in the glass, wishing it would go faster, disappear and release me from the task.  Eventually, I reached the bottom, and let out a deep sigh of success. I belched and then threw up on her shoes.
title: Udders

body: Just want to send this to StrainCentral
title: Five Stars

body: I just can't imagine life without this! It makes me want to drink milk.. EVERYDAY.
title: Five Stars

body: And with only half the Trans Fats and Gluten as regular Cow’s milk!!  Highly recommended and well worth the money!!Oh and by the way - Don’t forget to visit “Amazon's David Hasselhoff Store”.  You’ll be glad you did!!
title: Much better than Tuscan Half milk!

body: At 45, I thought my milk days were over.  We stumbled onto milk on Amazon while not in possession of good judgment and thought, "Why not?"  Fifty dollars later, it arrived.  Whole milk feels like half-n-half if you haven't drank the stuff in a while.  And it's good.  Why do kids drink so much of it?  Because it's good, duh.  If you don't have kids you may not have seen it in a while, so let me refresh your memory: it's white, it has no taste, but it has texture.  It's brilliant.  Dump it onto Cap'n Crunch: it doesn't change the taste.  Same with Sugar Pops: doesn't change them.  Why milk, then?  Why?  Here's my theory: you're pouring the drink into the food so you don't have to drink, too.  This explains why adults stop drinking it.  Adults have coffee, or maybe tea.  Oops, I almost wrote teat, which would have been a milk pun.  Anyway, alternating drinks of hot and cold makes your teeth fracture into tiny fragments instantly, which means no more milk if you're going to have coffee.  And who's giving up coffee?I was just informed that people have milk in their coffee.  Imagine that.In summary, I'm going all in for milk.
title: Alternating drinks of hot and cold makes your teeth fracture into tiny fragments instantly.

body: I long for you,To hold you in my hands.To caress your creamy whit plastic, warm from sitting in a cardboard box, on my porch, in the sun.I wish I could run to the kitchen Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz in hand, and pour the gloppy curdled milk into the grimy class on the counter.I long to bring the glass to my lips and feel the chunky, slimy curds and watery bland liquid struggle down my thought.I can here the doorbell now, the voice of the delivery man, "Here you go miss, a package from Amazon. How lucky you are!"I would do anything to for a glass of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz right now,But I can't,I shouldn't.Don't let me press that big buy button that is calling to me......I have gone and done it,Not again,My therapist is going to have another fit, for the 5th time.But I can't help it,The one thing I can't resist,Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon, 128 fl oz.
title: I Long For You

body: So Im just sitting there, playing Guitar Hero and dying of thirst. Boy does rocking out get your mouth dry. So I ran to the fridge, unsure of what I would find. Lets see, theres some cola, tea, purple stuff.....TUSCAN WHOLE MILK!!! Right on!I grabbed the jug, ripped off the top and chugged away. That refreshing blend of milk and air flowing down my throat. The crisp nature of the hard chunks. Oh no! The Tuscan Whole Milk was long since outdated. Since I was still thirsty I grabbed a spoon and dug in.Do I ever love me some Tuscan Whole Milk!
title: I hope this is under my christmas tree

body: I have purchased 40 gallons of Tuscan Whole Milk and have replaced all of the water in my aquarium.  My fish have never been happier!  I used to have a plain old "fresh water" aquarium with plain old "fresh water" fish. NOW I have a "TUSCAN WHOLE MILK" aquarium!  My neon tetras seem to be much more "sparkly" now, at least when they come close to the glass so I can see them.  My fancy guppies also seem much more active, often jumping completely out of the aquarium altogether. They have incredible "staying power" now that they have Tuscan Whole Milk - they often lie on the floor gasping for hours before I find them and return them to their wholey Tuscany milky home, with seemingly no ill effects.....
title: Great with Fish!

body: Creaminess allows for extraordinary milk bubbles for the mouth or through one's nose!!!I'll be back for seconds that's for sure!!
title: Fun!

body: While on the whole, the Tuscan Milk experience can be described as "mildly pleasant", I found that it failed the most important category of all... Compatibility with chocolate syrup. Indeed, the density of Tuscan Whole Milk is so severe that Hershey's Chocolate Syrup (and 95% of store brand equivalents) does not actually blend with the milk, but instead floats at the top no matter how hard you stir. And if you should be so foolish as to consider powdered Nesquik, you will find that the chocolate flavored granules in fact hover above the surface of the milk and create a choking cloud of air-passage clogging brown particulate.Were this Tuscan Whole Milk's only transgression, it might have earned it 3 stars, rather than 2. Unfortunately, the extraordinary density also affects the consumption of cereal. Captain Crunch for instance not only "stays crunchy", but it also never actually gets "wet". This is simply unforgiveable.For those interested, I would recommend drinking it plain... out of a sturdy glass.
title: Too Dense.

body: PART I.This is DEFINITELY great-tasting milk, and I'm REALLY glad to see aproduct that probably needs refrigeration on Amazon....because maybe my other favourite products which need refrigeration, (mayonnaise, ice-cream, whole cream, half-and-half), will also soon appear on Amazon.The PRICE, of course, is what makes me wary of ordering it from Amazon. Sigh.........I guess, due to the refrigeration and QUICK shipment made necessary by the extremely perishable nature of this liquid, whole milk, make the high price a necessity.  I believe it originates in New Jersey, or another eastern state.  For those in the central or western areas of the country, (or heaven forbid, Canada or Europe!), this milk's shipping and handling charges will be totally prohibitive.......unless one wins the lottery, becomes a successful actress, actor, writer, musician, investor, model, CEO, etc. --  or marries a rich person who loves Tuscan Whole Milk as much as you do!So, for right now, at least, this delicious milk is out of my price-range, (double sigh!)  Luckily, my local supermarket DOES carry the next-best tasting milk: ORGANIC VALLEY.  It is expensive milk too, and I usually don't get it -- but it's quite delicious, and, whilst imbibing it, I can easily pretend it is the "creme de la creme" of milks: TUSCAN WHOLE MILK!PART II.....THE__DREAMPreface:  As many reviews here seem to be part of an amorphous "Tuscan Whole Milk Creative Writing Contest", I've decided to try my hand at it as well........I had won the lottery!  This was a very strange feeling for me -- because generally, I don't believe in even entering the lottery!  Though I DO enter the Publisher's Clearing House Sweepstakes every chance I get, I've always felt that state lotteries, and especially mega-million lotteries, encompassing serveral states, were totally impossible for me to win.  So, I never bought a ticket for any lottery.  This did not, however, stop my best friend from buying a ticket for me for my birthday.  One ticket.  And it won!  It won me $738 million dollars....and twenty-three cents!I had always thought that if I came into a lot of money, the first thing I would do is ask Warren Buffet if I could consult with him on the best way to invest it.  However, the first thing I REALLY did, was go to my computer, go to Amazon.com, and order thirty-five gallons of Tuscan Whole Milk, (I like to put in a big supply of things, because prices keep going up), plus a mew refrigerator and freezer to put them in, as my current 15-cubic foot refrigerator-freezer seemed woefully inadequate to store all that milk.  All of these things arrived within the next two weeks -- two weeks which had been busy with TV interviews, meetings with lawyers, and the discovery of about 3,000 new relatives of whom I had never heard before.....It just so happened that, just after my new refrigerator and freezer, and thirty-five gallons of delicious TUSCAN Whole Milk had arrived, I happened to turn on the TV, and discovered that Mr. Warren Buffet was making a visit to the town where I live!  I put in a call to his hotel room and was lucky enough to actually talk to Mr. Buffet himself! (The MSN article had unwittingly divulged the name of the hotel at which hotel Mr. Buffet was staying, in the initial appearance of the article...though the information disappeared within fifteen minutes on the screen, when a hasty re-write of the article, minus hotel revelation, appeared).  Mr. Buffet was kind, and thoughtful, and immediately put me totally at ease.  He even offered to come to MY home, instead of my travelling to his hotel!With my new personal assistant, I hastily set up the dining room table, with food that I HOPED Mr. Buffet would like: smoked salmon, hamburgers and rolls, lemon sole, (he could take his pick!), and 7-layer cake, served with coffee and, (proudly), with my new Tuscan Whole milk.....When Mr. Buffet arrived, I felt I had re-met an old friend.  He was so unassuming and natural!  Happily, I led him to the dining room table, hoping that the food would put us even more at ease.  I looked forward, not only to "drinking in" his advice, but also to the beautiful platters arranged on the table.However, when Mr. Buffet saw what was on the table, he audibly gasped.  I was afraid he was having a heart-attack, and came immediately to his aid."That....that MILK!" he gasped.  "You threw away money on THAT milk!  It's $129 a gallon!  How...how could you?  How could ANYONE?"With that, he stormed out of my house.I've had a lot of fun and adventures, with my lottery winnings.  But, sadly, I have never seen, nor heard from, Mr. Warren Buffet, again.  :_(
title: PART I --HOW__MUCH__4__POSTAGE__&__HANDLING_?....PART II___THE__DREAM..

body: I'm a big milk fan. Not to say I'm fat, but big as in avid. So when I realized I could buy endless gallons of milk on Amazon I was thrilled. Now when I buy my next installment of classic Sherlock Holmes mysteries, I can add on a gallon of milk. And when I need to buy the new Radiohead CD, I can wash it down with some milk. Yea for milk!But one thing I'm curious, and somewhat concerned, about. The flying cow on the label. In all the years of drinking milk, I've had milk from organic cows, factory cows, sheep, goats, rice, and soy. But flying cows were never an option. My question to you is -- if I drink the flying cow milk will I have superpowers too? I mean, will I defy gravity? And if not that, then can I at least translate the endless mooing I hear from the cows in the barnyard? Will grass taste better to me? Will I be able to fight crime or do I need udders for that?Please let me know ASAP. I already have my super-hero cow outfit picked out!
title: Leaping buildings in a single moooooO!

body: If you pour a glass of milk and it is half empty and it spills you will cry.  However, if you pour a glass of milk and the glass is half full and it spills you will be fine.  If the glass is less than half empty and it spills you will cry and scream like a baby and may need to seek psychiatric treatment.  If the glass is nearly full and it spills, you will be fine and your happy disposition will be enhanced by the fact that you are able to clean up the milk.  If you are in Chicago and a cow kicks over the glass of milk it may just extinguish an open flame and a disaster will be averted.  If the glass of milk spills into a bowl of cherries, you may have a mixed metaphor or the start of a lovely dessert.
title: Milk May Spill With Various Outcomes

body: I used to be in a terrible way. I was depressed, emo and addicted to drugs and gambling. My wife had just left me and taken everything of value from my house, which was about to be demolished in two days time to make way for a freeway. My only son was killed in a tragic gasoline fight accident and I realised that I was mentally impaired. Not even a visit to the Dr Phil show could cure me. I was ready to end my life.As I typed my message into my myspace account saying how sorry I was and goodbye, I decided to try one last thing. Now I've never been a religous man, but I got down on my knees and asked God to help me.Instantly light blasted through my window shining brightly aginst my door and seconds later a deliveryman was knocking, saying that I had a delivery of 1 Gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk. I answered the door, revolver still in hand I snatched the milk ready to wash my sorrows down with some sweet, sweet tuscan before blowing my brains into my neighbour's living room.However, as I drank, I felt years of burdens just falling off me, all pain and anguish disappeared. I went and washed off my makeup and changed out of my black clothes. I was a new man.I'm now running for Governor of my state, have a multi million dollar recording deal as a jazz-blues singer and a new supermodel wife and pet orang-utan. My life is so happy.Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk and thank you Jesus Without you both I'd be burning in Hell right now.You're the man now Tuscan Whole Milk!!!

body: Even though we are in an economic down turn, when you live on credit you can still have it all. As long as the super market doesn't start laying off people, I can still make my monthly payments. So what that I am the only grocery bagger that drives a used Bentley, I got a great deal on the thing, and I only live like 2 miles away from work. Now having a car like mine allows me to get into clubs for free, and since I sip on the same drink all night, it allows me to save money while talking to the chicks. Sometimes I am even able to bring one back home. Now although I live in a studio apartment, I have a plethora of excuses that allow me to keep the chick around with out loosing my cover. It usually ends up with me saying I like staying close to my roots or that my main home is in a different country, even that I am married, women seem to like married guys, something about their ability to commit... But since I have a rather large TV (Best Buy credit card), a leather couch, and a sub zero refrigerator (Dont ask how it fits) I am able to steer them away from thinking I am a sham. Its the mornings that I always had issues with, after the lights are on, the windows are open, and the sobriety has taken its ugly turn. I knew that it was the "devil in the details" that could always help me out. I mean, how many people do you know with a case of Dom in the fridge and a bottle of Louis the 15th? Sure I never drink any of them, and they are all filled with colored water but they make for a great detail, and make me look really good. Thats where the Tuscan Whole Milk comes in. first off, who the hell would be dumb enough to pay for a gallon of milk $69.99 plus shipping? Only those of us who would buy a used Bentley. But thats OK, cause the women love it. When the chicks open my fridge door the first time and see that case of Dom and that gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, they know they are dealing with a smart consumer. After picking up a box of Corn Flakes, of course store brand flakes inside a Kellogg's box, my lady friend will need a product that will quench her need for milk and will do so knowing that it cost an exorbitant amount of money. Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk, your a product that allows me to continue to live the dream...

body: I have never tried hole milk before, so I don't know if Tuscan Hole Milk is simply a sub-standard product, or if the entire concept of hole milk is flawed. My first problem was that this product included no directions. I had no idea what hole to put the milk in. Further, what effect is hole milk supposed to have?I decided to put the Tuscan milk into both of my holes. The first problem is that the container is poorly designed for getting the milk into a hole. I would suggest some kind of tapered top for insertion. I wasted quite a bit of the hole milk trying to pour it in, and it made a huge mess in the bathroom. I finally ended up lying down in the tub and tipping the bottle at a 45 degree angle.This brings me to the next problem, which is that the milk does not stay in the holes if you move from a horizontal position. Without instructions, I am left wondering if this is supposed to happen, or if my particular container of Tuscan Hole Milk is damaged.Another reviewer suggested adding the Tuscan Hole Milk to dry cereal. This seems like a good idea, because the cereal would absorb the milk and probably help it to stay in the holes. My only question is if I should put the cereal in my holes before or after the milk, or rather put them together in a bowl and then scoop the mixture in.I haven't noticed any positive changes since I've been using Tuscan Hole Milk, and I'm starting to smell kind of funny. Therefore, until the Tuscan company has clearer packaging with instructions and usage suggestions, I won't buy this product again.
title: As a hole milk, this leaves much to be desired.

body: Ever since I was just a boy, I have been a huge fan of the milky-white delight that is Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 64 fl oz. My first experience with the original product came around when I was sill using a sippy-cup. The sheer joy that Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 64 fl oz brings to my soul had to be enjoyed once more, but with it's new release; Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. When I heard that they were doubling the quantity, I figured that I just had to buy the product and hope I would not be let down. I ordered the savoury liquid-dessert, and this what I got upon its arrival.With great anticipation, it arrived right on time and in pristine condition; wrapped, cold, and un-harmed by any of the dangerous elements. Inside, the holy nectar awaited with logo and all. Since I am not a hoarder, it was not necessary to hold on to the wrapping.When trying to open my large jug of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, I realized that I didn't have enough muscle to get the red lid right off. It was so tough at first that I though I was going to rip off my own arm before getting the milk! Luckily, I had a P90X kit containing the P90X 3-Phase Nutrition Plan, P90X Fitness Guide, and "How to Bring It" along with all twelve of the highly diverse and intense workouts. By using the P90X Workout Calendar and Online Support Tools, I was able to grow enough muscle to open the lid, but punch through solid-oak doors and muggers alike. Boy, it was a two-for-one bargain with this purchase!Finally, the taste. By Poseidon's trident, the smell was overwhelming! It almost made me get up and buy another dozen gallons for the small price of $45.00. The moment in which the moist, semi-gelatinous substance hit my tongue, I knew that I would never go back to 'peasant' milk from any other company. If you have yet to try out this beautiful drink, then you need to hop up, get to Amazon, and purchase this product! Though normal milk is satisfactory in a couple ways, Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz does more than just give you calcium; it enlightens you, brings joy to your life in every physical, mental, and spiritual, way, and in a couple cases has cured disease. Overall, I say if you are a milk fan, this game is a must buy (even if you are lactose intolerant)!This post was for a school assignment. Just imagine that we live in a world where this is an acceptable review; the lightest time-line.
title: More than just Milk; Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz!

body: I've been using a Windows XP laptop for a number of years and between the malware, the viruses, reinstalling XP, well lets just say I was beyond frustrated.  Then my Tuscan Milk showed up and I rushed to pour myself a tall, talk glass of that white wonder.  I set the glass on my desk and began to write this review when the phone rang.  There was no caller ID so I reached over to grab the phone and spilled my Tuscan Milk on the laptop!  The machine zapped and zinged and moaned and shut off.  Oh noooo Tuscan, what have you done to me!  I carefully wiped off the milk and powered the machine up.  Immediately I knew there were changes.  The BIOS screen was gone, replaced by a full, gray screen.  Then a picture of an apple showed.  Soon, a foreign login screen appeared and it had my user name.  I entered my password and glorious music played, followed by the most beautiful interface I had laid eyes on.  I clicked the postage stamp and my email was all there!  I clicked the icon of the world and a web browser opened.  I clicked the calendar icon and this thing called iCal appeared with all of my events!  Ever since, whatever Tuscan Milk did to my computer, its been like a revelation and working better than it ever had before.  Thank you Tuscan Milk!
title: Tuscan Milk saved my computer

body: I had struggled with homosexuality for years. I tried pills, figure skating deprivation, even spent a weekend watching Richard Simmons workout videos, nothing helped. Then when I was home for fourth of July this year, my mother offered me a glass of tall Tuscan whole milk. Seeing how thirsty I was and how cold and pure the milk was, I eagerly drank deeply.Then it started. Images of cats filled my subconscious. Jessica Simpson suddenly seemed talented. And the desire to biologically fill the world with as many children as humanly possible filled me with a primaral urgency.My mother looked up at me smirking as she dialed her friend Mindy Schwartz, "Mindy, have I got a boy for your Rivkah..."
title: The milk of heterosexuality

body: I was sitting in my kitchen having my first glass of Tuscan milk and I began to daydream of the cows in the field that had made this wonderful milk. How peaceful their days must be, eating grass filling up both stomachs. AH the long sleepy days on the farm. Then I noticed on the label that this milk is from New York. This is probably milk from organized crime. These cows are probably in some form of a cow "sweatshop" in downtown New York, forced to turn out more and more milk to keep people like Tony Soprano in hookers and cigars. I spit the milk out and poured the rest of the gallon down the drain. Those poor cows!UPDATEAfter an unscheduled surprise meeting with Union representatives, I would like to retract my former statement about Tuscan milk. I was mistaken as THERE IS NO CONNECTION BETWEEN TUSCAN MILK OR BEYER FARMS INC. AND ORGANIZED CRIME. I'm DEEPLY, DEEPLY, DEEPLY sorry for my prior statement and will never mention either the milk or you know who again. I was told, "the cows are very happy". Again my deepest apology to you knows who.
title: Those poor cows

body: I must write quickly, for soon, soon, the Milk will awake within me again.  And it will know, but you will have been warned.  The Milk will punish me, but it knows it must have a host, so I will survive - tormented and trapped within myself, but I will continue to exist, though I live in nightmare now.Beware!  Beware the Milk!  For the Milk lives.  I too was once tempted by the smooth, sweet creaminess of Tuscan Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 Fl Oz.  I too read the odes written to its greatness, not knowing that the Milk was forcing it's hosts to speak of the goodness of the Milk that the Milk might spread, that it might acquire new hosts in which to live, and to spread, to spread, to spread.Beware the sweet seduction of the Milk!  Ah - the bittersweet memories of that first gallon.  How smooth, how creamy, how exhilarating, uplifting, fulfilling and enlightening!  How free it made me feel!  But then came that terrible moment when in my home town supermarket, I reached for a gallon of store brand milk, and felt the pain.  Oh, the pain the Milk can give!  Equal in intensity to the first joy that the Milk can give, but pain!  Terrible pain!  Words alone cannot describe it!And now, I live in fear of the Milk, a Slave to the joy and the pain it can give.  Oh, the shame I feel that I must come to the Milk like a supplicant, begging for the pleasure it can give.  And the cowardice that I feel, knowing that I cannot face the pain it can inflict.Beware!  Do not let this be your fate!And now, I must go... the Milk stirs inside me, and it will be angry.  But perhaps, perhaps, it is not too late for you....
title: Beware!

body: I found this product everything and more, in fact, was as promised, after relieving my bladder of Tuscan Whole Milk on trees around the yard, marking my territory with rainbows, unicorns did in fact come to my house. That said, the Tuscan 198% milk, once you get past the fact it pours slower than molasses (I hear it takes years just to milk one Tuscan cow), allows you to hover in midair, shape and time shift, and some other properties not available in the 128 fl oz whole milk.
title: Good. But the 198% is better.

body: Search inside! ->Many years later, as he faced the firing squad, Colonel Tuscano Milkia was to remember that distant afternoon when his father took him to discover milk. ... First they brought the cow. A heavy gypsy with an untamed beard and sparrow hands, who introduced himself as Milkiades, put on a bold public demonstration of what he himself called the eighth wonder of the learned alchemists of Milkedonia. He went from house to house dragging two udders and everybody was amazed to see butter, cottage cheese, whey, and cow brassierres tumble down from their places and small low stools creak from the desperation of teats and gripping hands trying to emerge...[Translated from the Mooish by Gregory Lechebassa]Winner of the 1982 Nobel Prize in Agriculture.Highly recommended.

body: My milk came by UPS via Amazon Super Saver shipping (great value!). Unfortunately, it arrived warm and mildly chunky. As such, I've had to downgrade my rating to only four stars. It's still the best milk $700 can buy -- well worth getting my stomach pumped immediately after having a warm bowl of cereal!
