body: Having just supped my first tumbler of said milk it is safe to say I have fully broken my Tuscan Whole Milk hymen. I cannot help but feel disappoionted. So disappointed in fact that I felt compelled; no, I felt that IT IS MY DUTY to review this milk for what it is. It is a shoddy and poor imitation of Shepherd Gourmet Dairy milk.It is not, as some regard it "the milk of kings." It is a cheap knock-off of a far superior brand. Shepherd gourmet milk, or as I call it, Jesus's Choice" touched me in a way that nothing could every come close to.DO NOT BUY THIS MILK I URGE YOU, the moustache it will leave you with sinks right to the bone and produces emotional scars and/or tumours.You have been warned,Joe Bradbury
title: The Milk of Kings

body: this milk, with a gentle bouquet and soothing aroma should be aged in an oak cellar upon delivery for best results.  two weeks should suffice.drink it straight, or pour it over a bowl of cheerios for something a little different.first time milk drinkers beware - once you've gone tuscan, you'll never go back.now i just wish they'd come out with a 1%, for those of us watching our girlish figures.
title: those crazy kids

body: White as accurately pictured, and probably worth the price but is an inferior product to Provence Whole Milk, 128 fl oz. Also, customer be forewarned! This is not available in Kindle!
title: Worth the Price But...

body: I got my milk yesterday and was really suprised to see that the cap had NOT been perforated correctly so it was almost impossible to get off of the top of the gallon.I used a knife and while trying to cut through the plastic lid it slipped and cut deep into my hand.  I went to the ER and spent the majority of the night there after getting stitches.  I came home and my milk had been sitting on the counter for about 18 hours in 90 degree heat (I do not have air conditioning).ah well, 5 stars.  I'll drink it anyways.
title: Tuscan Milk, How I Love Thee

body: Sunlight streams through cracked blinds, casting slits of light on a yellowed bedspread.  A tipped bottle of "Old Crow" Kentucky Bourbon balances on the nightstand. A few inches away the pale face of a "Lady of the Night" sleeps, a soft mustache on her upper lip.Honk, Honk, Honk, below the 4th floor apartments window a car alarm goes off, awaking the large man next to the hooker.  He stumbles from his bed, naked, smelling of sex and cheap whiskey.  In the fridge he finds a week past date gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, and takes a swig.  He is surprised to find it still fresh past the expiration date.This is just another morning like any other for every kids favorite TV clown...
title: Bubbles

body: Does that label on the gallon jug of Tuscan Whole Milk say "Vitamin D"?  Is it true?  Do mine eyes deceive me? Glory be, it's all true!That's right, true believers, Tuscan Whole Milk contains nutritious, delicious Vitamin D... the SAME vitamin D that your skin produces when exposed to sunlight!  Oh yeah, that's solar power, baby, right in a glass!Now you, too, can harness the power of the sun, and use it to provide much-needed fuel for your body, and possibly make cookies too.  Cookies!  Imagine the possibilities!  Oh what a joyous time we live in.
title: Harness the Power!

body: I found that the Tuscan Whole milk is not the best choice when picking high quality dairy products.  It seems Tuscan had a little run in with the FDA when it was found that their cows had been getting into onion patches (see Napolean Dynamite for more info).  Although I will not endorse Tuscan Whole Milk, I will say, it's a tough industry out there.  When you have mega corporations like HOOD out there with accusations of cow abuse and using steroids, its tough to recommend any milk company.  I personally have my own cow that I milk, and I guess that is the only type of milk I can recommend, go out and buy a cow.  Oh yea, and some gloves too.
title: Tuscan Mediocre at best

body: I am going to be a thousand years old this July and as you can imagine someone that age is bound to have a wrinkle or two and recently my husband Bruce has lost all interest in sex so I have been quite depressed. Then last month I started looking into things that would give me eternal youth, sadly I found no way of creating the philosopher's stone as my knowledge of alchemy is rather limited. I then tried Elizabeth Báthory's method of bathing in the blood of virgins, sadly it didn't work but the bathing thing made me think of Cleopatra and her milk baths and that's when I ordered hundreds of gallons of this Tuscan Whole Milk. I have been bathing regularly in the milk for a few weeks now and I can already see a difference, my skin is now as smooth as that of the virgins I slaughtered and Bruce has had to be put on a leash. On the downside I do smell of sour milk which is why this is only getting four stars and not five.
title: Cleo had the right Idea.

body: I was eating some Spam, baby lima's and German potato salad. All of out my orange roughy, I thirsted for something unique. I thought about Elvis, and then of my days back in dubya dubya two. I dropped an awful lotta bombs on em. When The Japs bombed the Harbor, I thought "Satan has had his way today!" Now the King and I are gettin older, yeah he's still alive. I sang a duet of Amazing Grace with him, day before yesterday morning. Now how bout them apples! Now I had myself a cup of your fine diary product, and its like a miracle elixir! - Major Bill Smith - Ret.

One day I put a ad in the paper for someone to go back in time with me, I found some dude named Brain Peppers but I think he got lost after I told him Safety Not Guaranteed! Anyways while I was back here in the past I noticed milk that I would bring back to my village in the future (i live one week in the future). So i ordered 30 gallons of tuscan whole milk and when I brought it back to the future people stopped drinking gay fuel and I became president.THANK YOU Tuscan Whole Mike.

body: In search of the Higgs Bison, I poured a gallon of Tuskan Whole Milk into the Large Hadron Collider and waited nervously as the milk spun faster and faster towards the speed of light, until a frothy libation erupted, a milk shake to suckle fundamental physics and prove the existence of a divine nipple, god's particle.
title: Bovine divine

body: Dribbly chins of the children sipping on their Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz, their feet a foot of the ground swinging the way children's legs swing when their feet are off the ground free to pat at the air, the two little hands grasped around the 12oz glass, condensation beading to life, the TWM1G123floz being tucked back into its familiar spot, kept cold for days like these where the sharp sun seeps into the kitchen through creepy white shades, casting obtuse angles of light across the checkered tile floor and marble countertops, cold for the day when the children's feet reach the floor and seem to finally catch on to something to propel them forwards, away from their TWM1G123floz, moving on to Bud and Whiskey and White Russians, feet and whole bodies stuck to the ground, underground, where its cold and dark and no place for Whole Milk.
title: Feet off the ground

body: After purchasing a 128 fl oz gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk, I began to closely examine the container. To my surprise, I immediately recognized the hand of the master right there on the label! "128 fl oz" clearly refers to the birthday of "Floz" --the narcistic milkmaid girlfriend of DaVinci who resided at the time in Tuscany. She made him incorporate her January 28th birtday into almost everything he did so he wouldn't forget. In his waning years, uanable to break the habit (although he did manage to break from her), he began using the date as a reminder where to locate hidden messages and street numbers of secret societies he'd forgotten. I was attempting to break the code on the back of the carton, but it got all sweaty and smeary from condensation and I am awaiting the next delivery. Please! Purchase this milk yourself and attempt to break the code. Lives are at stake! Fortunes could be lost! The second coming could be missed!
title: DaVinci Code on Milk

body: I am a proud milk connoisseur. I must say that this amazing milk is even more thick and delicious than Cambodian breast milk.After drinking only one gallon is this fine milk I was imbued with the courage to face my fears of the staff at Sea World and live out my fantasy of having passionate intercourse with a dolphin.I can say with confidence that I am no longer interested in the pursuit of vaginal intercourse, from now on its only blowhole for me. Thanks Tuscan.
title: Have you ever milked an angel?

body: My friend is lactose intolerant and well let just say I think that was more than a gallon came out the other end. She spent the majority of Wednesday on the toilet, has devalued my house and my toilet needs more therapy than I can afford!

body: For those of you interested in fine bovine extract, here is a top notch lacteous delight.  When this fine Tuscan arrived at my doorstep I was eager to open it.  Upon opening the jug I was immersed in its wonderful acrid bouquet.  As I peered into my tulip and observed its thick, clumpy texture, I noticed a yellowish hue that signified quality aging -- probably in a warm, humid oak crate.  This is a heavy milk with a long finish with a wonderful acidity that would go great with a putrescent fish entree.
title: Bovine Glory

body: It's the most nutritious milk that I ever tasted from high class breed of cows.

body: As a professional, 10 time milk drinking constest champion. I can verify that Tuscan 1 gallon whole milk is by far the greatest milk ever made. When it first touched my lips I swore it was straight from gods nipple, it is now the milk I enjoy when kicking back and relaxing at home.There are many milks on this shattered earth, but perhaps Tuscan 1 gallon whole milk can save humanity once again from the brink of destruction and bring peace and prosperity to the face of all the children. Godbless.

body: It's shocking how little innovation there is in the Personal Milk Consumption Device space.  To start with, the form factor is not ideal.  When the device is full, it sometimes requires two handed operation.  Not optimal, especially when using other devices simultaneously.  There's no spill-containment mechanism, which in the year 2006 should be standard.  And then there's the materials and packaging.  The case just feels cheap and disposable.  For $3.29, I expect more robust packaging.The milk itself seems tasty enough.
title: form factor inhibits this PMCD

body: I was holed up in Bastion, with only two bullets left and a hoard of zombies ready to attack.I used the last of my bullets in a vain attempt to get as many as I could before I fell. It was then that the head zombie, a putrescent giant thing of immense incalculable doom, was shuffling towards me in what I could only assume would be my inevitable demise."This is it," I thought, "I am going to die". It was then I backed into something I did not expect. It was a 1 Gallon jug of Tuscan Whole milk.Who knew that Tuscan Whole Milk could decapitate the king zombie with just one mighty thrust, thus saving the entire world? I didn't. It was there to save the day... and my life.I owe my own existence...Nay, humanity's existence on this 128 fl oz jug of Tuscan Whole Milk.
title: Can fight zombies.

body: This is quite easily the most delicious beverage I have ever been able to sample, and it makes for the best baking ever, but you have to watch your ears sometimes.I think it was my 2nd shipment, I broke the seal on the cap and almost went deaf.  Ear doctor told me it was a 3500 Hz square wave.  Thankfully I have recovered my sense of hearing, and I know know to either cover my ears or turn my hearing off when opening my Tuscan Whole Milk.In summary, 3500 Hz square waves are among the most potent sound known to modern man.
title: WARNING: MAY CONTAIN SQUARE WAVES

body: No bathing instructions on label. I work days - I recommend evening delivery "with signature required".Also, I found 7 neighborhood cats on my porch - my packaging was scratched through - try to order with the "small snake" fill.

body: Oh Jug of MilkSo strong yet suppleCombined with cookiesYou make the perfect coupleFlexible art thouServed cold, hot, or shakenYou look so temptingAside my eggs and baconSome men like the form slimPetite and smallGive me my jug of milkRubenesque and tall

body: Give it up for the Tuscan dairy cows. They've done a terrific job this year. It must be their cud-chewing technique which sets them apart from ordinary dairy cows. The Tuscan dairy farmers must have chosen an extraordinary fine crop of grain to feed all their high performance lactaters. The milk is smooth going down and the aftertaste isn't half bad. I give Tuscan milk a thumbs up and the dairy cows should get a good"tip" and a much deserved slap on the back.
title: Give the cows some credit!!!

body: I bought this wholesome milk, white pure, and delicious. I snuck it into my teenage son's breakfast cereal, I distracted him by reminding him not to kill off the last Krackle. (We had heard of the demise of Snap and Pop.) Shortly after breakfast he cleaned his room! He combed his hair. He actually asked to get a hair cut. I am wondering what a second dose might do.
title: it saved my teenage son

title: Not for lactose intolerant.

body: One of my favorite things to do is to sit down and watch "Leon the Professional" whilst drinking Tuscan Whole Milk. In the movie, Tuscan whole Milk is the only thing Leon drinks. I'm serious go watch the movie. Stop it at 1:38, to get a good look at the milk carton. So remember, professionals drink Tuscan.
title: Leon the Professional drinks Tuscan

body: I flipped to the news and saw a terroist holding a pistol to a gallon of Tuscan Whole Milk. He was yelling at the news crews and police in some other language.  Later that evening, I saw crowds of people holding candles and crying.  There was a picture of the milk on the corner of the TV.  I hear there is a lot of political unrest in Tuscany now.
title: A worthy hostage

body: Milk is great to drink, and what better variety than the kind that arrives at your doorstep, as our forefathers used to enjoy.One word of caution, Milk, even when frozen into a baseball-bat shape is nigh worthless as a baseball bat, merely shattering into cloudy fragments at the first strike of a baseball. And if one of said fragments happens to strike/splash (if it's a hot day) the umpire, be prepared to face his wrath. If not in that inning, then in a subsequent inning (especially on hot, humid days), after the milk has curdled and started to emit that gorge-raising stench.
title: Not To Be Used As A Baseball Bat!

body: I had a friend . . . actually, more like an acquaintance, who suffered from leprosy. Upon reading the amazing rejuvenating qualities of tuscan whole milk, we decided that it was worth the shot .We poured a glass for him to drink. Nothing happened, except complaints about the taste. It tasted Sicilian. Anyhow, upset at both the taste of the milk, and his complaining about the taste, we poured the remainder of the milk over his head. Then, to teach him a lesson on complaining, we slapped this person 5 times.The next day when we met up, the leprosy was cured, and the skin rejuvenated. He mentioned that he'd tried pouring tuscan milk over his head before, but hadn't been slapped 5 times in the process. That's the trick. Pour and slip to cure leprosy.Thank you Tuscan Whole Milk!
title: Cures leprosy . . . but tastes like Sicilian Whole Milk (bleh!)

body: I honestly didn't know I could change the world with a simple flagon of Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. However, after I hefted its icy goodness to my non-lactose intolerant lips, gas dropped nearly $3 per gallon. While this made it easier for me to get milk from my own local store, nonetheless I knew I would forever be a slave to Tuscan Whole Milk's natural goodness.Tuscan Whole Milk - [censored], mother, angel, lover.And when you add it to coffee it is really very not at all bad.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk brought down gas prices

body: Upon receiving this wondrous product, I discovered a desire-- Nay, a NEED to write elaborate prose, and felt as though even my vocabulary had begun to flourish! But alas, now that I've run dry, I can feel the creativity bleeding from my soul... Woe is he who loses his most delectable source of inspiration and creativity!
title: Poetry, bottled oh-so elegantly....

body: It was only last evening when the UPS man brought the package of Tuscan Grade A Milk to my front door.  I had been playing "Pull the Tail on the Monkey" with my friend Brice & a small but rambunctious orangutan when I heard the bell, a loud and chipper call that broke the monkeys screams.  When I opened the package, the scent of fresh Cow stuffs immediately wafted toward my waiting nasal passages.  Brice, unready for the shock, fainted to the floor with a soft "thud."  Chugging down the cool white heaven, I suddenly had an epiphany!  I knew what I was missing.  I knew beyond any reasonable doubt (and even several unreasonable ones) that I needed to find the sacred talisman of Kublai Khan.  So I traveled to the far shores of Xanadu, where Alf, the sacred river ran, and I came across a dark and lonely cavern.  It smelled of home cooking and domestic disputes.  Once inside, I could see the distant flickering of a dying flame - and so I approached.  Standing there in the dying light was great Kublai Khan himself, chanting something frantic and turbulent under his breath.  Only after I'd advanced further could I hear his hoarse whispers "Grade A Milk, Grade A Milk," over and over as if in some trance.  I knew what to do immediately.  Reaching into my quick-freeze cooler pack, which I keep with me at all times (just in case,) I removed the remainder of the Tuscan Grade A - slowly, almost unwilling to part with this ambrosia.  With shaking hands I gave to the ancient warrior the now-light bottle, and watched as he awakened from his terrible dream.  "Thank you," he said in a strangely Welsh accent.  "You have saved me from the curse of Cowlania, the evil temptress of the Mississippi.  For this, I will give you my sacred talisman, so that you may call on me whenever you need.  Now farewell!"  He vanished into a puff of dairy, as if he had never been there to begin with.  But on the ground. . . on the ground there lay a glittering and plastic-looking object, about the the size of a zip-lock bag.  Upon closer inspection I realized that it was a zip-lock bag - but not just any.  It was sacred, I knew.  I carefully wrapped inside of it the remainder of my half-eaten turkey sandwich, which I had taken with me for just such an occasion.  I knew It'd prove useful.  I arrived home early this morning, hungry and exhaustionized from a long night of legend-saving.  To my delight, the plastic bag had kept my sandwich fresh and delicious!  I finished it in a quick and, frankly, disappointing single bite.  I knew as I swallowed it, though, that I was eating something preserved by the sacred talisman of an old and wizened warlord whom I had saved.  And now, after finishing that crushed and half-eaten turkey sandwich, I realize that Tuscan Grade A Milk has changed my life forever.  I used to be a nobody.  Now, I am a nobody with a bag.
title: This Milk Changed My Life

body: While disappointed that I could not get gift wrapping for this item, I was truly impressed with it's staying power when used for dunking.I tested a variety of cookies and other items in my Tuscan Whole Milk. While store-brand chocolate chip cookies did not stand up to the milk, a screwdriver did. Oreos were resistant to the milk at first, but soon gave in to the milky goodness and turned soggy. I did try to put a spoon in the milk to see how long it took to get soggy, but it did not. Glazed donuts seemed to last the longest.I did try to overflow my cup of milk using popcorn. Amazingly enough, no matter how much popcorn I stuffed into the cup, the milk did not overflow! I think this must be a genetic anamoly, although a welcome one.My conclusions? Cheap cookies are a waste of you money, Oreos only slightly better. Go for the glazed donuts and popcorn instead.
title: Positive Outlook

Relativity is no longer relative, gravity has no meaning other than as a force that pulls you towards the center of a larger object, and depending on the atmosphere, at variable rates. When wondering through the proverbial rice fields of the human mind, one would be so serene to experience such a glee that is the universal reclaimation of the soul. But alas, this is not to be, future generations of past enemies will ensure the obliteration of all that is good and highly organized in this world. And it is that theory, that school of thought that has created such a buzz within the scientific community, that has enveloped the humanity that we might cherish if we all weren't so busy shopping for the consumerism that is rotting our frightenly small hearts and possibly, but not confirmed, livers.So what is to be done about this epidemic? What global solution can be implemented on a local level that will be noticed by those who may or may not care? That is where this product comes in. Nothing short of revolutionary, nothing short of life changing and inspirational this product will shape the future molds that future generations will be using to mold certain things that people who are enlightened will be talking about. These few, who have seen the cryptic light will save their knowledge like diamonds in a fish tank, it will drive them to madness and steal the bright angels from their souls, replacing them with slightly darker and possibly menancing demons.However, there is salvation! With the availability of this fantastic product, we can now find ourselves letting the demons out of our souls, driving our conscious behaviors back into the light and becoming more human and in tune with the universe than ever before! Alas, there is a dark side to this universal transaction - you must first part with your hard earned currency. Put down 3.99, receive ultimate salvation from the harsh mistress that is universal reality. Destroy the outer lining of your darkened soul! Tuscan Milk will drive the demons from your liver, kidneys and other filtering organs, such as the gall bladder! The gall bladder will be clean! Rejoice! For salvation is here!The saviour has come back to save us all in the form of cow excretions packed in a universally adapted carton! He has spoken, "Drink me to find salvation."Go. Find your salvation. Buy some bananas while you're at it, and get redemption.

body: Orphaned at an early age, I lived with my Aunt May and Uncle Ben in Queens, New York. Where I lived the normal life of a college student. She going out with Harry Osborn, my school pal and college roommate.During a field trip, me and my classmates are given a science demonstration involving genetically altered Tuscan Whole Milk. I was terribly thirsty and, not knowing any better drank a glass of the altered Tuscan Whole Milk.  Soon after I developed unusual powers, super human strength, the abilities of a cow and a ESP like "Cow Sense" for danger. I become Tuscanman.Armed with my new powers I entered into a wrestling match and won in record time, but the promoter refused to pay out the $3000.00 prize money.When shortly after I had to chance of stopping a burglar fleeing from the office of the promoter, I did nothing to get revenge. The same burglar kills, moments later, my beloved uncle Ben.As Tuscanman I soon captured the burglar. body: Cindy and I lost our only son in August of '02.  It has been very hard on us.  Brian was only 3 when he was diagnosed with Leukemia.  The doctors did all that they could, and Brian fought so hard.  However, after 2 years of battling the disease, he succumbed, and went to his eternal rest.  Unable to bear the thought of putting him in a cold dark coffin, so far from home, we decided to have him cremated, and we placed his ashes in his favorite cookie jar above the kitchen cabinets.  I remember the day Brian was born.  The next day we started putting money away in a separate account for his college fund.  We wanted him to go to Stanford.  We had stowed away nearly 40,000 dollars before his death.  The months after his death were very hard on us.  Half a year had passed before I gathered the strength to clean out his room.  Cindy and I never discussed the College Fund.  One day, I just went to the bank and closed the account, putting all of the money into our joint checking account.  We both must have silently agreed to dispose of the money to forget our anguish.  We began to live extravagantly and well beyond our sustainable means in an effort to deplete the large sum of money serving as a cruel reminder of our devastation.  That's when Cindy started doing all of our grocery shopping online.  Yesterday, my brother Mark asked if we could take care of his son Jason while he and his wife were out of town.  We agreed.  After all, it might be good to have another child in the house after all this time.  When Jason came home from school, he poored a glass of rich, smooth Tuscan whole milk and also decided that he wanted some cookies.  He climbed on top of the counter and, reaching for the cookie jar, slipped from the countertop.  The cookie jar full of Brian's ashes and the glass of milk both tumbled to the floor.  At the sound of the crash, Cindy and I rushed into the kitchen, and were astonished to see that the ashes were mixing with the milk to form the likeness of a human.  Over the course of several minutes, we watched in disbelief as our son was revived before our eyes.  I cannot describe to you the joy of having our son back.  But we don't know how to explain to our son what happened, or why he has a pool table in his room, or what mommy and daddy did with his college fund.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk:  Revitalizing Formula

Thanks to the Italians, Texas streets will always have plenty of healthy long-haired puss for stroking.  A+++  Will do business again!!!

body: Ever since I passed their factory while lost in the wilds of Northern New Jersey and then subsequently found their products on the shelves at Gristedes, I have been in love with Tuscan Milk and their whole line of dairy products.The only better milk available is if you can get yourself to a farm and buy it less than a day old; otherwise it's Tuscan all the way.
title: I Love Tuscan Milk

body: When I first heard about Tuscan Whole Milk, I didn't know what to think.  Was it just your typical milk from a cow?  Or maybe it was rats being milked for their milk like you hear in some stories.  But no.  What I found would change my life forever.If you look at the label, you'll see a city skyline with a cow jumping over the moon.  Many see this and assume it's just a logo.  But no, it's a version of their secret for how to extract this delicious milk.  The company actually owns a 82-story building which they take the cows to the roof to milk them.  The reasoning for the high price is because the cows can only be milked once.  You may ask yourself, why?  Here is where the secret comes in:  They attach an apparatus called Trimilkernator.  This apparatus attaches itself to the cow's nipples like a bungee cord and then when it's fully ready, the cow is pushed off the roof. The Trimilkernator is able to extract 4 gallons of milk before the cow hits the floor and splatters all over.  This is the real reason you see a cow 'flying' over a city as their logo. The rush of the cow falling to it's death adds a special flavor to the milk which is unmatched anywhere.Little known facts:- It can be used as a gas alternative.- It has been marked illegal by the NCAA, NBA, NFL, and MLS due to it's athletic enhancements (think steroids x 10).- You can find a bottle of it in many rap videos from 1995-2003.  Just look for it.- It has been known to give you photographic memory after 2 weeks of drinking at least 8oz each day.Hope this helps you guys make the choice and give this milk a try.
title: Tuscan Whole Milk is worth EVERY penny.

body: Hello, i am writting to inform on the complete misconception of this ad!I recently bought my Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128fl oz, it arrived by mail, WARM!who drinks warm milk? but this is not the problem, the problem is that it is advertised as being Tuscan, but its not,its Chinese!Tuscan comes from Tuscany, in Italy, this milk was actually fabricated in China, as stated on the box, this left me in doubt as to other claims on this ad, so I did a little more seaarching,it doesnt actually contain 128fl oz of "Mystery Liquid" it contains 127! i was very disappointed by this fact. when i called the company to request for my money back, an indian man answered, stated that his name was John(which i totally didnt believe) and proceeded to tell me that they dont do refunds, i felt bad for the poor telemarketer, so i let them get away with my money.so, for the sake of all the little chinese kids in factories, the indian people in their underpaid telemarketing business, and not even accounting for the 1fl oz STOLEN from you, i mean STOLEN, DONT BUY!thank you.
title: False Advertisement.

body: I have recently saved the nutrition facts label from a jug of Tuscan and am in the process of comparing it with those of other similar brands.I have been doing this for years while eating one of: Rice Krispies, Corn Flakes or Ring Dings.I have contacted the FDA with the query that the calories, sodium and other ingeredients are not consistent between manufacturers (or is it producers or bottlers?).  Why do some brands have 150 calories in an 8 ounce glass and others 140?  Why are each of the other components slightly different?Is it the growth hormone?  How many calories in 8 ounces of artificial cow growth hormone?Why does Tuscan 2% milk not contain 3 calories since 3 is 2% of 150?Is there milk that is not whole?  Is that milk, therefore, not wholesome?  Would that destoy the self-esteem of the unwholesome milk?Why are 8 ounces a serving on milk but can of soda contains 12 ounces to a serving and a 2-liter bottle of soda contains another different serving suggestion?  Can I suggest that the FDA issue better uniformity guidelines?
title: Nutrition Facts Comparison

body: My cat Fluffy will only drink the finest milk from the finest cows.  A friend of mine told me about Tuscan dairy milk over a game of chess last week.  I quickly excused myself and went to the bathroom to check on Amazon for this Tuscan milk.  To my surprise they had it in stock and only $75 a gallon.  Do I dare, would Fluffy be able to tell the difference?Well I went ahead and ordered the milk and it came a few days later.  While Fluffy was sleeping I did alittle switch-a-roo of his milk and decided I would join Fluffy for a nap on the couch.Later that day I woke up to a god awful sound, it was Fluffy he was throwing up everywhere and was walking funny. Deeply concerned I put Fluffy in his pet carrier and drove like a bat out of hell to the emergency vet.  Sadly Fluffy did not make it.  Cause of death was blamed on the milk.  All this time I just thought someone was being funny nice and pre-warmed the milk for me. Come to find out there was an extra charge for ice packs to keep in cold during shipping.Is there anyway I can get a refund for the milk even after I opened it.
title: Killed Fluffy

body: On the advice of an obnoxious friend, not to be named, but you know who you are, Mike, I ordered 3,589 bottles.  See, Mike, my unnamed friend, told me that the cows were striking due to recent unionization and poor working conditions.  Thus leading to two outcomes, 1) Milk shortage or 2) Poor milk quality.  So, on Mike's advise, I made a large purchase.  How proud I felt when those UPS trucks (all 172) arrived at my front door.  How I laughed as my neighbor's watched in awe as this white gold was unloaded.  Now, 2 weeks later, no strike.  Starting to feel a little foolish.What to do?Maybe I should selling it as new/used.  Anyone interested?  They are in my garage/attic unopened. Will sell cheap.

body: I was on a United 747 from Heathrow last night. Next to me was a young man...sweaty, yet trying to look cool.  As I always do on my trips to and from the UK, I bring a gallon of Tuscan whole milk, which counters the effects of jet lag, air nausea, ear popping, plane food constipation, and (let's be honest)it's a wonderful conversation starter.  My neighbour suddenly pulls out a Gaterade and his ipod.  "Allah Akbar" he shouts out and in annoyance I turn to him to tell him to shut the hell up, accidentally knocking my milk jug over his lap just as a small explosion was beginning to emit from his groinal area.  The milk immediately fizzled the charge and I apologized, not knowing that I had just thwarted the opening salvo on the next big one.  But I would never be the hero I am today, were it not for my gallon jug of Tuscan Whole Milk...a vital tool in the war on terror.
title: This is the only milk that counters nitroglycerine explosions on airplanes

body: On the one hand, I am willing to give Tuscan Whole Milk 5 stars for the explosive diarrhea it gave me, which I quite enjoyed. However, the milk not only gave me diarrhea, it tasted like diarrhea, earning it only 1 star. So how many stars should I give it? Fortunately, I developed hepatitis, but as I am unsure at this point how severe my condition is, I remain neutral about the hepatitis. Thus, the most reasonable number I can give this product is 3 stars.I hope you find this review helpful.

Mariosa Luigis IV in a practically unfathomable display of generosity gave the farmer the slightest of nods.The nod, was not returned.Now was it the intention of the french farmer to insult Mariosa Luigis IV ?Or, did he just fail to see the generous social gesture?The motives of the farmer, remain unknown.What is known, were the consequences.The next morning Mariosa Luigis IV appeared at the French Farmstead,And demanded that the farms head Milker offer Mariosa Luigis IV his neck or first born Bovine to repay the insult.The frenchman, at first, tried to console Mariosa Luigis IV with a glass of fresh 1% milk, only to find, Mariosa Luigis IV was inconsolable with such a pathetic offering.So began, the massacre of the french farmstead,And all sixty of the sub par cattle inside,At the fists of the White Lotus.And so began, the legend of Mariosa Luigis IV Five-Point PalmExploding Udder Technique.which is quite simply, the only udder-blow in all of dairy proceduers that can produce milk like Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. body: The shadows from the setting sun drew themselves over Nukran and I. One slimy arm covered Nukran's eyes. Five months underground is bound to make your eyes sensitive."Then you know why I've come." I said."I've known since that botched job on Kalson VI that you would swear your allegiance to another and betray me. But why? Why would you go through all of this for Ebbadon?" Nukran's tentacles showered the ground with spittle as he spat the name of his arch-nemisis. "He's one of the most cruel crimebosses in this side of the galaxy."I couldn't help but laugh. "Ebbadon?" I asked between chuckles. "I killed Ebbadon. Can't you get the news underground? Fourteen Galzik parasites straight into his brain. They never even knew I was on the ship. No, Ebbadon didn't hire me to do this. You never told me about her. You had an affair with Mariella. And when you were afraid she would tell me the truth, you... you killed her!""No! No! I swear it! That's not true!" Nukran's pupils seemed even smaller now."Liar!" I cried. "She could have escaped that day in the terrubinium mines but you messed up the access codes on purpose! You killed her!" I drew my plasma pistol and leveled it on Nukran as tears ran down the scales on cheeks."I had hoped it wouldn't come to this." Nukran said calmly- almost soothingly. "I can see that you're not going to listen to me. I just hope that I can do this without both of us getting killed." He reached one hand into one of the skin pouches on his back."Oh no." I said, nearly dropping my pistol when I saw the object he had procured."You must have wondered what I did in the five months I spent miles under this city. I was acquiring this. One full gallon (128 fl oz) of Tuscan Whole Milk."Fear enveloped me. Every muscle in my body tensed up. I could feel my animal and human selves fighting for control. It was then that I blacked out.I awoke next to a pool of blood with scratches on my neck and buttocks that I can only guess must have come from me (Nakron, being a Cephalogicon has no nails or claws). Nakron was dead. There were many burnt holes in his torso and my gun was lodged deep in his soft Exo-skull.A Tuscan Whole Milk gallon container lay burst open; the contents mingling with Cephalogicon blood. I must have instinctually begun firing on Nakron as my animal self took over. Realizing my madness and that all hope was gone, Nakron must have decided to doom himself and the entire planet of Argosia by throwing the Tuscan Whole Milk at me. Fortunately for all of us (except Nakron of course) he had been given a dud. I guess I kept firing until I was out of Plasma Pellets at which point I bludgeoned him with my pistol until it got stuck. What I did next in my madness, I cannot begin to guess.Marveling over this, I tried to stand. I took a few drunken steps and dipped my small finger into the white pool that grew increasingly beige and Nakron's blood mixed into it. I touched my small finger to my tongue and fell over in relief."Dean's," I said to the dead Cephalogicon. "They screwed you over and gave you Dean's you old spacedog you."
title: Awesome

body: I'm always illegally importing dairy products into the US to give my food the 40%+ fat necessary to create a truly European experience.  Using this Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon 128 fl oz, however, is just over the top!  It's so creamy rich my customers can no longer eat more than one bite of my Panna Cotta without becoming drowsy and on the verge of a sugar coma.  Usually we like customers who eat themselves into a caloric stupor, as they tend to use their cell phones less often in the dining room and tend to over-tip.  But, when a Friday night run of Panna Cotta orders for dessert means 80% of our tables have people sleeping at them, the dining room loses a certain flair.  So, I'm going for the four stars, but recommending Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 gallon 128 fl oz for home use only.  Consider it a replacement for the main ingredient in your 1970s LSD parties, and follow all the same rules.

body: After a terrible ankle break, I needed the best I could to rebuild the bone. Despite the best medical care which included blood tranfusion, happy pills, and a hot doctor, I owe my dearest Thanks to Tuscan Whole Milk! I not only got all the wholesome goodness, vitamin D, and calcium I needed to do the job on my bum ankle from this product. Good Googly Moogly, I got a whole new foot! Yes, a THIRD foot! Now I know why Trent Reznor drank this stuff when he made THE DOWNWARD SPIRAL cd! Ok, there's like no proof of that. But Tuscan Milk has to play a part in ALL that's brilliant, beautiful, and becoming! Ok, it also plays a part in all that addictive, destructive, of pernicious pestilence within our souls, and the very reason why Germany had Hitler and now has Hasselhoff. Still, Tuscan Whole Milk... It's that good!Have you even heard THE DOWNWARD SPIRAL!? If CLOSER isn't about Tuscan Whole Milk then it's about Tuscan Whole Milk!I considered surgery to remove the extra part but I didn't. I began to love my new appendage and affectionately named it, "Tina". I saw the new foot as a gift from my leaders at Tuscan Whole Milk. There just isn't a Moo Juice quite like it! Sure people have stared and they've snickered at my extra foot. Some have even gone as far as asking how me and my "Kick Stand" are doing today! (How disrespectful! It's name is TINA!) Laugh they might, but I dare any one of them try to race me!Sticks and Stones...are they reeeeallly going to muck with Moi? NO! Cause thanks to Tuscan whole milk, I've even joined the dark side! Bring on your Skywalkers, your Obi Wans, Your Mace Windus, your Yodas and Yaddles, your John McClanes, your Vic Mackeys, Your Jack Bauers! But you can spare me Chuck Norris... that a guy is a freak and a tad touched due to those hot Charley nights in Nam. So if you're Norris free then bring it! It's Me, Tina, and a few gallons of Tuscan!Well, the milk will be here in a matter of days. So like, you can bring it then. If you want. But I'll call truce if you bring some cookies. I like those new Hershey's Kisses Cookies. They rock. I'll introduce you to Tina and you guys can be friends. We'll have cookies, guzzle the liquid light that is Tuscan Whole Milk, and listen to NAILS. Lovely moments, lovely moments, indeed!
title: If the chip in my head is correct, there will be others!

body: I feel compelled to relay my story with Tuscan Whole Milk.  My husband is a middle manager with the local stationery store.  In an attempt to move him up the ranks of paper pushers (pardon the pun), we decided to host a dinner party and invite some of his bosses.  Not being much of a homemaker, I was frantic to come up with a meal plan.  That is, until I discovered the response people seem to have to Tuscan Whole Milk.I ordered a gallon - 128 fluid ounces of pure dairy goodness.  I was quite concerned about how to serve Tuscan Whole Milk, because the packaging did not illustrate any "Serving Suggestions", like I'm used to seeing on cereal boxes, jello packets and soup cans.  Nor was there any peel-back label containing tasty recipes using Tuscan Whole Milk.  I was at a complete loss.  While I was pondering my next move, the doorbell rang.  I rushed to greet our guests and seat them in the dining room.  Then, under duress, I caught a glimmer of inspiration!  I ran back to the kitchen, kicking the Amazon box and air-bags out of the way, and stopped just short of the china cabinet.  The Riedel Crystal!  What better way to impress the upper crust than with Tuscan Whole Milk ensconced in the finest crystal wrought by Austrian artisans.  I plucked a handful of stems from the cabinet and popped the seal on Tuscan Whole Milk.  I was slightly overcome by the heady aromas unleashed from beneath the secure stay-fresh lid on Tuscan Whole Milk!  I couldn't believe the bouquet on this bovine libation - the sweet intoxicating blend of grass and grains, lovingly masticated and fermented into the supple, luxurious laiche that is Tuscan Whole Milk.Since time was of the essence, I didn't have the luxury of a full decanting of the Tuscan Whole Milk.  I had to place my family's financial stability and my husband's professional future in the capable hands of the fine dairy savants at Tuscan Products.  It was a gamble, to be sure, but we're talking about Tuscan Whole Milk, the flagship lactose au jus.  I poured with vigor and confidence.  The color was fantastic - it doesn't get any whiter than Tuscan Whole Milk.  I watched as the dulcet proteins coated the interior of the crystal and ran down to rejoin their lactose bretheren in the cradle of the stem.  Enough reverie: I've Tuscan Whole Milk to serve!I promenaded into the dining room, carefully toting my stems of Tuscan Whole Milk on my great-grandmother's silver serving tray.  I can imagine her in her own home, serving Tuscan Whole Milk to her esteemed guests.  With great hopes for the future of her own family, my ancestors, I believe my great-grandmother would've placed her trust in Tuscan Whole Milk back then.  And now, I know this is the right move - I can feel it.  First, the Tuscan Whole Milk, tomorrow a corner office!
title: Milk for a Better Tomorrow

body: I've experienced many products from Tuscan in the past, and have overall enjoyed their products.However, I think they've gotten overconfident.  Their "Milk" is just an attempt to cut into a market they don't understand based on brand name alone.First: The touch-screen was not all it's cracked up to be.  Sure, when I pressed hard enough, the "open" command got through, but to my mind a light touch should be all that is required.Second: No rust-proofing.  I live in an area where they salt the roads whether it's snowing or not, and so I expect to have a bit more rust on my car brakes than usual.  But this Milk rusted far beyond what I consider acceptable.  I may as well have bought orange juice.Third: There is no warning that this product must be separated by at least one padlock from "Peanut Butter," especially when there is Ambien in the vicinity.  I'm strongly considering looking into this claim with, at least, the BBS, and at most calling an attourney - had I known, I would have kept a closer watch on the girlfriend.  As it is, I need to recoup the emergency stomach-pumping costs, or I'm out rent next month.Fourth And Last: Although another reviewer has already mentioned this, I want to reiterate the lack of customer support/service.  Not only are they unhelpful and rude, but when I kept my temper enough to enquire further, I realized that the number provided actually connects the customer with the Russian Embassy in Trinidad/Tobago.  Such a practical joke may be entertaining in theory, but this is just irresponsible.I don't get it.  As far as this consumer is concerned, the Tuscan brand name is a brand to trust - we're talking on par with Volvo, Samsung, and UAC.  They should have at least hired the right consultants before this adventeruous venture - but apparently not.Although, as one caveat, I've got to admit that my loyalty to Tuscan cheese, peppers, raiders, and hand cleansers remains firm.  This product may get a single star, but the Tuscan brand has quality to spare on a failure.They better not try to get into selling disposable calamari, that's all I'm saying.
title: Unfortunate

body: So I was a TV anchorman and I said a ad word on the air and got fired. I was depressed , unshaved and aimless wandering the streets. My friends alienated me. body: My name is Arthur and...... I'm a milkoholic.I know, I know! We've all been there before. I used to be able to handle my habit. I could stop after one glass. But then, a friend turned me on to Tuscan Whole Milk. It was great at first, but then I couldn't stop! I was spending every waking moment wondering where my next fix would come from. I was in denial! I alienated my friends when I tried to disguise my use in the form of a milkshake. "No, its just ice cream," I would lie. But those who new me could tell. I went onto the harder stuff: I made my own Tuscan Chocolate Milk, I would snort Tuscan Powderd Milk,and inject Tuscan Heavy Cream.It all came to a head when I mugged the milk man. My friends had to have an intervention. They sat me down and told me how much they loved me and wanted to get help for me. I enrolled in the Lactose Clinic for the Chronically Tolerant. The first 48 hours were tough. The sweats, the hallucinations, the craving for any Tuscan dairy product just to get me throught the night.Finally, after 6 weeks of rehb, I am just now getting a handle on my addiction to Tuscan Whole Milk. My doctor has prescribed a regimen from Tuscan Whole Milk in controlled doses, then Tuscan 2%, Tuscan 1%, Tuscan Skim, Tuscan Fat Free, Tuscan Half-and Half, Tuscan Non-Dairy Creamer, and finally Tuscan Whey.I hope to build up my lactose intolerance in 2 years. As they say, "baby steps".That's my story. I hope you will learn from my mistakes: Tuscan Whole Milk only in moderation!
title: I'm doing the steps

body: And Saint Attila raised the Tuscan milk up on high, saying, "O Lord, bless this thy Tuscan milk, that with it thou mayst blow thine enemies to tiny bits, in thy mercy." And the Lord did grin. And the people did feast upon the lambs and sloths, and carp and anchovies, and orangutans and breakfast cereals, and fruit-bats and large chu...And the Lord spake, saying, "First shalt thou take out the Holy Pin. Then shalt thou count to three, no more, no less. Three shall be the number thou shalt count, and the number of the counting shall be three. Four shalt thou not count, neither count thou two, excepting that thou then proceed to three. Five is right out. Once the number three, being the third number, be reached, then lobbest thou thy Tuscan milk of Antioch towards thy foe, who, being naughty in my sight, shall snuff it."
title: Book of Armaments, chapter two, verses nine through twenty-one.

body: As a scientist, I approach the claim of Tuscan provenance of this gallon of whole milk with skepticism.  But after extensive testing, including radiospectronomy, carbon-14 decay, and a double-blind study using thousands of subjects, I've concluded with almost complete certainty, that this milk is indeed Tuscan, most likely from the region around the town of Urbino.  Whether you use Tuscan Whole Milk to boil up your own fresh mozzarella, or a nice cream reduction sauce, or simply pour it over the arched hemispherical rump of a hooker named LaQueesha for the lucky bachelor to lap up like a kitten, please know that Tuscan Whole Milk is 100% Tuscan.  And you can believe me, because I'm Italian.  And a scientist.  We scientists do this kind of thing all the time.  We don't have time for sex.
title: I'M A SCIENTIST !!! I HAVE A MASTERS DEGREE !!

body: I was promised this Tuscan Whole Milk could increase CPU rates in web servers by a factor of a gazillion, as well as increase RAM refresh rates, extend RAID arrays, improve ethernet performance, make ASP pages secure, fix PHP exploits, prevent port probing and block script kiddies and DDoS attacks, as well as ensure no hardware failures would ever happen.After carefully drip-acclimating an entire farm of web servers over a 6 hour period with 18 gallons of milk (6 for each rack), I'm sad to report it doesn't stand up to any of those promises, and now I'm out of a job and a half million customers are gathering a lynch mob.
title: Does not help web servers run faster

body: All joking aside, watching this gallon of milk turn sour on a countertop would be more enjoyable than watching that CRASH movie.  The performances were fine, Matt Dillon's in particular, but the film ultimately substitutes a ridiculous series of coincidences for a storyline.  Didn't we see that (to better effect) in MAGNOLIA?  The time and talent that was showcased in CRASH would have been better spent producing a television spot for Tuscan Whole Milk.  New slogan: "Tuscan Whole Milk. Better than CRASH."

body: All my life I've drunk cow milk.  Just a habit I guess.  My son told me about this great Tuscan whole milk. I thought it would taste gamey like other wild animals, but it was REALLY good!So my question is, what is a whole?  I can't find a picture of one on google or wikipedia.  Why haven't we heard more about wholes?  Maybe after seeing one I won't like their milk anymore.

body: When I saw this item on Amazon I knew that I had to get me some.  You see, I am lactose intolerant and am always looking to try rare milk brands to see if they make my intolerance tolerable.  I took one sip of this Tuscan Whole Mile, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz and felt the silkiness slide down my throat, WOW. body: This deeply-hued milk gives off aromas of calcium and niacin and generous American oak. There is less obvious oak on the palate. The milk is very crisp and smooth in the mouth, with modest sweetness and a dab of cheese flavouring; pleasantly sour aftertaste.  Ideally served chilled with grains and pastry. body: Some people here just don't understand that milk really can have different flavors, some better, some worse.  You are all used to homogenized assembly line stuff that you buy at the store but we here in Europe remember the days when what a cow ate made a difference in how the milk tasted.  I know some may find the comparison crude but ask a mother what her baby is like after she has eaten a few heads of garlic.  Not fun.  We understand that if you feed the cow sweet grass, sweet alfalfa, sweet corn etc. you will get a sweeter milk.  There was a time here in Europe when milk was very much a gourmet thing. People would simply buy their milk from a different farmer because it "tasted better".  That being so, farmers would compete for the taste of their customers.  You know how people are, they will try to be the best at anything.  So, like a farmer preparing his best goods for the State Fair, some farmers would feed their cows the best that they could.  Think of a bee keeper releasing his bees on to a field of clover or apple blossoms.  What could the dairyman do?  Let his cows eat from the same weed infested grass that they just pooped in?  Or could he bring them the leftovers from the fields, fruits, berries and herbs?  By doing so a farmer could turn out a truly great milk that was crisp, clean and delightfully sweet taste.  Unfortunately, Tuscan taste like regular milk.
title: A serious review.

body: I bought this milk last month to use in my work.  I'm on the IEEE Power Over Milk (POM)Committee, and I naturally assumed that this milk would be suitable for our tests.  I found that it satisfied only four of the six performace attributes we are trying to achieve:1 - Can you insert a std RJ45 connector into it: Yes2 - will it conduct 1-48volts without overheating: Yes3 - Will it transmit data at the rate of 1gigabit per secon: No4 - Does it fully saturate and ANSI Std. Corn-Flake: Yes5 - Does it have a current capacity ov at least 830 milliamps: No6 - Does it readily dissolve chocolate syrup to a point of creamery goodness: YesI cannot in good conscience reccomend this milk for Power Over Milk applications, but then again, that technology is years from being ready anyway.
title: Tasty, but poor connectivity

body: I would like to tell a story about how I came across this Tuscan Whole Milk and why I only rate it as a three star product.It began while I was fixing the horizontal stabilizer on my Marske Monarch. I was gliding over the Cape of Good Hope when I found a peculiar village. I decided this would be a fine location to land in order to see if anyone was in need of my free medical services. As I was adjusting the rudder and elevator to land on a thin dirt strip, I miscalculated adjustments and found myself barreling into dry grass field just shy of the strip. My co-pilot, Mr. Lucas, a mute servant I employ over the summer seasons, shook me until I woke. We gathered the parts that detached themselves from the glider upon the crash landing, and began reassembling the plane. To my surprise, a group of tribal men walked up to us and made gestures for us to follow them into the village. I instructed Mr. Lucas to gather my scuba equipment, medical pouch, GPS system, the satellite phone, and Forest Invader (a small parlor monkey I purchased in Bangalore) and we followed the strange men into the village. This apparently was all just a trick, as we were thrown into nets and into the back of a gray Datsun, which had seen better days. By my judgment of distance, they drove us 10-15 miles north. They stopped the truck and Mr. Lucas and myself were thrown out onto a paved road. The angry tribal men sped away, yelling God knows what in some strange, ancient language. Not 20 minutes into walking north up the road, we were picked up by a caravan headed to Cairo. I say! The first good bit news the entire day. They were glad to haul us (and my equipement and pet) along to Egypt. We arrived in Egypt some days later, on the almost exact opposite side of the very continent I crashed landed on earlier. It is in Cairo where I would make arrangements that led me try Tuscan Whole Milk.Mr. Lucas and I found our way to the Semiramis Intercontinental where I purchased a 2 room suite. We dropped off our equipment and headed to the hotel bar. On my 2nd glass of brandy, a man by the name of Mr. Grove (the only name he gave) approached me and casually asked if I would be interested in a business deal. Of course, I asked what of, and, I say! Mr. Grove needed to move 20 crates of Tuscan Whole Milk, which were in a refrigerated truck outside of the hotel! He offered 1000USD up front for the delivery of the boxes to his warehouse in South Africa (how strange are the hands that life deals) and 1000USD on the safe return of the truck to Cairo. Of course, I had 2 things on my mind at this time: retrieving my crashed Monarch from that blasted village and getting off of this continent. I accepted immediately, and used part of the payment to buy a trailer to haul back my glider to an airport in Cairo (you see, you need an engine aircraft to get the glider in the air). Mr. Lucas and I reached South Africa in a few days. The destination was Johannesburg, and by chance was only a 3 hour drive from my plane. While winding through the streets of Johannesburg, we were stopped by the South African Police Service, who demanded to examine the contents of the refrigerated truck. I have never known their men to be schooled in corruption, but the next thing I knew, Mr. Lucas and myself were in handcuffs and short 19 crates of Whole Milk. Of course, I bribed them a few Rand for our release and we were on our way. There was no way the warehouse would accept the shipment now, so I used the remaining payment to hire a translator while I was in the city, and floored the gas all the way to the village and its tribe.Upon arrival, I instructed the translator to demand their leader turn over my beloved Monarch or we would be forced to contact authorities (good Mr. Lucas was ready to dial away at the satellite phone). A strange exchange went on between the translator and the elder. A few moments later I was told they would barter for it. Of course, I offered the contents of the truck (save for Forest Invader). The elder opened the doors of the truck and took out a gallon of the milk in order to see if the ivory nectar was to his liking. He immediately spit it out! He yelled some sort of ancient orders to a group of men standing next to the truck, and a few seconds later, a sea of torches flowed towards the field where my bird was perched! I knew what ill fate my glider would meet in the coming minutes. The tribe bagged us yet again, but this time we were dropped off at a different location... the burned wreckage of my glider. After the tribe drove away, Mr. Lucas chewed his way out of the netting and freed myself and the translator. After a few minutes of argument with the translator, I awarded him the truck as an apology for this mess, and he drove off out of sight.There I was, a pilgrim in an unholy land, weeping in the ashes of my once cherished Monarch, with only my satellite phone, Forest Invader, and Mr. Lucas by my side, trying desperately to enjoy the remaining gallon of Tuscan Whole milk the tribe left for us (for they burned the rest of the crate), but I could not muster even a grin, as the cruel odor of burning fiberglass forced me to cast a frown. This opaline swill in my hand was the true cause of my grief, and I could not force myself to fully take pleasure in what remained. I gave the remaining carton of milk to my faithful servant, who seemed to enjoy it enough. He gulped down what remained and quickly displayed the thumbs up, which, in his odd mute ways, was a sign of appreciation. I'm glad you enjoyed the Tuscan liquid, Mr. Lucas, because I certainly did not.And now I hope you can see why I only afforded this whole milk 3 stars. I lost my glider, my scuba gear, my medical pouch, a small part of my sanity, and over a week of my life because Tuscan Whole Milk did not live up to the standards of some crude tribesman of yesteryear. I still mourn about the event to this day, while Forest Invader gently weeps beside me.
title: My experience with Tuscan Whole Milk

body: I don't drink milk, but the fridge always looks empty without any in there, so I had to find a use for the seventeen gallons of Tuscan Whole Milk in there that I bought because of all these terrific Amazon reviews. There's a nice way to whip the milk up in with the Kitchenaide, producing an excellent butter that works as a very fine polish for ukuleles. Just take the milk, throw it in the Kitchenaide, press on, and wait about 3.7297 hours. The resulting butter is a great polish for all manner of things. I use it on my groin and on my ukuleles. Nothing works finer for either household need.
title: Makes Fresh Butter Polish for Ukuleles & Heals Groin Skin Trouble

body: When I first saw Tuscan milk I was very skeptical of it's effects, but after reading 900 reviews I was pretty sure something amazing was to come out of this milk.I purchased 3 gallons which arrived at my door just 36 hours after my purchase. After about two glasses I started watching TV and left the kitchen, when I came back everything in my kitchen was flipped upside down and the milk had spilled and spelled out "death" on my floor... I thought I was going crazy for a second before I started smelling burning and realized it seeped into my electrical outlets and started a fire. I used the other two gallons to put out the fire and before I knew it, the fire was out. The fear kept me hyperventilating and I passed out. When I woke up from my kitchen floor all my ricedream was gone and the Tuscan was unopened as if nothing had ever happened.This stuff is amazing!

body: I'm not usually one to give in to the hype. But everyone keeps talking about this "tuscan milk" and how it's the new macarena. It's texas holdem, low carbs, and reality TV all rolled into one. But this is one fad that is sure to last.I bought my first gallon, and not being one for moderation, I ended up drinking the whole gallon one morning. I was just going to drink a glass before work, then be on my way. One glass turned into two. Two turned into a bigger glass. Next thing I know I was sprawled out on my living room floor next to the empty gallon.I stumbled up and made my way out the door, only to arrive at work and meet an angry boss. He said he was letting me go, and I was "no longer a part of the vision". I was angry. And very much dissapointed. I loaded my things into my car and drove away.On the way home, my car started sputtering. All the lights came on, and my engine fell out while going down the freeway. I pulled to the side of the road, and started walking. I certainly wasn't going to call a tow truck, I can't afford it now.I then got the bright idea to call my girlfriend. Upon answering, I could hear a man's voice in the background. She was out of breath, and certainly had just come back from a long jog. I asked if she would come and pick me up, and she said she was "indisposed at the moment". I then became more angry, and asked her why not. She promptly dumped me.With my belly still full of Tuscan Milk, I plodded on towards my home. I started pondering why she was leaving me, and entertained the thought that it must have something to do with that man in the background. Who was he? Why was he there? Then it dawned on me. The truth, as I had then thought, had arrived.It's that damn tuscan milk! I foolishly blamed the milk for my problems. I lost my job, my car broke, and my girlfriend left me. All in one morning! I thought the milk was the cause.Hours later, I arrived at my home. "Nice" I thought, as I spotted the 30 day notice. The thought of now getting kicked out my house kind of made me smile. At this point, nothing could get worse, right? It's not like a gang of ninjas is going to come in and kill my family or something.If you didn't catch the sarcasm in that last paragraph, a gang of ninjas did indeed come in and kill my family. Got em all. But still, I dont blame the milk now.You might ask, "why Jeremy? why are you so jovial?". The answer to that, my friends, is because I'm days away from becoming a millionaire. This whole situation will be erased. With my millions, everything will change.Fired from my job? Now I don't need one.Car broke down? I'll buy a lexus instead.Kicked out my house? To heck with renting, I'll buy a new one.Family dead? I'll buy a new one.Girlfriend left?  You get the picture.All my problems are solved!A few days ago I recieved an email from the prince of Nigeria. I appears their government is collapsing. And they need to move 100 million dollars out of there, STAT. So they researched, searching the world for a top secret, financial mercernary to give the money to, and found me. They must have heard about my skills. So they contacted me. I get, as a commission, ten percent of the take. If you think about it, that's a pretty good deal for someone who is saving your country.I've given them the neccessary banking information to the proper agents, and everything should be transferring soon. I will hang out in the park, where I now live, and wait for that phone call. Once I recieve the phone call, the money went through, and you are looking at a ten millionaire. I think I'll go purchase some new duds, and maybe head down to vegas and bet ten thousand a hand. I'll fly to miami and dig my toes in the sand, or jet off to Hawaii for some fun in the sun.I'm here at the library surfing amazon, and wanted to order some milk. For some reason my ATM wouldn't go through, kept saying insufficient funds, even though there is money in there. Must be some mistake. I'm off to the bank to ask them what's up, but first I thought I'd tell you all about the milk that saved my life.RECOMMENDED A+++++++

body: I don't even understand some of these reviews. "A good deal"? "High Quality"? Is that some sort of sick joke? Tuscan's first release of Whole Milk, back in '97 when it only came in the quart version, was amazing. THAT was ground-breaking. Never before had a a major Bovine product manufacturer put so much trouble into one good. The level of detail paid to release 1 really put it above the rest. And the customer service! Tuscan call centers in New York were open 24/7 to take customers' calls, which had never been done before. I saw a fellow reviewer commented that they must export tech support to South East Asia now. I wouldn't even know; I couldn't get past the computer!OK, customer service obviously isn't everything. But the Whole Milk itself is a piece of garbage! When it arrived, after several months mind you, sitting in some Tuscan distribution warehouse, it was in several pieces. Unbelievably shoddy construction. I expected more from Tuscan, I really did. I've heard horror stories about the Tuscan Whole Milk V 2.0 spontaneously igniting too. Seriously, if Tuscan wants to get serious they should issue an IMMEDIATE RECALL of their Whole Milk.You buy at your own risk!
title: RIP-OFF! DO NOT BUY!

body: This guide provides system requirements, installation instructions, and other, step-by-step instructions that you can use to deploy milk clusters if you are using Tuscan® Milk Server(tm) 2003 1 Gallon, Enterprise Edition, or Tuscan Server 2003, Datacenter Edition, operating systems.The milk cluster technology in Tuscan Server 2003, Enterprise Edition, and Tuscan Server 2003, Datacenter Edition, helps ensure that you have access to important dairy-based resources. You can use milk cluster technology to create several cluster nodes that appear to users as one gallon milk. If one of the nodes in the cluster fails, another node begins to provide service. This is a process known as "dairy-failover." In this way, milk clusters can increase the availability of critical applications and resources in the dairy farm.

body: To paraphrase Jack Handey:When I achieved transendence and perfect enlightenment, and I was drinking milk at the time, I was glad it was Tuscan milk that shot out of my nose. I was going to add some chocolate powder to make it taste better, but I wasn't sure if I had time.  If only there were some sort of milk-additive with a name that could tell me whether or not it took much time to make chocolate milk.  Well, I suppose that's just a crazy pipe dream.

body: Porkchop you should be concerned about the extraction process.  Milking these attractive and sociable animals is one of the most appalling processes in the food processing industry.  We at PETA believe this particular product will ultimately result in the extinction of the entire Tuscan population.  Indeed, 10% of these birds don't survive the first squeeze.  We have been trying to put these folks out of business since they started marketing this product as"gourmet" milk.  Please visit our website, [...] to find out more about this product and sign our petition to protect the Tuscans.  We suggest soy milk for your fruit loops.
title: Re: Porkchop's review - consumer alert

body: Tuscan whole milk, as the name implies is milked exclusively in Italy. It's a little known fact that Tuscan whole is milked entirely from the majestic teats of the Italian Meer cat. The Italian meer cat, or "stupidi americani bevono sperma roditori" in Latin is roughly translated as "very impressive milk product". The government of this third world country is so proud of their Tuscan Whole Milk that they are willing to share this rare and precious commodity with the western world for only $ 45 USD (+15 million Florin shipping and handling).This very impressive milk product can be used for anything from helping to fortify the sexual potency of the Alaskan female logging community to improving your over-all bone density and strength, which is as the name of this review implies, is what I use it for. The Italian Meer cat is highly prized in Canada for its therapeutic powers when ground down into an oil and rubbed vigorously into the scalp. The citizens of America's Hat use this homeopathic treatment to grow hair on their notoriously bald heads. As Im sure you know Canadian's are world renown for their male pattern baldness that even happens to their woman. However what is lesser known about the Canadians is that if you've ever met a citizen of the great frozen north that had any hair on their bodies at all, it was due entirely to the glandular secretions of the Italian Meer Cat. Italian Meer Cat milking can often be so violent that the World Trade Organization has passed international laws barring Canadians from owning, breeding or otherwise trading openly the Italian Meer Cat fluids. Before the creation of this law, Canadians selfish obsession with the Stupidi Americani Bevono nearly drove this beloved Italian rodent into total extinction.Thankfully our brave American armed forces stepped in to protect and guarantee the survival of this regal animal in a conflict which is now known as "Gulf War 1". Having disposed the vile dictator Ley Fagi Kaklvor (or some such Canadian nonsense) our Boys in Arms extinguished the swelling communism in their flaccid socialist hearts insuring once and for all the plorification this tiny nation's only export.In conclusion, Tuscan Whole milk tastes as good as its name sounds and is well worth the $ 45 USD (+15 million Florin shipping and handling) to import this wonderful and most impressive milk product directly to your door.Travis the Impalor, Amazon Product reviewer.(PS: Also makes an impressive skin treatment for the migrant children I keep imprisoned in a well. I apply it gratuitously via a rope and bucket to their dermis so that it's pliable and supple for when I upholster my custom furniture)
title: Milk gives me a firm boner.

body: In the darkest night, when all hope is lost and pain surrounds you, open your heart to Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon, 128 fl oz. The kindom of heaven awaits, and it is here in front of you. No longer will you cry or moan. The spirit of wholeness and light will radiate from you in whiteness, and flavor will speak the name of redemption. The skies will open and the foes of ameggedon will materialize. Do not give up.

body: The fullness and perfectly rounded bottom is only eclipsed by its open and waiting mouth. With sweating, muscled arms I lifted her opening to my own and suckled her lactic juices greedily, as if being sated was only a long forgotten dream. My face became wet with her loving nectar, droplets rolling down my bare chest. She always does this to me. I cannot help myself and she knows it.
title: Cheese is to milk as ice is to water

body: Although I prefer Tuscan Half Milk, which unfortunately has been difficult to find recently, I find Tuscan Whole Milk to be a suitable replacement.  It is milky white, and has a satisfying dairy aroma.It is perfect for those times that you feel like drinking milk.  For a change, you can even freeze it and eat it like that (I saw that on Martha Stewart's show).
title: Lactolicious!

body: I admit, I was fooled by the overwhelming positive reviews, but upon receiving the milk, my world fell apart. The jug seemed normal on the outside, so I opened it with glee. As soon as I did, a loathsome stench struck my nostrils. It was so overpowering that I lost consciousness. When I awoke, I was in hell. The milk is a portal to hell! Devils were all around me, dancing and singing a tune macabre. They brandished their pitchforks fiercely, and all I could do was curl up and cry. Satan then appeared to me, and explained that he was going to take the Earth for himself, using the milk. Please, don't buy it! Don't facilitate the apocalypse!
title: MILK APOCALYPSE

body: Hey Chris Coffman from St. Louis, MO, I believe you got my 128th ounce.My warm chunky jug jug of gooy white liquid only came with 127 fl. oz.If I send you 3 cents, could you send me the extra ounce?

body: I took home Tuscan Whole Milk, 1 Gallon 128 fl oz and gave it a chance, but in the end we turned it off after twenty minutes. I have to say the original starring Mickey Rooney was far more entertaining, and to top things off, the original didn't ruin my DVD player and stain the carpet.

body: On November 27, 1978, San Francisco city supervisor Harvey Milk was brutally assassinated along with Mayor Moscone by a deranged madman. I cannot believe that Amazon would be so insensitive as to carry a product named in such a manner as to make light of this horrific crime. Shame on Tuscan and shame on Amazon for their mockery of this great martyred man. Clearly the "whole" in the name is wordplay on the "holes" left in Milk's body by the lunatic's bullets. What's next, Amazon? Will you start selling Tuscan Drowned Laci?
title: Offensive

body: I was anxious to try the Ice Cold Milk as I eagly reached Level 5 but to my dismay it had only restores 436 mana. Not a great value at 1.25 silver. But you must remain seated while drinking.

body: Every once in a while, heaven smiles upon us mortals and offers us our dreams. Dreams made of homogenized milk. As far as miracles go, none have witnesses the universal sized profundity of this liquid ecstacy. Plus the citadel ruins the sunset at the beach.  Thanks a lot Tuscan Whole Milk.  Thanks a lot.

body: The milk was OK, though I must admit I bought it used.  I can't imagine buying it new, let alone the collector's version---NIB (New, In Bottle) and signed by the cow.  But maybe there's a difference in the taste.  Also, the standard shipping (7-14 days) put it slightly past the expiration date.

body: OK, I admit I have a serious, anaphylactic milk allergy. But after reading the reviews here, I thought this product sounded so magically wonderful that I'd give it a try anyway.Big mistake!!!I'm out of the hospital now and back at my computer, so that part's good. And I did get a helicopter ride to a major medical center, even if I wasn't awake for it.Still, all things considered, this product was a lousy purchase. The FDA needs to put a stop to the money-grubbing corporate monsters who market this stuff. Save your money, and save your life!
title: POISON! BEWARE!

body: This was by far the freshest milk I have ever tasted.  It still had that 'new milk smell'.I poured some in strategic spots in my house and car, so I can enjoy the smell for weeks to come.
title: Freshness is key

body: I had a friend of mine who is a scientist analyze some of this so-called "milk." Did you know that it's 2/3 water?!?! And there was animal tissue in it, like some sort of pus or something. Plus, if you leave it open on your porch for a few days in the summer it will give off the most disgusting smell you've ever sniffed and will eventually become full of maggots. I think it is reprehensible that Amazon is selling this product as something safe to drink and I plan to boycott this website until this product is removed.
title: Fun at first

body: Having just returned from an unexpected three-year vacation to a coastal Cuban community, I can now heartily endorse this milk with one caveat: Don't attempt to board a commercial flight with this milk in your carry-on. The TSA takes its own rules very seriously.
title: Don't take it on airplanes

body: I ordered Milk and they sent me cottage cheese with a layer of butter - it was warm but oh so good.  I will write the rest of the review when I have finished at the poison control center.

body: 1 gallon Tuscan Whole Milk1/2  cup  sugar1/2 cup light corn syrup1/2 cup peanut butter1 pkg. (2.8 oz.) OSCAR MAYER Real Bacon Recipe Pieces4 tsp. TANG Orange Flavor Drink Mix3 cups POST HONEY BUNCHES OF OATS Cereal, any varietyMIX sugar, Tuscan Whole Milk and syrup in large saucepan. Bring just to boil on medium heat, stirring frequently. Remove from heat.ADD peanut butter; stir until well blended. Stir in bacon pieces and drink mix. Add cereal; mix well.PRESS evenly into greased 8-inch square pan. Cool completely before cutting into 12 bars to serve.
title: A delicious mix

body: I just wanted to thank Amazon for the three different pictures of this product.  I wasn't sure if I'd buy it, but after looking at the varying images, well, I sure was sold.Thanks Amazon!

I'd imagine that ground human would be red or pinkish." well the answer to your question is: Bleach.
